description:
Axopar, the adventure company, is one of the fastest-growing boat brands in the world. Its success derives from the ‚Äúone boat, one world‚Äù concept, which stands for boats that are multi-functional and accessible for everyone, anywhere around the world. As a forerunner committed to continuous innovation, the company listens to its global community of Axoparians and shares the same respect and passion for nature. Axopar‚Äôs mission is to open new perspectives by bringing people out on the water and creating boats that make waves in the boating industry. www.axopar.com




We are looking for a Service Engineer to join Axopar¬¥s growing community




Axopar is looking for a new Service Engineer to join our dynamic Service team. This role involves providing technical support to Axopar Dealers, handling warranty and after-sales services, and developing service campaigns.




As a Service Engineer, you will be an integral part of our Dealer Support Team, where you will provide comprehensive technical support, manage warranty cases, and assist with service sales and repair work. Your role will involve advising Dealers on Axopar products and solutions, ensuring that they are equipped to carry out arrival inspections, pre-commissioning checks, and final handovers effectively. Additionally, you will lead or support service campaigns, including the creation of service bulletins and retrofit instructions, and you will be responsible for troubleshooting, repairs, and training Dealers, either virtually or on-site.




A key aspect of your responsibilities will be to collaborate closely with our Sales, Procurement, Production, Quality, and Product Management teams to ensure that all projects are delivered on time and meet the expectations of our customers.




The position occasionally requires international travel and offers the opportunity to work independently while also collaborating with a global network of partners. Position is full-time and permanent, with the opportunity to work in a hybrid model, working from our Helsinki office.




What we expect from you?




To excel in this role, you should have proven experience as a Service Engineer or a similar position within an engineering or service environment, ideally within the marine industry. Strong IT skills, including for example expertise in Salesforce or other ERP systems, as well as experience with data analysis tools like Power BI, will be essential. You should also have a solid understanding of after-sales and service processes. A formal qualification in Mechanical, Electrical, or Automation Engineering (BSc or higher) is desirable, although equivalent experience in boat building will also be considered.




In addition to your technical skills, you must possess excellent communication abilities in English, both written and verbal, and be comfortable traveling internationally as required. A proactive, customer-focused approach, along with a keen attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset, will be key to your success in this role. At Axopar Boats, we value independence and adaptability, and we seek a team player who is eager to learn, develop, and become an expert in the boating industry.




Why Axopar?




We offer you a unique position in a fast-growing, international company that has an entrepreneurial drive. At Axopar, we focus on innovative branding and marketing to further expand our business. Our working environment is forward-thinking, positive, and friendly. At Axopar, we all share a passion for adventure and outdoor activities. We will help you to succeed by providing you with a comprehensive onboarding and great opportunities to develop your skills and abilities. Our flexible working environment allows you to choose between working in our cosy offices in Helsinki, with the option for partial remote work as well. At Axopar, we offer you great employee benefits, including lunch, sports, and culture benefit as well as leisure and travel insurance.




Are you interested?




If you are interested, we want to hear from you as soon as possible! Please submit your application via the link by 17.9.2024. We will be looking to start the interviews already during the application period. This is a permanent position where you will be employed by Axopar.




The recruitment process is carried out in cooperation with Biisoni. For more information on the position, please contact Sanna Uurinm√§ki, Recruitment Consultant, e-mail: sanna.uurinmaki@biisoni.fi.
title: Service Engineer
workType: Customer Service, Engineering, and Quality Assurance
required skills: C, Excel, Access, Power BI, R
Soft Skills: attention to detail, communication, adaptability, problem-solving

description:
Job Description

About Merchant Group at Wolt

Wolt as a platform focuses on serving three main groups: customers, couriers, and merchants. In a nutshell, the Merchant Group strives to make Wolt an integral part of our Merchant‚Äôs daily business. Their core mission is to provide merchants with self-service tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use.

About The Merchant Analytics Team

Merchant Analytics is an embedded analytics function within the Merchant Group. The team works to unlock insights related to the marketplace and turn them into actionable recommendations that drive the success of merchants at Wolt. While keeping merchants at heart, the analytics team focuses on all kinds of analytics projects that can benefit merchants while ensuring a seamless consumer experience and also supporting Wolt‚Äôs marketplace strategy.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

Our offering to you


 * The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
 * You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working ‚Äî a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. üíô Read more about our remote setup.
 * You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.
   
   

Our humble expectations


 * Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
 * 4+ years of experience in an analytics or data science position within an industry or research setting.
 * Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation and causal inference using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
 * Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
 * Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.
 * Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.
   
   

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you‚Äôll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app ‚Äì we‚Äôre a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt‚Äôs name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we‚Äôre about getting things done. You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we‚Äôre the very core of Wolt‚Äôs products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!
title: Data Scientist (Analytics), Merchant

description:
Starship Technologies is revolutionizing deliveries with autonomous robots. These robots are designed to deliver food, groceries, and packages across college campuses and neighborhoods in minutes. Starship has now completed millions of autonomous deliveries to date, traveled millions of miles, and is currently doing more than 140k road crossings each day. Our contribution to society includes reducing congestion, and pollution, providing zero-emissions deliveries, increasing the quality of life for residents, empowering seniors and disabled people, and enabling affordable delivery for local businesses.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Data team and play an essential part in our mission to provide the world with affordable and environment-friendly deliveries.

You'll have a direct impact on shaping a company's success by collaborating with various key leaders across the organization.

Imagine working closely with our operations leaders to optimize staffing, streamline issue resolution, and ensure partners meet compliance standards. Beyond operations, you‚Äôll collaborate with other key leaders across various teams, driving efficiency and growth throughout the organization.

This isn‚Äôt just another data role - it‚Äôs a unique opportunity to shape the company‚Äôs success by influencing multiple areas of our business.

This position can be based in Finland or Estonia.

Your main responsibilities are:


 * Cooperating with stakeholders across teams to drive high-impact projects and support both strategic and day-to-day decision-making, enjoying a high level of internal visibility and directly influencing key company initiatives
 * Analyzing data to identify opportunities and guiding decisions on how we run our services
 * Building and maintaining reports and dashboards related to site and company management, from the underlying data models to the visuals
   
   

What‚Äôs in it for you?


 * You will collaborate with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We take pride in our ability to make the most of limited resources to solve problems no one has ever encountered before
 * Starship‚Äôs Data team is praised for excellence in every aspect, offering ample learning opportunities. The team members are highly skilled, providing a great opportunity for personal development
 * We are a fast-growing startup, with great opportunities to grow within the company. Your contribution will matter. There are lots of ways you can make a difference and personally feel the impact
 * You‚Äôll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe
   
   

What we hope you‚Äôll bring to the table:


 * 2-4 years of experience in a similar role as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Scientist, or in a relevant position
 * Experience in a role involving business, growth, or product analysis
 * Strong SQL skills
 * A quantitative mindset with a focus on data-driven decision-making
 * Proficiency in English, both written and spoken
 * Ability to work in a changing, fast-paced environment
 * Team player mindset
   
   

Beneficial:


 * Experience with Python or R
 * Previous experience with data transformation and BI tools, such as dbt, Databricks, Tableau, and/or Metabase
   
   

Want to learn more about our robots and our people? Get in touch and let‚Äôs have a chat! Also, have a sneak peek to our blog and discover more about us!
title: Senior Data Analyst

description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a seasoned "Business System Analyst" to serve in the role of "Financial Data Scientist" to join the Digital Solutions & Data Management Division of the Digital Finance Department. Digital Finance Department (DFD) is responsible for the coordination, development, and management of information systems used in financial accounting, treasury, financial planning & forecasting, performance management and the entire suite of digital solutions for the Finance Business line. Digital Implementation Division is responsible for providing program management services for implementation, rollout and support of finance system solutions through digital technologies including advanced analytics, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and Advanced Analytics technologies including Artificial Intelligence solutions and SAP solutions using Business Warehouse (BW) and Analytics Cloud (SAC). The department personnel are multidisciplinary professionals with key focus on Financial Applications functional experience and IT technical background. The Business System Analyst's primary role is to champion the identification, evaluation, design, coordinate implementation and facilitate rollout of Artificial Intelligence centric solutions in the Finance organization. The analyst will also lead implementation initiatives where required in addition to managing post implementation support.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Utilize a robust value-centric methodology to identify valuable opportunities enabled by AI/ML, Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics, Generative AI, Chatbots, and other technologies.
 * Leverage best practices to recommend and advocate for the transformation of finance functions with AI.
 * Conduct exploratory data analysis and leverage AI algorithms to derive value for finance functions, such as forecasting and anomaly detection.
 * Ideate AI solutions, develop scope, design, and facilitate implementation of digital solutions, and coordinate change management.
 * Continuously upkeep and train AI models to ensure integrity and traceability.
 * Design, develop, and implement AI-powered solutions to automate manual tasks, optimize processes, and enhance data-driven decision-making in Financial Accounting, Treasury, Performance management, and Investor Relations.
 * Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into technical requirements, and deliver impactful solutions. Assess requirements related to Finance AI use cases; Perform option evaluation; Provide support for implementation.
 * Develop and maintain machine learning models for tasks such as financial forecasting, fraud detection, anomaly detection, risk assessment, and investor sentiment analysis.
 * Clean, transform, and analyze large datasets from various sources to ensure data quality and prepare it for modeling.
 * Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, identify potential applications for the finance function, and propose relevant pilot projects.
 * Communicate technical concepts and findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
 * Participate in cross-functional initiatives to integrate AI and data science into broader business transformation efforts.
 * Organize and facilitate workshops with different users and consultants to document processes and drive transformation.
 * Lead the delivery and execution of key digital initiatives. Participate in solutions development through projects and programs, collaborating with business and technology groups.
 * Maintain, support, and optimize digital solutions.
   
   

Requirements:

 * Willingness to relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
 * Hold a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or IT from a recognized and approved program. Possession of an advanced business degree (e.g., MBA) and/or relevant professional certification (e.g., CMA, CFA, CPA) is preferred but not required.
 * Have six to eight years of experience in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and other related advanced analytics implementations for financial systems.
 * Possess expertise in Python programming languages and libraries such as NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
 * Have proficiency in UI programming, particularly with React.
 * Demonstrate skills to leverage Google Cloud or Azure Cloud for advanced analytics, which is desirable.
 * Showcase a thorough understanding of various aspects of implementing AI systems in Finance, including articulation and measurement of benefits, evaluation of technical and execution options, critical success factors, and project risks.
 * Have project experience implementing AI solutions and the ability to analyze business requirements, evaluate and recommend technical options, and support the execution process for implementing such solutions. Preference for involvement in hands-on technical solution management.
title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Business Systems Analyst - Data Science & Artificial Intelligence
Data Base Applications: Data Science, Data Analysis, Data Quality, Data Management

Job Description

About the Consumer Group

As the name Consumer Group implies, this group is responsible for building and developing Wolt‚Äôs consumer-facing products. The core mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in a pocket.

About The Consumer Data Science Team

Consumer Analytics team comprises a cross-section of Data Scientists (Analytics) and Analytics Engineers. We work closely with the Data Engineering team who help ensure we have the right platform to deliver our insights at scale. We partner with Product, Engineering, Design and Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

description:
Join us!




If you‚Äôre ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you‚Äôve come to the right place. We‚Äôre always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.




At Futurice, we're using advanced AI technology to transform how we work and help our clients. Last year, we successfully completed over 25 GenAI projects in different industries like law, media, logistics, manufacturing, and public sector. And there are tens of similar projects in progress. Our innovative use of AI has been recognized by top publications like Helsingin Sanomat and Taloussanomat. We've also collaborated with our clients to create over 60 real-world examples of how GenAI can be used in the public sector. You can read more about our work in our Generative AI Working Paper.




About the role




We are seeking a talented and accomplished Machine Learning Engineer to join our innovative and inclusive team of Data at Futurice. This is an extraordinary opportunity for a team player who is passionate about Generative AI, LLMs, and RAG. This role will be crucial for contributing to our generative AI initiatives, solving complex problems, and providing advice to decision-makers. We offer a hybrid working mode that allows for flexibility, but it is important that the candidate is located close to one of our Finland offices (Helsinki or Tampere) to ensure seamless collaboration. Please kindly note that, at this time, we are unable to offer relocation opportunities, or we will need to be highly selective in considering such requests.




Key Responsibilities:




 * Lead the design and development of tailored solutions that leverage GenAI, harnessing the power of Large Language Models (LLM) to address complex business challenges.
 * Work with LLMs, vector embeddings, and retrieval systems to develop a comprehensive GenAI application that leverages advanced natural language processing (NLP) techniques for tasks such as text generation, summarization, question answering, and content recommendation.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams, contributing to the development of AI use cases that contribute real value to the users.
 * Advise and support stakeholders on applying AI methodologies in their business to enable data-driven decision-making.
 * Lead and mentor within the AI domain, driving innovation and excellence in the Data Competence.
 * Support our sales team, leveraging your technical expertise to contribute to customer success and drive project engagements.




Qualifications:




 * MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related quantitative field with a strong focus on analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
 * Experience in GenAI, machine learning, and software development, with a history of successfully implementing (generative) AI use cases into practical solutions.
 * Proficiency in programming skills such as Python and other AI-related libraries and frameworks. Hands-on experience working with LLM APIs e.g. GPT or Llama2 and understanding of NLP coupled with LLMs.
 * Demonstrated ability in AI/ML solution architecture design and experience with data and AI tools on popular cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
 * Possession of relevant certifications in cloud technology or GenAI.
 * Excellent communication skills in Finnish and English, capable of explaining complex concepts to non-technical audiences.




Next steps




If this sounds like the opportunity you‚Äôve been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.




How we work




Ever since Futurice was founded, we‚Äôve been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We‚Äôve put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean ‚Äì take a look here to learn more, check our Culture handbook 2.0 and get to know some of our people through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our offices here!




At Futurice, new joiners are not expected to fit into a specific mold ‚Äì people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there‚Äôs power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about our DE&I commitment and efforts here.




We're Futurice




We are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.




Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.
title: Data Scientist

description:
At Cadence, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to make an impact on the world of technology.

Preferred Skills

Cadence Design Systems is a world leader in providing computational software for all aspects of intelligent system design. Your role will be to bring machine learning/AI expertise to a cross-disciplinary R&D team working on the emerging boundary of scientific computing and machine learning/AI. The candidate should have a PhD in computer science / applied mathematics / computational physics / electrical engineering and the following preferred skills:


 * Demonstrated expertise in theory and practice of neural networks / deep learning with working knowledge of contemporary topics (graph neural networks, attention mechanisms, transformer networks, reinforcement and transfer learning, etc.)
 * Facility with classical methods of statistical inference
 * Demonstrated ability to reduce algorithms and theoretical knowledge to practice and produce innovative research results
 * Demonstrated programming proficiency in Python/C++.
 * Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Julia.
 * Strong computer science background is a plus.
 * Familiarity with recent research trends in physics-informed machine learning e.g. physics-informed neural networks, neural operator theory, DeepONets is a plus.
 * Exposure to one or more application areas in scientific computing (computational electromagnetics, fluid dynamics, molecular dynamics, thermal analysis, electrical circuit simulation) and/or computational physics is a plus.
   
   

Candidate should expect to work with a cross-functional engineering team to perform cutting-edge research but ultimately deliver innovative technologies in a production environment.

We‚Äôre doing work that matters. Help us solve what others can‚Äôt.
title: Lead Software Engineer
required skills: C++, Tensorflow, Julia, C, Python, R

description:
Starship Technologies is revolutionizing deliveries with autonomous robots. These robots are designed to deliver food, groceries, and packages across college campuses and neighborhoods in minutes. Starship has now completed millions of autonomous deliveries to date, traveled millions of miles, and is currently doing more than 140k road crossings each day. Our contribution to society includes reducing congestion, and pollution, providing zero-emissions deliveries, increasing the quality of life for residents, empowering seniors and disabled people, and enabling affordable delivery for local businesses.

We‚Äôre hitting records on an almost weekly basis. Now is an exciting time to join as we grow rapidly around the world!

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our Data team and play an essential part in our mission to provide the world with affordable and environment-friendly deliveries.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll split your focus between building, governance, and optimization. You‚Äôll oversee our data infrastructure and tooling exposed to data and engineering teams, emphasizing the creation of automated, configuration-based solutions. Additionally, you'll optimize data handling cost-effectively as data volumes grow and design end-to-end pipelines that ensure data integrity and visibility, preventing accidental errors.

This role offers a unique opportunity to significantly impact how we manage and enhance our data systems.

This position can be based in Estonia or Finland.

Your main responsibilities are:


 * Developing solutions for data integration and tooling, such as data imports, job orchestration, development environments, and monitoring
 * Guiding architectural decisions to ensure robustness, cost-effectiveness, and strong observability of the data platform
 * Performance tuning for both existing and new workloads
 * Maintaining the health of our data platform (Databricks on AWS, with some applications running on Kubernetes) and addressing issues as they arise
   
   

What‚Äôs in it for you?


 * You will collaborate with people with a strong inner burning and motivation. We are self-aware and seek feedback and improvement. We take pride in our ability to make the most of limited resources to solve problems no one has ever encountered before
 * Starship‚Äôs Data team is praised for excellence in every aspect, offering ample learning opportunities. The team members are highly skilled, providing a great opportunity for personal development
 * We are a fast-growing startup, with great opportunities to grow within the company. Your contribution will matter. There are lots of ways you can make a difference and personally feel the impact
 * You‚Äôll have endless opportunities to learn from our inspirational, talented team members across the globe
   
   

What we hope you‚Äôll bring to the table:


 * A solid understanding of operating systems, networks, databases, and distributed systems
 * Experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
 * Proficiency in SQL, scripting, building robust data pipelines, and implementing monitoring solutions
 * An active interest in the field of data engineering
 * Enjoyment of performance tuning and troubleshooting, with a determination to resolve tricky issues
 * A ‚Äúlet‚Äôs do this‚Äù attitude, striving for pragmatic yet maintainable solutions
 * Good communication skills in both verbal and written English
 * Ability to achieve results independently as well as through teamwork
   
   

Beneficial:


 * Prior experience with Databricks, Spark, AWS, Airflow, Kubernetes, and Kafka
   
   

Want to learn more about our robots and our people? Get in touch and let‚Äôs have a chat! Also, have a sneak peek to our blog and discover more about us!
title: Senior Data Engineer
Data Base Applications: Databricks, Data Pipeline, Data Engineering, Data Infrastructure, Data Platform, Data Pipelines, Data Integration, SQL
Data Engineering: Databricks, Data Engineering, data pipelines, Data Integration, Spark, Kafka

description:
For our Leuven or Espoo offices, we are looking for highly qualified and motivated professionals like you. If you think you have what it takes to keep Septentrio firmly in Pole Position, get in touch.

We need you for the position of

High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer

The Job

Our High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer designs, implements and validates our state-of-the-art embedded positioning and navigation software. This software runs on GNSS and hybrid navigation modules capable of centimeter-level-precision positioning. As an algorithm engineer, you‚Äôre part of our PNT Products development team.

Your mission

As High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer, you are a key contributor to the development of Septentrio next generation Positioning Engine. The Positioning Engine computes centimeter level position, cm/s velocity and sub-degree orientation based on GNSS ranges coupled with additional sensors such as accelerometers, gyros, a magnetometer, and an odometer.

You work closely with peer Software Engineers and GNSS Algorithms Experts to develop high quality software in C++, running efficiently on a state-of-the-art embedded platform and will ensure the flexibility, modularity and efficiency of the object-oriented software implementation starting from Matlab and/or C++ prototypes.

You develop unit tests and software test cases to validate your algorithms and software, leveraging the Septentrio library of real test data and the continuous integration framework.

Your Qualifications

You have at least four years of hands-on experience in cm-level GNSS positioning, gained either in the industry or through academic research. You hold a MSc or PhD in geomatics, geodesy, aerospace engineering, mathematics, or a related field.

Your technical expertise will be crucial as you navigate the complexities of GNSS error components in adverse conditions, such as ionospheric storms or high multipath environments in industrial settings. A solid understanding of the Embedded Software Development Life Cycle, along with familiarity with tools like issue tracking, source control, and continuous integration, will help you excel in this role. Proficiency in embedded C/C++ is essential, and your experience as an algorithm developer will be backed by a strong foundation in linear algebra and advanced matrix handling. You‚Äôll be tasked with performance evaluation, quality control, and error analysis for the algorithms you develop, ensuring that they meet the highest standards.

We value individuals who are proactive, structured, and analytical problem-solvers. You should enjoy working closely with a small team of specialists, where collaboration is key to our success.

While not mandatory, experience working in Agile/Scrum teams, knowledge of ambiguity resolution algorithms, and programming skills in Matlab and Python will give you an edge in this position.

Our Offer

In exchange for your talent, we offer a competitive compensation package in a top-notch high-tech, international working environment. At Septentrio you‚Äôll have room to grow, both personally and professionally. Our on-boarding plan is legendary, our homework policy family-friendly. Get in touch and help us shoot for the moon, the stars and beyond.
title: High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer (Espoo)
required skills: C++, Matlab, C, Excel, Python, R

description:
Job Description

Together with our amazing People Analytics teammates from DoorDash, we‚Äôre looking for an Analytics Manager to lead our small but mighty team of analysts responsible for self-service reporting and deep dives across the People space. The ideal candidate will excel as a ‚Äúplayer - coach‚Äù, excited to provide functional leadership to the team, provide thought partnership to their stakeholders, and roll up their sleeves to dive into the data themselves.

The role can be based in Finland (preferred), or Sweden. You can work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the mentioned locations - the work format is up to you üôå

You will work directly with stakeholders across the Wolt people team (as well as the rest of the Wolt business), serving as their thought partner to solve problems and prioritize solutions to big, thorny questions. You will report directly to the US-based Sr. Manager of People Analytics at DoorDash, and will partner closely with them and your US-based peers in Recruiting Analytics and Data Science to lead People Analytics across the globe.

Your daily work will include


 * Supervising the day-to-day work of your team of analysts responsible for people analytics, recruiting analytics, and similar.
 * Serving as the trusted advisor, thought leader, and representative of the global People Analytics team to your stakeholders across Wolt.
 * Leading the development of metrics, reports, dashboards and analyses, putting high-quality insights directly into the hands of your stakeholders.
 * Developing a cohesive vision and roadmap together with your peers and partner teams across the globe, including US-based Data Science, People Analytics, Recruiting Analytics, Data Engineering, and People Applications teams.
 * Dive into the data, diagnosing data and reporting needs, building new solutions, and providing answers to big, ambiguous, critical problems.
   
   

Our humble expectations


 * Education: Degree in a quantitatively focused discipline, e.g., experimental psychology, economics, computer science, physics, or similar.
 * Strong experience working as an Analyst, BI Developer, Analytics Engineer, Data Scientist, or techy Data Analyst. People/HR Analytics experience is strongly preferred.
 * Experience leading small teams with outsized impact.
 * Demonstrated experience working with and influencing technical and nontechnical cross-functional peers and stakeholders. This will be a highly visible role within the People Team, and building trust with your colleagues will be critical.
 * Tech skills: Python, SQL, R, AWS, and one of the modern BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Sigma, or similar). Advanced SQL skills, and ability to write optimized queries for large data sets.
 * Subject Matter Expertise: Deep expertise in data visualization and analysis. Some expertise in statistics is preferred (regressions, t-tests). Nice to have: Experience analyzing survey data.
 * Since you‚Äôll be taking care of our internal stakeholders, we‚Äôre looking for someone who truly enjoys interacting with people on a daily basis. The ability to search for information and ask relevant questions from various teams will be crucial.
   
   

Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!


 * Complex environment with tons of data just waiting to be utilized ‚Äî you‚Äôll get hands-on experience in working on various TA metrics and topics.
 * You can choose the ways of working - work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the locations mentioned above.
 * You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, think big but stay humble, do right by people, treat others kindly and justly, and recognize that if we don‚Äôt learn, we won‚Äôt stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda‚Äôs greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.
   
   

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:

Orsi Kocsis, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - orsolya.kocsis@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants, and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions ‚Äì as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt‚Äôs products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants), and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt‚Äôs mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

So, why work at Wolt?

At Wolt, We‚Äôre About Getting Things Done.

You‚Äôll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself, and being around friendly, humble, and ambitious people.

We work hard to make cities into better places, and it‚Äôs pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you‚Äôre passionate about building things that just‚Ä¶ work, Wolt might be for you.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team ‚Äì people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates ‚Äì when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait ‚Äì we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

In this role, you will focus on improving existing systems and resolving production issues, rather than building new applications. If you have a strong background in backend development (particularly Python) and extensive experience managing large-scale production environments, we want to hear from you.

To apply, please send your CV and a Cover to s.cook1@jeffersonfrank.com

description:
Share this job



We are looking for a Service Engineer at Hitachi Energy, Grid Automation Service in Vaasa, Tampere or Helsinki.

As you will be part of our service team, you will be responsible for providing engineering and expert services for our existing installations globally. This includes system upgrades and extensions, consulting services, remote diagnostics, corrective and preventive maintenance, site audits and various cyber security services. In this position you need to be customer oriented, have an inborn ability to solve complex problems, readiness to travel and the ability to adapt and learn quickly new things. Ideally, you are already familiar with MicroSCADA X products, have experience in critical communication networks and understand the importance of cyber security for control systems.

Your Responsibilities


 * Working at the customer front end delivering engineering and expert services for MicroSCADA X control systems and related equipment
 * Participating in domestic and export projects of various sizes as a technical engineer
 * Supporting our end-customers with your technical expertise, leading to better user experience, higher customer satisfaction and long-term collaboration
 * Providing technical support for our sales teams in designing the scope to be offered
 * Creating and maintaining customer work logs, inventory databases and documentations
   
   

Your background


 * BSc or MSc in information technology or electrical engineering.
 * Good job planning, prioritizing, time management and documentation skills and the ability to work under pressure.
 * Able to work independently as well as part of a team.
 * Culturally sensitive communication skills with positive attitude and an open mind.
 * Ability to solve complex problems, learn quickly and innovate.
 * Readiness to travel ~30 days/year
 * Fluent spoken and written Finnish and English skills
 * Ideally you have work experience with MicroSCADA X products.
 * A proven track record in designing critical communication networks and cyber security is seen as an advantage.
   
   

Interested in joining the Hitachi Energy family and ready for a new exciting challenge? We look forward to receiving your application. Apply for the position by October 7, 2024. Please note that we will initiate interviews as candidates apply and position will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is found.

For more information about this role, please contact Jarmo Varmajoki, Service Operations Manager, tel. +358503341295.

description:
Tech Lead for Warframe Mobile¬†




Job Summary:

Are you a highly skilled and motivated Tech Lead with an experience in gaming? Join our dynamic team at Nitro Games and work with exciting and well-known IPs! We are looking for a talented professional to tackle complex technical challenges and ensure our projects' successful and timely delivery. As a Tech Lead, you will be crucial in designing and coding new features, optimizing performance, setting up build pipelines, and collaborating with various teams to bring our innovative ideas to life. If you thrive in a collaborative environment, this is the perfect opportunity!




Title:¬†

Tech Lead

Reports to:¬†

Project Lead

Responsibilities:¬†

Ability to independently design and code entire new features in a performant manner according to established coding conventions

Effectively communicate technical solutions and approaches in verbal and written form.

Able to work well in a collaborative team environment and within an iterative design process

Debugging, troubleshooting complex issues, and optimizing code for speed, memory, and overall performance

Follow the end-to-end software development lifecycle, from design and coding to testing and deployment

Develop high-quality, efficient, and maintainable code by project requirements and coding standards.

Independent dialogue and collaboration with the client

Setting up and maintaining build pipelines for both iOS and Android devices

Implement platform native SDKs such as Singular etc.

Collaborate with different teams

Ability to travel occasionally and participate in business calls over timezones

Software Development:

Core game system development, including gameplay mechanics, graphics, networking, and other essential features. The game uses a proprietary C++ engine (Evolution) with Lua. We expect an understanding of C++, Lua, Vulkan renderer, and Perforce. Experience in other proprietary C++ engines, Unreal Engine, native iOS development with Swift and/or Objective-C, and native Android development are considered positive.

Team Collaboration:

Work closely with designers and other team members to integrate gameplay features and systems into the game.

Collaborate with the project lead to create and manage development schedules, ensuring on-time delivery of milestones.

Quality Assurance:

Participate in efforts to identify and resolve bugs, issues, and bottlenecks in the development process.

Conduct code reviews to maintain code quality, consistency, and adherence to best practices.¬†

Documentation:

Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation for the project, including architecture, code structure, and system design.¬†




Qualifications:¬†

+15 years of experience in Tech

Strong knowledge of C++ design and programming¬†

Proven experience in a senior/lead role on multiple game projects, with at least some of them using a Proprietary C++ engine

Strong knowledge of gameplay programming

Ability to quickly get familiar with existing codebase

Experience using Windows/Mac

Knowledge of shader languages and render pipelines

Understanding and appreciation of optimized code

Understanding of CI/CD pipeline

Strong experience of working with LUA

Experience implementing native ios/android features

Strong knowledge of Jira and Confluence

In-depth knowledge of game development concepts, algorithms, and software design principles.

Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze and optimize code for performance

Love for games, including interest in free-to-play mobile games

Knowledge of Warframe is considered a positive

What we can offer: At Nitro Games, we pride ourselves on fostering a world-class, self-directed team that values work-life balance and supports family life. We offer the flexibility to work remotely, hybrid, or from our offices in Kotka or Helsinki, with full relocation support and language classes available for people moving to Finland.

Our benefits package includes comprehensive healthcare and cultural benefits like retreats and parties, ensuring your well-being both inside and outside of work. Our unique self-development program allows you to dedicate work hours to personal and professional growth, ensuring you stay at the cutting edge of your field. Additionally, take advantage of our generous stock option plan, a performance-based bonus system tied to EBIT, and extra paid holidays to relax and recharge!

The salary range is between 6500‚Ç¨ and 8500‚Ç¨ per month. The monthly salary can be negotiated to match your experience, skillset, and range of responsibilities in the role.




Additional Information:

Location: Finland

Employment Type: Full-time employment contract

Starting date: September/October

This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

This Company is seeking to appoint an M&A Finance Analyst to join the M&A Advisory Department, which is part of the Finance organization. The M&A Advisory Department provides finance input to transactions throughout the transaction process, including structuring, valuation, due diligence, and support to negotiations and documentation, as well as providing objective and independent advice to executive management relating to transactions.

The M&A Finance Analyst role supports the development and execution of large and complex international transactions by acting as a single point of contact for all finance-related inputs throughout the lifecycle of transactions, often against challenging deadlines. Activities include screening opportunities, structuring and framing, formulating valuation and bid price recommendations, financial due diligence, advising on accounting aspects of transactions, reviewing definitive agreements, purchase price adjustments, integration planning, and post-transaction evaluations. The M&A Finance Analyst will interface with other transaction team members and specialists within Finance such as Project Finance.

Responsibilities:

 * Provides expert and impartial advice to executive management to facilitate decision-making across all transaction aspects.
 * Plays a key role in multifunctional transaction teams, offering comprehensive financial support throughout transactions.
 * Evaluates commercial options and assesses transaction counterparties and joint venture partners.
 * Ensures valuation accuracy in transactions, including meticulous preparation of financial models adhering to This Company standards, robust documentation of assumptions, and thorough risk assessment.
 * Presents bid price recommendations to senior management considering the competitive landscape.
 * Manages financial due diligence, coordinating advisors' activities, and communicating findings to executive management for valuation and agreement considerations.
 * Offers guidance on transaction accounting aspects.
 * Contributes to definitive transaction agreements and oversees purchase price adjustments and post-transaction allocations.
 * Participates in integration planning, advising on finance integration aspects.
 * Coordinates inputs from other finance experts in transactions.
 * Guides and mentors team members in transaction processes.
 * Contributes to process and methodology enhancements to establish M&A execution excellence within the company.
 * Undertakes ad hoc financial analysis tasks, including transfer pricing, impairment reviews, government incentives, and group policy reviews.
 * Oversees external Financial Advisors and consultants on transactions, fostering relationships with banks to gain external perspectives on the M&A landscape.
   
   

Requirements:

 * This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
 * Accumulate over 10 years of relevant experience in conducting financial analysis for M&A transactions, often acquired in leading investment banks, accounting firms, or large international corporations.
 * Demonstrate significant involvement in large and intricate cross-border transactions, with a particular emphasis on the energy, natural resources, or infrastructure sectors.
 * Possess expert-level proficiency in financial analysis tools and methodologies, with a thorough understanding of financial statements, International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), and international taxation.
 * Hold a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Management, or Engineering; while an advanced business degree (e.g., MBA) or Accounting qualification is preferred, it's not mandatory.
 * Excel in numerical skills, demonstrating methodical organization and adaptability to dynamic work environments with multiple competing priorities.
 * Display strong communication skills, both verbal and written, and function effectively as a team player, readily integrating into diverse teams and providing coaching and mentorship to fellow team members based on your extensive experience.

This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. Job Summary

We are seeking a Business Development Analyst to join the Manufacturing, Technology & Operational Services Transactions Department (MTOST) at This Company. MTOST handles transactions across various business lines, focusing on manufacturing, new technologies, and operational services related to SAO operations.

The Business Development Analyst will play a key role in supporting the screening, planning, analysis, and development of new business ventures and divestments. Responsibilities include evaluating transaction proposals, actively managing project execution, and engaging in valuation, due diligence, negotiation, and transaction structuring. The Analyst will drive projects from initial proposal through to final deal signing and closing.

Key Responsibilities:

 * Conduct detailed due diligence on different aspects of target companies (with support from relevant organizations in the company).
 * Perform valuation of target companies based on different methods (with support from other organizations in the company) and evaluate the business plan of the targets.
 * Independently handle business proposals, develop a negotiation strategy, and establish commercial terms for the transaction, reflecting these in the term sheet. Negotiate and develop definitive agreements (with the help of the law department and other relevant organizations in the company).
 * Validate activities to progress proposals through stage gates, prioritize business proposals against investment criteria and NBD portfolio strategy.
 * Manage all aspects of transaction execution, including selecting, onboarding, and working with advisors.
 * Manage overall stakeholder management, including collaboration with internal organizations, consultants, and potential partners.
 * Assemble initial offerings to potential investors, lead investor selection activities, and coordinate with This Company subject matter experts to draft Memorandums of Understanding/Letter of Intent.
 * Provide administrative direction in the development and review of legal documents, including head of terms, MoU, cost-sharing agreements, and shareholder agreements.
 * Ensure compliance with process stage gates and approvals, approve contract payments and variations within limits, provide administrative direction and personnel management to all assigned Business Development Analysts, and perform other miscellaneous duties as directed.
 * Support the law department in anti-trust clearance activities and internal proponent organizations in post-acquisition integration activities.
 * Perform other miscellaneous duties as directed.
   
   

Requirements:

 * Willingness to permanently relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

 * Education and Qualifications:
   
   * Preferably hold a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Economics, Business, or Finance from a recognized and approved international program.
   * An MBA and/or equivalent qualification will be a plus, though not a requirement.

 * Experience:
   
   * Ideal candidate should have 10-15 years of experience in business development and transactions execution.
   * Experience with IOCs/NOCs, corporates, international consulting firms, accounting firms, investment banks, and private equity firms is preferred.

 * Skills and Competencies:
   
   * Strong background in transactions execution with extensive experience in financial valuation, modeling, due diligence, commercial negotiations, and transaction structuring.
   * Adequate understanding of financial analysis of companies, valuation methodologies, commercial principles of transactions, and various types of transactions.
   * Industry expertise or knowledge of specific venturing activities such as commercialization, spin-offs, joint venturing, project development, financial valuations, modeling, facilities planning, strategy development, or relevant experience.
   * Good interpersonal communication skills.
   * Working knowledge of a variety of MS Office tools.
   * Strong time-management skills, ability to meet deadlines, and work under stress.
   * Proven analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and emphasis on quality.
   * Strong team player demonstrating initiative, dynamism, and creativity.
   * Fluency in English (and other languages if possible).
   * Solid understanding of commercial business models in various sectors, e.g., oil & gas.
   * Experience with risk reporting and risk dashboard.
   * Understanding of portfolio management principles.
   * Solid understanding of accounting fundamentals.
   * Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Management Accountant (CMA), or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification are advantageous.

description:
The opportunity

Unity Grow team builds advertising and personalized content delivery solutions used in hundreds of thousands of apps. Our platform processes extensive data sets that are used by machine learning systems living in the core of our various products. Different deep learning techniques are revolutionizing automated decision-making systems and Unity is riding the front wave. Unity is investing heavily in mastering deep learning methodologies and applying them to real-world gaming problems of advertising, engagement, and monetization. In Demand Performance, we develop groundbreaking machine learning centric products. They provide millions of predictions for recommendations each and every second to optimize efficiency and profitability of user acquisition advertising campaigns.

Today we are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who will shine in our outstanding team! You will be working on models and embeddings that will be used in Unity machine learning models, in particular, conversion (i.e. start-to-install) prediction models. You will contribute and take ownership of end-to-end machine learning pipelines and develop deep neural network models whose results will be used by other teams and what you deliver is an integral part of the whole Unity Grow product. We expect you to have the motivation and skills to translate the business problems as Machine Learning problems and apply those in a large scale production environment. If you are open-minded, interested in learning and excelling we want to hear from you.

What You'll Be Doing


 * Work with a team to revolutionize personalization of user acquisition advertisement for mobile gaming
 * Translate business problems into a design and implement advanced machine learning models and algorithms
 * Develop deep learning and online personalized targeting solutions with tech stack of Python/Spark/Tensorflow/Pytorch on a large scale
 * Form and validate hypotheses about model performance by conducting statistical experiments or A/B tests
 * Contribute to the team roadmap once you get familiar with problems and opportunities presented to the team
   
   
   

What We're Looking For


 * Experience in machine learning model development using Tensorflow or PyTorch
 * Deep understanding of machine learning & software engineering concepts, from concepts to implementation
 * Capable of conducting analysis, statistics and data literacy to deduct where the challenges and opportunities lie
 * Good communication skills to help collaboration with other data scientists, engineers and product managers
   
   
   

You might also have


 * Experience in implementing varied data and machine learning based online decision-making systems on a large scale
 * Experience in mobile advertisement, gaming, or online trading
   
   
   

Additional Information


 * Relocation support is not available for this position.
 * International relocation support is not available for this position.
 * Work visa/immigration sponsorship is not available for this position.
   
   
   

Life at Unity

Unity [NYSE: U] is the world's leading platform of tools for creators to build and grow real-time games, apps, and experiences across multiple platforms. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, infrastructure experts, filmmakers, and more, use Unity to bring their imaginations to life across multiple platforms, from mobile, PC, and console, to spatial computing.

As of the fourth quarter of 2023, more than 69% of the top 1,000 mobile games are made with Unity as derived from a blended number of the top 1,000 games in the Google Play Store and iOS App Store. In 2023, Made with Unity applications had an average of 3.7 billion downloads per month. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please fill out this form to let us know.

This position requires the incumbent to have a sufficient knowledge of English to have professional verbal and written exchanges in this language since the performance of the duties related to this position requires frequent and regular communication with colleagues and partners located worldwide and whose common language is English. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Your privacy is important to us. Please take a moment to review our Prospect and Applicant Privacy Policies. Should you have any concerns about your privacy, please contact us at DPO@unity.com.

description:
Job Description

Secondary Job Description

The function

We have an exciting opportunity in our Global Liquidity Management (GLM) team as a

Senior Analyst Treasury Back-Office

The position will be an important partner in the operation of Global Liquidity Management (GLM) back-office activities and will have a variety of shared responsibilities in the fields of accounting and reporting, loan management, trade confirmations and treasury system operational and admin functions.

Welcome to our team

Global Liquidity Management (GLM) is part of the Treasury Organization and is responsible for operating Organon‚Äôs in house bank, cash pools and is the center of excellence for the Treasury ERP system, among others. The team has interactions with teams in Asia, Europe, Africa, and Americas.

This is a global remote position and can be based in The Netherlands, Austria, Portugal, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Finland, United Kingdom or Ireland. There is a possibility to work from a local office in the country for one or more days a week. Limited, occasional travel (for meetings in another country) may be involved.

Join us to play a key role in the treasury operations of the entire organization, providing the necessary liquidity support to a growing, start-up driven company.

Responsibilities


 * Trade confirmations for deals initiated by the front office team.
 * Accounting and Financial Reporting activities for the treasury entity such as:
    * Review and booking of accounting vouchers/entries.
    * Preparation of financial statements and various reports and reconciliations including analysis of results.
    * Preparation of tax returns and filing.
    * Document management.

 * Intercompany loan operations.
   

Role

As the Center of Excellence in treasury ERP and liquidity operations the role will have interactions with other finance colleagues in:


 * Supporting set up of new entities, bank accounts and intercompany loans.
 * Providing and refreshing knowledge transfer.
 * Troubleshooting and problem solving.
 * Treasury controls compliance.
 * Process improvements.
   
   

Required Education, Experience And Skills


 * At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in accountancy or equivalent.
 * Experience in an accounting and/ or financial analysis position.
 * Strong knowledge of accounting principles (experience in treasury is a plus).
 * Communication proficiency. Ability to frame and reframe statements as necessary for effective communication across different cultures, levels and business units in the organization.
 * Enjoys helping others problem solving and knowledge sharing. Manifests an inclination to lead, educate and coach.
 * Able to proficiently use SAP and MS Excel (pivots, advance formulas, multi-file linkages, in file validations etcetera).
 * Highly independent, goal-oriented and able to work with limited instructions and contact with other team members.
 * Excellent oral and written communication skills in English. Dutch is a plus.
   
   

Who We Are

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women‚Äôs Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

If you require reasonable accommodation(s) in completing an application, interviewing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please email us at staffingaadar@organon.com.

description:
Overview

Are you a skilled Software Engineer with a passion for developing high quality software that has an impact? Are you eager to work with top-notch colleagues and continuously develop your expertise? If your answer is yes, then we have an ideal opportunity for you!

We're actively looking for a Cloud Software Engineer to join our growing team of experts. With a diverse range of notable customers across various domains, we take pride in developing business-critical, large-scale solutions that make a real impact. Your role would consist of hands-on development activities in customer engagements, working closely with other Software Engineers and Architects. Your responsibilities could also include solution design, customer communication, Scrum Master or team leadership duties, sharing your expertise with your colleagues helping them grow and learn new.

Our typical tech stack includes .NET/C#, Azure, SQL and React and we often work in Scrum/Kanban teams. Working in our projects is dynamic and engaging, providing ample opportunities for learning and growth. We prioritize your personal development and offer mentorship with experienced colleagues. Additionally, we strongly encourage acquiring cloud certifications to enhance your skills, ensuring they stay with you throughout your career journey. We also provide Github Copilot and other AI assistants to our engineers to improve both productivity and work satisfaction.

If you're not yet familiar with Nortal, we are a global leader in strategic change and technology. We drive digital transformation within healthcare, the public sector, and leading manufacturing and energy companies in Finland. Our 2,000+ employees worldwide share the vision of creating a better future through seamless digital transformation, and we're constantly on the lookout for new talents to join us on this journey!

We maintain offices in Helsinki, Oulu, Turku, Jyv√§skyl√§, and Uusikaupunki. We highly value flexibility, giving you the option to work from home, your local office, or find a balance that suits your needs.

Responsibilities

In this role, you'd be responsible for:


 * Developing and designing modern cloud-based APIs, systems integrations, and enterprise applications for our customers, facilitating their digital transformation efforts
 * Building DevOps pipelines and writing IaC scripts to automate cloud infrastructure management, releases and deployments
 * Working with cloud-native PaaS and SaaS services and Edge components to build modern hybrid-cloud solutions
 * Working as a member of a team of specialists with a diverse range of skills
   
   
   

Qualifications


 * Experience in developing web applications, APIs, and integrations using cloud-native technologies
 * Proficiency in hands-on programming in .NET/C# environment
 * Proficiency with Azure services such as App Service, Container Apps, Functions, SQL Database, Cosmos DB, Service Bus, Event Grid, Event Hubs, Azure DevOps CI/CD
 * Familiarity with data modelling and front-end technologies like React.js is an advantage
 * Effective communication skills in both English and Finnish
   
   
   

Why join Nortal?

We value individuals not just for their skills, but also for their cultural alignment. Our core values include a commitment to delivering value and results, taking ownership, empowering oneself and others, and owning your future and growth. In addition to our professionalism, we appreciate a touch of good humor!

We prioritize your growth and development. At Nortal, we actively support constant improvement and knowledge sharing through our Capability teams, both internal and external training opportunities, self-learning, a mentorship program, and strong 1:1 culture. You will also get access to the newest development tools, such as AI assistants.

We prioritize your health and well-being by offering a flexible range of benefits, including flexible working hours, access to high-quality occupational healthcare, and bicycle benefit. We are also a remote friendly company.

Nortal values equality and diversity in our work community. We welcome applicants with different backgrounds, such as in regard to age, gender, language, culture or minority group.

If you're interested in learning more, please feel free to reach out to me for additional information:

Virpi Kivinen

+358 40 6616 338
