description:
Join us!

If you‚Äôre ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you‚Äôve come to the right place. We‚Äôre always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.




Data, Analytics & AI Principal

Will you be a catalyst for our key portfolio or account teams in driving business development and making sure our data competence development and client needs are in sync?

We are looking for a Data Principal who plays a leading role in steering and guiding the development of our business portfolio and ensuring our full cross-competence offering is actively utilized in the portfolio‚Äôs business development and sales activities. Data principal acts as a source of insights and expertise for key account leads as well as utilizes their excellent communication and teamwork skills to bridge all competencies (like tech, design & advisory) to work together in a winning cross-competence offer to our strategic key clients.

To make all this happen, deep digital experience is crucial.




As a Data Principal you have a wide understanding of the data & analytics area and a toolset of modern frameworks and methodologies in your back pocket. You have several years of hands-on experience in data management or advanced analytics and have extended your range of impact in advisory themes like helping customers with for example data strategy and governance expertise. We would be happy to see that you are passionate about business development, people and team development, cloud solutions, impeccable customer experiences and innovation. Or maybe about something else that we haven‚Äôt even thought about. Please tell us.




And to be more concrete, here is our wish list

We don‚Äôt expect you to master them all, but hopefully this guides you closer to our thoughts and needs:

 * Several years of work experience in either within data management or AI & Machine Learning areas
 * Clear vision on what are the next big trends in data, analytics & AI areas
 * Industry expertise on for example Public Sector, Health, Energy, Manufacturing, Logistics or Forestry
 * Enterprise & legacy software as well as integration understanding
 * Strong knowledge from different cloud ecosystems
 * Advisory capabilities for example related to governance and operating data & analytics
 * Solution & data platform architecture know-how
 * Experience in sales and thought leadership




What can we offer you apart from growing and learning in your role?

A unique and award-winning culture and work environment, based on values of trust, transparency, caring and continuous improvement. Our reputation as one of the most respected digital companies in the Nordics has allowed us to grow rapidly across Europe. This means that if at some point you would like to have a more international scope to your work and work abroad, you can take part in our expat programmes.




At Futurice freedom and responsibility go hand in hand. We believe that everything good starts with happy people, and everyone is encouraged to contribute and shape the future of our company.




Compensation

Your complete compensation package will be discussed in detail during the recruitment process. Our salary model is designed to offer a range of levels based on three factors: skills, responsibilities and impact. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment where every employee has the opportunity to thrive and advance in their career and become better versions of themselves.




During the initial interview round, we will discuss the salary range for this position. We offer a fixed salary with the possibility of performance-based bonuses and additional benefits.




Next steps

If this sounds like the opportunity you‚Äôve been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.




Our application form is about as easy as it gets. All you need to do is enter your contact information and upload your attachments. We‚Äôd love to see a CV, and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice. You can also submit links to your LinkedIn and/or GitHub profile or your portfolio, as well as share other attachments relevant to the application.

After we receive your application, we will reach out to you.




Those selected for the interview phase can look forward to an initial discussion that will help us get to know you better, and you to get more info about life at Futurice. This is followed by an in-depth talk with your potential future colleagues to dive deeper into your professional skills. Finally, there‚Äôs a general chat to discuss things like your potential future projects. It is also worth mentioning that reference calls are an integral part of our recruitment process.




How we work

Ever since Futurice was founded, we‚Äôve been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We‚Äôve put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean ‚Äì take a look here to learn more, check our Culture handbook 2.0 and get to know some of our people through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our offices here!




At Futurice, new joiners are not expected to fit into a specific mold ‚Äì people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there‚Äôs power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about our DE&I commitment and efforts here.




We‚Äôre Futurice

We are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.




Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.

description:
Job ID:¬†24725¬†

Are you a graduate with an IT background or an IT/Data analyst looking to build competence in data management?¬†

We are now looking for a motivated Data Steward to support implementation of data governance initiatives, maintain business critical data with a view to improve data quality and reduce risk, and build strong stakeholder relationships. ¬†

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers.

¬†

We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.¬†



About this opportunity¬†

Welcome to AWM COO in the Application Portfolio and Data Management team. You‚Äôll join AWM COO, a professional, fun and collaborative unit striving to ‚Äúmake it happen‚Äù ‚Äì delivering excellence through tangible results. This will be a unique opportunity for you to grow your career not only in Nordea but also in data governance. ¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:¬†

 * You will be responsible for metadata maintenance and documentation, implementing data quality controls and supporting risk mitigation activities
 * You will be responsible for performing BAU activities such as extracting data sets, configuring rules in relevant systems, and supporting with data classification and naming
 * You will implement and be responsible for deliveries in various projects and initiatives in the bank
 * You will work cross-functionally with stakeholders and contribute to developing communication materials, training, instructions on data usage

The role is based in Stockholm or Helsinki.



Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us. ¬†We are looking for a pro-active, energetic and results-driven individual to take this role to the next level and who sees this as an opportunity to grow in the data governance field!

To succeed in this role, we believe that:¬†

 * You have a strong drive and the strategic ability to see what needs to be done, both in the short and long term, with a solution-oriented mindset
 * You enjoy investigating and gathering information about data, and have attention to detail
 * You have strong collaboration skills and work well in a team environment
 * You have excellent stakeholder management skills, can navigate and collaborate across the value chain in AWM and Nordea
 * You have good English skills, both written and orally.



¬†Your experience and background:¬†

 * You have a minimum of 1 year relevant experience working with data in business, project or data management related role (or equivalent coursework experience)
 * Experience working with data quality, standards or controls
 * Work experience using SQL (or equivalent coursework experience)
 * Knowledge of savings products and business model is an advantage¬†

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 30/09/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact¬†Clara San Inocencio on tel: +46737471848 or e-mail: clara.san.inocencio@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.¬†

¬†

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond ‚Äì while having fun with it.

We‚Äôre ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for an experienced Data Lead to head our data craft within the Merge Mansion team. As a Data Lead, you‚Äôll be leading and mentoring data analysts and engineers across multiple product teams, fostering collaboration and the sharing of best practices. Merge Mansion‚Äôs Data team focuses on supporting our game development by providing data insights and analyses, creating and maintaining game-specific dashboards, improving data practices, and delivering meaningful reports to different stakeholders. You'll also help foster a data-driven culture while managing multiple projects in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


 * Leading and mentoring data analysts and engineers across multiple product teams, fostering collaboration and sharing of best practices
 * Understanding keys stakeholder needs and ensuring that actionable insights drive game development
 * Establishing best practices in data analysis, A/B testing, and data visualization to ensure data integrity and consistency across product teams
 * Identifying skill gaps within the data team and provide coaching, training, and resources to enhance technical and analytical capabilities
 * Staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data analytics to drive continuous improvement within the data function
 * Overseeing the creation of dashboards, reports, and models to provide actionable insights on game performance, player behavior, and KPIs
 * Aligning with the central data team on the analytics technology vision
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Extensive experience working as a data analyst or in a similar role related to business operations, with a proven record of leading teams
 * Strong understanding of game business models, KPIs, and game development and/or B2C online business and consumer segmentation
 * Situational awareness to successfully support game teams in data-driven decision-making across a broad range of game development stages
 * A good understanding of how to develop and improve our game and to support development teams in doing this
 * Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, and R, and visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI
 * Strong understanding of data models and the advantages and disadvantages of various approaches
 * Strong people and communication skills combined with a service-oriented attitude
 * Familiarity with the Free-to-Play mobile gaming market and an understanding of key metrics and challenges in the industry
   
   
   

What We Offer


 * Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
 * Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
 * Great opportunities to grow with the company
 * Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
 * Approachable leaders with low ego
 * Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office
   
   
   

Basics


 * Location: Helsinki, Finland
 * Relocation: Relocating to Finland expected, full support provided
 * Work model: Mix of office and remote work
 * Working language: English
   
   
   

Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think ‚Äúwe‚Äù before ‚Äúme‚Äù. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
title: Data Lead, Merge Mansion

description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team on a 10-month contract basis at Belmont Lavan Ltd. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, interpreting, and visualizing data to provide insights that drive business decisions.

As a Data Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design analytical models, and generate reports. You will also be responsible for maintaining data integrity, identifying trends and patterns, and presenting findings to stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:


 * Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple sources
 * Conduct thorough analysis of data sets to identify trends, patterns, and outliers
 * Create reports and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and understand business needs
 * Develop and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
 * Identify and recommend process improvements to enhance data collection and analysis procedures
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data initiatives and implement data-driven solutions
 * Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis tools and techniques
 * Translate complex data findings into actionable recommendations
 * Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Proficient in SQL and data analytics tools (e.g., Python, R)
 * Advanced Excel skills
 * Experience in data visualization and reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
 * Understanding of statistical analysis and modeling techniques
 * Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 * Attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis
 * Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines
 * Experience in the finance or related industry is a plus
 * Bachelor's degree in a relevant field
   
   
   

Expert's background and desired experience:


 * Experience working with location analytics
 * GIS
 * Data analytics (production and processing)
 * Understanding Python
 * SQL understanding
   
   

Experience with Esri tools and technologies is considered an advantage.

description:
In the era of Data & AI, the possibilities to make a change are limitless. Join our diverse team of professionals to help our Nordic and global customers to turn their businesses truly data-driven & digital. We are now looking for Data Engineers with hands-on experience to design and implement solutions for data processing, streaming, analysis and visualization. In your role, you would be building solutions together with our clients with modern tools, integrating the latest achievements of data & AI to our client‚Äôs core business processes.

Your work will span over the following areas:


Building data streams to integrate different types of data sources to the applications that utilize and analyze the data

Integrating data from on-premise solutions to cloud services

Utilizing various data storage solutions and data transfer methods

Building solutions for data transfer and mirroring between cloud platforms

Editing, enriching, filtering, and analyzing data


You preferably have work experience from some of the following qualifications and interest to grow on the others:


Experience in data lakehouse solutions, such as Databricks

Hands-on coding / application development experience, for example Python, JavaScript, Node.js

Experience in relational databases and NoSQL databases

Experience in designing and building solutions using cloud platform such as AWS, Azure or GCP

Experience and/or strong interest in technologies related to data streaming, such as Apache Kafka, Apache Flink or similar

Experience and/or strong interest in technologies related to batch-based data processing, such as Apache Spark, Apache Airflow or similar.


Qualifications

To succeed in your role, we are expecting the following key qualifications:


Degree in Computer Science or Technical Science or similar

Preferably at least one AWS, GCP or Azure certificate

Understanding and interest in data and the development of its mediation solutions, from solution design to quality assurance and production

Skills in information system development, such as using version control as a team member, documentation skills, testing skills and understanding the roles and practices of an agile-based team

Strong willingness and enthusiasm to learn and develop own skills

Ability to be an innovative, resourceful, and collaborative problem solver

Good presentation and communications skills in written and spoken on Finnish and English


Why Accenture?


Because people enjoy working here; the work we do is challenging, interesting and meaningful.

Accenture offers a unique career experience and unparalleled opportunity for you to grow and advance. We are driven by the best results, but we never forget to support each other. We like to challenge our employees and give them the opportunity to shine and succeed. We invest heavily in our people‚Äôs growth and knowledge development.

Our best and only asset is our people. We believe they‚Äôre at their best when knowing what is expected from them and we want to support them in different life phases. Our extensive MyWellbeing ‚Äìprogram is one of our key tools for that.

Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!


Interested? Make your move - apply online and attach a CV and letter of application as well as your transcript of records and salary request in English. We look forward to meeting you!

Requirements


 * A keen interest in staying up-to-date with the latest trends in the User Acquisition landscape
 * Knowledge of MMP, SKAN, and Google Privacy Sandbox
 * Extensive experience with data, either in gaming or digital marketing
 * Technical know-how in:
    * SQL at scale (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)
    * Python, R, or Julia
    * Looker, Tableau, or equivalent visualization tool
      
      
      

In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have some of these as well:


 * Past work experience in F2P mobile gaming business
 * Familiarity with:
    * Data modeling and transformation with tools such as dbt
    * Version control using Git
      

 * Statistics or ML experience with skewed distributions, such as ROAS modeling
   
   

What We Offer


 * Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
 * Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
 * Great opportunities to grow with the company
 * Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
 * Approachable leaders with low ego
 * Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office
   
   
   

Basics


 * Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
 * Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
 * Work model: Mix of office and remote work
 * Working language: English
   
   
   

Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think ‚Äúwe‚Äù before ‚Äúme‚Äù. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture

description:
Job ID:¬†25991¬†



Would you like to join our international team, to support us ¬†in work on Customer Experience Survey application? We are now looking for a¬†Senior IT Analyst to¬†to help us with a mission of simplifying and transforming our business and IT landscape.



At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.¬†

About this opportunity

Welcome to the Requirements & Analysis team. We are part of Data Systems in Group Data Management. As the¬†Senior IT Analyst you‚Äôll play a valuable role in building and supporting strong and productive teams.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Work with multiple, large and complex databases in Hue
 * Perform data analysis and verify outcomes for business requirements
 * Act as a bridge between business needs and developers to ensure the delivery of high quality IT solutions
 * Attend meetings with business, clarify issues with requirements, brainstorm for new, better solutions
 * Present findings to stakeholders, purpose new sources/attributes/statistics
 * Work with business in reaching out to stakeholders with queries about data, the meaning and logic behind it for new requirements and sources

 * Manage the integration of survey platforms with existing IT infrastructure including database and real time streaming platforms
 * Check data and process quality during BAU
 * Creation and maintenance of relevant documentation including requirements, functional and technical specification that define and support the solution
 * Work¬†in an Agile environment as an integral part of the cross-functional agile delivery team



You‚Äôll join a team of great individuals, where continuous learning is a virtue. The role is based in¬†Gdynia; Gda≈Ñsk; Helsinki; Warszawa; ≈Å√≥d≈∫.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Have at least 5+ years of relevant experience
 * Have experience with data analysis -¬†SQL is a must, working with Hive is an asset or at least the ability to quickly find solutions for HiveQL
 * Have ability to work on your own, actively search for solutions and answers (is proactive in reaching out to colleagues for help)
 * Logical thinking, know¬†how to understand new databases quickly
 * Have ability to find solution to complex data analysis questions
 * Have knowledge how to speak with stakeholder/business, you can stand your ground in a professional way
 * Are innovative in finding new solutions, can quickly come up with analytical proposals during meetings
 * Have experience with collecting and managing business requirements to design, develop and deliver IT solutions
 * Have ability to understand and to create technical documentation (i.e. Confluence)
 * Possess excellent communication and stakeholder managment
 * Possess good understanding of the Agile mindset and values
 * Have experience in working with business end users



Your experience and background:¬†

 * Knowledge of SQL, technical design & creating technical documentation
 * A strong solution-oriented and analytical mindset
 * Thrive when working with complex end-to-end solutions and processes
 * Experience in working with distributed global teams
 * Fluency in spoken and written English language
 * The knowledge about iterative and incremental development
 * The knowledge about fundamentals of software development processes and procedures
 * SAFe knowledge

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

description:
Job ID:¬†24697¬†¬†

We are growing our team in Data, Digital Sales and Engagement (DDSE) Finland. We are looking for a person that loves working with data and analysis to join our existing Analytics team. In DDSE we are a group of specialists in various fields; everything from digital marketing and content production to web analysis and data science. Collectively, we are responsible for engaging new and existing personal customers in digital channels, and driving sales via online/mobile banking and nordea.fi. ¬† ¬†¬†Every day, we work hard to ensure that each individual customer in Nordea receives personalized follow-up and advice in digital platforms.¬†Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. Joining the team will provide you with opportunities to use your experience with data analysis, visualization, statistics, machine learning and business analysis, to support business stakeholders to see improvement opportunities. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.

¬†About this opportunity¬†

¬†

This is a role within Personal Banking Analytics Finland / Data, Digital Sales and Engagement. In Data, Digital Sales and Engagement (DDSE), we are building the omnichannel customer journey seamless experience and for that we need to connect different data sources across our platforms and applications. We want to send relevant personalised messages to our customers offering the right product or service, in the right channel, at the right time.¬†

¬†

What you will be doing:¬†¬† ¬†As a Data Analyst / Data Scientist, you will act as a link between data and omnichannel customer journey development. You will work on e.g. product portfolio, sales funnels, campaign performance, sales reports, customer segmentation or propensity models for marketing, You are able to clearly communicate complex issues in an easy and understandable manner to a wide range of stakeholders.

¬†

In addition you will be: ¬†

 * Participating actively in the work of digital customer journey teams, training and coaching the team to utilize data & analytics
 * Giving regular updates and insights on how omnichannel business is developing including e.g. sales, activity performance, customer behavior, pricing, process steps and demand
 * Helping on the set up of customer engagement activities: analysis to identify target groups, evaluate data availability, support utilizing sufficient control groups, monitor the outcome of activities, and evaluate the results
 * Recommending and performing analysis of different data sources to spot development trends and pain points
 * Together with a wider data analyst community, take part into building analytics & tools needed for business development

¬†

The role is based in Helsinki, Finland.



Who you are



We are looking for a curious, driven Customer Journey Analysts / Data Scientist that is a crucial part of a customer journey team. Our dream candidate is someone who is comfortable working on their own or as part of wider data analyst community to support our business stakeholders in Personal Banking.

¬†

To build a successful career with us, you‚Äôll work well with others and always act with customer‚Äôs needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you‚Äôre excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You‚Äôre honest and reliable and passionate about doing a great job.¬†

¬†

Experience/ Background:

 * Academic degree in highly quantitative discipline or specialisation such as Computer Science, Physics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Economics, or Finance, and you have understanding of statistical concepts (e.g. Hypothesis Testing) and machine learning models
 * 2+ years of experience in data analytics. Ideally you have experience working on analytics / data science projects delivering tangible benefits / outcome
 * You are comfortable in using languages for data science & statistics e.g. Python, R, SQL
 * You know your ways around databases like Snowflake & visualization tool such as Power BI
 * Proficient in written and spoken English and preferably also Finnish



To succeed in this role, we believe that:

 * You share a ‚Äúmake it happen attitude‚Äù ‚Äì you have a proactive, innovative and can-do oriented mind-set with the ability to convert new ideas into concrete actions
 * You have good interpersonal and communication skills to ask the right questions to stakeholders and colleagues. You thrive in a cross-functional set up.
 * You have a passion for teaching others and supporting less experienced data users, with the ability to inspire and motivate¬†

Additional background and/or skillset, that are beneficial in this role:

 * You understand the principles of working with an Agile development approach
 * Financial industry expertise
 * Teaching experience

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next step

¬†

Please apply latest 22/09/2024. Notice that we don¬¥t consider applications via emails.

¬†

For more information about the team and the role, please contact Eeva Asikainen eeva.asikainen@nordea.com.

description:
You know the feeling when you‚Äôve beaten your personal high score? Working in Analytics at Supercell is like having those moments everyday. And better yet, making the best gameplay decision is a perfect blend of intuition and data.

As a Data Engineer, you‚Äôll be leveling up our Player Care operations. Actionable data is an integral part of providing better experience to our players and enabling both our Player Support and Trust & Safety teams to be effective and data driven. We are working towards being hypothesis driven and for that - we need your skills to help us build our data and tooling to be ready to continuously improve our service.

Picture yourself leveling up our tooling to legendary status of the highest of echelons. Rock solid and modern, others would say. Continuously raising the bar is your choice of approach.

You won‚Äôt be playing a follow-the-script type of a game with us. See, you are the forward-thinking, data-loving problem solver type who is seasoned to spot opportunities even when they're in stealth mode.

You‚Äôll be joining a company where thoughtfulness, quality and focus are kept in high regard. We are passionate about not compromising on quality and choosing a long term approach to make Supercell a truly global games company that will last for many decades to come.

Time to send us your application?

Responsibilities


 * Owner of Player Care specific data pipelines and data products.
 * Maintain, plan and execute roadmaps for data engineering improvement in your team, as well as integrating company wide data engineering initiatives.
 * Build/improve new dataset & applications upon the discovery of new insights
 * Support the team in their quest to become data driven
 * Define what data is collected to best serve our business needs
 * Proactively suggest and implement improvements that increase scalability, robustness and availability of data systems
 * Together with analytics engineering team, contribute to developing the company wide vision and strategy for data engineering practices
   
   
   

Requirements


 * +5 years of experience in data engineering or another relevant domain
 * Expert knowledge of Python and SQL
 * Highly proactive and independent doer
 * Strong communication skills
 * Track record of maintaining large scale ETL processes
 * Experience with modern data stack
 * Familiarity with large scale data warehouse technologies (e.g. Databricks, Spark)
 * Familiarity of build, deployment and orchestration tools
 * Passion for pumping out the highest quality data in a fast-paced environment
   
   
   

Benefits And Compensation

However, luring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.

We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.

About Supercell

We are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released six games globally ‚Äì Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale, Brawl Stars, and Squad Busters.

To make six games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality. Our mission is to create great games that as many people as possible play for years and that are remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we put together the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence to succeed.

You Might Love It Here...

If you love games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams that have the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games, and the company.

We know it takes more than trust and independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed and have fun while at it.

This position is in Helsinki, but you're not?

Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to ensure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you bring along. In addition to cats and dogs, we've even relocated a horse.

Not sure if you should apply?

Do it! You might feel like you don't tick all the listed requirements with stellar scores. That's fine! We're here to help you succeed. Also, we're happy to learn about any specific accommodations you might require to fully engage in our recruitment process.

And here's a video about what we do. (Best enjoyed with salmiakki and rye bread)

description:
Job ID:¬†25760¬†



Do you enjoy working with data analysis? Do you like solving problems and find out new and innovative solutions? Do you understand the principles of banking and are you able to apply this knowledge in your daily work?¬†We are looking for a Senior or Quantitative Risk Analyst to join Credit Risk Data Analytics team that is recognised for its professionalism, competence and capabilities. We have an ambitious development plan for the Risk models and together with our colleagues in Nordea we‚Äôll be part of creating the future of banking. ¬†At Nordea, we use internal models for calculating regulatory capital and these models are developed and maintained by Risk Models. This includes the data asset that collect and aggregate data from most of Nordea‚Äôs data landscape. Data analytics is in the core of statistical modelling to create an understanding of the data that‚Äôs used for modelling. ¬†At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger. ¬†

About this opportunity

Welcome to the Credit Risk Data Analytics team, a part of Risk Models organisation. ¬†We add value to Nordea and our customers by improving Nordea data quality, helping visualising and create the understanding of our data so modelling teams can build great models, finance can calculate profitability and the bank advisors can make credit assessments. ¬†As a (Senior) Quantitative Risk Analyst, you play a valuable role in performing technical data analysis in UDM, which is a database built on Hadoop. Your role will also include coordinating data related activities and ensuring proper communication within the team and across other Risk model areas.¬†¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Different types of quantitative data analysis such as:

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†- Data reconciliation

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†- Root-cause analysis for data quality issues

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†- Data extraction based on desired content

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†- Refinement of business requirements

 * Take responsibility for data related deliveries
 * Communicate status to relevant stakeholders
 * Performing data governance tasks as defined in Data Governance Recipe
 * Preparing reports and other documentation used for both senior management and external reporting
 * On occasions you will act as a bridge between business and IT, and ensure correct understanding between both parties

¬†

You‚Äôll join an international team with variety of backgrounds and skills. We believe that strong drive and passion for change are fundamental for delivering on our commitments. Bring your background and skills to our team, and you will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and develop.

¬†

The role can be based in Denmark, Finland, or Poland.



Who you are¬†

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Have an adaptability to thrive in fast-paced and dynamic environment
 * Are structured and able to coordinate several deliveries simultaneously
 * Are self-driven and able to work independently but also enjoy collaboration with others
 * Have strong analytical skills and keen attention to detail with the ability to analyse complex data and processes to derive meaningful insights
 * Have good communication and presentations skills, are not afraid to speak up and can effectively convey business requirements to IT teams and facilitate collaboration between stakeholders
 * Are curious and proactive, focus on solutions rather than problems and share our enthusiasm for developing and learning and constantly improving your skills and competences

¬†

Your experience and background:

 * An interest in finance and technology
 * Experience working with data analysis in a database structure
 * Understanding of the credit risk area, particularly working previously with credit risk data would be an advantage but is not a prerequisite
 * Knowledge of SQL, SAS, Python or similar
 * Experience with Big Data would be an asset
 * Master‚Äôs degree in finance, economics, engineering, physics, mathematics or a great reason for not having one

¬†

¬†If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 18/09/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact¬†Ismet Gurbuz,¬†Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst (ismet.gurbuz@nordea.com) or¬†Nina Faljic,¬†Head of Data & Strategy (nina.faljic@nordea.dk).

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

description:
Musti makes the life of pets and their owners easier, safer and more fun. We are the leading Nordic pet care company and we operate an omnichannel business model to cater for the needs of pets and their owners across Finland, Sweden and Norway. We offer a wide, curated assortment of pet products. We also provide pet care services such as grooming, training and veterinary services in selected locations.

Musti Group‚Äôs net sales were EUR 422 million in the financial year 2023. At the end of the financial year 2023, the company had 1,582 employees, over 1,5 million loyal customers and 342 stores.

Read more about us!




Lead Data Engineer




In this position you will be leading, designing and hands-on developing solutions using Musti Group‚Äôs data platform architecture. We are looking for a person who wants to make an impact by designing and building scalable solutions to complex problems. In this position you will have a great opportunity to contribute to the company level development in a Nordic leading company in pet care business. To a person who is passionate about data ‚Äì Musti will provide a dynamic working environment which also gives an excellent drive for personal development.




In this role you will

 * Act as an owner of the Musti Group‚Äôs modern data platform
 * Design and develop data pipelines, related modeling and integrations
 * Be passionate towards exploring and identifying the best solutions to fit the business requirements and use cases related to data and analytics.
 * Hands-on support and maintain the current data & analytics, architecture and data flows, as well as support and mentor data & analytics team members
 * Manage and set-up chosen technologies and new features according to business needsManage vendors and cost of related solutions




The following skills will help you to succeed in this position

 * Technical background and programming experience
 * Experience in Cloud data platforms and tools (AWS, Azure, DV 2.0, ETL/ELT)
 * Hands on skills with Snowflake
 * Matillion or similar tool considered as an advantage
 * Ability and passion to drive the technical platforms with strong focus and solution orientation
 * Good communication, collaboration, and facilitation skills in a dynamic working environment. Knowledge of agile methods is also appreciated.
 * Fluent language skills in English; Finnish or Swedish language skills are an advantage




Above all ‚Äì we are looking for an ambitious attitude and willingness to solve problems. We appreciate a team player with business-minded, pragmatic, down-to-earth, hands-on way of working and experience in retail and online business in a multinational environment.




Why to join our pack?

We offer you a diverse and inspiring work in the rapidly growing and evolving business in one of the leading pet retail companies. You have the possibility to develop your own work and the Musti data platform. You get to work with other stakeholders but have the independent touch of your work. You will meet furry colleagues and you can bring your own four-legged friend to work with you.




This position is based in our Helsinki K√§pyl√§ office, with the option to work remotely as part of our hybrid working model. We often have dogs in the office; therefore the work might not be suitable for a person who is allergic to pets.




For further information please contact IT Recruitment Consultant Pia Klemi, +358 40 772 3440, pia.klemi@wiseit.fi




If you consider yourself as a suitable candidate, please submit your application with CV and salary request from link below.

description:
Are you a data professional who is looking for the next step in their career?

Would you like to have a real say in how clients adopt their data solutions and drive value?

Do you enjoy adopting new technologies and methods, in particular AI?




Nigel Frank are partnered with a leading data consultancy who are growing due to their increasing workload and strong pipeline of work. Their sleek office is based in central Helsinki and promote a flexible hybrid policy, with a friendly, but ambitious technology-driven environment.




This is a fantastic time to join as they continue to grow to support their customer, for a business that offers real career development opportunities, both through professional and personal development.




What can you look forward to?

 * Hybrid policy with an encouraged 2 days in the office
 * Your choice of laptop and set-up
 * Interesting projects in various industries including Telecom, Transport, Logistics, Banking, Healthcare, Retail, Pharma, FinTech, Motor and others
 * Competitive remuneration package: high base salaries, collective bonus, you specify your pension level and over 30 days' vacation
 * Monthly catch-ups with your manager to make sure you‚Äôre happy with your work and on the right path to reach your goals
 * Time and budget devoted to training and development
 * Attend at least 2 conferences a year with regular social tech meet-ups




At the moment, there is a strong focus on building the team with Data Engineers, where you will help build robust and efficient data flow. It should be ensured that the right data is available, in the right format, at the right time, for critical analysis across the business.




If you want to develop within the most prominent data platforms and join a team of colleagues who encourage knowledge sharing and progression, take a look at the requirements below.




What we need from you

 * At least 2 years of data engineering experience: building data pipelines, modelling, cleansing, transformation, etc.
 * Proficiency in Azure: particular experience within Data Factory, Fabric, Databricks, Synapse, etc.
 * Skilled in working with databases, both on prem and cloud: Snowflake, SQL, Postgres, etc.
 * A desire to learn more and keep on up-skilling ‚Äì current consultants are building their experience in advanced analytics (AI/ML) and project leadership
 * Strong communication demonstrated through managing and engaging stakeholders and eliciting requirements effectively
 * Analytical and problem-solving skills
 * Ability to work independently and as part of a team ‚Äì you will be working alongside your skilled colleagues while also taking the initiative
 * It's a bonus if you've worked with visualisation and tools such as Power BI
 * Fluency in Finnish is required




This is an established company that has a fantastic reputation on the market with over 80% of their customers extending projects due to the team‚Äôs performance; they‚Äôre also having to turn down customers due to how many exciting projects they have right now and all of their consultants being busy on a project.




Since they prioritise having a great culture and working environment, you can expect to be surrounded by the latest tech and very best consultants; offering you a great chance to continue to grow your skill set.




Day to day you'll be involved in daily stand-ups and scrums to collaborate with the wider team to offer help, advice and updates on projects. You will be expected to work on projects concurrently whilst supporting the sales teams in scoping new clients. This means that the role will add real excitement to your day as no two days will be the same.




If you find this opportunity interesting, apply and we can run through the details. Alternatively, if you have any questions, drop me a message on LinkedIn or give me a call: +46 77 588 86 15

description:
About Us

News & Feature Media digital development team is specialized in developing large scale business-critical digital news products for consumers together with business & product owners, designers and other stakeholders. Our Data & Analytics team is responsible for developing personalization and optimization related to news services journalistic content, providing real-time news article analytics to editors as well as providing data-based features to engage readers.




About The Role

In this role, you will

 * Write high quality, maintainable code and release it as well working features
 * Perform peer reviews and participate in technical discussions both at the team level and product level
 * Participate in internal and/or external developer communities
 * Contribute to technical planning and backlog management
 * Help investigate and resolve production issues
 * Mentor and empower other people around you




About You

In our belief, we find the following characteristics important to succeed in the job.

 * Experience. 3-5+ years of software development experience. You are well versed software development and can manage also in the cloud.
 * Software development. Programming languages are only tools, but you have most experience in the areas of Scala, TypeScript or Python. If needed, you can work with JVM languages, namely Scala and/or Java. On databases, you understand the characteristics of relational, timeseries and key-value databases, and have used MySQL, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, InfluxDB or others.
 * Cloud development. You can work yourself through in the cloud infrastructure. We are using AWS with CDK/CloudFormation, but your experience can be also from GCP or Azure.
 * Data engineering. You understand and are interested of the usage of machine learning methods and algorithms in commercial products and have hands-on experience of data pipelines and analytics using tools such as PySpark, Databricks or Apache Flink.
 * Technical leadership. As a senior member in the team of developers, you have been enjoying the opportunities to take the responsibility to support others and make technical and architectural decisions. You can transform business requirements into technical solutions and talk and write about complex ideas concisely.
 * Willingness to learn. As new, interesting, and better technologies evolve, you have the willingness and demonstrated capability to learn new things quickly and share your learnings with others.
 * Team play. You have positive, forward looking attitude, and the ability to work with various types of people. Your written and vocal communication skills are strong.




We have an open culture and a flexible hybrid working model, our workplace is located in the heart of Helsinki. You can develop your know-how with versatile responsibilities and our wide education opportunities.




Could this be the role for you? It‚Äôs easy to apply, so do it now or ask for more information from Harri Virtala (harri.virtala@sanoma.com) or Jyrki Hokkanen (jyrki.hokkanen@sanoma.com).

This position requires a work permit and permanent residence in Finland. We expect applicants to be able to work from the office two days a week. Applicants may be required to undergo a security clearance in accordance with the Security Clearance Act (726/2014).




Apply between 10 September 2024 and 30 September 2024 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)




Employment type: Fulltime

Sanoma Tech & Data

Sanoma Media Finland is the leading Finnish cross-media company and a forerunner in the digital transformation of media. Our brands deliver relevant, inspiring and captivating content across media channels and reach almost every Finn every week. Our Tech&Data organisation is operating at the very heart of the fast-paced media world. We have 100+ experts of IT and data based in different cities in Finland.

We develop digital services and create Innovations for Helsingin Sanomat, the leading daily newspaper in Scandinavia, Ilta-Sanomat, the market leader in digital and mobile news, regional media Aamulehti, Satakunnan Kansa and a large number of local and regional newspapers as well as beloved lifestyle brands. Nelonen Media is the leading entertainment house with an extensive video, audio and event portfolio.

We have an open culture and have flexible hybrid working model. You can develop your know-how with versatile responsibilities and our wide education opportunities.Our workplaces are located in the heart of Helsinki and Tampere.

Our mission is to offer Finnish media content also to next generations.

description:
Job ID:¬†25577

¬†

Would you like to help Nordea leverage the ML platform to support Machine Learning Models? We are now looking for a Senior ML/Data Engineer ¬†to develop and deploy ML models for real-world problems.



At Nordea, we know our customers‚Äô needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. ¬†

¬†

About this opportunity



Welcome to the Data Engineering team in Group Data Management Unit. We add value by improving our ¬†AI target architecture to a hybrid cloud where CP4D plays a key role.

¬†

As the Senior ML/Data Engineer, you‚Äôll play a valuable role in leveraging our ML Platform for increasing demand towards future AI models, including migration towards AWS Cloud Solution and extending current architecture by implementing new components of AI platform.

¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Keeping CP4D compliant, up-to-date and scalable (e.g. new storage solution)
 * Our Target AI architecture is a hybrid cloud where CP4D plays a role. We should harness its capabilities to greater extent (e.g. Open Scale for monitoring, CP4D Feature store, CP4D WMLA, GPUs)
 * Support increasing demand from business (e.g. Propensity, Customer Lifetime Value, Micro-segmentation, channel recommendation models), helping use case team(s) in training and deployments
 * Help in optimizing our current MLOps practices and libraries, make applicable for wider range of use cases outside propensity models. Harness standard capabilities from CP4D and cloud for scalability
 * Cloud enablement for AI/ML when it comes, AI model development and deployment

¬†What we offerYou‚Äôll join a company where your personal development is our number one priority. In regular one on ones and quarterly feedback talks, you and your manager will identify possible paths for you to grow and utilize your strengths the best we can.



As a company, we offer Hybrid working model, diverse teams, English as main working language, sport package & professional learning benefit like Udemy/Coursera, etc.¬†The role is based in Warszawa; Gda≈Ñsk; Gdynia; Helsinki.



Who you are



Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.



To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Are passionate about business meaning of data, understand customer journey and ML concepts in enabling world class AI services ¬†
 * Are able to work independently, proactively proposing new ideas and seek opportunities for organisational improvements
 * Are eager to work on your professional development and have keen interest and ability on sharing knowledge with others¬†
 * Have positive attitude to your work and confident in navigating any challenges
 * Have excellent communication, stakeholder management and collaborative skills

¬†

Your experience and background: ¬†

 * Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics or equivalent¬†
 * 5y+ hands-on experience with complex SQL, including analytical window functions and queries optimalization
 * 3y+ of experience in creating, deploying and validating ML models running on modern heterogeneous multicore architectures
 * Experienced in using popular ML frameworks, such as Pytorch, TensorFlow, CP4D
 * Strong programming experience and scripting skills (python/pyspark/shell)
 * Strong experience with Hadoop ecosystem and big data volumes processing in close real time (Hadoop, Hive Spark)
 * Familiar with code versioning strategy - GIT/Bitbucket

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 23/09/2024.

description:
Join Nordcloud and make your mark on the European IT industry. Help our clients thrive on their cloud journey in solution areas such as infrastructure, migration, data, and security.

Currently, we are looking for a Cloud Data Engineer to join our team in Finland.

‚ÄúYou will be joining our stable data team that already has a strong foothold in the existing customer base. We would like you to support our growth and offering in the data area while contributing to our demanding customer project." ‚Äì Ville M√§kiranta, Head of Transform

Your daily responsibilities:


 * Working as a spearhead in our customer projects, together with our sales team, creating value for the customer and strengthening our team
 * Creating impact on our customer projects, building data pipelines and designing data transformations on cloud data platforms
 * At times, working together with our sales, delivery experts, customer and project managers to design and architect data solutions, with ownership from a technical point of view
 * Being part of our diverse global data team (nationalities from over 30 countries) building deltalakes, lakehouses, and data warehouses
   
   
   

Your key skills:


 * Strong skills and working experience with AWS or Azure
 * Experience in building and designing data solutions in large environments
 * Experience with two of the following tools: Databricks, Snowflake and/or DataVault
 * Proficiency in Python, SQL with some knowledge of cloud computing
 * Solid understanding of git/version control
 * Work experience with Azure Data Stack
 * Experience with Spark
 * Degree in computer science or equivalent
 * Passion for learning new technologies
 * Knowledge of agile methodologies
 * Fluent communication skills in English and Finnish
   
   
   

Skills we'd consider a plus:


 * Knowledge of another hyperscaler (preferably Google Cloud)
 * Experience with Databricks
 * Hands-on experience with any cloud provider
 * Familiarity with data warehousing and lakehouse
 * Some experience with NoSQL, Kafka
   
   
   

The successful candidate is expected to go through a security clearance.

We encourage you to apply, even if you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements. We value your growth potential and enthusiasm!

What we offer:


 * Individual training budget and exam fees for certifications
 * Flexible working hours and hybrid/remote working model
 * Laptop and equipment of your choice
 * Local package such as extensive private health care and wellness benefits
   
   
   

Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Finland.

About Nordcloud

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. We are triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, and we are recognized as a 'Visionary' by Gartner for Public Cloud IT Services. With 10 European hubs and over 1200 employees, we are known for our innovative cloud-native solutions and we have delivered over 1000 successful cloud projects.

description:
Job ID:¬†25717¬†¬†

Master Data Management, Master Data Governance & Analytics¬†Are you passionate about data, analytics and care about quality? Right now we are looking for a senior Business Analyst to strengthen our team of analytics professionals working with the data foundation in our bank- the Master Data.

¬†

At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.

About this opportunity¬†

Welcome to the Master Data Governance & Analytics team, an ambitious Nordic team working across our Scandinavian countries to deliver high quality Master to all Business Areas in the bank. data (currently covering Customer, Product, Organization and reference data)¬†As a team we support in establishing new Master Data products, as well as developing and maintaining the existing ones. We have a deep understanding of the processes and systems capturing and maintaining our Master Data, so besides being part of our own Master Data Management Agile Release Train (MDMART), we are often consulted by different business areas to profile or extract data sets for different purposes and also participate in larger change initiatives in the bank.¬†

¬†

We are also responsible for managing quality on our Master Data products, and plan and execute mitigating actions where needed. ¬†You will be joining a team of data professionals who are always willing to offer support, sparring, ¬†feedback and best practises with you. We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture and strive to have fun in our daily work. We continuously maintain and expand our internal network with stakeholders in different Business Areas as well as central functions.

We offer flexible working, meaning you have the flexibility to work from home and office.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Be Subject Matter Expert of our Master Data Products and the underlying systems.
 * Participate and support our internal ART in e.g. data profiling, data extracts, release verifications. Also support projects and other internal change initiatives involving master data within our scope.¬†
 * Proactively work on data quality issues in our Data Products including analysis, proposing mitigating actions and also drive development activities in order to improve quality.



The role is based in¬†either Copenhagen, Helsinki, Stockholm or Gdynia.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Have a proactive, innovative and can-do oriented mindset even in uncertain situations.
 * Are a structured and organized person who takes an active role to drive things forward.
 * Possess good communication and cooperation skills with stakeholders on different levels.
 * Ability to work well within a team, as well as individually.



Your experience and background:¬†

 * You are well acquainted with SAFe agile way of working and methods and have experience as a Senior ¬†Business Analyst or similar change management position.
 * Strong analytical background with excellent SQL skills.
 * Strong ability to learn and understand a complex architectural landscape around master data.
 * Solid knowledge or interest within the master data domain. Specific experience from any of our Master Data Products is an advantage.
 * Familiarity with Data Quality measurement and reporting.
 * Fluent in spoken and written English.

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 30/09/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Carl Ekelund.

¬†

If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

Job ID:¬†25561¬†

Model Development, Quantitative Finance¬†

Are you good at pricing derivatives and would you like to develop the state of the art models for estimating future financial risks? We are now looking for a¬†Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst to improve our assessment of the credit risk in Nordea's derivative transaction business.



At Nordea, we know our customers‚Äô needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.¬†

About this opportunity

Welcome to the Counterparty Credit Risk Models team. We add value by¬†developing internal models that measure and predict the credit risk of derivative transactions, thereby keeping the bank safe and trusted. As Senior Quantitative Risk Analyst you‚Äôll play a valuable role in making sure that we make the most accurate counterparty credit risk predictions, and that our models are reliable and well understood.¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Come up with new ideas to measure counterparty credit risk, for example in relation to collateral agreements
 * Analyse and visualize the performance of existing and new models
 * Be a sparring partner in model validations of derivative pricing models and other components of counterparty credit risk models
 * Collaborate with the other teams in the counterparty credit risk value chain: for example model validation, infrastructure, IT, front office¬†

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.



Most likely you are experienced in derivative pricing models, preferably in the interest rate, FX, or inflation market. Apart from experience in quantitative finance you might also have experience from working in a risk area in a bank. You have a strong analytical background from a M.Sc. or Ph.D. in a quantitative field, such as economics, finance, engineering, physics, mathematics, econometrics or similar.



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Cloud Engineer - Helsinki - up to 5000‚Ç¨/pm + 10% bonus




We're looking for an experienced Cloud Engineer to join our product development company. You will work for a company that delivers advanced Artificial Intelligence-based capabilities to Network Services worldwide where its mission is to deliver a world-class and safe environment in the modern world.




Responsibilities

 * Design & implement high-quality solutions.
 * Build, deploy & operate CI/CD pipelines, service monitoring & alerting.




Requirements

 * Experience in working with AWS: ECS, ELB, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, Route53, CloudWatch, IAM, VPC, Cognito, SNS/SQS/Kinesis, CloudFront, WAF
 * Experience in developing and running containerized and serverless applications in AWS
 * Understanding the key technical aspects of distributed systems, observability techniques, monitoring and alerting systems
 * Proficiency in programming languages (Typescript/Javascript/Python/Java)
 * Strong emphasis on security, automation and quality
 * Experience in provisioning resources in cloud-based environments using infrastructure as a code. Ideally AWS CloudFormation with AWS CDK.
 * Have a solid understanding and experience building declarative automation pipelines with tools such as Jenkins or GitHub Actions to implement CI/CD pipelines to compile, test, package and deploy components in multi-account, multi-region cloud environments
 * Good understanding of the Git version control system, and common development and collaboration methodologies around it
 * Documentation skills (processes, diagrams, technical designs)




In return

 * Healthcare
 * Mobile/laptop of choice
 * Culture/lunch vouchers
 * Hybrid working model
 * Conferences/training
 * Bike benefit (tax-free benefit)
 * Home internet subscription
 * Personal training budget (conferences, webinars, books etc.)
 * AWS certification bonus
 * 100 hours per year for competence improvements (during office hours)

Plus much more




To apply, you can contact me via email at j.wright@jeffersonfrank.com or call me at +358 75 3263948 for more information.




Jefferson Frank

Jefferson Frank is the Amazon Web Services (AWS) recruiter of choice. We work with organizations worldwide to find and deliver the best permanent and contract AWS DevOps, Big Data, IaaS and PaaS, and AWS Security professionals on the planet. For more information, visit jeffersonfrank.com.
