description:
Miltton is growing its martech competencies and we are looking for a consultant to join our talented and driven team in Helsinki. Miltton offers a dynamic and a human-centric culture and a house full of talents from different fields of business to learn from. We aim to be true changemakers in our clients' businesses and drive responsible growth.¬†

¬†

Your role¬†

As our new Martech consultant, you will become a key player in delivering advanced marketing technology solution services for our clients from various industries. You are competent developer with experience in APIs, webhooks, SDKs in various technologies. You also understand how all channels and technologies play together towards business goals. You believe in customer-centric approach and value technology as a driver towards better business decisions.¬†¬†

¬†

Responsibilities

 * Participate or lead Marketing automation, CDP ( Customer data platform), CRM, or other Martech-related projects¬†¬†
 * Consult and advise clients on implementation and optimization of modern marketing technologies and tools¬†
 * Provide expert consultation on integrating marketing technologies including APIs, webhooks, and SDKs into clients‚Äô systems¬†
 * Act as an intermediary between clients' marketing and IT functions ensuring seamless implementation and usage of technologies¬†
 * Collaborate in cross-functional teams to ensure clients' business challenges are answered and digital potential unleashed¬†

¬†

Requirements

 * You will have at least 5+ years work experience in Martech ‚Äì such as implementing marketing automation systems, CDPs or similar¬†
 * You have a strong history of showing business understanding and digital business capabilities in your previous work¬†
 * Your experience in best-in-breed technology (e.g. Braze, Iterable, MParticle, etc) is an advantage but suite experience in eg. Salesforce or Adobe is valued¬†¬†
 * You are sales-minded and result-oriented¬†
 * You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and manage multiple stakeholders.¬†
 * We expect you to have a curious mind and interest in learning¬†

¬†

If you see yourself in this position, please apply with your salary request by 13th September! We will start contacting suitable candidates instantly and close the recruitment as soon as we have found the right match.¬†¬†

¬†

In case you have questions about the position, please contact Emmi Ter√§s, Director Data-driven marketing services by phone +358407462176 on Wednesday August 28 between 10-12pm or Friday August 30 between 10-12pm Finnish time.
title: Martech developer

description:
TL;DR

Would you like to be a part of Recordly's story? Now is your chance! We‚Äôre looking for a Machine Learning Engineer eager to help businesses capitalize on the opportunities data and machine learning offer. Working at Recordly means you get to work with customers that truly want to make data and ML/AI their competitive edge.




‚ÄúWHO/WHAT IS RECORDLY?‚Äù YOU MIGHT ASK

Recordly is an independent Futurice family company specializing in value creation for our customers with data solutions. We believe a significant data transformation is taking place, but many companies are facing challenges in actualizing its full potential. We are here to help.




Our mission is to define the way data and people cooperate. We want to support businesses in understanding the data they already have, the business opportunities data possesses they‚Äôre not yet realizing, and how to use these to enhance strategic KPIs. Simultaneously, we aim to translate business requirements into actionable tasks for teams working with the data or related technologies. Through this collaboration with our customers, we aspire to drive and accelerate a broader data transformation movement.




In more traditional terms, our core business is data management, data architectures, and hands-on data engineering that enable exceptional user experiences, efficiency gains, AI solutions, and new business models. We also get our hands dirty with streaming ML, GenAI, or building enterprise-level ML platforms. In simple terms, we tech the heck out of data. What sets us apart is who we are and how we do it.




Our employee promise (besides offering engaging customer assignments, of course) includes the possibility to enjoy the company's success and shape who we are and what we do, together. We believe in being open about how the business is going and how the choices we make affect the bottom line. Take a look at our site to get to know us better.




NOW TO THE ROLE ITSELF

A Machine Learning Engineer at Recordly typically works in tight cooperation with very skilled colleagues and our customers within different assignments. Assignments vary and typically require hands-on work from time to time - meaning you may have to open up AWS/Azure/GCP Console and deploy some machine learning resources or write some MLOps stuff or data pipelines when the Data Engineers are not around. As we focus on creating actual business value by creating or utilizing for example data and machine learning platforms, we value the following skills:




 * Technical skills, both verbal and written, along with the ability to influence and demonstrate confidence in communications with data and machine learning technologies such as
 * Fluent with cloud infrastructure, especially the data side of the big three. We don‚Äôt expect you to be certified (we can help you with that), but work experience at least within one of the big three is needed.
 * Python - Yeah. This is our main tool in development. Knowledge of other languages is considered an advantage. Of course.
 * MLOps concepts and tool(s) - The most important part of your job is to build the capabilities to enable productive machine learning solutions. We believe that MLOps and other <Dev/Data>Ops methods are an important part of that.
 * Basic knowledge of machine learning models - It‚Äôs important to make business value using various machine learning models. To ensure this, a basic understanding of how the models work is sufficient, but even more important is an interest in how the models are operated in a production environment.
 * Understanding and/or experience with Data Lake infrastructure, Data Warehousing, and Data Analytics tools. By this we mean, that you know what other tools (MDM, Data Catalogs, Data Lineage tools etc.) are needed for a good data platform and have some experience with those.
 * Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and machine learning technical requirements. And we truly mean this. We want to be the glue, bridge, sellotape - whatever you want to call it - between the IT and business departments so that they understand each other.
 * Finnish and English skills as some of our projects are in Finnish.




WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU

When you join Recordly, you‚Äôll be greeted by our open culture and awesome colleagues. On the more tangible side, we both want you to be able to pay your bills and take good care of yourself. We do not believe in a one-size-fits-all approach. Therefore, we have introduced a pimp my benefits plan to make sure you get the most out of your benefits. Pick and choose what benefits you want to prioritise! In addition to the pimp my benefits offering, a great common baseline of benefits is offered to all employees. Below you can find some further details about our current benefit offering:




 * As a Recordly employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share program
 * A yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Recordlians)
 * Flexible remote working model
 * Extensive health care, including dental and mental health
 * Monthly massage
 * Insurance for travel and free-time
 * Phone benefit
 * Pick the laptop and phone of your choosing
 * Child care services when your child falls ill
 * Recurring training & learning sessions and other social events
 * Lunch benefit as a part of the pimp my benefits plan
 * Sports & culture benefit as a part of the pimp my benefits plan
 * Bike benefit as a part of the pimp my benefits plan
 * Public transportation benefit as a part of the pimp my benefits plan
 * IT & remote budget as a part of pimp my benefits plan
 * Home cleaning or additional child care services as a part of the pimp my benefits plan




Besides those, we promise you challenging customer assignments. Go check out the amazing work our data architects have done. Please note that currently we only offer permanent remote work opportunities in Finland.




INTERESTED TO HEAR MORE?

We‚Äôre eager to hear from you soon and we encourage you to send in your application as soon as possible. The recruitment process usually has two to three steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Recordly and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings. We‚Äôre committed to creating a good match between you and our organization, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews. When we‚Äôre done with the face-to-face discussions, we might want to contact the people you have chosen as references.

description:
Job ID: 25605

¬†

At Nordea, we know our customers‚Äô needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. ¬†¬†About this opportunity

¬†

Would you like to join a team delivering competitive, streamlined, and compliant card products for everyday spending to our customers?¬†

¬†

We are looking for an IT Analyst to support the Danish Consumer Cards Product team by performing analysis work for the team backlog. At Nordea, we recognize that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to stay ahead of the curve.

¬†

We are deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background.

¬†

With us, you‚Äôll be in good company, with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.



Responsibilities:¬†

 * Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document business strategies and objectives.¬†
 * Translate business strategies into detailed technical requirements for the IT team.¬†
 * Verify developed solutions by conducting test results on Mainframe applications.¬†
 * Liaise with IT developers, architects, and other technical staff to ensure that business requirements are clearly understood and accurately implemented.¬†
 * Analyze and map current business processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization.¬†
 * Develop and propose new business processes that align with strategic goals.¬†
 * Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) and obtain sign-off from business stakeholders.
 * Provide training and support to business users to ensure successful implementation.
 * Generate reports and provide insights to stakeholders on the effectiveness of implemented solutions.
 * There are many opportunities to shape the position and title around a skilled and ambitious candidate.

¬†

Who you are

¬†

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe you:

 * Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 * Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills.¬†
 * Are effective in a cross-functional team environment.
 * Can manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously.¬†
 * Utilize excellent analytical and collaboration skills in the requirement refinement process.
 * Are ambitious, quick to learn, and willing to grow and develop the role and the team.
 * Actively share your knowledge and experience to enable successful initiatives and strengthen team performance and skills.
 * Have experience with SAFe/agile methodology and agile teams.
 * Have experience in Test-Driven Development and are adept at using the system development life cycle in your daily work.
 * Enjoy working in an international environment.



Your Experience and Background:

 * 10-12 years of experience in IT or business areas. - At least 5 years in the banking and financial services industry, specifically in consumer card services.
 * Proven experience with Agile methodologies and the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
 * Experience working with the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
 * Background in data mapping and migration.
 * Proficiency in process modeling.
 * Hands-on experience with SQL.¬†
 * Strong understanding of the cards domain.
 * Solid technical knowledge for effective collaboration with developers.
 * Proficiency with analysis tools and methodologies.
 * Familiarity with regulatory requirements in the banking sector.

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

¬†

Submit your application no later than¬†26/09/2024.

¬†

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

¬†

For Swedish candidates only:¬†For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

¬†

For Polish candidates only:¬†Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

¬†

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‚ÄòGDPR‚Äô. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.

¬†

The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza ≈ömiglego 20, 93-281 ≈Åod≈∫. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.

¬†

We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

description:
Jefferson Frank have partnered with a leading SaaS provider to find a Senior ML Engineer to join their cutting-edge team!




They are a rapidly growing company revolutionizing the market research industry through their cutting-edge SaaS platform. Their solutions help businesses make data-driven decisions to improve product development and customer insights. They value creativity, collaboration, and innovation, and they're committed to pushing the boundaries of AI and machine learning to solve complex business challenges.




Role Overview:

They are seeking a skilled and passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join their dynamic team in Helsinki. In this role, you will design, develop, and deploy machine learning models that power the core functionalities of the platform. You‚Äôll work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to implement scalable solutions that transform data into actionable insights for their clients.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Develop and deploy machine learning models to enhance the platform‚Äôs features and performance.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production environments.
 * Optimize and scale algorithms for handling large datasets with high performance and efficiency.
 * Experiment with and implement new techniques to improve model accuracy and system latency.
 * Monitor and refine deployed models to ensure optimal performance over time.
 * Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML to continuously enhance our offerings.




Requirements:

 * Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
 * 3+ years of experience building and deploying machine learning models in production.
 * Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar.
 * Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
 * Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) for model deployment.
 * Strong understanding of algorithms, data structures, and software engineering best practices.
 * Familiarity with MLOps tools and workflows is a plus.
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate with teams across disciplines.
 * Fluency in English; Finnish language skills are a plus.




What They Offer:

 * Opportunity to work on innovative projects with real-world impact.
 * A supportive, collaborative, and forward-thinking team.
 * Career growth and professional development opportunities.
 * Competitive salary and benefits package.
 * Flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.
 * Modern office space in central Helsinki.




How to Apply:

Using the link on LinkedIn, otherwise you can drop me a message or call (+46 77 588 86 15) with any questions!

description:
F-Secure makes every digital moment more secure, for everyone. For over 35 years, we‚Äôve led the cyber security industry, protecting tens of millions of people online together with our 200+ service provider partners. We value our Fellows' individuality, with an inclusive environment where diversity drives innovation and growth. What makes you unique is what we value ‚Äì be yourself, that is (y)our greatest asset. Founded in Finland, F‚ÄëSecure has offices in Europe, North America and Asia Pacific.




------------




Would you like to apply your development skills in a global cybersecurity company? As our Senior Data Engineer you will work on the data platform that provides insight how F-Secure's world-class cybersecurity products and services perform. This platform processes data from various sources to generate insights about product usage and protection efficiency. Our systems extensively use AWS services and are built with a DevOps/SRE mindset, incorporating CI/CD, self-healing, elasticity, and scalability.




As a key member of our Data Engineering team, your work will directly impact the effectiveness of our solutions, ensuring that our data infrastructure is robust, scalable, cost-effective, and capable of responding to emerging threats.




The teams purpose is to help collect and connect data within F-Secure and provide a data platform for various reporting purposes. For example, as F-Secure's vision is to be the number one security experience company in the world, our team is responsible for providing the data for measuring how close we are in achieving that vision. We also report to our partners how we have protected their customers and how different security features have been used. We work with security, subscription and application telemetry data and our systems are built in the cloud.




Our Technology Stack

Our tech stack includes AWS services like S3, Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, and Athena, along with tools such as Cloudformation, Terraform, Jenkins, and Docker. We are a cloud-native team based in Helsinki, Finland, working with security, subscription, and application telemetry data to provide a comprehensive data platform for various reporting purposes.




Key Responsibilities




 * Take ownership of designing, developing, deploying, and monitoring data systems, ensuring high performance and reliability.
 * Work closely with analysts, developers, product managers, data scientists and security experts to translate data needs into actionable insights that drive business value.
 * Design, develop, and manage data enrichment and processing pipelines, handling millions of events every day.
 * Plan and design new data solutions with the team and other functions, keeping our systems cutting-edge and cost effective.
 * Stay up to date with new technologies, evaluate their potential, and integrate them into our existing systems.




What are we looking for?




 * At least 5+ years in data or cloud engineering with a strong background in building and managing cloud-based systems.
 * Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code, data management, and working with relational or NoSQL databases.
 * Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, for example AWS services such as S3, Kinesis, Glue, Redshift, or Athena, combined with strong programming skills in Python or NodeJS.
 * Proven ability to design, develop, deploy, and monitor cloud systems, ensuring high performance, reliability, and scalability.
 * Ability to collaborate effectively with business analysts, data scientists, developers, and other stakeholders to drive actionable insights.
 * Full professional proficiency in English.




Make sure to mention these if you're looking for bonus points:

 * Experience with data engineering tools such as DataBricks, Airflow, dbt, and ETL orchestration.
 * Knowledge of AWS lower-level fundamentals.
 * Experience with Kafka.




What will you get from us?




 * You will work together with experienced and enthusiastic colleagues, and within F-Secure you will find some of the best minds in the cyber security industry.
 * We warmly encourage our Fellows to grow and develop within F-Secure, and in your career here you can find yourself contributing to any number of our other products and teams. You decide what to make of this role, what your priorities are, and how you organize your work for the best benefit to us all.
 * We offer interesting career paths and a strong compensation model with wide range of benefits. You get a chance to develop yourself professionally in an international and passionate team serving our customers in providing world class security, privacy and uncensored access to information online.
 * You get to work in a flexible, agile, and dynamic working environment that supports individual needs. Giving our people both support and the opportunity to be in charge of their own work is something that is in our DNA.
 * We are in a unique phase in our 30-year history and with curiosity and excitement in the air we see no limits for building a strong and fruitful career with us!




Our benefits include extensive health care, remote working, company supported sport activities, lunch vouchers, regular massages, gym and sauna at the premises and many more things to keep our best asset ‚Äì people - happy!




A security vetting will possibly be conducted for the selected candidate in accordance to our employment process.

,

description:
Evac has been a pioneer in sustainable technologies and solutions for decades. Today we are the world‚Äôs leading provider of integrated Evac¬Æ water, waste and wastewater technologies, Cathelco¬Æ corrosion protection and marine growth prevention and HEM¬Æ freshwater systems.




Our technologies address the increasing need for innovative solutions driven by the megatrends of climate change, circularity, and increasingly scarce freshwater resources. We contribute to a better environment and cleaner seas by helping our customers eliminate waste, conserve water, mitigate emissions, and lengthen the lifecycle of their vessels or buildings. Together with our 500 colleagues in 14 countries, we strive for a future with no waste.




We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Technical Solutions Engineer to join our marine sales team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing technical inquiry documents, developing detailed technical specifications, and creating comprehensive documentation packages for system project sales in the marine industry. As a key technical expert within the sales team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring our offerings meet customer needs, while also contributing to ongoing development projects and participating in customer visits and ship surveys when required.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Technical Analysis: Evaluate and interpret technical inquiries from customers and sales representatives.
 * Documentation Preparation: Develop and prepare detailed technical documentation, including system descriptions, for system project quotations.
 * Materials & Deviation Lists: Create materials lists and identify potential deviations for system project quotations.
 * Project Handover: Assist in the preparation of project handover documentation to ensure a seamless transition from sales to implementation.
 * Collaboration: Work closely with product management, engineering teams, and other stakeholders to determine the most feasible technical solutions.
 * Customer Engagement: Participate in customer meetings and ship surveys to provide technical expertise and ensure customer satisfaction.
 * Regulatory Compliance: Stay informed about the latest industrial standards and regulations, reporting on relevant findings.
 * Cross-Department Communication: Liaise with R&D, Supply Chain, and other departments to gather product technology and cost information.
 * External Communication: Coordinate with third-party representatives, suppliers, and designers as needed.




Success Factors:

 * Technical Acumen: Strong ability to learn and understand Evac products and associated technologies.
 * Project Insight: Basic understanding of delivery project business and project engineering processes.
 * Design Proficiency: Proficient in design tools such as AutoCAD, MS Visio, and 3D design software.
 * Industry Experience: Previous experience in ship design, process engineering, or related fields.
 * Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
 * Customer Focus: A strong customer service attitude, with a focus on both internal and external clients.
 * International Mindset: Ability to thrive in an international environment.
 * Language Skills: Proficiency in English and Finnish is required; additional language skills are a plus.
 * Marine Expertise: Prior experience in shipbuilding or offshore projects is highly desirable.




Performance Metrics:

 * Documentation Output: Quantity and quality of technical document packages created.
 * Efficiency: Turnaround time from receipt of RFQ to delivery of quotation materials.
 * Feedback: Positive feedback from sales managers and representatives.
 * Accuracy: Precision in engineering/customization and deviation management for offers.




Travel Requirements:

This position may require occasional travel for ship visits and customer meetings.




Qualifications:

 * Education: Degree in Engineering (Machinery, Process, or Shipbuilding).
 * Experience: Minimum of 3 years in an engineering field, such as ship layout design, mechanical engineering, or process engineering.




If you are passionate about engineering and thrive in a collaborative, international environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and help shape the future of marine technology!




Evac Group is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
sector: Utility System Construction and Maritime Transportation

description:
Open Application to Jump into Our Cloud Technology Journey

At Codento, we work with customers from many different industries to provide value with cloud technology, software, and AI.




Google Cloud stands out as the fastest-growing cloud platform, and the demand for expertise in this domain is soaring. Codento proudly ranks among Finland's leading Google Cloud organizations.




If you‚Äôd love to join our empathetic group and challenge yourself in cloud technology but didn‚Äôt find a fitting job ad, you can leave an open application here!







Examples of Consultant Positions We Will Need in Our Growth Journey

 * Cloud Architect
 * Data Engineer
 * Data Architect
 * Data Scientist
 * Software Architect
 * Software Developer

What usually binds these different positions together at Codento is having a solid background in coding hands-on and a strong interest in cloud technology.







Why Codento?

At Codento, we empower you to not only leverage your existing expertise but also to delve deeper into the realm of Google Cloud. We‚Äôre committed to helping you grow as a professional since it also helps everyone around you. We provide the tools, time, and knowledge-sharing opportunities necessary for your growth.




When you become a Codentian, you become part of a compassionate community united by a shared passion for technology and personal growth. We believe in active participation and include Codento team members in decision-making processes. Thus, strong teamwork and a commitment to promoting a harmonious work environment are key attributes we value.

Interested? Wondering About Something?

description:
Introduction




Tesseract Investment is a regulated institutional digital asset lending company based in Finland. We provide yield-generating solutions to institutional clients across Europe and other emerging markets. Our white-label product, Earn API by Tesseract, enables partners to offer their customers different financial products tailored to specific risk strategies.




Since founding in 2017, we have a track record of rigorous risk management, innovation, and profitable growth. In June 2021, we raised a 25 MUSD Series A to supplement our growth.




Your responsibilities




We are looking for a dependable full-time Principal Engineer to join us in our Helsinki team. You will be the copilot of our VP of Engineering with responsibilities in architecture, development and leadership. We offer an amazing environment to grow towards highest levels of tech leadership.




Some key tasks include:




 * Deliver new features and maintain the existing platform by writing clean, well-tested, well-documented, and elegant backend and occasionally frontend code. Make sure your team deliverables reliable and consistent work in production.
 * Work together with VP of Engineering to develop blueprints, architectures and designs for the new services while shaping our standards for their implementation.
 * Work with the team by reviewing and testing the work of others.
 * Develop and maintain test automation on all levels of testing triangle. Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines.
 * Support and contribute on infrastructure development and maintenance.
 * Be curious of our software performance in live customer settings, develop monitoring to gain insight and proactively identify problems to improve the stability of the service. We built it, we run it.




What we expect from you




 * 8+ years of relevant software development experience (programming, databases, architecture design, etc.) with at least some of that in SaaS or product company context.
 * Experience of working with production systems.
 * Excellent full stack programming skills and experience in Typescript and its ecosystem, combined with a strong habit of writing and maintaining tests.
 * Experience in containers and their orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
 * Experience in RDMS, preferably PostgreSQL.
 * Experience in cloud based software architecture design.
 * Experience in Infrastructure-as-Code and AWS.
 * Good collaboration and communication skills. You are always helpful and respectful towards others.
 * Excellent English language skills, Finnish considered as a benefit.
 * Valid work permit to work in Finland.




We also value if you have experience in:




 * Regulatory environment e.g. banking, finance, accounting, healthcare.
 * Developing system and acceptance test automation.
 * Developer recruitment.
 * Planning, leading and coordinating software development work.
 * Process development and setting development standards.
 * Crypto & blockchain and/or web3.







About Tesseract




We are a forerunner and one of the longest-standing market participants in the digital asset lending market. As a well-funded high growth firm, we pride ourselves on our proprietary technology and innovative products. We are a team of result-driven professionals with clients all around the world. Read more about us on our website.




Who you will be working with

description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond ‚Äì while having fun with it.

We‚Äôre ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for a solution-oriented Cloud Security Engineer to help us integrate security-minded thinking into every aspect of our game development cycle. Joining our InfoSec team, you will take on the responsibility of securing our cloud infrastructure, application development, and security tooling, while also supporting our game teams with security-related matters. You will play a key role in building our blameless security culture by championing honesty, solution-oriented thinking, collaboration, and a strong sense of responsibility, so we can openly and constructively address security concerns.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


 * Developing, implementing, and maintaining cloud security architecture, policies, and procedures
 * Collaborating with game and infrastructure teams to identify, evaluate, and mitigate security risks, integrating security into our development lifecycle
 * Developing and further improving the security of cloud infrastructure, emphasizing automated, reusable, and architecturally sound solutions
 * Fostering open communication, collaboration, and a culture where voicing concerns contributes to swift and effective threat response
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Extensive work history in Cloud Security, Application Security, or DevSecOps roles
 * Hands-on experience on securing production workloads in Amazon Web Services (AWS)
 * Knowledge of security and infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation
 * Strong understanding of security controls, privacy considerations, and risk management
 * Proven capability to support Infrastructure and Game teams with related security inquiries related to infrastructure, development, and application deployment process
 * Solution-oriented mindset with a focus on automation and architectural security
 * Ability secure platforms, and information across the organization, and take ownership of this responsibility
   
   
   

In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have these as well:


 * Familiarity with mobile application development, application and API security, and CI/CD pipelines (Github Actions, ArgoCD)
 * Experience of conducting threat modeling in cloud native environment and application development
 * Practical know-how of Kubernetes (EKS) or other serverless and container technologies
 * Demonstrated ability in security incident investigation and response in cloud environments
   
   
   

What We Offer


 * Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
 * Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
 * Great opportunities to grow with the company
 * Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
 * Approachable leaders with low ego
 * Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office
   
   
   

Basics


 * Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
 * Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
 * Work model: Mix of office and remote work
 * Working language: English
   
   
   

Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think ‚Äúwe‚Äù before ‚Äúme‚Äù. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
title: Cloud Security Engineer

description:
Why Verifone

For more than 30 years Verifone has established a remarkable record of leadership in the electronic payment technology industry. Verifone has one of the leading electronic payment solutions brands and is one of the largest providers of electronic payment systems worldwide.

Verifone has a diverse, dynamic and fast paced work environment in which employees are focused on results and have opportunities to excel. We take pride in the fact that we work with leading retailers, merchants, banks, and third party partners to invent and deliver innovative payments solution around the world. We strive for excellence in our products and services, and are obsessed with customer happiness. Across the globe, Verifone employees are leading the payments industry through experience, innovation, and an ambitious spirit. Whether it‚Äôs developing the next platform of secure payment systems or searching for new ways to bring electronic payments to new markets, the team at Verifone is dedicated to the success of our customers, partners and investors. It is this passion for innovation that drives each one of our employees for personal and professional success.

What's Exciting About The Role

We are looking for an experienced and technically minded Linux Engineer to support and maintain all Linux and Oracle VM infrastructure across multiple datacenters.

Key Duties And Responsibilities


 * Complete BAU tasks, escalating where exceptions occur
 * Respond to and escalate service incidents, ensuring all incidents are resolved within SLA
 * Develop and implement new BAU tasks and manage change within BAU task procedures
 * Complete acceptance testing of new releases and patches, providing technical feedback to Development
 * Manage the deployment of system changes and maintenance tasks during specified maintenance windows
 * Perform as part of a team, respond to Customer RFPs
 * Preparation of technical documentation and SLA reporting
 * Perform as part of a team providing 24/7/365 on-call support by responding to escalations, alerts, incidence and problems that affect the environment and payment systems the team is responsible for
 * Process compliance
 * Perform as part of a project delivery team if/when assigned
 * Perform in a role as a subject matter expert in support of the environment and applications assigned
 * Provide hands on support on Enterprise Linux (RHEL, Rocky, Oracle) and Oracle VM operating systems
 * Manage and maintain Red Hat Satellite
 * Management of Puppet infrastructure and deployments
 * Manage the Oracle VM capacity and provide monthly usage
 * Highlight any issues to line manager
 * Responsible for providing regular status updates, issues, concerns to management Apply a sense of urgency, commitment and focus on the right priorities in developing solutions in a timely fashion
 * Review documentation and change control for technical accuracy
 * Participate in product evaluation initiatives including feature analysis and system trade-offs
 * Provide support and input for PCI audits and security compliance
 * Perform other duties as necessary
   
   

Skills And Experience We Desire


 * Native Finnish
 * Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
 * 5+ years hands-on systems implementation and Enterprise-level experience in Linux administration
 * ITIL Foundation certification Skills/Abilities
 * Working knowledge of Networking components, Load balancers , firewalls, routers, switches
 * Advanced Bash scripting
 * Experience of automation using Ansible, Puppet and Foreman
 * Working knowledge of monitoring solutions, such as Zabbix, ELK, App Dynamics
 * Knowledge of Containerized environments
 * Working experience with change management ticketing systems and process, i.e. ServiceNow
 * Experience of working in an enterprise environment
 * RHCE certified Desirable Red Hat Certified Specialist in Ansible Automation Red Hat Certified Specialist in Container Management
 * Experience in the payment industry is a plus
 * Knowledge of PCI requirements 3.x is a plus
 * Positive attitude, Dogmatic with strong attention to detail
 * Ability to work well individually and with your team members in a cross cultural environment
 * Seek out opportunities to improve your own and team performance and recommend potential improvements in infrastructure, automation, processes or services and is prepared to manage change
 * You deliver enterprise level quality on time, demonstrate initiative when resolving incidents or problems, self-motivated and accountable and effectively apply critical thinking and technical expertise to efficiently guide the team
   
   

Our commitment

Verifone is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Verifone is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
title: Linux Engineer
Soft Skills: critical thinking, attention to detail, leadership

description:

We are looking for an experienced Game Designer to join our New Games team and start working towards our next global hit game. You will design engaging game experiences that align with our chosen game vision and resonate deeply with players, informed by a continuous cycle of feedback loops.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


 * Translating the game vision into tangible and clear design proposals, and effectively communicating this game design
 * Designing gameplay, systems, progression, monetization, features, and live events
 * Defining what is valuable for the target audience, and how the systems deliver that value in the form of content with a long-term perspective
 * Shaping the player experience and overall player journey from install to years of live service
 * Designing a long-term, scalable and balanced game economy
 * Working together with Game Lead to shape a focused and clear game vision that meets the audience needs and business objectives
 * Collaborating with artists to ensure the game‚Äôs visual style supports the vision and appeals to the audience
 * Working closely with engineers to ensure design intent matches implementation
 * Collaborating with user research to deepen our understanding of the target audience and to inform decisions and get player feedback.

 * Understanding of free-to-play business model and market trends
 * Deep knowledge of game mechanics, dynamics and aesthetics

Job ID:¬†25161¬†

#IT #Developer #Data #Engineering

Would you like to work with Big Data? We are now looking for a¬†Senior Data Engineer to develop, maintain, test and evaluate Big Data solutions within Nordea‚Äôs next generation Big Data Platform.

In Nordea, we‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology to reinvent the future of banking. A tech revolution is underway ‚Äì and you can make an impact. Though we‚Äôre a Nordic bank, we‚Äôre also one of the largest IT employers in Tricity and Warsaw. Working with international teams in an inspiring working environment, you‚Äôll have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.¬†

About this opportunity

Welcome to the Capability Area Data Engineering team. We add value by¬†building distributed and highly parallelized data processing pipelines which process a massive amount of data. We leverage Scala and Spark to enrich and transform corporate data to enable searching, data visualization and advanced analytics. As the Senior Data Engineer, you will play a valuable role in creating high-performing, flexible, robust, scalable and easily maintainable global reporting solution for the Bank.

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Building distributed and highly parallelized big data processing pipeline which process massive amount of data (both structured and unstructured data) in near real-time
 * Leverage Spark to enrich and transform corporate data to enable searching, data visualization, and advanced analytics
 * Working closely with analysts and business stakeholders to develop analytics models
 * Continuous delivery on Hadoop and other Big Data Platforms
 * Automate processes where possible and are repeatable and reliable
 * Work closely with QA team

You‚Äôll join a where your personal development is our number one priority. In regular one on ones and quarterly feedback talks, you and your manager will identify possible paths for you to grow and the right amount of guidance needed to reach you.¬†The role is based in¬†Stockholm; Gda≈Ñsk; Gdynia; Helsinki; Oslo; Warszawa.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Are collaborative and achieve your expectations through communication and teamwork
 * Are curious, responsive and can understand the needs of others to ensure delivery of the desired results
 * Work qualitatively and strive to always do things better
 * Have a high level of self-motivation

¬†Your experience and background:¬†

 * Experience working in Agile methodologies
 * Unit testing experience with framework ScalaTest or similar
 * Programming experience with Scala or Java and willingness to learn Scala
 * Experience with distributed data processing engines like Spark

¬†As an advantage, familiarity with one or more of the below technologies:

 * Robot Framework
 * Atlassian Suite: Confluence, JIRA
 * Hadoop ecosystem (hive, oozie, Impala etc.)
 * Snowflake

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 01/10/2024.¬†Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

description:
We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our Revenue Operations team. In this role, you will analyze data from various sources, identify trends and patterns, and present actionable insights to guide our organization's strategic decisions.







In your role as Business Analyst, your responsibilities include

 * Data Analysis and Reporting: Collect, analyze, and interpret data from CRM systems, sales records, and customer feedback to generate meaningful reports
 * Forecasting: Provide a clear way to look forward to how the business performs based on the input of customer-facing teams
 * Insight Generation: Translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for business improvement. Develop self-service analytics tools for departments and management aligned with their goals and objectives
 * Reporting Tools Management: Develop and maintain business intelligence tools such as PowerBI, provide user-friendly and comprehensive insights to business leaders
 * Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with sales, marketing, professional services, customer success and Finance teams to understand their data needs and support them with relevant analytics and dashboards
 * Market and Trend Analysis: Conduct trend analyses to support strategic planning and operational adjustments
 * Performance Monitoring: Implement, monitor, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular updates to management on sales, marketing, professional services, and customer success outcomes
 * Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process optimization based on data analysis and contribute to implementing changes
 * Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members on data analysis and interpretation to foster a data-driven decision-making culture within the organization




Requirements

 * Proven experience in business analytics, data analysis, or a related field. Minimum three (3) years is preferred
 * Strong proficiency in data analytics tools and software, particularly PowerBI
 * Excellent analytical, statistical, and problem-solving skills
 * Ability to interpret large amounts of data and present findings clearly
 * Finance background/knowledge preferred
 * Strong communication and presentation skills
 * Fluent in English
title: Business Analyst

description:
Job ID:¬†25263¬†

¬†

We are looking for a Senior or Quantitative Risk Analyst to join EAD Models team at Nordea. ¬†

¬†

We are looking for credit risk model developers. The job provides an exciting mix of challenges, where different areas of knowledge and skills can be applied: developing advanced statistical models, designing internal software libraries, working with big data, analysing economic behaviour, understanding and abiding to regulatory constraints and further, to explain complex models to stakeholders on all levels across the bank.¬†

¬†

At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.



About this opportunity¬†

Welcome to the EAD Models team, part of the Risk Models Methodology & IRB Models unit. Working with us, you will be a part of one of the most important programs for the bank, which consists in upscaling Nordea‚Äôs internal models for credit risk. There are opportunities to work on all aspects of IRB model development, scorecards, PD, LGD and CCF.¬†¬†

As the Quantitative Risk Analyst you will have great possibilities to develop your skills within advanced modelling ‚Äì a field which is in high focus in Nordea.¬†¬†Being a part of the broader Group Risk organization, you'll help ensure that compliance underpins every decision we make and every action we take. By bringing your perspectives to the team and through your focus on quality and cooperation, you will be important.

¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Develop and maintain IRB models ¬†
 * Develop tools for data extraction for model development and other analysis
 * Continuously work on improving methodological choices for the models and be able to clearly communicate its rationale and impact to internal and external stakeholders ¬†
 * Join an open and inspiring atmosphere, where you will cooperate closely with your colleagues across the bank
 * Give input to senior management and business based on data analysis and previous experience

¬†

You will join a highly professional and dedicated team of quantitative analysts with a large network across the bank and with excellent opportunities for personal and professional development. Joining the team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to draw and leverage on your teammates‚Äô expertise and commit to excellence.¬†



The role is based in Warszawa; Gda≈Ñsk; Gdynia; Helsinki; Oslo; Stockholm.

Who you are¬†

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share the same values with us.

¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table
 * Are dependable, willing to speak up even when it‚Äôs difficult
 * Have excellent communication skills
 * Are committed to empowering others

¬†

Your experience and background:¬†

 * Master's or PhD degree in a quantitative field or software development field, including but not limited to mathematics, economics, statistics, data science, software engineering, computer science or similar
 * Experience in SQL, Python, SAS or similar
 * Experience working with data and models
 * Experience in IRB/IFRS9 or CCF modelling is required

¬†

Nice to have:

 * Experience in driving deliveries, ideally in an agile environment ¬†
 * Knowledge of credit risk processes would be an advantage
 * Hands on experience in Big Data platforms, e.g. Hadoop
 * Understanding of technologies and IT solutions used for data processing

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!¬†

¬†

Next steps

description:
Do you have extensive experience in Stata or R? Are you familiar with Finnish register data or other health data? Are you a team player with strong analytical and communication skills who is looking to work as a consultant?

Quantify is growing rapidly and we are now looking for a Finnish speaking Senior Research Analyst with at least 2 years of relevant experience in data management or statistical programming to join our Real-world Evidence & Analytics team. Join us in our quest to improve healthcare for patients all around the world!

The Role

As a Senior Research Analyst you will be part of a diverse team responsible for design and execution of various projects within Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR). Examples of day-to-day activities include:


 * Investigate different sources for health data and its quality
 * Develop study protocols and statistical analysis plans
 * Apply for real-world data and communicate with data holders
 * Develop code for data management and analysis in R or Stata
 * Perform quality control of statistical code and output
 * Prepare study reports and academic publications
 * Presentations to internal or external teams
 * Support and preparation for client meetings and sales related activities
   
   

You will be supported by experienced team members who will help guide your work. You may interact with other teams specialized in other areas of health economics and outcomes research.

Your Qualifications


 * Postgraduate degree (MSc, PhD) in statistics, biostatistics, economics, data science, epidemiology, engineering, mathematical modelling or another quantitative discipline
 * At least 2+ years of relevant work experience at a pharmaceutical company, consultancy, government agency or university
 * Extensive experience of data management and statistical analysis using Stata or R
 * Experience from working with Nordic health care registers or other large health databases
 * Experienced in writing statistical analysis plans, study protocols, study reports
 * Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) in English and Finnish is mandatory
 * Hard working, driven and curious
 * Strong analytical skills combined with an independent, solution oriented ‚Äúhands-on‚Äù mentality
 * Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team
 * Well-developed critical skills with attention to detail
 * Prior experience of register-based cancer research or pharmacoepidemiology is a merit
   
   

About Quantify

Quantify Research is an expert consultancy in health economics and outcomes research with Nordic roots and values. We create evidence to support the value of pharmaceutical products across many disease areas, through three internal business units: Real-world Evidence & Analytics, Modelling, Access & Strategy and Evidence Review and Synthesis. Quantify is proud to work with medical innovators across the globe to improve patient lives.

We offer a workplace where you can develop your skills and knowledge in a fast-paced, high-impact environment. There are many opportunities for leadership, personal growth, and involvement in exciting initiatives. Through your work, you will play a key role in helping patients access life changing medicines in a variety of disease areas. We have office locations in Stockholm (headquarters) as well as Chandigarh, Copenhagen, Helsinki and Oslo. This is a fulltime position, based at our office in Helsinki metropolitan area, with a hybrid workplace model where you can mix in-office and remote work to enjoy more autonomy and a better work-life balance. We are looking to fill this position as soon as possible.

Application

Please send in your application quickly as we might fill this position before the end of the application period. Last date to apply is September 30th. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact HR Generalist Fredrika Juhlin by email: fredrika.juhlin@quantifyresearch.com
title: Finnish speaking Senior Research Analyst
Soft Skills: communication, leadership, attention to detail, analytical skills

We are looking for an experienced Game Designer to take ownership of designing game features from concept to implementation and managing the game economy of Merge Mansion.

Responsibilities

 * Taking ownership of designing game features from concept to implementation
 * Following through on features to ensure they work as designed and achieve the expected impact once live
 * Documenting and communicating feature designs and intentions with the rest of the team
 * Designing, modeling, monitoring, and balancing complex game economy systems, ensuring that the game experience is fun and engaging
 * Ensuring that every system in the game is tuned and works seamlessly together with the rest
 * Being the go-to person for questions about new features, existing designs, or an ongoing in-game event
 * Working closely with Product Managers, Data Analysts, and other stakeholders to align design solutions with business goals and user needs
 * Collaborating with other team members, such as Artists, Programmers, Story, and Project Managers to implement and iterate on features and content based on goals
 * Facilitating brainstorming with other team members and designers to collect more input and pick best design ideas available




Requirements

 * Extensive experience in game design, game systems, and balancing game economies in a live game
 * Clear understanding of free to play games and how their game economies work
 * Strong sensitivity to gameplay and game design which makes you uniquely skilled in building needs and emotions in the context of a game
 * Logical thinker with strong attention to detail. Working with numbers and analyzing data is your second nature, and spreadsheet is a go-to in your toolkit
 * Ability to communicate game concepts in a strong and concise way
 * Programming or scripting skills are a bonus




What We Offer

 * Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
 * Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
 * Great opportunities to grow with the company
 * Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
 * Approachable leaders with low ego
 * Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office




Basics

 * Location: Helsinki, Finland
 * Relocation: Relocating to Finland expected, full support provided
 * Work model: Mix of office and remote work
 * Working language: English




Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.




We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.




We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!




Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.




We are collaborative and humble, and think ‚Äúwe‚Äù before ‚Äúme‚Äù. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.




To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.




We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.




Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
title: Game Designer, Merge Mansion

description:
Our Sales team is expanding, and we are now looking for an enthusiastic Sales Analyst to our Sales team in Helsinki. Do you have strong experience working with sales analyses in an international technology company? Are you interested in high-tech and working in a cutting-edge field? Are you always eager to learn more? If yes, please do read more!




As Sales Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving our sales strategy and operations. You will be responsible for compiling and analyzing sales data, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights that will help shape our business decisions. You will develop and automate our current reporting further, to gain more efficiency and deepen the reporting structures from global to regional level. Your work will directly impact our ability to meet sales targets and grow our market presence.




To succeed in this role, you already have work experience as a Sales Analyst or similar role and are experienced in sales analyses and reporting. You have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field and understanding of sales and marketing processes. We are using Salesforce and PowerBI, so the usage of these tools is already familiar and easy to you, related certificates are seen as an advantage. We expect you to have the ability to work independently under pressure, excellent communication and problem-solving skills and keen eye for details and data accuracy. You have a positive hands-on attitude, collaborative and innovative mindset, and passion for developing your area of expertise further.




Our organization is growing fast, and we continuously develop our way of working. This role provides you an opportunity to join us in that path and grow yourself as a professional in an international environment, alongside colleagues with wide-range expertise.




Main responsibilities

 * Take the lead on compiling data for regular forecasting and reporting:
 * Data collection of weekly and monthly bookings forecast reports and keeping the forecast templates updated
 * Updating our Sales and Marketing KPI reports and calculations, and maintaining the KPI follow-up report
 * Collecting, calculating and updating the monthly bookings report
 * Further develop and automate the current reporting to gain more efficiency:
 * Building and maintaining Salesforce based reports and dashboards to achieve single-source views for sales management
 * Form additional reports from the business data warehouse with PowerBI with other data sources
 * Deepen the reporting structures from global to regional level
 * Analyze the new data and insight requests and compose reports based on the requests
 * Analyze the available data to present interesting findings to the sales management
 * Participate in the development work on business applications to ensure accurate and timely reporting




What we expect from you

 * 3-5 years of experience as a Sales Analyst or similar role
 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, sales, marketing or finance
 * Experience on sales analyses and reporting
 * Experience in using Salesforce as your main tool
 * PowerBI usage experience
 * Understanding of sales and marketing processes
 * Ability to work under pressure
 * A keen eye for details and data accuracy
 * Strong problem-solving skills
 * Excellent communication skills




We also appreciate

 * Innovative and collaborative mindset
 * Confidence in working independently
 * Positive hands-on attitude
 * Passion for building and developing reporting
 * Salesforce and PowerBI certificates are a plus




Please apply as soon as possible by submitting your CV and application, on September 29, 2024, at the latest through our recruitment system. This position will be filled once a suitable candidate is found.




For more information, please contact our Sales Operations Manager, Minna Karhu by email minna.karhu@bluefors.com.




Bluefors designs and manufactures measurement systems, that can provide clean and quiet environment for scientific research, even at ultra-low temperatures. We have a strong focus on the quantum computing and information community. Our systems have options including wiring and superconducting magnets and can be customized to meet the requirements of each customer. We are here to support scientists and industries go further. For this we brought together the best minds. We are curious to the core and have one mission: progress. Continuous development, learning, collaboration, and information sharing are fundamental to our way of working.




Bluefors is a well-known market leader with reliable, easy-to-use quality products. In our agile company structure customers are in direct contact with scientists and engineers who design their system. We deliver systems all around the world and the markets for our products are constantly growing. Currently we employ more than 600 professionals from over 50 different nationalities. We offer competitive benefits package, employee share program and a flexible working environment. Our head office is in Pit√§j√§nm√§ki, Helsinki. We are a non-smoking workplace.
title: Sales Analyst

description:
For our Espoo offices, we are looking for highly qualified and motivated professionals like you. If you think you have what it takes to keep Septentrio firmly in Pole Position, get in touch.

We need you for the position of




High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer




The Job

Our High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer designs, implements and validates our state-of-the-art embedded positioning and navigation software. This software runs on GNSS and hybrid navigation modules capable of centimeter-level-precision positioning. As an algorithm engineer, you‚Äôre part of our PNT Products development team.

Your mission

As High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer, you are a key contributor to the development of Septentrio next generation Positioning Engine. The Positioning Engine computes centimeter level position, cm/s velocity and sub-degree orientation based on GNSS ranges coupled with additional sensors such as accelerometers, gyros, a magnetometer, and an odometer.

You work closely with peer Software Engineers and GNSS Algorithms Experts to develop high quality software in C++, running efficiently on a state-of-the-art embedded platform and will ensure the flexibility, modularity and efficiency of the object-oriented software implementation starting from Matlab and/or C++ prototypes.

You develop unit tests and software test cases to validate your algorithms and software, leveraging the Septentrio library of real test data and the continuous integration framework.

Your qualifications

You have at least four years of hands-on experience in cm-level GNSS positioning, gained either in the industry or through academic research. You hold a MSc or PhD in geomatics, geodesy, aerospace engineering, mathematics, or a related field.

Your technical expertise will be crucial as you navigate the complexities of GNSS error components in adverse conditions, such as ionospheric storms or high multipath environments in industrial settings. A solid understanding of the Embedded Software Development Life Cycle, along with familiarity with tools like issue tracking, source control, and continuous integration, will help you excel in this role. Proficiency in embedded C/C++ is essential, and your experience as an algorithm developer will be backed by a strong foundation in linear algebra and advanced matrix handling. You‚Äôll be tasked with performance evaluation, quality control, and error analysis for the algorithms you develop, ensuring that they meet the highest standards.

We value individuals who are proactive, structured, and analytical problem-solvers. You should enjoy working closely with a small team of specialists, where collaboration is key to our success.

While not mandatory, experience working in Agile/Scrum teams, knowledge of ambiguity resolution algorithms, and programming skills in Matlab and Python will give you an edge in this position.

Our Offer

In exchange for your talent, we offer a competitive compensation package in a top-notch high-tech, international working environment. At Septentrio you‚Äôll have room to grow, both personally and professionally. Our on-boarding plan is legendary, our homework policy family-friendly. Get in touch and help us shoot for the moon, the stars and beyond.
title: High Precision GNSS Algorithm Engineer
required skills: C++, Matlab, C, Excel, Python, R

description:
Cloud Developer, Maventa




Maventa is an e-invoicing platform and we are responsible for a state of the art electronic invoice and document exchange hub, operating in several countries, and serving close to 300 000 companies. Our platform serves tens of millions of transactions each month. Maventa is an API-first SaaS product, and while we have a UI, it‚Äôs playing a smaller role.




We are now looking for a new colleague to join our product development team. The role is a combination of software development on the cloud with DevOps. In this role, you'll not only contribute to our cloud-first initiatives but also ensure the delivery of high-quality, maintainable, and testable code, integral for both our application and infrastructure solutions. You'll be part of a culture that values collaborative problem-solving and innovative thinking.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Design and implement scalable, resilient cloud-based applications and infrastructure.
 * Lead cloud migration initiatives for existing applications to enhance performance and reduce operating costs.
 * Promote infrastructure as code (IaC) practices using tools such as Terraform and Ansible, to ensure code quality and ease of testing.
 * Advance our observability and monitoring capabilities using DataDog to improve system insights and reliability.
 * Develop and refine CI/CD pipelines, with a strong emphasis on GitLab, to support automated testing and deployment processes.
 * Foster a team environment that embraces mob programming, with a focus on crafting testable, high-quality code for both application features and infrastructure components.




To Succeed in this role you need:

 * Proven experience in cloud services, with AWS expertise highly valued.
 * Experience in cloud migration is a plus.
 * Solid understanding of infrastructure as code (IaC), through tools like Terraform, Ansible, etc.
 * Deep knowledge of CI/CD practices, particularly with GitLab.
 * Hands on experience on coding: we are using Ruby and Rails and we hope you either are proficient with it or are willing to learn
 * A history of working on or interest in improving observability and monitoring practices, ideally with experience in DataDog.
 * A commitment to producing testable, well-crafted code, upholding exceptional standards for both application development and infrastructure.
 * Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, with an appreciation for mob programming.




What do we offer?

Instead of ball pools and glitter, we are passionate about product development and having an impact on society. We are not ready, and it makes the journey interesting. This is your platform to shine!




This role is tailored for an individual who is aspiring to influence the cloud computing landscape positively while working within an environment that rewards innovation and cultivates professional growth. If you are passionate about developing cutting-edge cloud solutions and are driven by the challenge of optimising infrastructure and application performance, we invite you to apply to become an integral part of our dynamic team.




We are a diverse group of people composed of many different nationalities, organised into cross-functional teams. Our way of working is self-organised, agile and we solve difficult problems as a team, often by group programming. We aim to constantly improve how we work together. We value our colleagues' opinions and their wellbeing is a top priority for us. For us, it is important to have freedom to experiment on new things and to promote learning. We primarily work remotely, but we also enjoy getting together in person from time to time.




Our employees play a pivotal role in the company‚Äôs success.We offer a wide selection of benefits to our employees which you can use for example via ePassi.. We offer inspiring challenges, and innovations are born by trials that we continuously produce. We see failures as opportunities to learn and grow. Our background in Visma Group creates us support and opportunities to network colleagues with other Visma companies worldwide.




The salary range for this position is estimated to be 4800-6000‚Ç¨/month according to your skills and experience. Please let us know your thoughts on your salary in your application. Also your title will be based on your skills and experience.




We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Please apply with your CV or Linkedin profile latest on 30.9.2024. We‚Äôre expecting you to be comfortable working mostly remotely as we are an international team. You can also use the facilities of our office in Helsinki (Tripla). We believe diversity is a richness so we would love to have applications from software architects with various backgrounds. However, unfortunately we are not able to offer relocation services so you would need to be based in Finland and have a valid work permit.




Any questions? Please don't hesitate to contact Team Lead Karoliina K√§rkk√§inen by email or phone during the following times:

Tue 17.9. Klo 13-14

Thu 19.9 Klo 13-14

Mon 23.9 Klo 13-14

Tue 24.9 Klo 13-14

karoliina.karkkainen@visma.com
