title: Cloud Engineer

description:
We are looking for a lead developer for our client company VividWorks Oy to take technical leadership responsibility, spearhead and help shape new innovations and coach and support the rest of the team. As a lead dev, you will be actively participating in product discovery and product delivery with variable emphasis over time.




About the role

VividWorks' product is used by over 50 businesses mostly in Europe and but also in Asia-Pacific and Americas in both retail and manufacturing as a mission critical sales tool. You will work in product team developing the core offering of VividWorks. Immediately upon start you will be able to contribute on something new and exciting VividWorks is working on that they are happy to share more during the interview stage.




Ideally you would live within commuting distance of Oulu office near Ainolanpuisto or Helsinki office in Arabianranta, but this requirement isn‚Äôt carved in stone. You are offered flexible working arrangements, but the team enjoys meeting face-to-face regularly as well. You will have to travel occasionally to in-person meetings arranged by the team or company.




You must have an existing work permit to work in Finland or you are a citizen of Finland. You speak and write well in English. Finnish language is not a pre-requisite for the job but is a plus.




Work tasks

Your main emphasis will be to lead in product delivery, but to shape the technical direction you will need to actively seek and learn about our customers business and IT architecture.




 * You are a go-getter and can derive actionable tasks for development.
 * You demonstrate continuous learning as a habit.
 * You are a hands-on teacher and therefore a power multiplier on the team.
 * You are a hands-on developer and can develop high-quality code alone and together with others.
 * You write documentation together with the team and own the architecture and domain model documentation yourself and ensure they are constantly updated when necessary.




We are looking for

In this role tech stack is C# ASP.NET, React, Redux, Typescript, JS, Node.js, Three.js, PHP, Python, OpenCV, Unity, SQL, Docker. This will evolve over time.

 * You must be expert proficient with C# ASP.NET and proficient with as many of the other techs as possible. You are expected to learn all the tech over time to some degree.
 * CI/CD pipeline is built into Azure DevOps and contains build and deployment automation, unit tests, integration tests and end to end tests using Bicep, C#, Playwright and PowerShell which you and the team maintain and develop continuously.
 * VividWorks is using Scrum and leverage DevOps practices, and you are expected to actively lead and develop our methodologies.
 * VividWorks infrastructure is composed mainly of the following Azure services: Azure AD B2C, App Services, Key Vault, FrontDoor(CDN), CosmosDB, Blob stores, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure DevOps, MS SQLServer
 * Daily IT is Microsoft 365, Slack, Linear, Confluence, Sharepoint, Teams (mostly for calls), Lucidchart/Miro/draw.io, Visual Studio Enterprise, Visual Studio Code We hope you have a wide understanding on the technologies used in the company. Not everything has to be perfect, but the understanding and willingness to learn is required.




Our recruitment process

This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client‚Äôs wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.




VividWorks is not accepting unsolicited assistance from recruiters or search agencies for this employment opportunity. Please do not forward resumes to any person or other company location. VividWorks is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited referrals.




Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.




VividWorks Oy

VividWorks‚Äô mission is to make commerce of physical products better. We believe that businesses will prosper, buyers will be more satisfied, and commerce will be more sustainable when purchase decisions are based on product visualization. VividWorks exists to visualize physical products and enable visual product configuration in a virtual or augmented environment for our customers online and in-store. We want to build the world‚Äôs best Visual Commerce SaaS platform for retailers and manufacturers of physical products, and we're serving a growing community of leading companies in industries such as furniture, building supplies, kitchen & bathroom, and real estate/home improvement.
title: Lead Full-Stack Developer (Helsinki/Oulu)

description:
Description

At Varjo, we are not just a Finnish mixed and virtual reality technology company; we are pioneers in the immersive computing revolution. Our mixed reality solutions redefine realism, creating virtual experiences that match the authenticity of the real world. Since our founding in 2016, Varjo has rapidly expanded its global footprint and currently operates in several locations - Helsinki, Oslo, Germany, UK and Washington D.C.

Why Varjo?

Imagine working in an environment where your daily endeavors contribute to training astronauts, designing cutting-edge vehicles, and transforming professional use cases worldwide. Varjo's VR and XR solutions set the industry standard for quality, and we've recently raised the bar for prosumers seeking lifelike virtual simulations. Now, we're on the brink of ushering in the future of computing, where the digital world seamlessly integrates with our physical surroundings, reshaping the way we live our lives.

Our Team and Culture

Join a multicultural team comprising talents from around the globe, where diversity fuels innovation and drives results. English is our daily working language, providing an inclusive and collaborative atmosphere. At Varjo, we believe in the power of different experiences, backgrounds, and ideas coming together to shape the future of immersive computing.

Values That Define Us: Aim for Virtually Impossible, Do It with Style, Be Kind, Have Each Other's Back, If We Are Not Having Fun, We Are Doing It Wrong

Opportunity Awaits

Varjo is seeking the best and brightest to join us on this exhilarating journey. As we continue to set new standards in technology, we invite you to be a part of our vision for the future. When we are done, computers will look nothing like what they do right now.

Areas and Technologies We Work With


 * C++/C Programming
 * Embedded C/C++
 * SLAM and Computer Vision (image processing, object recognition and detection)
 * Algorithm Design and Optimization
 * GPU/CPU Programming
 * Unity and Unreal Development
 * Sensor Fusion
 * ROS (Robot Operating System)
 * ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems)
 * 3D Reconstruction
 * CUDA
 * Optics and Cameras
 * Audio and Video Streaming
   
   

Apply Now

Submit an open application, including your CV, a link to your LinkedIn profile, and details of projects that make you particularly proud.

If you have connections at Varjo, feel free to drop some names. Join Varjo and play a crucial role in shaping the future of immersive computing.
title: Open Application

description:
Type: Full-time, at least 6-months fixed-term contract

Location: J√§tk√§saarenlaituri 1, 00180 Helsinki

Application DL: 18.9.2024




We‚Äôre excited to announce that Supercell, one of the leading mobile game development companies in the world, is now looking for a Game Research Intern to join their Product Research Team in Helsinki!




This is a one-of-a-kind possibility to dive into a completely new role and to support Supercell‚Äôs Product Research Team working alongside different game teams at Supercell in obtaining actionable insights through mixed-method research by focusing on Supercell‚Äôs games, players, competitors and the trends and changes in the global gaming market. The Product Research Team aims at informing and empowering product decisions throughout the full lifecycle of game development ‚Äì from concept, prototype, testing to live-operation ‚Äì with human and market insights. During this 6-month internship, you will learn how to conduct player research and market analysis, and work closely with different game teams and crafts to create holistic insights connecting players, data, competitors and the market.




More specifically your daily adventure as a Game Research Intern features juggling tasks like:

 * Designing, conducting and analyzing surveys, interviews and playtests to support the conception and iteration of new features and new games
 * Collecting, monitoring and analyzing market data on key competitors, key regions and the global gaming market to identify trends and potential opportunities
 * Assisting the Product Research team in various other projects and ad hoc requests




In this position you‚Äôll have the support of the Supercellians around you, but you need an independent and self-driven mindset. We will do our best to support you to learn and grow. We have many fun and challenging research questions here at Supercell, and hope you will find them intellectually exciting too. We don‚Äôt expect you to know everything yet but hope that you are eager to deepen your expertise and have a proactive approach to your work. You will also benefit from analytical mindset and previous work experience from gaming, market research, management consulting or other relevant fields.




Why you will love it at Supercell:

 * You‚Äôll be offered a chance to start your Game Research career as well as to get an insider view into a global mobile games company
 * You‚Äôll get to work with a really nice bunch of people that do everything to make sure that you feel at home at Supercell and that you are set up for success!
 * You‚Äôll be surrounded by an international work environment; you‚Äôll hear chatter in different languages from all over the world around the office
 * You‚Äôll be given both freedom and responsibility, including flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely from time to time
 * All in all Supercell will offer you everything that you need to succeed in your role - the rest is up to you!




What Supercell is looking for:

 * A relevant educational background or ongoing studies for example in psychology, sociology, cognitive science, human-computer interaction, behavioral science or related fields
 * Knowledge / understanding of conducting primary research and secondary research (qualitative, quantitative and / or desktop research)
 * A passion for games and any sort of entertainment in general
 * Experience with some data analysis tool, such as R, SPSS, Python
 * A full working proficiency in English




What Supercell considers as an asset:

 * Previous work experience from gaming, market research, management consulting or other relevant fields.
 * Other language skills, such as German and Japanese




Practicalities:

This is a full-time and fixed-term position for at least 6 months, in which you will be employed directly to Supercell. The exact duration of the employment relationship is negotiable. The ideal starting date for the position is as soon as possible. The position is located at Supercell's headquarters in Helsinki and we hope you are able to work at the office at least a few days per week as part of a hybrid model. Salary in this position ranges between approximately 2500-3000‚Ç¨/month (gross) depending on the level of your experience, and will be negotiated individually.




Hungry yet?

Not sure if you should apply? Do it! You might feel like you don't tick all the listed requirements with stellar scores. That's fine! We're here to help you succeed. Send us your CV and application letter in PDF-format by the latest 18.9.2024 via our application system here: https://emp.jobylon.com/applications/jobs/251363/create/. Please also mention your salary request and the preferred starting date in your application documents. We are actively reviewing applications throughout the application period and processing them in the order they are received. Remember to use the application system as we do not accept applications by email.




You can familiarize yourself with Supercell here: https://supercell.com/en/. For more information about the recruitment process contact aTalent‚Äôs Senior Recruitment Consultant Anni Nurmi (+358 50 304 2987, anni.nurmi@atalent.fi).
title: Game Research Intern

description:
Do you love when data creates understanding? We do. We are expanding our team and looking for a skilled Analytics Consultant to join our fun-loving bunch!

What is the job like, really?

As an Analytics Consultant, you'll work as an expert in versatile digital commerce projects handling customer and product data. You‚Äôll be helping our Top 200 enterprise customers with their commerce projects, and you know how to describe our clients' problems in terms of business and how to turn data into insights and solutions. You are involved in sketching and implementing analytics strategies that can combine all kinds of customer data, product data, behavior data, marketing data etc. You'll work with a team of experts in complex customer projects and get to dive deep with your expertise.

Do you love when data drives businesses forward? We do.

Key Responsibilities

üí´ Plan and implement custom digital analytics solutions

üí´ Debug and troubleshoot technical errors across environments and validate data to ensure accuracy and consistency

üí´ Optimize website performance and usability

üí´ Validate, unify, and visualize cross-system data on custom dashboards

üí´ Support other team members with analytics methodologies and play crucial role in various of commerce and analytics projects

What are we looking for?

We don‚Äôt expect you to be a unicorn, but the more you know about the following, the better:

üéØ Strong expertise in web analytics tools (such as Google Analytics, Piwik Pro, and Matomo)

üéØ Experience with tag management systems (such as Google Tag Manager and Tealium)

üéØ Basic understanding of essential languages for the role (such as JavaScript, HTML, and SQL)

üéØ Digital marketing principles and conversion tracking possibilities

üéØ Pulling, blending, and visualizing data from various data sources on custom dashboards (such as Looker Studio)

üéØ Experience with consent management platforms (such as OneTrust and CookieBot)

üéØ Team player and can spar solutions and specifications with other project stakeholders

üéØ Comprehensive knowledge of topics of data integration, customer lifetime value, data warehousing, search engine optimization, and conversion rate optimization, and how to leverage and apply these concepts effectively

üéØ Fluency in English and Finnish

Seen As An Advantage

‚≠êÔ∏è Proficient in implementing server-side tagging solutions (such as Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Stape)

‚≠êÔ∏è Highly skilled in advanced JavaScript techniques and web design stacks (HTML, CSS)

‚≠êÔ∏è Experienced in data querying (such as with Google BigQuery)

Cool, but what's in it for me?

üåü Maximal flexibility and location independence ‚Äì set up your workstation wherever you want and utilize our awesome office spaces in the way you feel is most suitable for you.

üåü Solid pay ‚Äì your monthly base salary will be based on your experience and expertise + you‚Äôll naturally get to enjoy Vincit‚Äôs bonus model, personnel fund and transparent salary weeks.

üåü More than generous employee benefits ‚Äì lunch benefit, free snacks and drinks, healthcare and dental care services, extensive insurance, childcare services, high-quality work equipment ‚Äì the list goes on!

üåü Best place to grow ‚Äì We want to ensure your Vincit career is filled with learning and growth. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve set up Univincity to support your professional development, offering a wide range of workplace learning opportunities.

üåü Various career opportunities ‚Äì pursue the role that's right for you, be it a new position, lateral move, or venturing into a different direction. Read inspiring examples of career paths in our career stories.

üåü Work-life balance ‚Äì We encourage you to shape your work life according to your personal needs. Whether it's family commitments, a side hustle, a sporty career, or simply the desire to downsize, we're always ready to discuss how we can tailor your work to fit your lifestyle.

üåü Modern, transparent, and humane organization culture ‚Äì thanks to these traits, we're an award-winning workplace to be proud of.

üåü Active communities - Our belief, "extraordinary things are created together", is best seen in our various communities. We believe in togetherness and support each other in finding their place and peeps in the organization, whether it‚Äôs office communities, hobby clubs, project teams, or more.

üåü Local and international work environment ‚Äì engage in various activities and hobby clubs in your local community or explore exchange opportunities in our European or US talent hubs.

üåü We are committed to making the digital world more inclusive ‚Äì we take our DEIB (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging) journey seriously to create a safe and welcoming workplace for everyone.

üåü A team of skilled experts at least equal to yourself ‚Äì our way of working and thinking usually suits those who are, or want to be, at the top of their profession. Work with us and you get to be part of our Vincit community which consists of the country‚Äôs top developers, designers, and other experts.

üëâ Explore real-life examples of our human-centric Vincit culture in our People & Culture blog.

Curious but still on the fence?

To get to know us as an employer, we recommend checking our career site, blog, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.

P.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, you need to have the necessary permits for working in Finland.




We‚Äôre a leading digital business agency committed to accelerating and transforming our clients' businesses without the fuss. We believe that technology is key to solving the global challenges of our time. Together, we can achieve amazing things by breaking the norms of work-life and offering the best possible environment, tools, and growth opportunities for our employees. We aim to create better Mondays‚Äîfor our people, our clients, and our planet.

Our community is made up of top professionals from a diverse range of IT fields, united by a passion for what digital tools, empathy, and sharp thinking can accomplish. At Vincit, you'll get to work alongside skilled experts and with customers that include everything from small start-ups to multinational giants.

Explore more about us and our story. Learn more at our career site.

description:
This job is with ABB, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

This position reports to

OEM Hub Lead

Your role and responsibilities

Do you want to make own impact for the Finland carbon neutral targets? Approximately 70% of Finland electricity is consumed in electrical motors. Energy efficient motors and drive control play major role towards the net zero goals. Join our market leading company and our team responsible for the Motors and Drives and be part of the Energy Efficiency Movement.We are now looking for an Application Engineer at ABB Oy, Drive Products division in Pit√É¬§j√É¬§nm√É¬§ki, Helsinki. In this role, you will have the opportunity to design and develop solutions for customers and help customers in their technical related problems. Each day, you will work directly together with customers to achieve best possible solutions for each case. You are a part of NEU OEM hub that delivers solutions and handle customers cases in Northern Europe. You have also a possibility to work together with other similar ABB hubs in Europe.The work model for the role is: hybrid will be mainly accountable for:√¢‚Ç¨


 * Developing OEM specific solutions together with local sales (region Northern Europe)√¢‚Ç¨
 * Developing solution-based software√¢‚Ç¨
 * Developing solution/concepts in close collaboration with customers√¢‚Ç¨
 * Documentation of the solution√¢‚Ç¨
 * Onsite and aftersales support for dedicated OEMs√¢‚Ç¨
 * Sharing solutions and application knowhow within the global OEM communityYou will join a talented, high performing team, where you will be able to thrive.
   
   

Qualifications For The Role


 * Enhanced technical knowledge for drives
 * Established technical background for PLC, motors, programming skills, especially IEC 61131
 * Ability to demonstrate your experience in taking technical ownership for developing a solution with the customer
 * B.Sc. in engineering or a similar degree
 * You are at ease in communicating in Finnish and in English, both written and spoken
 * Good understanding of the electrical design of a machine is beneficial
 * Enhanced knowledge in functional safety is a benefit
 * DC/DC and DCT technology understanding is an advantage
 * Motion application knowhow and understanding of fieldbus technologies are beneficial
 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills, and you enjoy collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
   
   

More about us

ABB Drive Products serves the industries and infrastructure segments with world-class drives and programmable logic controllers (PLC). With its products, global scale and local presence, the Division helps customers to improve energy efficiency, productivity and safety.Our culture and benefits reflect our values: courage, care, curiosity and collaboration. The most appreciated benefits according to our personnel are at the moment e.g. an annual performance bonus, employee share acquisition program, continuous learning opportunities, bicycle and other wellbeing and family benefits. We have a hybrid working model.For more information, OEM Hub Lead Lasse Lipsanen, tel. +358 50 332 3256.Please apply for the position by September 26, 2024. We look forward to receiving your application. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

description:
Location:¬†Hybrid in Helsinki region¬†¬†




Overview

We are seeking a skilled and customer-oriented Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing, optimizing and maintaining data integration solutions for our clients. This is a customer-facing position where excellent communication and problem-solving skills are essential.




Key Responsibilities

 * Develop new data integration or data engineering tasks as per client requirements
 * Provide excellent customer support and communication throughout the support lifecycle
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment of data solutions
 * Monitor, maintain, and optimize existing data integration solutions for clients.




Requirements

 * Proficiency in SQL is a must-have skill
 * Basic knowledge of Azure, preferably Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks
 * Strong customer support and communication skills in English
 * Excellent soft skills including logical thinking, troubleshooting, and investigation
 * Detail-oriented with the ability to carefully manage tasks and communication with stakeholders.




Extra points if you have

 * Experience in Microsoft SSIS, SQL server and Python
 * Experience in a customer-facing role
 * Background in data engineering, data integration, data analysis, ERP consulting, or related fields
 * Procurement knowledge




Benefits

 * Competitive compensation package and a stock option program
 * Awesome perks include extensive health care, mobile phone connection, home internet plan, recreational benefit, referral bonus, bike benefit, and many more.
 * Opportunity to work in hybrid with a supportive team
 * True autonomy and responsibility. We are looking for people who yearn for this freedom, make the most out of it, and take on responsibility
 * Growth opportunities within the company, including training and development programs




We welcome individuals with backgrounds in data analysis, data management, or similar fields who are interested in transitioning to a customer-facing data engineering role.

How to Apply

Please submit your resume and add a note of why you‚Äôre a good fit for the role. We review applications on a rolling basis and will reach out to candidates who pass our initial screening for a first interview.¬†




If you have further questions about the position, don't hesitate to contact the hiring manager, Senior Project Manager, S√©bastien Garcia (sebastien.garcia@sievo.com).




Recruitment Process

 * 1st round: interview with HR and hiring manager
 * 2nd round: take home technical assignment
 * 3rd round: interview with team leads




At Sievo, we celebrate and support differences and strive to create a culture where everyone feels valued and included. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against any individual in hiring or employment based on gender, gender identity or expression, age, ethnic or national origin, nationality, language, religion or belief, opinion, disability, state of health, sexual orientation, or other personal reasons.




Studies indicate that women are more hesitant to apply for a job and tend to feel their qualifications do not align perfectly with the role. If you're interested in the position and believe that you have the potential to excel in it, we encourage you to apply.

description:
IQM is the European leader in superconducting quantum computers, established in Espoo, Finland. Since 2019, we have grown to 270+ employees and have established subsidiaries in Germany, Spain, France, Poland, the US and Singapore. We build quantum computers for research laboratories and supercomputing centers. For industrial customers, we deliver quantum advantage through our unique application-specific co-design approach.

We build world-leading quantum computers for the well-being of humankind now and for the future.

(www.meetiqm.com)

Are you passionate about embedded systems and looking to join a dynamic team where you can grow and make a real impact? We're on the hunt for a motivated Embedded Software Engineer to be part of our experienced development team. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, we want to hear from you!

We value social skills and teamwork as much as technical expertise. If you're comfortable in fast-paced development projects with multiple stakeholders, you could be the perfect fit.

What I will be doing?

As An Embedded Software Engineer, You Will


 * Develop Python and C++ code for drivers and modules related to qubit control.
 * Read and interpret complex IC datasheets (e.g., very high-speed DAC).
 * Measure system functionality using oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers, and verify changes.
 * Utilize version control with Git for efficient collaboration.
 * Participate in team work planning using Scrum methodology.
   
   

What skills do I need?

Skills

You should have a strong interest in the following areas, with some skills requiring proven knowledge now, and all expected to be mastered within two years:


 * Proficiency in Python and C++ coding, including drivers and other modules.
 * Ability to read and understand complex IC datasheets (e.g., very high-speed DAC).
 * Capability to measure system functionality using oscilloscopes and spectrum analyzers.
 * Experience with version control using Git.
   
   

What skills are nice to have?

While not required from day one, these skills are highly valued and can be developed on the job:


 * Agile development (Scrum or Kanban).
 * Experience with Linux in embedded systems (e.g., ARM, FPGAs).
 * Familiarity with build tools like Buildroot and Yocto.
 * Linux kernel development (e.g., device drivers).
 * Digital electronics debugging and design.
 * FPGA development.
 * Digital signal processing.
   
   

What can I expect from IQM?


 * A great opportunity to perform world-class R&D and implement cutting edge technology
 * Work alongside a dedicated team
 * Contribute to groundbreaking projects that will shape the future of quantum
 * Thrive in a creative and open start-up environment that fosters growth, learning, and innovation
 * Be part of an international, fast-paced environment that values collaboration and cultural diversity
 * Play a significant role in a rapidly growing organization and be a part of our exciting success story
   
   

Meet our people and hear more about IQM by visiting our Youtube channel here

We'll proceed with the interviews immediately, so please submit your application soon.
title: Embedded Software Engineer

description:
As a Full Stack Developer, you will be at the forefront of transforming the Electric Vehicle (EV) charging industry. Your role involves the development of software solutions for our eMabler Open EV charging platform, from implementing user-friendly interfaces to ensuring seamless integrations with EV charging Hardware and EV ecosystems.

Responsibilities


 * Development of software solutions for EV charging systems, encompassing front-end and back-end components.
 * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate software with EV charging hardware for seamless functionality.
 * Develop intuitive and user-friendly interfaces, ensuring a positive user experience.
 * Build robust APIs and integrate with third-party services as needed.
 * Ensure data integrity, quality, security, and high performance.
 * Collaborate closely with backend developers to integrate frontend interfaces with backend services and APIs.
 * Implement industry standards for interoperability and communication protocols.
 * Participate in agile development processes, including sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives.
 * Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to maintain high-quality standards.
 * Identify opportunities for innovation and optimization within EV charging software.
   
   

Qualifications


 * Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Software engineering, or a related field.
 * Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer and resident in the EU+EFTA countries.
 * Proficiency in front-end technologies (JavaScript, React, Angular, or Vue.js), HTML, CSS, and back-end technologies (C#, Node.js, Python).
 * Experience with database technologies (SQL, Cosmos), Git, and REST API development.
 * Experience with Cloud technologies (Azure, GCP, or AWS) is a bonus.
 * Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment. Strong time management and organizational skills.
 * Fluent English (written and verbal).
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to troubleshoot and debug complex software systems.
 * Interest and experience in the EV charging industry is desirable.
 * Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, evolving industry. Willingness to learn and apply new technologies.
   
   

What We Offer


 * An opportunity to be part of a fast-growing SaaS company, revolutionizing the entire industry with a talented team.
 * Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
 * Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
 * Contribution to the growth of sustainable transportation through EV charging solutions, where you get to leave your footprint for the future carbon-neutral world.
   
   

Join our team and be part of revolutionizing the EV charging landscape. Apply now to contribute your expertise to the development of cutting-edge solutions in the electric mobility sector.

Recruiters don't get in touch with us, we might contact you.

For more information or questions please contact us at maria@emabler.com

description:
ZetaDisplay is an award-winning, European leader in digital visual transformation. They operate at the cutting edge of digital signage development to create market leading solutions in partnership with their clients. As one of the largest full service digital signage solutions partners in Europe, they work across concepts, hardware, and software solutions to empower businesses to captivate, connect and influence their audiences by meaningful visual experiences across the world.

ZetaDisplay work in close partnership with many of the biggest global brands, supporting them through the continual process of digitizing physical spaces, connecting big data, providing insights, and aligning marketing- and business technologies with the development of cutting-edge visual experience solutions. ZetaDisplay employs ~220 people across seven European countries. They currently manage more than 100,000 installations in over 50 markets worldwide.

Please visit their website to read more about their business.

About The Role

You will be joining their international R&D department with offices in Sweden, Finland. Norway and the Netherlands. You will be working with their leading Digital Signage CMS suite, serving both global and local customers. They believe the team is not stronger than its weakest link, meaning that they expect all team members to contribute to the success of our products. This means that you will have the opportunity to really make an impact for their product suite.

As a DevOps Engineer you will work within the development teams to evolve their CI/CD pipelines and manage and develop our cloud infrastructure. Their SaaS products are mainly built within Azure but they also have services in AWS. They are currently executing a refactoring project transforming our back-end services to a brand new micro service architecture. Together with the team you will own their build pipelines (GitHub) and their cloud environments (Dev, Test, Staging, Production)

Key Responsibilities And Primary Tasks


 * Develop and maintain their CI/CD pipeline
 * Manage and develop their cloud architectures and encironments
 * Evangelize and implement industry practices within the domain
 * Contrivute to architectural plans together with the Teach Leads and development teams
 * Take a pivotal part in evolving ZetaDisplay's Saas offering to best in class
   
   

WHO ARE YOU?

To be successful in this role we believe that have have:


 * A university degree in Computer Science or similar.
 * At least 2 years‚Äô experience as a SW developer
 * At least 2 years‚Äô experience as a DevOps Engineer in an Azure and Kubernetes environment
 * Have developed CI/CD pipelines in GitHub
 * Ability to maintain a larger microservice architecture
 * Excellent communication skills in English
   
   

It Is Also Beneficial If You Have Experience Of


 * Istio, OPA, FluxCD, DataDog (or similar tools)
 * DevOps of Amazon AWS
 * Multi-cluster and multi-region deployments
 * Working in distributed teams
   
   

But Most Importantly, We Believe That You


 * Love building great software
 * Have a strong drive and like testing new technologies
 * Are a strong believer that good practices do not decrease pace of development
 * Enjoy team work
   
   

WORKING CONDITIONS


 * Travel may be required from time to time for collaboration with collogues at other ZetaDisplay offices.
 * ZetaDisplay offer flexibility in terms of workplace but believe in a mix of working from home and meeting colleagues in the office.
   
   

Other Information

Start: As per agreement

Location: Helsinki

Employment: Fulltime

This is a direct employment with ZetaDisplay but the recruitment is handled by A-hub, for any questions regarding the position please contact A-hub. Salary and terms of employment is discussed seperately.
title: DevOps Engineer to ZetaDisplay

description:

description:
Are you a technical expert in Data Science & Machine Learning? Are you looking for a new job opportunity in this field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in cybersecurity and machine learning? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? Are you enthusiastic about working with fascinating projects in state-of-the-art research facilities? VTT might be just the place for you.‚ÄØ

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Get to know us further by exploring‚ÄØ VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for a Research Scientist to join our‚ÄØCybersecurity research team.

As a Research Scientist, you have a role in performing cutting edge applied research on AI/ML and their interaction with cybersecurity. You will design, develop, study and test ML solutions to solve diverse cybersecurity problems. In this position, you will work under the guidance of experts in ML and cybersecurity. You can also contribute to the definition of the long-term roadmap for ML & cybersecurity research and contribute to its execution. You will work in customer projects and collaborative research projects with industrial and academic partners. You will write and communicate about your research results through peer-reviewed papers, reports, patents or public presentations.

Our research team counts 15+ members working on applications of AI to solve cybersecurity problems, the security of AI systems, cybersecurity testing and on the security of future networks (e.g., 6G). It is a main contributor to VTT‚Äôs mission for building digital trust in society.

As‚ÄØa Research Scientist,‚ÄØyou will:


 * Perform research on applications of ML to solve cybersecurity problems.
 * Contribute to our strategy on ML & cybersecurity research.
 * Participate in research projects, commercial and public, on both a national and international level.
 * Communicate your research results through peer-reviewed papers, reports, patents and oral presentations.
 * Support knowledge building for ML in the team.
 * Continuously acquire knowledge and learn new skills.
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * You have an MSc or a PhD degree in machine learning, computer science, mathematics or another relevant field.
 * You have theoretical knowledge of conventional supervised and unsupervised ML techniques such as SVM, Random Forest, Boosting methods, DNNs, DBScan, etc.
 * You have hands-on experience with Python ML libraries such as ScikitLearn, Pytorch, Keras, Numpy, etc. and ML development platforms.
 * You have practical hands-on experience in applying machine learning to solve cybersecurity or other type of problems.
 * You have a critical thinking mindset.
 * You have good problem-solving skills
 * Optional: You have good scientific writing and presentation skills.
 * Optional: You are knowledgeable and have practical experience with LLMs
 * Optional: You have a track record of research publications in machine learning, cybersecurity, or other relevant publication venues.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * Visionary and motivated
 * Committed and flexible
 * A team player with good collaboration skills
 * Project management skills and experience are considered as a plus.
 * Experience with customer projects is considered as a plus.
   
   
   

With VTT, you‚Äôll‚ÄØenjoy:


 * Visionary work in technology.‚ÄØWe offer positions at the cutting-edge of technology and engineering, from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy ‚Äì‚ÄØ the path of exponential hope .
 * Fascinating projects, excellent research environment.‚ÄØOur researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects locally and internationally. At VTT, you'll have state-of-the-art research facilities, such as Micronova, the Finnish research infrastructure for micro-, nano-, and quantum technologies. ‚ÄØ
 * Great career opportunities, superb colleagues.‚ÄØAt VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over ten years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun. Read more about‚ÄØ our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.
 * Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture excellent team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation and cognitive ergonomics training.
   
   
   

Apply now‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our community of brilliant minds!

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut‚ÄØat the latest by 15 September‚ÄØ2024.‚ÄØWe will process applications as they come in and fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.‚ÄØA security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.

Interested and want to know more?

For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Samuel Marchal, samuel.marchal@vtt.fi , +358 50 433 4884.

We look forward to hearing from you!
title: Research Scientist, Data Science & Machine Learning
Soft Skills: problem-solving, collaboration, leadership, critical thinking, collaboration skills

description:
Join us as a C++ Developer




Do you believe in beauty when it comes to programming? Do you have a vivid interest in elegant algorithms? Are you fluent in C++? If so, we would like to meet you. Here is what we offer in a nutshell:

 * A wide array of extremely challenging C++ development tasks
 * An international team of brilliant minds
 * A working environment that makes this team stay and grow
 * Enough time to make sure that every detail of your solution is perfect
 * A flat organization and plenty of room for your ideas
 * No scheduled meetings
 * Lifestyle-friendly working hours, no deadlines, no overtime
 * Support for relocation
 * A competitive salary from the start and a raise to EUR 130,000 annually after only one year




About us

think-cell is a fast-paced software company in Berlin, Germany, with a focus on developing graphics products that stand out from the crowd. More than 1,000,000 users worldwide rely on our software for their daily business because we make creating PowerPoint presentations so much easier, faster, and more enjoyable. Among our customers are many renowned consulting companies and large international corporations.

Because think-cell is highly profitable, we do not have to make compromises regarding code quality and beauty. We are willing to go the extra mile in developing sophisticated algorithms and refining our user interface, and we are proud of our many happy customers. The company is owned and managed by seasoned computer scientists, which contributes to a working environment that makes exceptional Developers want to come and stay.




About our software

Our focus is on business slides (as opposed to more artful, open-ended applications) because they offer great potential for automation of the layout tasks traditionally performed by PowerPoint users themselves. There are plenty of challenges, from a solid understanding of what makes a good layout, to algorithms that produce an aesthetically pleasing output fast enough for interactive slide design, to an intuitive and unobtrusive graphical user interface that supports our original approach to slide layout, to solid technical solutions for automatic bug reporting and updates, to compatibility with third-party software on the computers of over a million users.




Here are some highlights of what we have done:




Language

 * Everything we do is C++. Even our customer portal is written in C++. There is some Assembler glue code where necessary, and our build scripts are written in Python, but other than that, think-cell is all about C++.
 * We closely track the latest versions of our compilers, Visual C++ and Xcode, so we can always use the latest C++ standard features as soon as they become available.
 * We fund the working group for programming languages of the German Institute for Standardization (DIN). Some of our employees are members of this committee and vote in the international standardization process ISO / IEC C++.
 * We are also an official sponsor of the Standard C++ Foundation, which promotes international standards for C++.




Library

 * We use Boost throughout our code, e.g., Boost.Spirit for parsing.
 * We have our own range library, in the same spirit as Boost.Range or Eric Niebler‚Äôs range-v3, but going further, for example, by unifying internal and external iteration. We gave a talk about it, and most of the code is public.
 * We develop our own cross-platform library to support macOS and Windows with a single code base.
 * We have our own reference-counting and persistence libraries to save and restore whole object trees.
 * We have an extensive bug reporting infrastructure. Assertions and error checks stay in the release code, and our software automatically reports bugs to our server. The server analyzes the bug, categorizes it and files it in a database that all Developers can access. If an update fixes the bug, the user can download the update directly from a bug response web page.




Algorithms

 * think-cell was founded on the idea for an algorithm for automatic slide layout, and we are still on an exciting journey towards that ambitious vision. You can see our most recent release in action!
 * We developed a new algorithm for automatic point cloud labeling that allows labels to be positioned away from the actual points.
 * We developed a new algorithm for automatic column chart labeling.
 * We are working with John Forrest ‚Äì author of the linear solver CLP ‚Äì to make his simplex code faster for our kinds of problems.
 * We developed many generic data structures that are not in C++ or Boost, such as partitions.
 * Our software not only produces charts, it can also read them off print and digital images. For our chart recognition tool, we rely on OpenCV and the Leptonica Image Processing Library.




Reverse Engineering

 * We do lots of reverse engineering with the disassembler IDA from Hex-Rays, to achieve things that are not possible via the documented Microsoft Office API.
 * We have probably written the best function hooking engine out there. Each time our software starts, we patch the Microsoft Office executables in memory. Rather than hard-coding patch addresses, we search for small chunks of assembly code to protect against minor changes in the executables.




About this job

We're looking for bright, creative Developers with a solid theoretical background. Our team‚Äôs backgrounds range from 10+ years of commercial experience in various fields to fresh graduates in Computer Science, Physics, and Mathematics. A university degree or work experience with C++, in combination with a fresh and creative problem-solving approach, would be ideal for this role. We love working with talented people, whether you're a student, fresh graduate, or C++ expert, therefore our recruitment process is skills-based and consists of tasks related to the role.




You will mostly work independently and will be responsible for the whole range of tasks involved in implementing a new feature. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective and discuss abstract concepts with fellow Developers. We expect each of our Developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing, rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus put everyone in control of their own work.




At think-cell, there are no deadlines or scheduled meetings. A feature is ready to be released when you are convinced that you have implemented the best possible solution. Meetings take place as needed, and only the people actually involved in the topic are required to attend. At any time in the process, ideas, suggestions and criticism from anybody in the hierarchy are welcome and are seriously considered. We want to hear your ideas, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.




We have published several scientific articles in the areas of artificial intelligence and computer graphics, and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close relationships with universities and research institutes across the U.S. and Germany.




think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends.




We pay very competitive salaries and offer our Developers EUR 130,000 annually after one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and we will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit. You should be able to communicate effectively in English. Knowing German is not required, but we will arrange and cover to costs of German lessons, if desired.

Job ID:¬†22761¬†

¬†

Are you passionate about exploring data, identifying anomalies and visualizing your findings so that others can benefit from your insights?‚ÄØThe Data & Analytics team is looking for a new colleague to join us in shaping the future of internal audit.¬†

¬†At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner that our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll also have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.‚ÄØ

¬†

About this opportunity

¬†

Welcome to Group Internal Audit (GIA). We are an independent function, supporting the Nordea Group Board and Group Executive Management in protecting the assets, reputation and sustainability of the largest bank in the Nordics.‚ÄØ¬†¬†

In the Data & Analytics team we assist auditors with challenging data analysis tasks and use data science to enable innovative audit approaches in audit projects.‚ÄØ¬†

¬†As a Data Analyst (Internal Auditor) in the Data & Analytics team in GIA, you will have an unique opportunity to perform data analytics on data sources from all over the Bank. The results of your analyses will have a direct impact on the management of key risks in Nordea. On top of that, you will get a chance to drive key aspects of GIA‚Äôs data analytics strategy.‚ÄØ¬†

¬†What you‚Äôll be doing:‚ÄØ¬†

 * Contributing to various projects with data analytics: participating in audits as a data expert, performing data extraction and cleansing, conducting data exploration and complex data analyses,¬†
 * Developing and maintaining data knowledge and expertise on key data assets in Nordea,¬†
 * Applying advanced analytical techniques (incl. machine learning) useful for auditing, such as outlier detection and analysis, natural language processing, network analysis, etc.,¬†
 * Contributing to the development of data analytics capabilities and to the change in mindset in the organization by e.g. advocating the use of data analytics, sharing knowledge, running training sessions etc.,¬†
 * Driving innovation and challenging the way we work,¬†
 * Contributing to the development and maintenance of data analytics tools and dashboards.¬†

¬†The role can be based in either Finland (Helsinki) or Poland (in either Warsaw, Gdynia, Gda≈Ñsk or ≈Å√≥d≈∫).¬†

¬†

You will be part of the D&A team located in Gda≈Ñsk, Warsaw, Helsinki, Copenhagen, Oslo and Stockholm. Group Internal Audit prioritizes use of technology to facilitate efficient, flexible working. This means that although you will work with colleagues in the Nordics, travel is kept at family and environmentally friendly levels.‚ÄØ¬†



Who you are

¬†

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best. We imagine that you enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You‚Äôre dependable, willing to speak up ‚Äì even when it‚Äôs difficult ‚Äì and committed to empowering others.¬†

¬†To succeed in this role, we believe that you present:¬†

 * Flexibility:‚ÄØyou are a flexible team player who is able to work both independently and in cooperation with others, with the drive to achieve high quality deliveries,¬†
 * Drive & Motivation:‚ÄØyou are proactive, curious and passionate, and have the willingness to grow and evolve,¬†
 * Analytical skills:‚ÄØyou have an analytical and structured way of working and you apply sound judgement in your work,¬†
 * Collaboration:‚ÄØyou can maintain excellent collaborative skills, with strong written and verbal communication, and are able to communicate effectively with senior professionals.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ¬†

¬†

Your experience and background:¬†

 * Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative subject such as mathematics, statistics, computer science or related field,¬†
 * Practical experience in applying data analytics to solve real-world problems, including data extraction, cleaning and transformation,¬†
 * Proficiency with SQL, Python and data visualization tools,¬†
 * Fluency in written and spoken English,¬†
 * Hands-on skills in implementation of machine learning techniques would be an advantage,¬†
 * Some understanding of or experience with risk management, controlling or audit in the financial industry is a significant plus.¬†

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 16/09/2024.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

¬†

Only for candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.

¬†

¬†

Only for candidates in Poland:¬†Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

¬†

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‚ÄòGDPR‚Äô. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.

¬†

The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza ≈ömiglego 20, 93-281 ≈Åod≈∫. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at:¬†https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf

¬†

We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

description:
Are you interested in quantum computing applied to material modelling problems and looking for a postdoctoral opportunity in the field? VTT might be just the place for you. If you are an international talent searching for a new opportunity, read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation here !

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time‚ÄØand turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2300 brilliant minds from almost 60 different nationalities is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .‚ÄØ

We are now looking for a Postdoctoral Researcher to join our ProperTune Integration team for a fixed-term three-year contract starting in January 2025!

VTT started a Postdoc programme in 2023 to develop new ways to support scientific excellence and to strengthen career paths from universities to VTT. We want to provide development opportunities for recent university PhDs in applied research and industry collaboration. As a Postdoctoral Researcher at VTT, you are able to make an impact on our customers and society. Our researchers work closely together with industry, often in interdisciplinary research groups. VTT has excellent research infrastructure and internal services to support your research work.‚ÄØ

We are now recruiting four Postdoctoral Researchers in the Knowledge Driven Design research area to boost the concept of a Materials Acceleration Platform (MAP).‚ÄØ

In this Postdoctoral Researcher position, you will have an essential role in developing our competencies for using quantum computers to material modelling problems. You will be working in close collaboration with material scientist developing material models and optimize some parts of material models to be run with a quantum computer. Our team ProperTune Integration works on High Performance Computing utilizing fastest supercomputer in Europe, the LUMI, and VTT‚Äôs own gate-based quantum computers, extreme parallelization of code for material models, machine learning and AI.

Our objective is to accelerate new material development with data driven and computationally fast solutions and that way support the development of new materials needed in green transition, finding substitutes because of resource scarcity and enabling development of totally new material applications.

Read more about our VTT Propertune¬Æ concept:‚ÄØ Computational material design ‚Äì VTT ProperTune¬Æ

‚ÄØ

Your responsibilities as a Postdoctoral Researcher:‚ÄØ


 * Conducting world class research in quantum algorithms and how to apply them to material science problems
 * Advancing the use of quantum computing in specified material development projects
 * Collaborating in research team and project group with co-writing and project work
 * Participating actively in dissemination with journal publications and in seminars
 * Supervising or‚ÄØtutoring junior team members .
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * Quantum computing expert familiar with materials modelling or material modeller (ICME) familiar with quantum computing.
 * You have recently (max 5 years ago) gained your doctoral degree in computer science, physics or mathematics, or a closely related field.
 * You have experience in quantum computing research field and knowledge of how to utilize quantum algorithms to material science problems
 * You have excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * Innovative, an outside-the-box thinker with the ability to learn new things continuously.
 * You enjoy challenges and have a strong passion for work.
 * We appreciate the ability to tolerate pressure and maintain good work-life balance, as well as the willingness to collaborate with experts and partners across different fields.
 * An open-minded and innovative person with a vision of longer-term research needs.
 * You are eager to work with new topics and methods, even out of your comfort zone to achieve the set ambitious goals.
   
   
   

With VTT, you‚Äôll‚ÄØenjoy:


 * Science with‚ÄØan‚ÄØimpact.‚ÄØAt VTT, we‚ÄØseek to solve large societal challenges and drive a sustainable future through‚ÄØapplied research‚ÄØand innovation. With us, you‚Äôll get to work on‚ÄØresearch‚ÄØprojects that‚ÄØmake a‚ÄØconcrete, positive impact in the world. Read more about our strategy, the path of exponential hope , and our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.
 * Support for your postdoc research. During your postdoctoral term, we offer training in project management, scientific writing, communication, and commercialisation. You‚Äôll have the opportunity collaborate with industry on projects, access our research infrastructure and internal support services, explore interdisciplinary research, and secure funding for your postdoc term. At VTT, you‚Äôll enjoy flexibility and independence in your work, with a blend of academic research and engaging customer projects for an exciting career path.
 * Open culture of innovation.‚ÄØWe have 80 years of experience in science-based innovation, a strong international reputation‚ÄØand global networks. We work truly across disciplines, and house all the cutting-edge sciences from quantum computing to synthetic biology under one roof. At VTT, you‚Äôll join a community of over 2200‚ÄØmultidisciplinary‚ÄØexperts who foster a culture of trust, openness and sharing knowledge. Collaborating‚ÄØwith amazing colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.
 * Nordic work-life balance.‚ÄØWorking in‚ÄØFinland, the happiest country in the world, enables a‚ÄØgreat quality of life. At‚ÄØVTT, we‚ÄØmake our people‚Äôs well-being a strategic priority. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), our benefits include extended occupational healthcare, and a range well-being services, such as exercise and culture benefits and hobby clubs. Read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation .
   
   
   

Apply now‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our community of brilliant minds!

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut‚ÄØat the latest by 30 September 2024.‚ÄØWe will process applications as they come in, and fill in the position as soon as we find the right candidate.‚ÄØA security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.

Interested and want to hear more?

For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Marko M√§kip√§√§, marko.makipaa@vtt.fi, +358 45‚ÄØ678 8723 on 23 September 12-14 o¬¥clock or on 27 September between 10-11 o¬¥clock (Finnish time, UTC+3).

We look forward to hearing from you!

Location:‚ÄØVuorimiehentie 2, Espoo or Visiokatu 4, Tampere

This postdoc position is part of Postdoctoral Programme for Research Institutes. The Programme has been granted 40 million euros in funding based on the Finnish government's multi-annual research and development (R&D) funding plan. This funding enables recruitment of 85 PhD-level experts to 12 Finnish government research institutes between 2025 and 2028. The aim of the Programme is to strengthen RDI competence in areas important to society and business . Postdoctoral researcher will conduct goal-oriented high-level research at the interface between the academic community, industry and administration. The Programme supports postdoctoral researcher‚Äôs networking and mobility between sectors.
title: Postdoctoral Researcher, Quantum Computing for Material Modelling

description:
Are you ready to advance your coding skills?




Are you an experienced software developer with a strong drive for growth? Are you in between tech jobs, and are now looking for new opportunities? Integrify is seeking motivated individuals to elevate their tech careers in Finland.




Our advanced 3-month online Full Stack Development program, starting October 14, will equip you with the technical and professional skills needed in the industry, leading to exciting career opportunities with our partner companies in Finland. This 3-month Full Stack program is an unpaid internship, after which developers can secure a paid position with one of our partner companies.




Are you an ideal match?




We're looking for individuals with:

 * Residency in Finland
 * Excellent communication skills in English and/or Finnish
 * A minimum of one year's experience in software development
 * A university degree
 * An active GitHub portfolio and/or a portfolio website
 * Commitment to full-time studies (5 days a week)




During the free 3-month program, you will:

 * Master React and Redux, or Angular and NgRx
 * Excel in Java with SpringBoot or C# with ASP.NET Core
 * Receive personalized 1-on-1 career guidance
 * Get access to our partner companies in Finland




If you recognize yourself in these criteria, apply via our website at: Integrify Full Stack Program




About Integrify

Integrify trains professional technical talent and connects them with Finnish companies. We provide world-class education for people driven to reinvent their careers. With over 150 partner companies, including TietoEvry, CGI, and dynamic startups, Integrify is your gateway to a thriving tech career in Finland. Our mission is to empower ambitious individuals to reinvent their careers through world-class education and unparalleled industry connections. More information is available at Integrify.




Note: The applicant needs to be a resident of Finland.

description:
Impelsys is a market leader in providing cutting-edge digital transformation solutions & services ‚Äì leveraging digital, AI, ML, cloud, analytics, and eerging technologies. We deliver custom solutions that meet customers‚Äô technology needs wherever they are in their digital lifecycle.




With 22+ years of experience, we have helped our clients to build, deploy & streamline their digital infrastructure by providing innovative solutions & value-driven services to transform their business to thrive in a digital economy. We offer expertise in Technology Services | Products & Platforms | Learning & Content Services to drive business success.




Some of our marquee customers include Elsevier, Wolters Kluwer, Pearson, American Heart Association, Disney, World Bank, International Monetary Fund, BBC, Encyclopedia Britannica, McGraw-Hill, Royal College of Nursing, and Wiley.




Our technology stack is varied and cutting edge. We have moved from monolithic applications to distributed architecture to now, microservices based architecture. Our platform runs on Java, LAMP and AngularJS. Our mobile apps are native apps as well as apps built using React, Xamarin and Ionic. Our bespoke development services' TRM includes AngularJS, jQuery, Bootstrap, Cordova, Kafka, PNGINX, Propel, MongoDB, MySQL, DynamoDB, and Docker among others.




Impelsys is a Great Place to Work certified company & has a global footprint of 1000+ employees, with its delivery centers in : New York | Amsterdam | Porto | Bangalore | Mangalore

Website http://www.impelsys.com




Our Vision

We are a purpose-driven company with the vision to make the world a better place by helping spread knowledge through technology




Our Mission

Our mission is to empower enterprises in their digital transformation journeys by leveraging the power of knowledge.




Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced Test Automation Engineer to join our team in Helsinki. This role involves designing and implementing test automation for large-scale systems (end-to-end and API testing). You will work closely with development teams to ensure seamless integration and high-quality delivery. The position offers a hybrid working model, with approximately 1-2 days per week of on-site work.




Key Requirements:

 * 7+ years of relevant experience in test automation
 * Strong expertise in designing and executing tests for complex systems
 * Proven experience with expanding existing test automation frameworks (Robot Framework + Python)
 * Ability to identify dependencies and potential risks early in the development process
 * Familiarity with Agile methodologies and practices
 * Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team
 * Excellent communication skills in both Finnish and English.




Preferred Qualifications:

 * Prior experience in the finance sector
 * Note: This position requires a security clearance.

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


 * 7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )

 * Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)

 * Bachelor‚Äôs/Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
 * Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
 * Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
 * Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
 * Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.

About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


 * Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
 * Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
 * Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
 * Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
 * Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
 * Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
 * Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
 * Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
 * Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
 * Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

description:
üåü Exciting Opportunities for Doctoral Researchers in Particle Physics with CMS in Lahti/Lappeenranta/Helsinki! üåü




We are actively seeking candidates to join our teams as Doctoral Researchers.




All the details on InspireHEP and the university's recruitment/application website:

Two PhD positions (deadline 15 October) as part of the Finnish doctoral pilot program with extra support: https://inspirehep.net/jobs/2829107 and https://lut.rekrytointi.com/paikat/index.php?jid=1155&o=A_RJ




üöÄ Come to the #LandOfTheCurious and work with us:

üî¨ Panja Luukka, Ahti Karjalainen D.Sc., Aneliya Karadzhinova-Ferrer on the instrumentation side (1 position) and

üíª Nurfikri Norjoharuddeen and Henning Kirschenmann on the data analysis side (1 position).




üíª CMS Data Analysis

The group contributes to the analysis of data from the CMS experiment and the development of analysis tools and software. It is an integral part of the joint Finnish CMS programme, which has leading expertise in jet calibration and hadronic final states in general. The programme has received an ERC grant for jet energy corrections and RCF funding for the ForVVard project on probing electroweak symmetry breaking through the study of vector boson scattering. It is also part of the SMARTHEP network for real-time data analysis.

Potential doctoral research topics for this position include expanding the ForVVard analysis of VBS events, enhancing jet calibration techniques, exploring new applications for real-time data analysis in particle physics, or leveraging quantum computing methods to address challenges in high-energy physics.




üî¨Experimental Particle Physics Instrumentation

The group focuses on the CMS experiment at CERN and has been contributing to the tracker and muon sub-detectors of CMS. Detectors based on similar technology can also be used in other fields, such as medical imaging, beam characterization, and nuclear safety and safeguards. We strive to apply the technologies we have mastered not only to fundamental research but also to a larger context benefiting society.

The junior researcher‚Äôs doctoral dissertation may deal with topics such as gamma-ray spectrometry for soil mapping, position-sensitive scintillator detectors for gamma- and X-ray imaging and spectroscopy, semiconductor reliability studies for the new centre of excellence at LUT, and feasibility studies towards electrification.




What We Offer:

‚úÖ Immersive research experience.

‚úÖ Collaborative and inclusive work environment in the "happiest country in the world".

‚úÖ Opportunities for skill development and career growth.

‚úÖ Access to global networks and partnerships.

‚úÖ Chance to contribute to scientific breakthroughs with real-world impact.




Further information

 * Professor Panja Luukka, +358 40 072 2211, firstname.lastname@lut.fi
 * Professor Henning Kirschenmann, +358 50 524 5662, firstname.lastname@lut.fi

You can also reach both professors directly by emailing¬†lut-cms-recruitment@cern.ch.




And as a heads-up: In addition to the Lahti and Lappeenranta campuses, we as the whole Finnish CMS Collaboration community share workspace at the Helsinki Institute of Physics Kumpula campus in Helsinki üëç
