description:
Job Purpose

The Performance Analyst plays a pivotal role in analysing and optimizing business performance across their respective market.

This role involves deep data analysis, identifying barriers to revenue and profit growth, and collaborating with various teams to implement effective solutions.

The Performance Analyst will work closely with country managers and franchise partners to ensure tailored strategies that drive continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


 * Collaboration: Building strong relationships with Country Managers to gain deep insights into their operations, local markets (including competitor landscape), & customers.
 * Analysis: Identifying areas of strength and weakness within their business units through detailed performance analysis using the IWG analytical toolkit and reporting suites.
 * Problem-Solving: Collaborating with centralised teams (e.g. marketing, finance, pricing, recruitment) to develop tailored solutions for the identified issues.
 * Implementation: Assisting in the implementation of these solutions to ensure they are effectively addressing the problems.
 * Continuous Improvement: Monitoring the outcomes and making necessary adjustments to strategies and processes to drive continuous improvement.
   
   
   

Team Dynamics

The Performance Analyst role is part of a Global Performance Management Team, split into regional teams, each headed up by a Team Lead, dedicated to driving revenue growth and optimising EBITDA margin.

The team collaborates closely to share best practices and insights, enhancing the revenue and margin performance across various markets.

As an independent entity, the team provides objective and actionable insights during regular business reviews, supporting country, regional, and functional teams.

Reporting to the Chief Strategy Officer, the Performance Management Team is responsible for monitoring performance against targets.

The Chief Strategy Officer, along with the Performance Management Team, conducts quarterly deep dives with country managers, regional CEOs, and sales and operations functions to ensure continuous improvement and strategic alignment.

Personal Abilities


 * Commercial Acumen- Strong understanding of business operations and the ability to make sound decisions that positively impact financial performance and drive business growth.
 * Accurate - Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
 * Communication - Ability to communicate effectively with others using the spoken and written word.
 * Problem solving - Ability to find a solution for or to deal proactively with work-related problems.
 * Working Under Pressure - Ability to complete assigned tasks under stressful situations.
 * Agile - Ability to deal with shifting priorities and issues inherent in a young company.
 * Passionate - A desire and passion to beat the competition and win.
 * Pragmatic - Ability to be hands-on as well as strategic and be a trouble-shooter when the business need deems it appropriate to do so
   
   
   

About The Company

IWG has been at the forefront of flexible working for more than 30 years. With over 3,500 locations around the globe, spanning brands including Regus, Spaces, Signature and HQ, we have made it possible for businesses of all sizes to make the transition to hybrid working, empowering employees to work wherever and whenever is most convenient.

We help more than 8 million people and their businesses to work more productively, supported by a choice of professional, inspiring and collaborative workspaces, communities and services. As the world‚Äôs leading provider of hybrid work solutions, with four times the number of locations compared to its nearest competitor, IWG is already working with over 80% of the Fortune 500 and counts businesses including Amazon, Netflix, EY and Uber amongst its customers.

Companies of all sizes are shifting to flexible working to lower costs, improve employee retention and lower their carbon emissions. The flexible workspace is expected to grow by 600% by 2023, when 30% of all office space will be hybrid. We are growing our network faster than ever to keep up with demand from customers as we work towards our goal of reaching 30,000 centres.

Carbon Neutral Workplaces

IWG‚Äôs purpose of helping everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet is at the heart of everything we do. We are proud to supply all of our customers worldwide with carbon neutral workplaces, and we have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.

Leading Employer Award

IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in both 2022 and 2023. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.

Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home
title: Performance Analyst

description:
Are you passionate about understanding what drives business performance, the latest technology, and M&A? Are you excited about finding new and innovative ways to solve problems? With SaT Data & Analytics you will have the opportunity to be part of a new wave of business analytics within the world of M&A, helping our clients get to faster and deeper insights than ever before.

Your role as Analyst/Senior Analyst

In your role you will help our clients uncover the key drivers behind their businesses by building new solutions, analysing structured and unstructured datasets, and bridging the gap between data owners and users. Whether you are working with a private equity client looking to sell a portfolio company or guiding a corporate client through their first ever acquisition ‚Äì no project is ever the same and every transaction presents its own unique set of challenges and analyses.

The one area that will be consistent throughout is the use of data driven solutions to analyse large and complex datasets ‚Äì building sophisticated transaction driven analyses to help address our clients‚Äô challenges in fast-changing markets. The central driver of the Data & Analytics group is a constant ambition to improve the M&A process, recognizing the significant untapped value that sits in the ever-growing volume of data our world is generating.

You will be a part of a Nordic-wide team, a group with a diverse set of backgrounds including data science, engineering, finance, and accounting (amongst others). You will have the opportunity to work on projects both in Finland, as well as abroad, working side by side with talented and driven colleagues who will give you the support and guidance to succeed from day one.

Qualifications


 * In your final year of university or approximately 2 years of relevant postgraduate experience
 * Currently based in Finland with valid working rights
 * Strong academic track record
 * General business acumen and an interest/understanding of finance
 * Strong communication and presentation skills
 * Experience/knowledge of programming languages and data visualization tools, e.g.:
   * Programming languages such as Python, R, SQL
   * Visualization software such as Power BI, Tableau

 * Some experience/knowledge of the below technologies is desired (but not critical):
   * Data processing such as Databricks, Snowflake, DataIku
   * AI/ML
   * Cloud technology such as Azure, AWS, GCP
   * Git such as GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps
 * Finnish working proficiency considered as an advantage
   
   

What we are looking for


 * Passion for learning and commanding the latest innovations and technology trends
 * Analytical thinkers excited about solving complex problems in a fast-paced environment
 * Dynamic team players who work well with people with different personal and technical backgrounds
   
   

What we offer

At EY we put our colleagues at the centre, where you will have the ability to have a large impact on developing your career based on your own personal interests and goals ‚Äì regardless of whether that includes industries and clients or developing your knowledge within specifics tools, technologies, and areas. On top of this you will receive opportunities to get involved in our exciting projects such as volunteer work, recruiting, and engagement with our student relations teams.

Sound interesting?

Send in your application with your CV, cover letter and university transcript before 3.11.2024.

Once you‚Äôve applied, you‚Äôll receive an invitation to our gamified ability test. This is done in collaboration with our service provider, HireVue. Please note that the ability test is part of the recruitment process and need to be completed in order to be considered in this process.

Selections and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Victor Eriksson at victor.eriksson1@se.ey.com.

Our workspace is designed with accessibility in mind, ensuring an inclusive environment for all of us. If you need any support or adjustments during the recruitment process or the employment, please contact our local recruitment team at rekrytointi@fi.ey.com. You do not need to disclose any details about your disability or reasons for needing adjustments. Simply let us know what kind of support or adjustment you require and how it will benefit you throughout the process. We are committed to ensuring a smooth and inclusive recruitment process for all candidates. Read more here.

EY | Building a better working world

EY Strategy and Transactions teams work with clients to navigate complexity by helping them to reimagine their eco-systems, reshape their portfolios and reinvent themselves for a better future. With global connectivity and scale, EY Strategy and Transactions teams help clients drive corporate, capital, transaction and turnaround strategies through to execution, supporting fast-track value creation in all types of market environments. EY Strategy and Transactions teams help support the flow of capital across borders and help bring new products and innovation to market. In doing so, EY Strategy and Transactions teams help clients to build a better working world by fostering long-term value.

For more information, please visit www.ey.com/StrategyandTransactions

Shape your future with confidence. Join EY today!

description:
Software Developer (Consulting)




We are looking for newly graduated software developers with 1-2 years of relevant experience within tech projects.




üí´ What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Software Development at Netlight?

Join the Netlight Helsinki office as a consultant and be a part of shaping the software products and technical solutions of today and tomorrow alongside your colleagues and clients. Our focus is not only on the digital product, but also on the team dynamics and overall business impact. At Netlight, you‚Äôll have the ownership to carve your own career path and together with the support network choose from a range of client and roles based on your personal experience, strengths, interests, and market demand.




As a Software Development Consultant you will help our clients in areas such as Fullstack development, Web Development, System Development, Cloud, Mobile Development, Architecture, DevOps, Infrastructure to name a few.




Minimum Qualifications

 * Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Engineering or Technology
 * Relevant project experience in the IT-field
 * Highly proficient in spoken and written English




Preferred Qualifications

 * Master‚Äôs Degree in Engineering
 * 1-2 years of relevant project experience within the IT field
 * Proven track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)




üíú Come work with us

Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight‚Äôs purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




‚ú® About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.




Application

We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications.

We will get in touch within two weeks if we find that your profile and experiences are a match with the qualifications at this time.




Please note that response times may be longer than usual due to our vacation period that ends in the beginning of August. Thank you for your understanding!

description:
Overview

Rambus is looking for new college graduates to join our embedded software team in Espoo for both SW development and QA roles.

Responsibilities


 * Design and implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment.
 * Work with the design and architecture leads for implementation requirements.
 * D evelop, code, test, and debug system software .
 * Documentation of all the work performed (in all stages)
 * Ability to deep dive into the low-level code and develop necessary drivers, libraries, and integration plugins.
 * Participate and initiate code r eview s.
 * Test and verification of SW products.
 * Be able to work with and support the QA team to evaluate the code and generate quality metrics.
 * Assess third party and open-source software .
   
   

Qualifications


 * Successful completion of MS /M Sc or other relevant technical master‚Äôs course in Software engineering , security, IT etc.,
 * Have knowledge and has ability to develop applications for resource constrained embedded environments .
 * Experience with emulation environments ( QEMU or similar SW emulation envs . )
 * Knowledge of device drivers, software l ibraries and APIs ( Experience in working with open-source crypto libraries like openSSL , gptee etc is a plus)
 * Experience with Linux, RTOS, device drivers and bare metal development
 * Familiarity with SCRUM/Agile methodologies
 * Familiarity with Continuous integration systems and tools.
 * Command in C/C++, and at least one scripting language such as Python.
 * Fluency in Java , Android in a plus.
 * Knowledge of developing applications for Secure environment s .
 * Initiative-taking and s trong collaborator
 * Good written and verbal communication in English
   
   

About Rambus

Rambus is a provider of industry-leading chips and silicon IP making data faster and safer. Over 30 years of advanced semiconductor experience. Whether in the cloud, at the edge or in your hand, real-time and immersive applications depend on data throughput and integrity.

Rambus products and innovations deliver the increased bandwidth, capacity and security required to meet the world's data needs and drive ever-greater end-user experiences. Within the Silicon IP Business unit we develop truly differentiating IP products, with largest Security IP development team in the industry, we secure many tear-1 asic‚Äôs in the industry.

Rambus offers a competitive compensation package, including base salary, bonus, equity and employee benefits.

Rambus is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Rambus is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may let us know in the application.

For more information about Rambus, visit rambus.com. For additional information on life at Rambus and our current openings, check out rambus.com/careers/.

description:
About Us: Pharmaca was born in 1975 from a need for reliable pharmaceutical information. Ever since, we have developed and enhanced data to catalyze intelligence for health. We are a growing tech company dedicated to enabling better decision making for the entire health life cycle.




Position Overview: We are looking for a development focused Data Engineer to join our Business Intelligence Services team. You will play a key role in developing our data platform and advancing fact-based decision-making for our customers. You will be an integral part of the product team responsible for technical development and maintenance of our market data and real-world-data products. You will work together with Product Manager and Tech Lead to plan and build a future of cloud native data platform.




As a Data Engineer your will:

 * Develop and maintain our data platform. Conducting data updates and validations.
 * Develop data pipelines and data solutions, such as data models and data marts.
 * Proactively work with team members, customers, Nordic partners, vendors and business stakeholders to make the most out of the data platform and product portfolio.
 * Contribute to common documentation, architecture, working principles, and solution description.
 * Participate in product development by finding ways to utilize our data sources and explore new technology and tools to ensure efficiency and reliability.
 * Create the future by acting as a representative of Business Intelligence team in data platform transformation projects, including technical data solution design.




¬†Qualifications:

 * 3+ years of experience as a data engineer building, developing, and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines. Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, including ETL processes, data modeling, and schema design.
 * SQL Server Expertise: Proficiency in SQL Server, including database design, optimization and maintenance.
 * Knowledge of Python and Snowflake experience is a plus.
 * Hands-on experience working in Azure Environment and knowledge of Azure Data Factory, Blob storage, Databricks, Analysis services.
 * Some knowledge of modern BI tools such as Power BI.
 * Ability to translate business needs to technical requirements. Willingness to actively take part in development projects within the team.
 * Effective communication and social skills. Working proficiency in English and Finnish.

¬†

Why Join Us?

 * A key role in a growing and internationalizing technology and expert company, whose vision is to be a global innovator in pharmaceutical and health information.
 * Meaningful tasks within developing products and solutions that support health promotion. We are a small team with a minimum level of unnecessary bureaucracy. You get to say what are the best technologies and tools to use.
 * We provide a flexible hybrid work model and care about your work-life balance. Our cozy office is in the heart of Helsinki.
 * We have been a Great Place to Work for several years. In 2023, we ranked 10th on the list of Finland's Best Workplaces‚Ñ¢ in the small organizations category.
 * Extensive employee benefits, such as dental care and massage services.

¬†

Our Recruitment Process: Interested? Easy Apply now!

We will continuously review applications during the application period and will get back to you as soon as possible. Candidates that are selected will undergo the following interview process:

 1. First introductory meeting (via Teams)
 2. Technical Interview (Teams)
 3. Face-to-face discussion

description:
Job ID:¬†26192

¬†

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together ‚Äì and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.¬†

¬†

About this opportunity

¬†

Welcome to the SME Digital -team in Business Banking ‚Äì Corporate Digital. We add value by developing our digital solutions (Nordea Business Web and Mobile) to our Small and Mid-sized enterprise customers and are set to become the leading digital SME Bank. You will join our Product Management team, working in a development hub that consists of seven development teams and approximately 90 people, including other supporting roles. As customer insight analyst, you‚Äôll play a valuable role in making sense of our online & offline data and driving better decisions but also understanding customer needs and revealing new opportunities. You have the possibility to make our product team even stronger.

¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Analyse and provide insights to customer behaviour & journeys within mobile and netbank via Adobe Analytics Workspaces
 * Analyse and provide insights to customer characteristics through different data sets
 * Deliver deep-dive analysis and generate data-driven insights with recommendations to the product development teams and senior stakeholders
 * Support product teams with tracking implementations in a way that enables good analysis and follows general tracking framework (e.g. conversions, flow analytics)
 * Share your findings with various stakeholders across the organization via presentations, reports and dashboards but also developing and owning Key Results and KPI‚Äôs

¬†

You‚Äôll join a team of professionals that are passionate about understanding our customers and have a focus on learning and developing. The role is based in Helsinki or Stockholm.

¬†

Who you are

¬†

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * are passionate about doing a great job and delivering results
 * favor open communication and speaking up
 * enjoy taking initiative and bringing your ideas to the table
 * have a can-do attitude and take ownership
 * are invested in your own personal and professional development

¬†

Your experience and background: ¬†

 * Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in relevant field (engineering, computer science, statistics, etc.) or equivalent job experience
 * You have experience in implementing tracking, analysing online (web or mobile) data by using web analytics tools (e.g. Adobe Analytics or similar) and presenting results
 * Having experience in at least one self-service analytics platform is a plus (e.g. Power BI, Qlik Sense, Tableau, etc.) and writing basic / moderate SQL queries
 * You are a good data storyteller with the ability to communicate findings in an engaging manner
 * You are fluent in English

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 11/10/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Olli Petteri Anteroinen¬†olli.anteroinen@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

description:
We are now looking for Cloud focused Data Engineers!




Why are we are actively hiring for this position and others?

We have previously been a traditional IT consultancy, and we are developing into a Digital Workforce Solutions company in Finland, who are receiving regular requests from customers for a wide range of projects. We have current project requirements, so we are encouraging IT professionals located within Finland to apply.




Why should you apply to DigiDo?

We are a smaller sized team currently with a flat hierarchy and mainly senior-level of IT professionals. We have a clear aim of offering our employee's long-term projects that are motivating, salaries that are respectful and a supportive, trusting environment for each individual.




Positions we're looking for?

Data Engineers

Data Architects

Data Analysts

Bi Consultants




Technical Skills we are focusing on:

Cloud - AWS, Azure, GCP

Coding - C#, Python

BI tools - Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Quicksight

Azure - Databricks, Data Factory, Data Lakes, MS Fabric

AWS - Glue, Lambda, Redshift, S3

GCP - Pubsub, BigQuery, Bigtable, Cloudstorage




Bonus points for knowledge in:

- SQL, Spark, CI/CD, GenAI, Apache Kafka, Snowflake, Informatica




Language requirements

Finnish: The majority of our customers currently expect a professional level with the Finnish language, so our highest chance of success when hiring is with matching applicants to projects who have this language ability.

English: We are actively trying to improve the number of customers that we have who are offering English speaking projects ‚Äì we still encourage your application!




Offices and Remote Work

Offices: We currently have modern, central office spaces in both Helsinki and Tampere ‚Äì while our customers often offer office spaces, covering other locations within Finland.

Remote: Our customers can usually offer at least 75% remote work, though many of our projects can be closer to full remote work.




Salary and Benefit Information

Basic salary: As always, this depends on the experience of any applicant and the job that you are hoping to apply for. Our Senior Developer's will usually be earning a minimum of 5500‚Ç¨ p/m as a basic salary. Some experience/projects can also allow us to offer 6000‚Ç¨ p/m and above as a basic salary.

Benefits: We are regularly reviewing the extra benefits that we offer, but all staff can expect a comprehensive healthcare package, lunch vouchers and more.




Any questions about this application?

Email: max.bright@digido.fi




Contact Us

Our management team are happy to answer any questions you might have about our recruitment process or about working at DigiDo in general:

Operations Director: jani.rautjarvi@digido.fi

Job ID:¬†26367¬†¬†

Would you like to be part of a Nordic team, developing the future credit processes for our customers? We are now looking for an experienced Business / Data Analyst with Product Owner experience to our High Risk Data & Default Management Team.

¬†

We are offering you an exciting opportunity to develop key capabilities at the heart of Nordea. Your work will require to understand the connection between business processes, data and the respective IT set-up to pro-actively solve complex problems connected to Nordea‚Äôs Credit Risk process.

¬†

About this opportunity

¬†

Welcome to the High Risk Capability team. We are a growing team, driving the development for high risk credit processes (such as default management and early warnings). Our aim is to build sustainable processes and supporting tools that cater for automation through which we enable great customer experiences. You will work closely with team members and relevant stakeholders to drive the implementation of new solutions and processes for business and regulatory requirements.

¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

 * Structuring and driving analysis and initiatives from initiation to successful delivery in close collaboration with management and stakeholders
 * Be part of an agile structure, with focus on defining, prioritizing and driving features working closely with development teams and relevant stakeholders
 * Ensuring our solutions meet business and regulatory requirements and maximize business value
 * Building expertise of Nordea‚Äôs credit risk agenda especially on High Risk; including understanding of regulatory requirements affecting Credit Risk including the systems and data flows
 * Identifying and actively proposing improvements to streamline the end to end credit processes and enable automation in the area

¬†

You‚Äôll join a diverse, multi-faceted and passionate team. Occasional travel primarily in the Nordics should be expected. The location is preferably in Sweden or Finland.

¬†

Who you are

¬†

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and¬†that we imagine you share with us.

¬†

Your experience and background:

 * At¬†least 3 years of experience¬†working with regulations / data / business processes within Banking, preferably within Credit Risk
 * Experience in driving change (from gathering business requirements to implementation),¬†in an agile environment
 * Comfortable working independently with data analysis (i.e. in SQL)
 * Have a professional level of English, both written and spoken
 * Have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, building strong relationships with stakeholders across Business and IT

To succeed in the role, we believe that you:

 * Can effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment
 * Are self-going with a¬† natural ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude, show ability learn quickly and have a solution-oriented mindset supported by structured, analytical and creative thinking

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

description:
Job ID:¬†26214

Have you already gained experience in an analytical role, and would you now like to enhance your path to become a true professional in corporate banking and credit risk? This is an opportunity to work with the largest corporate financing transactions, in a close cooperation with the best corporate bankers in Nordea. ¬†Credit, Rating & ESG Analysis (CREA) is the competence centre for credit risk and corporate rating analysis in Nordea Group Credit Management. Our ultimate goal and purpose is to conduct first class credit analysis, share expertise and create value-adding information to the credit decision-making and for the customer responsible units in the bank.

About this opportunity

Welcome to CREA Corporate FI 1 team, which assesses and analyses credit risk aspects on Large Corporates & Institutions (LC&I) and largest Business Banking (BB) corporate customers in Finland. Credit analysts are responsible for the credit analysis on their own customer portfolios, as well as analysis on ad-hoc based transactions and customer cases. You will be working in a team of dedicated employees with high level of competence and strong sense of collaboration and togetherness. We take pride in the work we do, and support and help bringing out the best of ourselves.¬†¬†What you will be doing:

 * Ownership of conducting credit risk analysis and ratings on your own customer portfolio as well as ad-hoc based cases.
 * Conducting credit risk assessments on various industries and different transactions.
 * Working as a credit professional and active member of customer deal teams together with other corporate banking professionals.
 * Keeping yourself up-to-date of status and outlook of specific industries and sharing the relevant conclusions to internal stakeholders.

¬†

The role is preferably based in Helsinki, Finland.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

 * Have an analytical mindset and strong analysis skills, and are able to draw concise conclusions.
 * Have passion to challenge yourself and look outside the box.
 * Are a committed team player with a can-do attitude, who thrives in a professional environment sometimes with tight deadlines and intense periods.
 * Focus on assignment, manage time effectively and organize your tasks with high standards of quality.

¬†Your experience and background:

 * Bachelor's/Master‚Äôs degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Technology or another relevant field.
 * Professional skills and experience in analysing and interpreting financial information.
 * Excellent interpersonal and communication skills both in Finnish and in English.
 * Prior work experience within corporate analysis or corporate banking is considered as an advantage.



If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application with salary request no later 13/10/2024. For more information, you are welcome to contact Timo Arponen +358 40 705 5340 or timo.arponen@nordea.com

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.¬†

description:
IQM is the European leader in superconducting quantum computers, established in Espoo, Finland. Since 2019, we have grown to 270+ employees and have established subsidiaries in Germany, Spain, France, the US and Singapore. We build quantum computers for research laboratories and supercomputing centers. For industrial customers, we deliver quantum advantage through our unique application-specific co-design approach.

We build world-leading quantum computers for the well-being of humankind now and for the future.

(www.meetiqm.com)

We are seeking a skilled Data Engineer with an analytical and business-oriented mindset. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in implementing data solutions that produce impactful insights, driving best practices around Data Quality and Data Governance. You will collaborate closely with various teams to maintain and develop our data infrastructure, supporting key organizational goals and objectives.

What will I be doing?


 * Data Pipelines: Build and maintain efficient data pipelines for our data services.
 * Data Modelling & Architecture: Develop and document data models and architecture for future scalability and efficiency.
 * Data Quality & Timeliness: Ensure our data warehouse is updated with timely and quality data.
 * Software Development: Write maintainable, high-performance code.
 * Analytical Tools Development: Support and develop analytical tools (e.g., Tableau, Streamlit) to provide actionable insights.
 * Continuous Improvement: Plan and implement improvements to support organizational objectives and OKRs.
 * Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with various teams to address data needs and requirements.
   
   

What Skills Do I Need


 * Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a related field.
 * Strong background in a data-intensive discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Mathematics, or Operations Research.
 * 2+ years of hands-on experience deploying production-quality code.
 * Professional experience in building data pipelines, preferably using Python
 * Strong understanding of SQL, data warehouses (e.g., Postgres), and ETL/ELT best practices.
 * Experience with data pipeline tools and orchestration frameworks (e.g. Airflow or Dagster)
 * Proven skills in data modeling and building scalable data architectures.
 * Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
 * Eagerness to stay updated with advancements in data engineering.
 * Strong collaboration and communication skills for effective teamwork.
 * Capacity to provide knowledge sharing and advice on best practices in data.
   
   

We Value Candidates Who Have


 * Experience working with data lake architectures and big data technologies.
 * Experience in developing RESTful APIs.
   
   

What can I expect from IQM?


 * A great opportunity to perform world-class R&D and implement cutting edge technology
 * Work alongside a diverse and dedicated team
 * Contribute to groundbreaking projects that will shape the future of quantum
 * Thrive in a creative and open start-up environment that fosters growth, learning, and innovation.
 * Be part of an international, fast-paced environment that values collaboration and cultural diversity.
 * Play a significant role in a rapidly growing organization and be a part of our exciting success story.
   
   

Meet our people and hear more about IQM by visiting our Youtube channel here

We'll proceed with the interviews immediately, so please submit your application soon.

description:
Role highlights:


 * Senior Data Engineer
 * Espoo, Finland
 * Permanent
 * Hybrid
   
   

Who are we?

ICEYE is the global leader in synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellite operations for Earth Observation, persistent monitoring, and natural catastrophe solutions; owning and operating the world's largest SAR constellation. ICEYE is headquartered in Finland and operates from five international locations with more than 600 employees from nearly 60 countries, inspired by the shared vision of improving life on Earth by becoming the global source of truth in Earth Observation.

Our satellites acquire images of Earth at any time - even when it's cloudy or dark - providing commercial and government partners with unmatched persistent monitoring capabilities. Information derived from our SAR images helps customers make data-driven decisions to address time-critical challenges in various sectors, such as maritime, disaster management, insurance, and finance.

Our team is a tight-knit group of experts across many disciplines (e.g., engineering, software development, radar technology, etc.). We're innovative, driven people who strive for excellence in everything we do. Teamwork, curiosity, and having fun are core values at ICEYE, and contribute to Making the Impossible possible!!

Why should you work for us?

ICEYE is at the cutting edge of new technology and we are continuing to build and operate our commercial constellation of SAR satellites. Working with ICEYE, you will be part of making the impossible possible, whilst shaping the Earth Observation industry. You will work with varied, diverse and engaged colleagues to further the ICEYE mission. At ICEYE we realise that without great people we can not succeed, therefore you will be an integral, valued and appreciated colleague, with the ability to directly shape the vision and direction of the business.

We actively support Continuous Professional Development, and will provide access to a range of avenues to allow you to succeed, including courses, training and attendance at conferences. ICEYE is a place where your development, your growth and your success is a priority.

What is the role?

To support the growth of the company, we are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to support our ICEYE Analytics in the Helsinki area, Finland. ICEYE Analytics is focused on building cutting-edge solutions that leverage remote sensing technology to provide near-real-time insights into the impact of global natural disasters and geophysical changes. These solutions enable end users to make informed decisions for event characterization, assessment, and response during critical times.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will help the Data Engineering and Product teams to build highly scalable and resilient solutions and provide easy-to-use workflow and orchestration capabilities for our analytics users so that they can focus on their strengths. You will build scalable services and tools to help partners implement, deploy and analyze data assets with a high level of autonomy and limited friction. You will help ensure ML-powered products are scalable and robustly executed in a cloud-based environment against large geospatial datasets. You want to build best-in-class solutions using robust coding practices and the latest tech to excel analytics at ICEYE.

Responsibilities


 * Design and develop highly scalable and resilient services and data pipelines for data ingestion, processing, and serving using modern technologies.
 * Help to design, build and maintain infrastructure and tooling to enable the development and deployment of machine learning models at ICEYE.
 * Improve the data quality and reliability of the pipelines through proper monitoring and failure detection.
 * Drive process discovery and resolution of technical blockers; generate ideas and identify /solve problems.
 * Comfortably collaborate with cross-functional partners and lead technical initiatives end to end.
 * Produce simple, high-quality clean code using frameworks, services, and reusable assets where possible and help analysts and scientists in Analytics to write better code through coaching and mentoring.
   
   

Requirements

What will you need to be successful in this role?


 * You have at least 5 years of software/data engineering professional experience, including contributions to making infrastructure decisions.
 * You are skilled at crafting and building robust distributed microservices with tools like Docker, Kubernetes, AWS ECS/EKS etc.
 * You are proficient in object-oriented and/or functional programming languages, Python being our main language
 * You are an expert in building internal tools and automation and can develop API services to support internal operations.
 * You are an expert in SQL and have a good understanding of relational databases.
 * You are proficient in infrastructure-as-code (Terraform or similar.).
 * You have experience working with ML engineers and data scientists to build tooling and automation to support the entire ML engineering lifecycle, from experimentation to production operations. Experience with KubeFlow, AWS Sagemaker, and Airflow would be great. We use Argo Workflows, and Valohai for our workflows, so knowledge of those would help you a lot.
 * You are able to effectively collaborate with cross-functional partners and explain sophisticated technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
 * You are comfortable finding your own way and living well in the continuous stream of change that is inevitable in a start-up that is beginning to scale.
 * You put Agile values into practice every day.
 * You have a strong dedication to code quality, automation, and operational excellence: CI/CD pipelines and unit/integration tests.
   
   

In addition to the above, it would be beneficial if you had the below attributes and skills:


 * We work with large amounts of geospatial data, so having experience with those is a plus.
   
   

Benefits


 * A job that matters in a dynamic Earth Observation environment with a scale-up approach
 * An independent role with a supportive and diverse work environment
 * Occupational healthcare, occupational and private insurance
 * A yearly benefit budget to spend as you wish (i.e. on sport, transport, bike benefit, wellness, lunch, etc.)
 * Phone subscription with iPhone of choice
 * Relocation support (i.e. flight tickets, accommodation, relocation agency support)
 * Time for self-development, research, training, conferences, or certification schemes
 * Inspiring and collaborating offices and silent workspaces enable you to focus
 * A wide variety of the best coffee, tea, snacks, and sweets to accompany your daily space mission
 * Base salary range for this position is 5500-6500 EUR per month (gross) contingent on your experience level, and will be negotiated individually.
   
   

Diversity, equity, and inclusion

At ICEYE, we believe that diversity isn't just a buzzword - it's our greatest asset.

We're committed to fostering an inclusive environment where every voice is not only heard but celebrated. We know that diverse perspectives breed innovation and creativity, which is why we actively seek out individuals from all walks of life, backgrounds, and experiences.

Whatever your background, we want you to bring your authentic self to the table. Join us and be part of a team where differences are not only embraced but cherished, because together, we're stronger.

Apply now to start your ICEYE journey, and help us continue to make the impossible possible together.

Read more about ICEYE and working with us at iceye.com

description:
Join us!

If you‚Äôre ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you‚Äôve come to the right place. We‚Äôre always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.




As a Senior Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients‚Äô data!

We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It‚Äôs all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.




In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Senior Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible on a governmental organization.




We are excited to find a talented Senior Data Engineer who is already based in the Helsinki or Tampere area and eager to collaborate with our team and customers. We offer a hybrid working mode that allows for flexibility, but it is important that the candidate is located close by one of our Finland offices to ensure seamless collaboration. Please kindly note that, at this time, we are unable to offer relocation opportunities, or we will need to be highly selective in considering such requests.




Here are some practical things we‚Äôd love to see in your back pocket

 * Experience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)
 * Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.
 * An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.
 * Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!
 * Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent in Finnish and English.




Next steps

If this sounds like the opportunity you‚Äôve been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.




We're Futurice

We are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.




Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.

description:
We are seeking an AI/ML Engineer with strong data science expertise to join our Data Science team for a full-time, ongoing position. The position is based in Helsinki, but you can also work easily remotely with us.




Position Overview

As a key member of our Data Science team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing generative AI applications and machine learning solutions as well as developing and maintaining our analytics platform in multi cloud environment. We are looking for a highly skilled, hands-on developer with strong data science expertise.




Key Responsibilities

 * Design, develop, and implement machine learning applications, including both classical methods and generative AI.
 * Engage in full-stack development, both frontend and backend, within AWS cloud infrastructure.
 * Contribute to the design and development of LLM-based applications, focusing on RAG and generative AI platform architecture, as well as component development
 * Lead and manage end-to-end projects, from identifying and defining business problems to planning, implementation, and deployment of machine learning models.
 * Effectively communicate insights and findings to non-technical stakeholders, ensuring alignment between business objectives and technical solutions.
 * Collaborate closely with other data scientists, developers, and cross-functional business teams to deliver impactful results.




Requirements

 * M.Sc. degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
 * A minimum of 4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist / Data Engineer / Full Stack Developer is preferred.
 * Proficiency in data science, including machine learning, Python programming, data visualization, relational databases, AWS cloud infrastructure, and Generative AI (with an emphasis on Large Language Models and RAG applications).
 * In-depth knowledge of AWS services and cloud architecture principles. Google Cloud Platform is a significant advantage.
 * Solid experience in productization frameworks, micro-services architecture and related frontend and backend technologies like FastAPI
 * Demonstrated ability to work independently with strong communication and teamwork skills.
 * Familiarity with DevOps tools, including Git, Jenkins, Docker, Ansible, and Terraform
 * Fluency in either Finnish or English.




Additional Preferred Qualifications

 * Proficiency in AI platforms from leading cloud providers like Microsoft Azure AI studio
 * Practical knowledge of MLOps practices.




WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:




As stated in our employer promise we want to offer you a humane workplace where everyone can be one-of-a-kind as part of our community. Our values fast, bold and straightforward can be seen in our everyday lives. DNA strives to provide an excellent place to work, and we are constantly aiming to improve our practices as an employer to meet this goal.




Join our team and be part of an innovative and dynamic environment. We offer you excellent opportunities for professional growth and development.




JOIN US - WE ARE ALREADY WAITING FOR YOU!




Please apply via our recruitment system by October 13th. You can submit your application in Finnish or English.




If you have any questions about the role or DNA, please contact the hiring manager Tuomas Nikkonen / tuomas.nikkonen(at)dna.fi, or mobile +358 44 044 6063.




DNA IN A NUTSHELL:




DNA is one of the leading telecommunications companies in Finland. Our purpose is to connect you to what matters most. We offer connections, services and devices for homes and workplaces, contributing to the digitalisation of society. Already for years, DNA customers have been among the world leaders in mobile data usage. DNA has about 3.6 million subscriptions in its fixed and mobile communications networks. The company has been awarded numerous times as an excellent employer and family-friendly workplace. In 2023, our total revenue was EUR 1 067 million and we employ about 1,700 people around Finland. DNA is a part of Telenor Group, a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics. More information: www.dna.fi, X @DNA_fi, Facebook @DNA.fi and LinkedIn @DNA-Oyj.




DNA's award-winning work culture is based on freedom and is built on trust. With us you have the freedom to shine as you are and achieve great things together with others. We appreciate employees from different kind of backgrounds regardless of age, gender, appearance, heritage, who they love or how they see the world.

¬†

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.¬†¬†

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.



We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do ‚Äì when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues and meeting our potential candidates.

¬†

We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on the broader perspective in our daily challenges.¬†¬†

description:

description:
Job ID:¬†26000



Are you a seasoned Business IT Analyst with experience in banking or group finance? Do you have solid SAP S/4HANA experience? Are you interested to be a key player in the team implementing SAP S/4HANA in Nordea Bank? If this sounds interesting, please keep reading.

At Nordea, we know our customers‚Äô needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.¬†¬†

About this opportunity

Join our Requirements & Analysis capability team as a Senior IT Analyst and be key player of our upcoming implementation of SAP S/4HANA! As a team we focus primarily on the Financial Accounting and Procurement domain within Finance Service Area. ¬†We are embarking on a new and exciting challenge! We will be using SAP S/4HANA for our General Ledger based on S/4HANA Finance Universal Journal, Group Reporting, Disclosure Management! We are looking to strengthen our team with a SAP S/4HANA Banking expert. We believe you have excellent general ledger & finance experience as well have implemented solutions using SAP S/4HANA which is necessary to succeed in this role. ¬†You will be part of an international team with team members working across the Nordics, Poland & India (offshore), we add value to Nordea by employing requirements engineering, system analysis & design to enable our stakeholders to build innovative solutions. We take a key part in large-scale programs as well as Agile Release Trains while working with complex IT landscape and large data volumes. ¬†What you‚Äôll be doing:¬†

 * Be our SAP S/4HANA expert and take the lead for requirements management, solution advisory as well as design for key financial processes ‚Äì accounting, controlling and reporting
 * Together with the business, domain and solution architects do the data architecture and modelling within SAP S/4HANA landscape
 * Build a contextual understanding of business processes on one hand and functional/technical know-how of our solutions on the other



The role is based in Stockholm or Helsinki. ¬†

Who you are



Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us. ¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you are/have:

 * A team player who enjoys collaboration in a multicultural environment
 * Excellent communication & analysis skills
 * A genuine interest to learn and develop within the area
 * Appreciated for your positive approach and ability to turn challenges in to opportunities
 * Good at engaging stakeholders at different levels
 * A skilled engineer at heart with passion for developing solutions and take pride in seeing your efforts paying off in form of a great business application

¬†

Your experience and background:

 * Have deep knowledge of SAP (FI-CO) implementation in the banking industry
 * Currently working as a lead / senior Business or IT Analyst or application architect within the CFO area
 * SAP S/4HANA general ledger & finance experience, including migration and/or implementation of S/4HANA
 * Experience working with Agile software development, ideally SAFe framework
 * Fluent in English ‚Äì both written and spoken



As this is a key role, your SAP S/4HANA specific experience in finance, controlling and reporting will be a key for success.

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 01/12/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Kiran Kollimarla, kiran.kollimarla@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Only for candidates in Sweden -¬†For union information, please contact Finansf√∂rbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

¬†

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

description:
Job Title: Delivery/Operations Engineer (DevOps & Software)

Location: Helsinki, Finland (Fully Hybrid Working Style)

Salary: ‚Ç¨5,400 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨5,900 per month

Bonus: 10% (paid in 2 parts: profits and performance)

English Speaking




Job Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled Delivery Engineer with a strong background in DevOps and software engineering to join our team in Helsinki. This role is ideal for an experienced Ops engineer with expertise in backend development (particularly in Python) and a proven track record in managing large-scale production systems. The ideal candidate will focus on improving the reliability, performance, and scalability of our existing production environment rather than developing new applications.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Troubleshoot & Resolve Issues: Diagnose and resolve complex infrastructure and application issues to ensure the reliability and stability of our systems.
 * SRE Practices: Implement and manage Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) principles to enhance system performance and availability.
 * Monitoring & Alerting: Develop, maintain, and optimize monitoring, logging, and alerting systems using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, and CloudWatch.
 * Automation & Tooling: Implement automation to streamline processes and reduce manual intervention.
 * Incident Response: Develop automated responses to common alerts and incidents, minimizing system downtime.
 * Root Cause Analysis: Conduct thorough root cause analyses for incidents and implement preventive measures.
 * System Optimization: Continuously seek opportunities to improve system performance, focusing on infrastructure and application code.
 * Collaboration: Work closely with development, QA, and operations teams to ensure seamless software integration and delivery.
 * Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of processes, procedures, and technical specifications.




Qualifications:

 * Experience: At least 3 years of experience managing large-scale production systems, with a background in Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) or a similar role.
 * Technical Skills:
 * Proficiency in backend development with Python.
 * Expert knowledge of AWS cloud services (Fargate, DynamoDB, Kinesis, CloudFormation).
 * Experience with monitoring and observability tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, CloudWatch).
 * Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
 * Communication: Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
 * Tier 2 Support: Knowledge of Tier 2 technical support processes and best practices.




Team Structure:

 * Team Size: 3-5 people within the operations unit, with collaboration across 3 development squads.
 * Flexibility: Open to candidates with varying levels of seniority, provided they have relevant experience with large-scale production environments.




Why Join Us?

This role offers a unique opportunity to focus on improving and optimizing our current production systems. You'll work in a collaborative environment where your insights and expertise will directly impact the efficiency and reliability of our services. If you're passionate about system reliability and have a strong coding orientation, we'd love to hear from you.

description:
Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled Power Platform Specialist with comprehensive experience across all aspects of the Power Platform, including Power Automate and M365 cloud data solutions. The ideal candidate will also be familiar with M365 tools such as Lists, Forms, Pages, and Loop, and have a strong understanding of services that improve efficiency within the M365 environment, such as CoPilot.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and implement solutions using Power Platform tools and focusing on Power Automate and data management in M365 for a large financial services customer.

Identify and implement strategies to enhance the efficiency of M365 environments using CoPilot and other relevant services.

Provide training and support to team members on Power Platform and M365 tools.

Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in Power Platform and M365 technologies.


Qualifications:


Proven experience from Power platform is required and can be from Power Apps low code development or from Power automate tools.

Familiarity with M365 tools such as Lists, Forms, Pages, and Loop.

Knowledge of efficiency-enhancing services within the M365 environment, including CoPilot.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

Good presentation and communication skills in written and spoken Finnish and English.


Why Accenture?

Because people enjoy working here; the work we do is challenging, interesting, and meaningful. Accenture offers a unique career experience and unparalleled opportunity for you to grow and advance. We are driven by the best results, but we never forget to support each other. We like to challenge our employees and give them the opportunity to shine and succeed. We invest heavily in our people‚Äôs growth and knowledge development.

Our best and only asset is our people. We believe they‚Äôre at their best when knowing what is expected from them and we want to support them in different life phases. Our extensive MyWellbeing program is one of our key tools for that.

Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age, etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Interested? Make your move - apply online and attach a CV and letter of application as well as your transcript of records and salary request in English. We look forward to meeting you!

description:
Job ID:¬†23314¬†

We are now looking for an Adobe Marketing Automation Expert to manage and support the Marketing Automation application with Adobe Experience Platform and Adobe Journey Optimize.



At Nordea, we know our customers‚Äô needs are changing ‚Äì and we‚Äôre deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We‚Äôre creating an agile environment where we‚Äôre harnessing the power of technology ‚Äì one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.¬†

About this opportunity



Welcome to the Group Data Management and Data Operation team. We add value by providing data and analytics solutions to the rest of the Nordea. As the Adobe/SAS Marketing Automation analyst, you‚Äôll play a valuable role in becoming a Subject Matter Expert around application management including different compliance and life cycle management aspects. In your role, you will be working closely with our application owners and provides and supporting them to ensure our applications meet the expected Nordea standards.

Examples of the solutions we enable via our agile release trains are Common Data Platform (CDP), business data marts, Marketing Automation, AI & Machine Learning application etc.



This is an opportunity for you to be part of taking Data @ Nordea to the next level and to collaborate with different organization units and teams across the Nordics, Poland and India.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.¬†¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

description:
Location: Espoo, Finland

Are you searching for a stable and people focused workplace in Finland? Do you want to contribute to innovative, SMART, and forward thinking sustainable solutions that improve people's wellbeing? If so, Helvar could be your next home.

Here at Helvar we are expanding the skills in our team and are now seeking a highly skilled Cloud Test Specialist to join our dynamic team.

As our Cloud Test specialist you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of IoT cloud-based systems and applications through rigorous testing strategies. This role involves designing, implementing, and executing test plans, identifying potential risks, and automating test processes to support a continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline in a cloud environment.

You will be working in product development projects by designing and executing test cases for solutions made of a combination of hardware and software products. In doing so you will be contributing towards the improvement of testing capabilities and increase the automatization level throughout the test pyramid at Helvar. You have an interest in test automation and controlled embedded systems. You understand both software and electronics and are comfortable with electrical measurement devices.

You will accomplish this by working closely with the development team including HW engineers, SW engineers, product managers and UX designers. In this role you will have the opportunity to enhance and grow the testing culture and processes, as well as participating in system testing and customer pilot projects.

What you'll be doing as our Cloud Test Specialist:


 * Design and implement test plans: Create and execute comprehensive test plans for cloud-based applications and services, covering functional, performance, security, and scalability testing aligned to business requirements and development epics.
 * Cloud environment testing: Conduct testing in AWS cloud environments ensuring compatibility, performance, and security compliance.
 * Automation and CI/CD integration: Develop and maintain automated test scripts and integrate them into CI/CD pipelines to enable rapid and reliable delivery of cloud solutions.
 * System testing: Contributing to the overall verification and validation of the system, and identification of gaps including documentation. Understanding system level behaviour and ensuring this is fully verified and documented.
 * Performance testing: Measure system performance and scalability under different workloads, optimizing cloud applications for resource efficiency and cost.
 * Collaboration with development teams: Work closely with development, product management, and technical support teams to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve defects or issues early in the development lifecycle.
 * Monitoring and Reporting: Monitor cloud environments during testing, document results, and generate reports that highlight areas for improvement, including recommendations for performance or security enhancements. Reporting test progress to the Product Owner and the Project Manager.
 * Continuous Improvement: Identify and implement best practices, tools, and processes for cloud testing, keeping up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in cloud computing and quality assurance. Be a contributor to the quality of Helvar products and processes.
   
   

Skills that would be great for the cloud test specialist role at Helvar:


 * Experience with cloud solutions: Significant experience in testing cloud-based systems and applications, with a practical knowledge of end-to-end testing preferably AWS
 * Experience in planning and execution: Experience of planning and executing tests from business requirements and epic definition. Experience of defining system test approaches incorporating software and hardware.
 * Testing frameworks and tools: Experience of test automation frameworks such as Pytest and Cypress to build and automate test cases.
 * Testing management: Experience of working with test management software such as Xray for Jira.
 * Agile methodologies: Significant hands-on experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies and tools such as Jira, Confluence for tracking issues and working collaboratively in teams.
 * Analytical mindset: Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to analyse test results to recommend corrective actions.
   
   

Nice to have


 * CI/CD tools: Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab integrating automated tests into the deployment pipeline.
 * Security testing: Knowledge of security testing practices, including penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and cloud security best practices.
 * Networking: Knowledge of Bluetooth, Zigbee, DALI or other relevant standards
   
   

How we approach our work:


 * Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively across teams.
 * Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.
 * A proactive and collaborative approach to solving problems and improving processes.
 * A good work ethic and an eagerness to learn. Tolerance towards ambiguity.
   
   

The OPX (Testing and Quality) team you'll be joining:

You'll be joining a friendly, dynamic international team with members based in both Espoo, Finland, and Dartford, UK. Our Operational Excellence (OPX) team focuses on program management, testing, and quality assurance, combining thought leadership, teamwork, and creative problem-solving. We‚Äôre committed to continuous improvement, always putting the needs of our customers first, executing with discipline, and streamlining processes to add value. By working together, we aim to enhance our operations and foster a supportive, collaborative environment where everyone can contribute and grow.

Ideal Educational background


 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience
   
   

Why join Helvar


 * We have a culture centered around trust, meaning you'll get autonomy over your work
 * With over 100 years of history, we are a stable Finnish family owned business
 * Wellbeing is at the heart of what we do, whether its developing the bests products for our customers, or the way we care for our employees
 * With almost 300 employees, we are a mid sized company where everyone is accessible
 * Due to growth, over the past few years ,we have hired more than 100 employees at across different levels of experience
 * We value internal mobility and prioritise internal employees for internal opportunities
 * Our average employee tenure is around 8 years, double the industry average
 * With offices in Finland, Sweden and the UK, and employees based across Europe, the middle east and Asia, we embrace our international teams
 * We work in a relaxed environment where work-life balance is key, but strive for strong professional and business growth
 * We offer all Employees a dedicated wellbeing day every year so they can recharge how they wish
 * All employees can make use of their Empower Hour every week, which can be used for wellbeing, community or learning
 * We value and encourage a feedback culture, where we conduct regular surveys (this includes your annual personal development review) to improve ways of working
 * Innovation is at the heart of what we do, and our mindset is to continue to evolve our offering to our customers and to learn and develop our own personal skills
 * We encourage a learning culture where you can access multiple online learning topics via our online learning platform
   
   

Base Package:

Base Salary + Bonus

Our Story

How To Apply And What To Do Next.

At Helvar we truly value our employees, you define our culture and shape our future. We all spend so

much time at work that it‚Äôs important we also spend time learning and having fun, and if that‚Äôs you,

we'd love you to apply today!

If you'd like to consider joining the Helvar Family, then please apply below with your details and

upload a CV. There are also a couple of application questions that we hope you won't mind

answering.

Once you've applied, you'll be contacted by one of our team. ‚ÄØIf you do have any questions

and would like to consider being a part of the‚ÄØHelvar‚ÄØfamily, feel free to also get in touch with

our‚ÄØTalent Acquisition Partner, Ben‚ÄØFryer‚ÄØat ben.fryer@helvar.com

In the meantime, please give us a follow on Instagram: @lifeathelvar

The Helvar Promise to You!

At Helvar, we‚Äôre determined to improve the wellbeing of people in every space - including our own employees. We promise you conditions that foster your personal growth and help you achieve your full potential. As a tight-knit company with a family ethos, we‚Äôre proud to see that Helvarians care deeply about our customers, our partners, our planet and each other. Our drive to create a better working environment is part of what we call Brighter Spaces.

We trust your vision! "Over the last 100 years, we've become experts at innovation. It's part of our culture. Together we evolve and adapt our solutions to create perfect conditions.‚Äú

We invest in you! "As we spend 1/3 of our life at work, it's important to have fun! We work in a friendly, easy-going atmosphere, and we're focused on improving your wellbeing. We celebrate a learning culture and promote Bright Ideas.‚Äù

You have the freedom to impact! ‚ÄúPeople help shape our success. This allows us to be true leaders. With your ideas, we're focused on achieving a brighter, sustainable future for generations to come.‚Äù

We‚Äôre with you all the way!
title: Cloud Test Specialist

description:
At NGP Capital, we are an early-stage Venture Capital firm investing in B2B companies from Series A onwards in Europe and North America within enterprise software, industrial tech, cybersecurity, and infrastructure. Through our $400m fifth fund launched in 2022, we focus on companies driving the convergence of the physical and digital world. Some highlights from our portfolio include GetYourGuide, Lime, Immuta and Akeyless. We‚Äôre powered by data: we use our unique analytics platform ‚ÄúQ‚Äù to scout and monitor over 2,5 million technology startups and growth companies globally.




We are now looking for a Full-Stack Data Engineer to join our analytics team. You are the lead developer of a cutting-edge data & AI platform that extends all the way to a custom web front-end. You‚Äôll utilize a modern serverless cloud infrastructure with state-of-the-art DevOps practices and tools such as vector databases, LLMs, LLM agents, Langchain, and dbt.




What would you work on?

 * Data platform: Building and maintaining a robust data platform, centered on BigQuery, dbt and various data integrations
 * DevOps: Developing and maintaining a scalable and automated DevOps infrastructure for efficient platform management
 * Generative AI: Working extensively with LLMs, including semantic search, vector databases, embeddings, and agent-based frameworks.
 * Operational tooling: Develop integrated tools that seamlessly support our team‚Äôs day-to-day operations, ensuring our platform is a core part of the business.




What do we expect from you?

 * Passion for technology, startups, and venture capital
 * BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, a STEM field or another quantitative discipline
 * Advanced Python Skills for backend & data pipeline development
 * Experience with the Modern Data Stack, including tools such as dbt, Pinecone and Langchain
 * Experience in working with LLMs (e.g. chat models, embeddings, agents, and semantic search)
 * Advanced SQL skills and experience of BigQuery or other scalable data warehouses
 * Strong cloud architecture expertise for building scalable data applications
 * Software development skills for creating custom solutions, writing clean and scalable code, and integrating APIs
 * Full-stack mindset, with a solid understanding both backend data systems and frontend applications
 * Self-driven working attitude and a transparent communication style
 * Fluent communication skills in both spoken and written English




What can we offer?

At NGP Capital, we‚Äôre at the forefront of the venture capital industry, leveraging alternative data to make impactful investments. You‚Äôll work as a part of a small and a dynamic team, you‚Äôll directly see the effects of your efforts, and you‚Äôll have a broad responsibility over your domain. You‚Äôll have the chance to impact architectural decisions, and work at the leading edge of new tools and technologies.




We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where everyone can thrive. Our team comes from a variety of backgrounds and cultures, and we believe that this diversity is key to our success. As part of our team, based across offices in Palo Alto, Helsinki, Berlin, and Shanghai, you'll have the opportunity to work alongside people across the world and learn from their unique perspectives and experiences.




We also offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and we work in a hybrid work model.




Interested?

Please apply by sending your CV and cover letter directly over LinkedIn, or alternatively to team@ngpcap.com with the subject ‚ÄúFull-Stack Data Engineer‚Äù, we‚Äôll review applications as they arrive. If available, please attach any relevant projects, whether in the form of a blog post, research report, Github repository or similar.




For any questions, please reach out to Atte Honkasalo (Vice President, Data & Analytics) via atte@ngpcap.com.




Location

Helsinki, Korkeavuorenkatu 30
