description:
Sievo <3 Azure




We are the Cloud Data nerds at Sievo, a global leader in Procurement Analytics. We are growing, improving, ambitious, working our way through the clouds, and aiming even higher. Integrations, Databricks, Data Factory, Data Lake, IaC, CI/CD, and scaling are parts of your playground? Let‚Äôs talk then!




As a part of our growth, we are looking for a passionate Senior Azure Data Engineer to join our Cloud Data Framework team in Helsinki, Finland.




About the team




Our team designs and builds tools, libraries, data schemas, processes, and best practices for an Azure-based integration framework that our data engineers use when they implement customer-specific ELT pipelines. We research to stay on the competitive edge and quickly adopt new technology. We are part of the Product organization at Sievo - we work with the biggest and most extraordinary global customers and their ERP systems, as well as with third-party providers of data on market indexes, risk, sustainability, diversity, etc.




Sievo is working on the Big Data scale with more than 1000 active integrations for more than 70 ERP system types. Our customer base and data source landscape are growing, which puts more emphasis on us developing better tools to manage the heterogeneous landscape.




For this role, we value strong Azure data engineering experience and a mindset of building robust, upgradeable solutions. We are looking for a data engineer to help us build and modernize our data pipelines in the cloud, contributing to our vision to automate the whole lifecycle of customer data pipelines.




Responsibilities




 * Build standard Azure solutions for our integration pipelines between customer solutions and the Sievo cloud
 * Manage pipelines using Infrastructure-as-Code, CI/CD, and automated testing
 * Own and improve the ELT products built for data extraction, transformation, and loading data to the curated data zone
 * Proactively suggest and implement improvements to reduce manual work, increase testing, scalability, robustness, and availability of data systems
 * Maintain batch and near real-time data pipelines
 * Improve tooling used by data engineers to access, transform, and validate the data
 * Train and support other Data Engineering team members during the transformation to Azure




Requirements




 * Previous experience in designing, implementing, and deploying data pipelines in Azure
 * Experience in Databricks, Azure Data Factory, and Data Lakes
 * DevOps-oriented mindset
 * Good scripting skills, preferably PowerShell
 * Experience in Python & SQL
 * Ability to innovate and work independently
 * Ability to work as part of a product development team
 * Responsibility and ownership




Nice-to-haves




 * Background in backend software engineering
 * Experience with Azure technologies, such as Synapse Analytics, Functions, Logic Apps, monitoring, security, etc.
 * Experience in data pipeline migrations
 * Experience in REST APIs
 * Managing Infrastructure as Code. We use Bicep, but experience in any modern IaC technology applies
 * Experience in building data- or integration-related software products




What‚Äôs it like working at Sievo




 * Competitive compensation package and a stock option program
 * Opportunity to work with the most extensive amounts of data from exciting global clients - the ones you read about in the news, business and management books
 * Awesome office in the heart of Helsinki - or, if you prefer, hybrid working mode
 * True autonomy and responsibility. We are looking for people who yearn for this freedom, make the most out of it, and take on responsibility
 * Continuous learning - we adore learning new technologies, and you will be developing skills outside your current expertise
 * Opportunity to join the leader in the Procurement Analytics Solutions space
 * Possibility to work with an international group of awesome people from diverse backgrounds - with more than 40 nationalities represented.




We offer relocation support and a comprehensive package for exceptional candidates.




How to apply




Could this be you? We would love to hear from you!

Please send us your application and CV. Additionally any GitHub links, contribution to open-source projects, and displays of passions projects are all welcome.




We are continuously reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and offer flexible starting dates. For more information or questions, contact us at heta.ruikka@sievo.com.




At Sievo, we celebrate and support differences and strive to create a culture where everyone feels valued and included. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against any individual in hiring or employment based on gender, gender identity or expression, age, ethnic or national origin, nationality, language, religion or belief, opinion, disability, state of health, sexual orientation, or other personal reasons.




Studies indicate that women are more hesitant to apply for a job and tend to feel their qualifications do not align perfectly with the role. If you're interested in the position and believe that you have the potential to excel in it, we encourage you to apply.

required skills: Scala, C, Excel, Access, Python, R

description:
We are looking for an experienced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning expert for the role of Senior AI Engineer! Join our team to develop modern ML and GenAI solutions for our clients. We seek a professional with a strong AI and data science background who can elevate our clients' AI projects to the next level.




Your tasks will look like this:




- Acting as an AI expert, designing and implementing intelligent solutions in client projects.

- Creating innovative AI solutions on a broad scale, from simple statistical models to pioneering GenAI applications.

- Transforming clients' business challenges into concrete AI models and solutions that deliver measurable added value.

- Participating in the further development of our clients' existing AI projects.

- Analyzing and interpreting large datasets, refining them into critical insights to support decision-making.

- Working closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure project success.

- Keep up-to-date with the latest trends in the AI field and bring new ideas and technologies to our company.

- Developing clients' internal tech competencies.




You‚Äôll get to work on challenging projects in interesting industries and domains using the latest methods and technologies. You‚Äôll work closely with the clients and your teammates to give input into projects and shape the final solution.




We expect you to have:




- Strong experience in developing and implementing AI solutions, as well as in statistical and mathematical modeling.

- Experience with Python.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and analytical thinking.

- Some experience with cloud and/or data engineering.

- The ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

- A relevant higher education degree (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, physics) or equivalent work experience.

- Fluency in both Finnish and English.




Our culture is open, hierarchy-free, and focuses on learning and caring about others. We are curious and passionate, with a desire to do things brightly. At Brightly, you will get to work on projects where we create trendsetter data-driven services of tomorrow. We constantly challenge ourselves and our clients to achieve the best possible outcome.




With us, you can get:




- The opportunity to work in an inspiring and dynamic work environment.

- Continuous learning and development opportunities.

- Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely.

- The chance to influence and develop future AI solutions.

- The opportunity to join Brightly's popular ownership program.

- A highly professional work community where technical challenges are actively shared and discussed.




If you feel that this description matches you, please send in your application. We would love to hear more about you. Please, tell us a bit about yourself using the below form and introduce yourself. If possible, include your CV and some concrete work examples in your application to make the recruitment process more straightforward. Feel free to call our Talent Lead Henna, at +358 40 749 4884. You can also drop a message on LinkedIn.




We look forward to receiving your application!

______________




Psst. You can also read our blogs related to the topic! ‚§µÔ∏è




üéâ The Dos and Don‚Äôts of Production Grade GenAI Software

üéâA Deep Dive into Machine Learning with Databricks AutoML: Revolutionizing Retail Sales Predictions

üéâStop Talking About AI, Start Solving Real Problems

üéâUncovering The Pulse of Social Media: AI Insights into Finland‚Äôs Labor Market Debate




Brightly is a strategic technology partner for large organizations. Our clients trust us to create end-to-end digital solutions for a brighter future. Thriving in complex data landscapes, our expertise ensures a seamless transformation of raw data into valuable insights and practical end solutions - allowing everyone to think brighter.
title: Senior AI Engineer

description:
Salesforce Technical Architect




We are looking for exceptional individuals to join our team and seize this unique opportunity to build a highly capable company for its new era. We value innovators, those who relentlessly drive continuous improvement, and people who thrive in collaborative environments to achieve outstanding outcomes




Imagine being part of shaping the new MacGregor and our Information Management (IM) function. It's not just a job; it's a once-in-a-lifetime transformation journey, and we're inviting you to come along for the ride. Let‚Äôs rule the seas together! ‚Äì Thomas Bayard ‚Äì Vice President, IM




Salesforce Technical Architect




The Salesforce Technical Lead is a critical role responsible for leading the technical design, development, and implementation of Salesforce solutions that align with the organisation's business objectives. This individual will serve as a technical expert, providing guidance and mentorship to the development team while ensuring the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and maintainable Salesforce solutions. The Technical Lead will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, project managers, and other IT teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring the successful execution of Salesforce projects.




Key Responsibilities




 * Lead the technical design, development, and implementation of Salesforce solutions.
 * Provide technical guidance and mentorship to the development team.
 * Ensure adherence to best practices and coding standards.
 * Conduct code reviews and ensure the quality of deliverables.
 * Translate MacGregor`s business needs and requirements into Salesforce terminology and solution
 * Design and implement scalable and maintainable Salesforce solutions.
 * Integrate Salesforce with other enterprise systems.
 * Evaluate and recommend new Salesforce technologies and features & give singoff for technical design before development starts
 * Collaborate with project managers to ensure successful project delivery.
 * Identify and implement process improvements to enhance development efficiency.
 * Promote a culture of innovation and learning within the team.




Skills and Experience




We expect you to have the attitude of 'I am here to help you' and being a very driven person & team player. Good interpersonal and communication skills are a prerequisite. Readiness to bring the best practices and benchmarking opportunities from the industry to the business. As we are a dynamic organisation we expect you to adapt and respond to change rapidly.




Skills and experience that would help you succeed in this role:




 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.
 * Proven experience (typically 3+ years) in Salesforce development and administration.
 * Salesforce certifications such as Platform Developer I & II, Application Architect, or System Architect are highly preferred.
 * Experience leading technical teams and mentoring developers.
 * Strong proficiency in Apex, Visualforce, and SOQL, Lightning Web Components is a plus.
 * Experience with Salesforce APIs, integrations, and data migration tools.
 * Knowledge of Salesforce security models, sharing rules, and profiles.
 * Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for Salesforce development.
 * Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently.
 * Adaptability and willingness to learn new technologies, expand existing skills and / or grow into an experienced architect.
 * Knowhow of jenkins, bitbucket and github are highly preferred




Why MacGregor?




We offer you the unique opportunity to jump into a transformation journey, where you can leave your footprint.




MacGregor is shaping the offshore and marine industries with leading cargo and load handling solutions and services. Working together with shipowners, operators and builders, we innovate, design and develop solutions that last for a lifetime.




We are a global company that operates in more than 30 countries with 2000 employees and more than 700 MEUR revenue. Our products and solutions can be found onboard more than every second vessel in the global merchant fleet.




Values guide our work




 * Integrity steers all our thinking, behaviour and the relationships with our customers and other stakeholders.
 * Quality is valued in our processes, products and services and helps to improve our customers‚Äô performance and our own competences.
 * Safety is essential in everything we do




We offer our employee benefits such as occupational health services, benefit funds, accident insurances, holiday bonus, lunch benefit, ePassi, and more.




Additional information




Position is primarily located either Helsinki, or Kaarina. Alternatively, other MacGregor locations are also an option.




Wise IT is supporting MacGregor in this important recruitment. If you have any questions about the position, please contact: Tiia-Liina Aavisto, IT Recruitment Consultant, tiia-liina.aavisto@wiseit.fi +358 40 186 0696




Does this sound like the job for you? If yes, we hope to hear from you before the application deadline 31.10.2024, through submitting your application via our Wise IT recruitment system.




Proud of our heritage, leading today and ready for the future.




Our purpose: We enable sustainable global maritime operations by maximising efficiency in cargo and load handling.




Our vision: creating lifetime value.
title: Salesforce Technical Architect

description:
Our award-winning tech community is looking for lead developers to join us in Helsinki.

As a lead developer at Reaktor, your job is to work with the full software development lifecycle, help your team succeed, and deliver results

Your Daily Tasks Include


 * Being the first point of contact for the client when it comes to technical questions or the quality of the delivery
 * Working together with the client‚Äôs tech and business teams: facilitating collaboration between different stakeholders to ensure quality delivery
 * Implementing new features that require changes to front-end applications, back-end servers, and/or databases, knowing what is needed from infrastructure to support the team's work
 * Improving the team's ways of working by empowering them to discover optimal workflows and enabling a healthy work-life balance among team members
 * Building relationships with the client to ensure future collaboration
 * Assisting the team in adopting and following agile practices
   
   

You are an experienced developer who enjoys facing technical challenges and is at home providing clarity in ambiguous situations

To Thrive In This Position, You‚Äôll Need


 * Experience on a broad spectrum (back end, front end, and ops). Usually, to be successful in this role at Reaktor, we've noticed it's good to have a minimum of eight years of relevant work experience
 * Solid understanding and experience of agile project management principles
 * To have both previous team-lead and consulting experience
 * Experience working with several client stakeholders to solve complex problems
 * Previous experience with at least one common server-side programming language. Currently, many of our projects are built with TypeScript/JavaScript and Node.js. But, Java/Scala/Kotlin, Clojure, and Python are also used
 * Strong knowledge of at least one common client-side language and framework. We often use TypeScript/JavaScript and React on our web app projects and Swift, Java/Scala/Kotlin, or TypeScript/JavaScript React-native on mobile
 * Relevant skills to create new backend services and tweak CI/CD pipelines when the project requires
 * Know-how on databases (e.g., PostgreSQL)
 * Fluent verbal & written English skills
 * To be willing to work in a hybrid setup, where you work with your team at the office or at the client premises
   
   

Why join us?

For two decades, we‚Äôve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change ‚Äì building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people.

While Working At Reaktor, We‚Äôll Provide You With


 * To be able to impact how you work. Together with the client, your team chooses the approach, technologies, and methodologies you think will work best in any given situation
 * A community with as much support as your heart desires
 * A team that‚Äôs not only experienced but considerate as well ‚Äì they all want you to succeed
 * A sustainable work-life balance and support for your daily life outside of work. (e.g., free moving day, Reaktor car share, sick child care services, office space to use for your private events, etc.)
 * An opportunity to grow as a professional. In addition to the day-to-day work, we offer internal training courses, community events, and 15-minute coffee breaks to discuss hot topics in tech and design
 * A possibility to take part in more extended academy-like studies like Cloud Academy.
 * 300+ hobby clubs, from winter swimming and running to knitting and archery, that bring people together outside of (and sometimes inside) office hours. Many of these are supported by Reaktor
   
   

Diversity, equity, and inclusion

Together, we are committed to making Reaktor an environment that embraces and values all of our employees for the whole of who they are. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply, knowing that studies show that members of underrepresented communities don‚Äôt apply for jobs unless they fully satisfy all of the requirements. If you're thinking twice about applying for this reason, we invite you to send us your application anyway. You could be just the person we're looking for.

Read more about our DEI work here.

Interested? Drop us a line via the form below. We'll be happy to hear from you!
title: Lead Developer

description:
eBrands is looking for a Lead Developer to lead and manage our technical team of 4 and help drive our software platform to the next level. You will report directly to the Founder/CEO.




eBrands is a technology company focused on expanding and growing beloved consumer brands through e-commerce and major retail channels across the US and Europe. We specialize in scaling both our own and third-party brands through our brand expansion platform, think Export as a Service. By leveraging data-driven strategies, creative solutions, and AI technology, we optimize brand performance and enhance supply chain efficiency. Committed to sustainability and innovation, eBrands transforms local brands into global successes.




Our platform consolidates, analyzes, and forecasts data from multiple sources, offering a comprehensive view of business performance. It also enables our partners to efficiently manage their operations with us. It serves as an integration layer between our in-house software, and 3rd party SAAS products. It is a key part of our business, helping us to efficiently manage +30m in Revenue, +1M orders per year, and 1000+ products across a global supply chain and sales channels.




You will be working with a team of great other software developers and data engineers to build integrations and services that help us utilize data in the best possible way.




We are using a modern technology stack on AWS; using services including EventBridge, Lambda, Redshift, SageMaker and OpenSearch. We would like you to have experience of managing technical projects, as well as hands-on experience of working with integrations, data pipelines and event driven architectures in a cloud environment.




Your responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

 * Managing the roadmap and backlog for our platform
 * Managing the technical team
 * Advising non-technical stakeholders on technical matters
 * Identifying trends, metrics and useful insights that can help the business¬†
 * Investigate and find new data sources to improve reporting and forecasting
 * Design and plan new integrations
 * Developing our AWS Infrastructure using the CDK library (Typescript)
 * Building and maintaining services that can connect to data sources and process this data efficiently and reliably (Typescript)
 * Work with teams from sales, marketing and logistics to plan requirements (i.e what data is needed, where it is collected from, frequency, and reporting output)




This is a hybrid position based in our Helsinki office.




QUALIFICATIONS




 * Previous experience managing a technical team
 * Previous experience managing technical projects
 * Previous working experience in a hands-on development role
 * An ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively
 * Experience working with AWS or other public cloud providers
 * Experience with IAC
 * Strong Typescript skills
 * Strong SQL skills
 * A good understanding of performance, scalability and security
 * Industry experience of eCommerce is a big bonus




QUALIFICATIONS

Please send your CV, salary request, and a short application detailing why you think you would be a great fit for eBrands to join@ebrands.com.
title: Lead Software Engineer

description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond ‚Äì while having fun with it.

We‚Äôre ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for a highly skilled Backend Programmer to make our game more efficient, secure, reliable, and scalable. You'll be joining the Backend Tech Team, collaborating with experts in programming, data, infrastructure, and player experience to extend and implement services and applications. Working on a live game comes with unique challenges‚Äîyour code will interact with millions of players, and you'll need to respond quickly to live issues, requiring creativity, attention to detail, and adaptability. This role values strong communication and collaboration, which are essential for building trust and working well with the team.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


 * Designing, implementing, and testing game backend functionality for a single mobile game using C# and latest Microsoft .NET technologies
 * Driving feature implementation from design to deployment and monitoring
 * Ensuring game backends are stable, secure, efficient, and scalable
 * Integrating external services with game servers
 * Collaborating with the backend technology provider
 * Supporting other programmers and developers in their requests for tooling and features
 * Participating in on-call rotation for live monitoring and troubleshooting with various stakeholders
 * Working on a live game with its particular challenges, including rigorous testing, migrations, monitoring, and maintenance
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Experience writing quality code, especially in C# using .NET framework
 * Proficient in working with databases, especially SQL
 * Good understanding of stateful and stateless server architectures
 * Ability to work with frontend technologies, including Vue and REST APIs
 * Skills in integrating external services or third-party APIs with existing backend systems
 * Expertise in building and operating scalable applications for a large number of simultaneous users
 * Proficiency with cloud services such as AWS
 * Experience in conducting performance testing and working with monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus, and Loki
   
   
   

What We Offer


 * Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
 * Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
 * Great opportunities to grow with the company
 * Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
 * Approachable leaders with low ego
 * Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office
   
   
   

Basics


 * Location: Helsinki, Finland
 * Relocation: Relocating to Finland expected, full support provided
 * Work model: Mix of office and remote work
 * Working language: English
   
   
   

Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think ‚Äúwe‚Äù before ‚Äúme‚Äù. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
title: Backend Programmer
Soft Skills: attention to detail, collaboration, creativity, adaptability, communication

description:
Join us!

If you‚Äôre ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you‚Äôve come to the right place. We‚Äôre always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.




About the role

Will you be a catalyst for our key portfolio or account teams in driving business development and making sure our data competence development and client needs are in sync?

We are looking for a Tech Principal who plays a leading role in steering and guiding the development of our business portfolio and ensuring our full cross-competence offering is actively utilized in the portfolio‚Äôs business development and sales activities. Tech principal acts as a source of insights and expertise for key account leads as well as utilizes their excellent communication and teamwork skills to bridge all competencies (like tech, design, data & advisory) to work together in a winning cross-competence offer to our strategic key clients.




As a Tech Principal, Enterprise AI Architect, you have a wide understanding of cloud technologies, modern technology platforms, such as Salesforce and Microsoft Power Platform, AI and modern frameworks in your back pocket. You have several years of hands-on experience in enterprise architecture and have extended your range of impact to help customers with your technology strategy and governance expertise. You are particularly interested in AI and how it will shape companies' enterprise architectures, and business processes and strategies. We would be happy to see that you are passionate about business development, people and team development, software engineering, impeccable customer experiences, and innovation. Or maybe about something else that we haven‚Äôt even thought about. Please tell us.




And to be more concrete, here is our wish list:




We don‚Äôt expect you to master them all, but hopefully this guides you closer to our thoughts and needs:




 * Expertise and vision on what is the next big trend in technology platforms and enterprise solutions
 * Industry expertise on Public Sector, Energy, Manufacturing, Logistics or Forestry
 * Enterprise & legacy software understanding
 * Strong understanding from different cloud ecosystems
 * Deep development experience and understanding
 * Solution architecture & backend solutions know-how
 * Interest and experience in AI & Machine Learning
 * Willingness and capability to lead by example in client projects
 * Experience in sales and thought leadership
 * Valuing and actively engaging in effective communication, you possess at least fluency in English, with Finnish being a significant advantage




Futurice offers you

Besides our overall cultural and organizational model, we support your growth as a professional. As an agency, we have a versatile portfolio of projects, and we solve different kinds of problems that require different kinds of tools. For you, this means the chance of a lifetime to pursue your learning goals and broaden your skill set. You will be inspired and supported throughout your journey, as our aspiration is to be the Ultimate Learning Platform for your career. On top of this, you get the opportunity to work with the most motivated and multi talented forces in development, design and strategy.

In addition, we listed here some of the perks we offer:

 * Futurice Hybrid Work Model
 * Free choice of laptop, phone, tablet, headphones and other work gear
 * Sports and lunch benefit
 * Futurice's clubs for free-time activities
 * Learning events
 * Certification programs




Compensation

Your complete compensation package will be discussed in detail during the recruitment process. Our salary model is designed to offer a range of levels based on three factors: skills, responsibilities and impact. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment where every employee has the opportunity to thrive and advance in their career and become better versions of themselves.




During the initial interview round, we will discuss the salary range for this position. We offer a fixed salary with the possibility of performance-based bonuses and additional benefits.




Next steps

If this sounds like the opportunity you‚Äôve been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.




How we work

Ever since Futurice was founded, we‚Äôve been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We‚Äôve put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean ‚Äì take a look here to learn more, check our Culture handbook 2.0 and get to know some of our people through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our offices here!




At Futurice, new joiners are not expected to fit into a specific mold ‚Äì people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there‚Äôs power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about our DE&I commitment and efforts here.




We're Futurice

We are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.




Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.
title: Tech Principal, Enterprise AI Architect

IT Developer, Transaction Monitoring

title: Expert IT Developer

description:
Accenture is looking for Full Stack Developers with Azure expertise to join our team of open-minded, multinational, and technology-driven people. At Accenture, we help our clients improve their systems, processes, and business in the new and continuously evolving digitalized world.

As part of Accenture‚Äôs global team, you will have the opportunity to work with like-minded and inspiring colleagues using the latest technologies. With our broad global resources and deep technical know-how, we collaborate with clients to cultivate ideas and deliver high-performing results.


Job Description


Do you follow new technologies and have a desire to change the way business gets done? Do you want to implement emerging solutions for some of the most successful companies? If you answer yes to these questions and you are passionate about helping clients effectively improve their businesses, then we want to meet you.

Your key responsibilities will be in implementing end-to-end projects on Azure cloud, migrating from on-premises. You will participate in development, designing, building integrations to various systems, and overall testing.

Basic Qualifications:

You preferably have work experience from some of the following qualifications and interest to grow on the others:


Degree in Computer Science, Technical Science, or similar

Experience and interest in designing and building solutions using the Azure cloud platform

Experience in end-to-end delivery of software projects

Experience in unit, integration, system, and regression testing

Hands-on coding experience in programming languages like Java, Python, Typescript, or .Net

Strong interest in growing your technical skills

Ability to be an innovative, resourceful, and collaborative problem solver

Good presentation and communication skills in written and spoken Finnish and English


We also value previous experience in some of the following and interest to grow on the others:


Experience and/or interest in container technologies such as Docker & Kubernetes.

Experience and/or interest in Github Actions & Workflows

Restful Webservices & Event-driven systems

Frameworks like: Spring Boot, Spring MVC, React, Angular, Vue.js, and Java Spring

Experience in application migrations, re-architecting, and re-platforming


Why Accenture?

Because people enjoy working here; the work we do is challenging, interesting, and meaningful. Accenture offers a unique career experience and unparalleled opportunity for you to grow and advance. We are driven by the best results, but we never forget to support each other. We like to challenge our employees and give them the opportunity to shine and succeed. We invest heavily in our people‚Äôs growth and knowledge development.

Our best and only asset is our people. We believe they‚Äôre at their best when knowing what is expected from them and we want to support them in different life phases. Our extensive MyWellbeing program is one of our key tools for that.

Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age, etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Interested? Make your move - apply online and attach a CV and letter of application as well as your transcript of records and salary request in English. We look forward to meeting you!
title: Azure Full Stack Developer

description:
ReOrbit is looking for a motivated Senior Satellite Systems Engineer to join our team at our HQ in Helsinki, Finland.




This role will take the lead on designing and developing our systems, at satellite level, whilst supporting and mentoring other members of the team. Your extensive hands-on experience of working on satellite systems means you can start contributing immediately to our projects.




This full life-cycle, end-to-end role requires someone who has worked right from the beginning of a project, working with stakeholders and defining requirements through design and development of the system, working with suppliers and into AIT and launch. It‚Äôs a pivotal role, working inter-disciplinarily with the subsystem teams, weaving the systems into the platform level.




It's an exciting chance to join a dynamic start-up, with the opportunity to make a real impact, helping determine how we develop our systems to reach our goal of pushing the boundaries of space data transfer.







Responsibilities




 * End-to-End System Design: Lead the design, integration, and validation of complex space systems, ensuring that every component works in harmony to meet the projects or product‚Äôs objectives.
 * Requirements Engineering: Collaborate closely with stakeholders to define and refine both technical and non-technical requirements, ensuring clarity and alignment with mission goals. CONOPS/OPSCON, use cases development
 * Subsystem Integration: Coordinate across different engineering teams (software, hardware, electrical, etc.) to ensure smooth subsystem integration, paying special attention to interface management.
 * Performing feasibility studies
 * Supporting business development with bids, providing technical information and supporting documentation
 * Documentation







Skills & Requirements




Essential




 * At least 10 years' experience working as a systems engineer on satellite projects
 * Extensive commercial space industry experience; designing satellite platform architecture
 * Full lifecycle experience, through all phases of a project, from requirements to AIT and launch
 * Good understanding and exposure to different subsystems including avionics, payload/RF, GNC, Flight SW etc.
 * Has previously developed documentation for requirements, AIT, CONOPS/OPSCON, design review gates etc.
 * Mission analysis and modelling
 * Knowledge of Space Industry Standards:NASA Standards: Familiarity with NASA‚Äôs systems engineering standards, including NASA Systems Engineering Handbook (SP-6105) and other relevant technical standards.
 * ECSS Standards: Strong understanding of ECSS standards related to systems engineering, particularly ECSS-E-ST-10C (System Engineering General Requirements), and other relevant standards such as ECSS-Q-ST-10C (Product Assurance). Experience applying these standards in the design, development, and validation of space systems.




Desired




 * Experience working on geo-stationary communication satellite projects
 * Holistic thinking: Ability to approach problems and solutions with a comprehensive view, understanding how all subsystems and components interact within the larger system to achieve overall objectives. The candidate should be able to consider not just the technical aspects but also operational, environmental, and human factors in decision-making.
 * Team Leadership and communication: Serve as a central communication point between engineering teams, project managers, and stakeholders. Foster collaboration, transparency, and clarity.







What does ReOrbit do?




ReOrbit builds the foundation for the next generation of space applications by transforming satellites into truly intelligent, interconnected platforms, defined by software. Our satellite design philosophy revolves around the idea that satellites must network, communicate with each other and thus improve mission efficiency. How can this be achieved? Thanks to a flexible software-first architecture, where all these aspects are dealt with upfront in the mission concept, as integrated functionalities.




ReOrbit‚Äôs top-notch team of software engineers and system architects develop in-house software, procure hardware from the best-in-class suppliers, and seamlessly integrate the components to create flexible and secure satellites. Today, we are a rapidly growing company building a very strong multidisciplinary team to support our activities. We are headquartered in Helsinki, Finland with a subsidiary in Bariloche, Argentina.







Working at ReOrbit




At ReOrbit, we are focused on building a strong team as we believe nothing can be accomplished without innovative, humble and curious minds working together on a common goal. We‚Äôre all about fostering an inclusive, dynamic environment where equality and diversity are our strength. Our hierarchies are designed thoughtfully, and titles reflect the work we do.




We offer




 * Challenging but rewarding environment ‚Äì you will thrive if you are always reflecting on how to make things better. Your ideas will be heard
 * Ambitious and supportive network of people, who are motivated to change the space industry, bringing expertise from both classic and new space
 * Benefits such as lunch vouchers, free gym, events, parties, occupational health care - but most importantly a possibility to be a part of a unique and diverse team, connected by similar mindset and sense of humour
 * We like to spend time together! You can choose activities whichever is to your liking ‚Äì runOrbit, climbOrbit; become ping pong or board games champion (warning ‚Äì not easy to compete with existing ones)
 * We support relocation and integration into Finnish society, find some experiences about relocation here




Please, submit your application as soon as possible - we are excited to hear from you and can‚Äôt wait to discover your unique skills and experiences.




For agencies: We do not accept unsolicited CVs for our open vacancies. Any CV sent to our team unsolicited will reserve us the right to pursue a candidate without obligation to the sender. All candidate submissions must be conducted through our official channels and in accordance with our terms of engagement.

description:
Job Title: DevOps Engineer ‚Äì AWS Specialist (Greenfield Projects)

Location: Helsinki, Finland




Are you passionate about building innovative solutions that drive positive change? We‚Äôre looking for a talented DevOps Engineer to join our client in Helsinki, working on transformative greenfield projects that have a real impact on society. You‚Äôll be part of groundbreaking initiatives in both the forestry and healthcare sectors, creating cloud infrastructure that supports sustainable practices and improves the quality of life for people around the world.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Design and implement cloud infrastructure for new, large-scale greenfield projects using AWS services.
 * Automate infrastructure deployment and monitoring with tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible.
 * Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines to enable rapid, reliable deployment of innovative applications.
 * Collaborate closely with development teams and stakeholders to architect secure, high-performance solutions for forestry management and healthcare platforms.
 * Optimize AWS services, including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and VPC, to ensure scalability, efficiency, and sustainability.
 * Implement robust cloud security practices to safeguard sensitive healthcare data and support compliance with industry regulations.




Your Profile:

 * Proven experience in designing and managing AWS cloud infrastructure.
 * Strong knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
 * Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and CI/CD pipelines.
 * Ability to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams to shape impactful solutions.
 * Passionate about using technology to solve complex problems in sustainable forestry management and healthcare.
 * Knowledge of cloud security best practices and compliance requirements.




What They Can Offer:

 * An opportunity to contribute to meaningful greenfield projects that promote sustainability and enhance healthcare delivery.
 * A collaborative and mission-driven environment where your work makes a difference.
 * Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits.
 * Flexible working options and a focus on work-life balance.
 * Professional growth and development opportunities, working with the latest cloud technologies.




If you want to leverage your AWS expertise to build impactful solutions that benefit both the environment and society, apply today!

description:
Grow. Make a difference. Together.




We are aiming to be the very best in Data Driven Services in the Nordics. In order to do so, we are looking for top-notch Senior AI Developer to strengthen our Data & Analytics crew.




What is the role about?

Your main task is to deliver demanding data-driven solutions to our clients and to act as one of our senior experts for the work related to AI/ML.




Your role will involve driving the development direction, providing guidance, and delivering effective data engineering and AI / ML solutions within these environments. Performing in public and showcasing our data services would be part of your role as senior expert. The highlight of this job is the diverse and interesting range of clients we serve, representing various industries and organizations ‚Äì and widely influencing role internally.




As we are a compact but dynamic team, your role is evidently a responsible one. You would take part to pre-sales, offering development and our internal competence and process development too. As a team, we collaborate and constantly improve our operations (such as DataOps thinking) by networking across different fields with colleagues to innovate and discover the best practices and technologies that benefit our clients.




What do we expect from you?

We, as Knowit employees, are all Makers at heart; we do what we promise with great passion. We take pride in our work and vast expertise.




In addition to the Maker mindset, we expect you to have a strong understanding of Modern Data Stack trends and processes, the courage to look ahead and challenge the past, as well as the ability to design solutions that meet our clients' data and business needs.




Furthermore, for this type of senior role we would expect that you:

 * Have several years of diverse experience in AI & Data Science roles.
 * Strong programming skills in Python and proficiency in SQL.
 * Experience with major AI and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
 * Experience with big data platforms like Databricks.
 * Knowledge of modern cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP, and related data science tools/services.
 * Experience and understanding of Generative AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and explainable AI
 * Experience at least couple of the following skills;
 * Natural Language Processing: Text analytics, sentiment analysis, language models.
 * Computer Vision: Image processing, object detection.
 * Time Series Analysis and Forecasting.
 * Optimization algorithms and operations research.
 * Data and AI strategy/advisory consulting.
 * Data mining and statistics.
 * Data pre-processing, cleansing, pipelines, architecture, data warehousing and data lakes.
 * DataOps, MLOps.
 * You enjoy solving complex data challenges and collaborating with clients and the team
 * Ability to understand business problems, objectives, and translate them into data-driven solutions
 * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in Finnish and/or English
 * Understanding of ethical considerations in AI, such as fairness, bias, transparency, and accountability.




In addition to these skills, we value your genuine enthusiasm for continuously developing yourself as a data professional and utilizing the latest technologies in the field.




How do you benefit for joining us?

Knowit offers you an excellent opportunity to shine in our Data & Analytics team while expanding and deepening your expertise among the industry's top professionals. In the Nordics, we are one of the leading providers of data and analytics solutions. We maintain close partnerships with market-leading technology companies such as Tableau, Microsoft, dbt, Databricks, Snowflake, and AWS.




We are a flat organization where everyone can be their authentic selves. A relaxed, functional, and professional work environment is fundamental to us, and team members are only one Slack message away. We provide modern office spaces in Helsinki, Tampere, and Turku, as well as ergonomic work tools. This role is permanent and full-time, and we offer the opportunity to work with a remote/hybrid model that suits you. Naturally, we provide comprehensive employee benefits to support your well-being and enjoyment at work, including flexible working hours, an excellent work-life balance, extensive opportunities for skills development and career advancement.




We trust and empower you, and we strive to provide you with the professional opportunities that align with your aspirations within our team. Our diverse data activities enable the development of your expertise, and you will have a genuine impact on shaping the future of our data operations.




Did we spark your interest?

If yes, we would definitely like to hear more about you. If you come up with any questions or want to have a quick chat before making any further decisions, just reach out for Talent Acquisition Partner Annastiina Korpi, whose contact information can be found in our career site.




Knowit - We are Makers of a sustainable future

Our work community in Finland consist of over 500 IT professionals and management consultants in Helsinki, Tampere, Turku, and Oulu. Our working culture consists of low hierarchies, relaxed and open atmosphere and moreover, of great people.

title: Full-stack Developer

description:
Join our a+ team! At Accountor Software , we are forerunners for the future. Together, we help and support thousands of companies to manage their business better and more efficiently. We do this by providing the best financial management software and services on the market.




What your future looks like at Accountor




Are you an experienced UI developer with passion?

We share a bold vision of being the most preferred business software and solution partner for SMEs. We take pride in being the developers behind one of the largest B2B SaaS solutions in the Nordics‚ÄîProcountor.

We are looking for a forward-thinking UI developer who will shape the future of Procountor as part of a scrum team and together with a collaborative network of professionals. You will develop new features and bring your insights to life by influencing how those features should work and look. In short, you will play a key role in building market-leading financial software.

We run Procountor in both Azure and in private cloud. We have our own public API, which you can explore here: https://dev.procountor.com/.

We value agile processes, proper release processes, and test automation. We aim for continuous improvement in everything we do, and we enjoy experimenting with new tools‚Äîlike AI‚Äîthat can make our work more efficient. If you can do something easier, faster, or more efficiently, why not just go for it.

But our true superpower lies in our people. The Procountor software development team is at the heart of our journey, and with your expertise, you‚Äôll help us modernize Procountor‚Äôs technologies and pave the way for its future.

Most of our multinational Product organization is located at our headquarters in Espoo and our team meets regularly at our Espoo office. We also have locations in Turku, Tampere, Oulu, Jyv√§skyl√§, and Stockholm, and we work with a flexible hybrid model.




Technologies we currently use

 * front-end - React, TypeScript, interacting with our REST API
 * backend - Java 17, Spring Boot, MySQL, JOOQ, Vaadin
 * API - Java 17, Spring Boot, MySQL, JOOQ
 * Jenkins, Junit, JBehave, Cucumber, Playwright, JMockit, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Azure, Copilot

You don't need to master them all, but naturally we hope you have experience from most of these or similar technologies. We hope you share our passion of learning something new every day.




With these skills you are one step ahead

We‚Äôre looking for a UI Developer, who enjoys crafting elegant and responsive user interfaces for business-critical applications. You take pride in collaboration and sharing knowledge with peers‚Äîall the while keeping customer value at the forefront of everything you do.

You are proficient in TypeScript and write beautiful code that is easy to read, well-documented, well-tested, and easy to maintain. Continuous development is very important to you, and you enjoy picking up new technical skills, improving existing ones and always are up for trying out new tools and technologies.

Over the years you have worked on multiple business-critical applications in cross-functional product teams, where your past and present colleagues recognize you as a wonderful collaborator.

You contribute by providing constructive feedback during code reviews, and do not shy away from questioning decisions made by others. You also take the time to step back and reflect and recognize on your and your team‚Äôs achievements.




Key responsibilities:

 * Building intuitive, user-centered applications that deliver real value to our customers.
 * Excellent communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * A collaborative mindset to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and backend engineers, all working towards delivering the best experience for our users.




Key skills and attributes:

 * Proficiency with React, TypeScript, and REST APIs, and have worked on multiple business-critical applications
 * Experience with test frameworks
 * Experience with continuous deployment pipelines
 * Nice to have: Experience with design systems and Storybook
 * Bonus: Java coding skills that will set you apart.




So why should you choose to work with us? Well, let us tell you!

 * Our people are the best in the business. We have a truly international team of professionals who are passionate about what they do. We are proud to have around 15 nationalities under our roof and to have achieved a gender division of 50-50 in our workforce, a rare feat in the tech industry. With a team of almost 400 spread across Finland and a tight-knit group of 15 in Stockholm, we are an industry forerunner in Finland and hopefully soon is Sweden too!
 * We offer fantastic opportunities for professional growth and development. With our in-house trainings and a yearly personal budget for professional development, we want to make sure that you can develop yourself as an expert in your field. Our company offers great career paths within our different products, projects, and countries.
 * We have a comprehensive set of benefits that are designed to support your well-being and help you grow both personally and professionally. From a competitive bonus program (paid twice a year) to modern devices, we've got you covered. And with extensive occupational health services and a range of recreational benefits, we're committed to helping you maintain a healthy work-life balance.




Please note that we are actively following the process and might proceed with interviews also during the application period. If you want to know more about the position or Accountor Software, Tiina Lahdentausta (hiring manager) will gladly tell you more. You can email her directly to tiina.lahdentausta@finago.com. If you have any recruitment-related questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at talent.fms@finago.com However, please note that we are unable to accept applications via email and ask you to kindly submit your CV via our recruitment portal.

Apply between 3 October 2024 and 17 October 2024 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)




Accountor FMS (Financial Management Software)

Accountor Software is a leading cloud-based financial management and HR SaaS software company supported by its tech-enabled services business. Our mission is to help our customers use the possibilities of modern technology and digitalization in their everyday work. For more information on our product portfolio, please visit our websites: Procountor, Ecom, Isolta, Apix, eTasku.

description:
Job Description

About The Role

Exciting opportunity for an experienced Software Developer to join our Cloud Team in Espoo, Finland. You will be working in a combination of energy domain expertise and AWS cloud development competences within our team to develop and maintain our solution.

Hansen Technologies is implementing a cloud native, microservice-based Energy Data Management solution for the energy industry. Our solution plays a vital role in ensuring that energy meter data is precise and up to date so that accurate readings are reported to our customers. We are a critical link in making sure that grid operators and energy companies have the necessary information to manage energy infrastructure in Finland. It‚Äôs an exciting time to join our team as we push the envelope in Meter Data Management solutions for the energy industry!

About You

You are a highly enthusiastic individual with proven experience working with AWS for at least 2 years as well as:


 * Proficient in Python and C#
 * Experience in scripting/programming and automation.
 * Experience in cloud Ops, Monitoring and Logging
 * Is comfortable in a hybrid working environment of Microsoft and Linux
 * Good verbal and written communication skills in the English language
 * A team player; experience in working inside an Agile team with a DevOps focus
   
   

Additionally, We Highly Appreciate If You Have


 * AWS Certified Developer Associate level or minimum similar knowledge within cloud
 * Experience with Serverless architectures, EaC and IaC.
 * Experience with Docker or other container services.
 * Experience in brownfield and greenfield application development.
   
   

Key Responsibilities


 * Participate in service and software development activities, from design to development including reviews whenever needed.
 * Provide estimates on progress and technical quality for stakeholders and team members.
 * Be open-minded for new methods and tools to improve our way of working.
 * Set up environments programmatically (like AWS cloudformation).
 * Share cloud knowledge and support less experienced cloud engineers.
   
   

Benefits and Perks

Join us for a rewarding career with competitive compensation, leave entitlements, health coverage, and financial security. Enjoy work-life balance, growth, and recognition for your exceptional performance. Our team will unveil the intricacies of our benefit package during the selection process.

[The benefits and perks are subject to regional variation.]

Company Overview

Hansen Technologies (ASX: HSN) is a global software and services provider, serving energy, water/utilities, and telecommunications industries. With customers in 80+ countries, we foster collaboration across 36 global offices. From 5G advancements to renewable energy transitions, we empower customers to overcome challenges, innovate, and drive new business models.

Contact Us

If you possess the desired skills and enthusiasm, please ‚ÄúApply Now‚Äù via the link or visit our career page.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Visit our website at hansencx.com for more information.
