title: Lead/Expert Java Developer, Nordea Payments

description:
We are looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to join our Community Tech Team in Helsinki. The Community team strives to engage and excite players across the globe through multiple platforms in the digital and physical world.

Our team acts as the bridge between the millions of players that play our game and the teams at Supercell who create the magic. Your colleagues are the faces of the games and the ones who advocate for the players within the game teams. We are here to build games and products that our players will love for years and years. To name a few products that you will be contributing to, our Creator Program, Inbox (Web based in-game news), SpellFactory (Deep link service that rewards in-game items) and many others.

We‚Äôre now looking for someone to join the team and take our projects to the next level. You will work closely with our game teams, our community managers as well as external consultants and leading digital agencies together with whom we build these services.

Responsibilities


 * Prior experience as Tech Lead or directly related experience ‚Äì familiarity with digital product development is essential
 * Design the technical architecture how these services should be written by both in-house developers and external agencies
 * Hands-on approach with programming and software development
 * Ensure high quality delivery of said web services
 * Continuously evaluate the performance and quality of our partners and provide helpful feedback across the scope: design, architecture, security, backend- and frontend code quality - all the way to the UX
 * Contribute to best practices on security, reliability and scaling digital services
 * Work in collaboration with the our game teams, the Supercell ID team, our Store team and external digital agencies to deliver seamless player experiences
 * We‚Äôre a small and nimble team so you will also have the chance to contribute to design and operation of these services
   
   
   

Requirements


 * Wide understanding of web technologies: JavaScript, HTML/CSS, PHP, Java and SQL, as well as a proven excellence with JavaScript frameworks, especially React.js and Next.js
 * Fluent in CSS and accustomed to design systems which work both well on mobile and desktop platforms
 * Previous experience on writing Node.js backend for web applications
 * Experience with Linux shell and scripting languages
 * Entrepreneurial mindset (self-motivated, tenacious, resourceful, no handbook necessary)
 * An open and respectful attitude towards others and their work
 * Fluent verbal & written English skills
 * Experience with cloud computing (e.g. AWS) and Terraform
 * Located in or willing to relocate to Helsinki
 * An open and respectful attitude towards others and their work
 * Eagerness to integrate our products into the games
 * Passion for games and online communities around games
   
   
   

Nice-to-have Experience


 * Docker and Terraform
 * Java-based service development
 * Mobile app development
 * Experience with C++ and game development
 * Prior experience in the field of games is a plus but not required as long as you are passionate about games
   
   
   

Benefits And Compensation

However, luring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.

We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.

About Supercell

We are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released six games globally ‚Äì Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale, Brawl Stars, and Squad Busters.

To make six games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality. Our mission is to create great games that as many people as possible play for years and that are remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we put together the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence to succeed.

You Might Love It Here...

If you love games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams that have the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games, and the company.

We know it takes more than trust and independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed and have fun while at it.

This position is in Helsinki, but you're not?

Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to ensure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you bring along. In addition to cats and dogs, we've even relocated a horse.

Not sure if you should apply?

Do it! You might feel like you don't tick all the listed requirements with stellar scores. That's fine! We're here to help you succeed. Also, we're happy to learn about any specific accommodations you might require to fully engage in our recruitment process.

And here's a video about what we do. (Best enjoyed with salmiakki and rye bread)
title: Full-Stack Developer, Creator Platform

description:
Reaktor's award-winning tech community is looking for full-stack developers to join us in Helsinki.

If you are in your element with a full software development cycle, have a passion for solving human problems with a holistic approach, and are curious to experience working in a low-hierarchy environment, you might just be what we're looking for.

As a Full Stack developer at Reaktor, your job is to be an expert in a range of software development responsibilities spanning the entire software development lifecycle, from front-end to production.

Your Daily Tasks Include


 * Working together with the client‚Äôs tech and business teams and helping them to pick the right technologies suitable for their needs.
 * Implementing new features that require changes to frontend applications, backend servers, and/or databases, even on infrastructure.
 * Delivering the client and the team with a world-class technical expertise.
 * Other software development-related tasks, such as debugging, designing, and participating in creating the architecture.
   
   

You are a curious-minded developer who is comfortable working on both the back-end and front-end of an app and understands the role of infrastructure in everyday tasks.

To Thrive In This Position, You‚Äôll Need


 * Experience in a broad range of software development modalities (backend, frontend, ops, and consulting skills).
 * We don‚Äôt have a hard limit with years of experience, but we‚Äôve noticed that these competencies usually take several years to accumulate.
 * Previous experience with at least one common server-side programming language. Currently, many of our projects are built with TypeScript/JavaScript and Node.js. But, Java/Scala/Kotlin, Clojure, and Python are also used.
 * Strong knowledge of at least one common client-side language and framework. We often use TypeScript/JavaScript and React on our web app projects and Swift, Java/Scala/Kotlin, or TypeScript/JavaScript React-native on mobile.
 * Relevant skills to create new backend services and build CI/CD pipelines when the project requires.
 * Foundational knowledge in DevOps, including Continuous Integration (CI), automated deployment, and test automation
 * Know-how on databases (e.g., PostgreSQL).
 * To be comfortable engaging with the client stakeholders when needed.
 * Fluent verbal & written English skills.
   
   

Why join us?

For two decades, we‚Äôve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change ‚Äì building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people.

While Working At Reaktor, We‚Äôll Provide You With


 * To be able to impact how you work. Together with the client, your team chooses the approach, technologies, and methodologies you think will work best in any given situation.
 * A community with as much support as your heart desires.
 * A team that‚Äôs not only experienced but considerate as well ‚Äì they all want you to succeed.
 * A sustainable work-life balance and support for your daily life outside of work. (e.g., free moving day, Reaktor car share, sick child care services, office space to use for your private events, etc.).
 * An opportunity to grow as a professional. In addition to the day-to-day work, we offer internal training courses, community events, and 15-minute coffee breaks to discuss hot topics in tech and design.
 * A possibility to take part in more extended academy-like studies like Cloud Academy.
 * 300+ hobby clubs, from winter swimming and running to knitting and archery, that bring people together outside of (and sometimes inside) office hours. Many of these are supported by Reaktor.
 * Check more about our benefits & perks on www.reaktor.com/careers
   
   

Diversity, equity, and inclusion

Together, we are committed to making Reaktor an environment that embraces and values all of our employees for the whole of who they are. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply, knowing that studies show that members of underrepresented communities don‚Äôt apply for jobs unless they fully satisfy all of the requirements. If you're thinking twice about applying for this reason, we invite you to send us your application anyway. You could be just the person we're looking for.

Read more about our DEI work on our website: www.reaktor.com/dei.

Interested? Drop us a line ‚Äì We'll be happy to hear from you!
title: Full Stack Developer

description:
About Limber

At Limber, we‚Äôre crafting a SaaS platform that empowers engineering companies to manage the full life cycle of their commercial projects. Our mission? To be the ultimate go-to solution for engineering firms looking to master project execution from start to finish.

Since our founding in 2017, with backing from Startuplab, we‚Äôve grown into a thriving, self-sustaining company. Our team is spread across Norway and Finland, and we‚Äôre all driven by a shared passion for innovation. We‚Äôre still in the early stages, which means there‚Äôs plenty of room for you to make your mark and help shape our journey.




Who we are looking for

We‚Äôre on the lookout for the seventh member of our team ‚Äî an engineer who‚Äôs not just looking for a job but is eager to dive in and make a real difference. You should be self-motivated and capable of driving your work forward without needing constant oversight or direction. If you‚Äôre excited about pushing the boundaries of what our platform can do and bringing fresh ideas to a talented team, we want you with us.




What you will be doing

You‚Äôll play a crucial role in developing new features and maintaining existing ones. This includes building innovative services and applications, as well as optimising our build and deployment processes. Your contributions will be key to taking our platform to the next level.




Must haves

 * Minimum of 4 years of professional software development
 * Passionate about building maintainable and scalable systems
 * Strong proficiency in TypeScript and Python
 * Regular on-site presence in our central Helsinki office (‚â• 1 day per week)
 * Experience with designing and maintaining backend APIs




Nice to haves

 * Experience with Node.js, tRPC, GraphQL, Websockets, REST-based APIs, gRPC, Kubernetes, Github, Google Cloud Platform, Azure
 * Experience with CI/CD pipelines and GitOps
 * Experience with web security testing practices, such as the OWASP Web Security Testing Guide
 * Fluency in Swedish or Norwegian, both written and spoken




Benefits

 * We offer both remote work and an personal office seat in central Helsinki
 * Flexible hours
 * Two meeting-free days per week guaranteed
 * Company off-sites at least 2-4 times a year




Hiring process

 * Application Your potential future colleagues will review your application
 * Coding task We will send you a small coding task to validate your skill level
 * Culture interview 30-min video call Our goal is to explore your motivations to join our team, learn why you‚Äôd be a great fit, and answer questions about us
 * Technical interview 45 minutes You'll meet your potential future colleagues who will evaluate skills needed to be successful in your role. No live coding
 * Limber for a day (paid day at Limber) You‚Äôll join the company for a day, meet the team, and work on a task related to your role, offering a realistic view of what it‚Äôs like working at Limber
 * Offer If everyone‚Äôs happy, we‚Äôll make you an offer to join us ‚Äì YAY!




If you have any additional questions you can contact us at hiring@limber.no.
title: Senior Backend Engineer

description:
We are looking for a senior machine learning engineer to join the team in Helsinki!

We are a team of 50+ based in Helsinki who have created a SaaS platform to help businesses have more success with their product launches based on data & insights

You will be based in-house working with our team and part of the wider data & engineering environment, reporting into the Lead Data Scientist

We Hope That You Can


 * Bring strong expertise and know-how in Data Science and Machine Learning (ML) Engineering.
 * Be the primary go-to person for data Analysis and ML topics.
 * Reinforce the company's technical project management capabilities by effectively coordinating project development across the Data Science stack.
 * Contribute fresh ideas to the team for building and maintaining ML models at scale.
   
   

Your Task


 * After 2-3 weeks, you will add value as an Individual Contributor on data analysis, model development and machine learning productization.
 * After 4 months, you will demonstrate a thorough understanding of the company's business domain and application-specific features.
 * After 6 months, you will effectively drive a project and be in charge of communication with the Product team.
   
   

What are we looking for in you?


 * We hope that you can bring a strong academic background along with 5+ years of experience in building ML models
 * We would like you to have worked with multiple data sources and operating ML models at scale
 * It is beneficial if you have worked with sales predictions using different types of data or marketing mix modelling
 * We also valuable personal skills and hope you will be a great team player with excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical colleagues
   
   

Technologies you are expected to master: Python, SQL, AWS

To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Be


 * Results-driven, by always looking for solutions, not excuses. Willing to go the extra mile when needed.
 * Quality-driven: committed to building robust, maintainable, and high-performance code.
 * A holistic thinker who looks at the bigger picture, striving to include both what the company customers and the business need.
 * Highly ambitious, with a proactive approach to your own professional growth.
 * Flexible and effective in a hybrid working environment.
   
   

What's in it for you?


 * Opportunities for professional growth in a fast-growing, evolving company
 * Office with a view in downtown Helsinki
 * Hybrid working policy with most colleagues doing 2-3 days per week in office, and flexitime available
 * Occupational Pensions
 * Lunch benefits
 * Equity
   
   

For any questions, contact Lucy on l.whiting@tenthrevolution.com
title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Helsinki

description:
Lead Software Engineer - Software Consultancy




Are you a Lead full-stack developer looking to join an award-winning tech consultancy?




The company:




Join the Amsterdam team at a global technology consultancy, committed to developing best-in-class digital products and services for its clients, whilst providing its team with the autonomy to develop as individuals.




With a focus on creating, optimising, and delivering innovative digital products, this leading consultancy boasts an impressive 700 designers, developers and strategists across Europe, North America, and Asia.




The opportunity:




If you‚Äôre looking to work for a low-hierarchy, high-performing company as a software developer, then this could be the perfect fit for you.




This role provides the opportunity to utilise your passion for problem-solving and combine it with your understanding of the full software development cycle ‚Äì taking a holistic approach to building web or mobile apps for clients, who may include adidas, HBO or Supercell.




You‚Äôll be a Technical Leader with a naturally inquisitive mindset, guiding our clients and having the autonomy to make technical decisions. You‚Äôll have the chance to work on diverse software development projects, including both the frontend and backend of apps.




Key responsibilities:




 * Providing consultancy services to your client, as the primary point of contact, for the development of their software project.
 * Ensuring collaboration between your team and the client‚Äôs business and tech teams.
 * Empowering your team to take a proactive approach to implementing updates on software ‚Äì whether that‚Äôs changes to backend servers, databases, or the frontend applications.
 * Fostering the relationship with the client, to ensure a successful working partnership and future opportunities.




Key requirements:




 * Experience across frontend, backend and ops, including an understanding of agile project management principles.
 * Previous experience with 1+ server-side programming language. (This may include TypeScript, JavaScript, Node.js, amongst others).
 * An understanding of 1+ client-side language and framework. (This may include, but is not limited to, TypeScript, JavaScript, or React for web app projects and Swift, Java/Scala/Kotlin, or TypeScript/JavaScript React-native on mobile apps).
 * Experience engaging and communication with client stakeholders, to progress complex projects.
 * Experience in leadership and consulting positions.
 * Knowledge of databases and creating new backend services.




Why should you apply?




If successful in your application, you‚Äôll receive a whole host of benefits from a company committed to caring for its employees. Some of these include:




 * A top-spec computer, phone, and other office essentials.
 * Unlimited phone plan and home-internet connection.
 * Enhanced parental leave and childcare support
 * Comprehensive healthcare benefits, including physical and mental health support
 * A commitment from its employer to a sustainable work-life balance, to help you grow and thrive




In addition, a successful applicant will have access to a variety of professional growth opportunities in this role, with the option for internal training, as well as agency over how you work and what technologies are used in an environment where autonomy is valued highly.




Sound like this could be for you? Apply now via LinkedIn.
title: Lead Software Engineer

description:
About The Job

we are looking for an experienced Solution Engineer for our new Business Unit in Quality Assurance Software.

Axivion is the technology leader for next-generation static code analysis. In addition to classic analyses such as MISRA, AUTOSAR C++14, or metrics, Axivion Suite exclusively allows you to check the compliance of your software architecture. With additional checks for clones, cycles or unreachable code, you will always be able to prevent software erosion in your development projects.

Squish (by Froglogic) supports agile-oriented teams. You can schedule routine or custom-triggered test executions, and identify regressions before builds get to QA. Quality Assurance Resources | QA (qt.io)

As a Solution Engineer, you will be responsible for pre-sales technical assistance for the regional sales teams and will perform technical presentations & demonstrations of Qt Quality Assurance products, in addition to being involved in all aspects of the technical sales.

You will connect with Director and VP-level of Engineering professionals and demonstrate the value of Static Code and Software Architecture Analysis tools and other Qt Quality Assurance products such as test automation. You will help customers solve their development issues and deliver business outcomes with a consultative sales approach.

You will


 * Be directly responsible for teaming with the sales team through all aspects of the sales cycle.
 * Understand technical customer requirements and find solutions together with Product Management / R&D.
 * Provide strategic and senior-level product presentations, demonstrations, and trade show support.
 * Follow up on prospects and accounts for functional/technical issues related to the sales cycle and guarantee a successful customer experience.
 * Manage product evaluations and prepare RFP/RFI responses.
 * Coordinate the technical training of the sales teams.
 * Identify the need for additional sales, training, and consulting.
   
   

About You


 * 5+ years of professional experience.
 * Technical knowledge and understanding of the software quality assurance processes.
 * Experience in the testing of safety-critical software projects (ex. Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Medical, ‚Ä¶) and are familiar with the underlying methods, processes, and standards (e.g. ISO26262, IEC62304, ...)
 * Experience in development or quality assurance of embedded applications (C/C++).
 * Experience in a scripting language, ex: Python.
 * Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD workflows.
 * Knowledge of build tools, ex: CMake, Make, Bazel, BitBake, etc
 * Excellent presentation, demonstration, and facilitation skills in leading meetings, trials, and projects.
 * Experience with the creation, customization, and delivery of presentations
 * Fluent verbal and written communication in English
 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science/ technology or equivalent related experience.
   
   

Beneficial Skills


 * Autonomous and organized with effective communication skills, listening, verbal and written.
 * Must take initiative and be a proactive member of the sales team.
 * Capable of leading deep-dive technical discussions.
 * Team player with interpersonal skills to work with sales and technical staff in a dynamic and innovative company environment.
 * Very good business understanding.
 * Willing and able to travel 20% within EMEA
   
   

The role is based in one of our offices in Europe: Berlin, Munich, Paris, Oslo, Espo.

What We Offer

In Germany


 * Public transportation ticket (Deutschland ticket)
 * 30 vacation days per year
 * Flexible hours that focus on work/life balance
 * Possibility to work up to 3 days/week from home
 * Mobile phone and subscription
 * Language learning platform (Babbel)
 * Full support for your mental health at work and home via Auntie Program
 * A friendly, diverse, and sociable workplace
 * Great colleagues from all over the world
   
   

In France


 * 25 vacation days per year + RTT for work-life balance, plus additional paid time off for important life events
 * Health insurance provided by SwissLife (FR)
 * 100% reimbursement of your Navigo Pass, mobile bill, and your internet at home
 * Swile meal voucher
 * Flexible hours that focus on work/life balance
 * Possibility to work up to 3 days/week from home
 * Mobile phone and subscription
 * Language learning platform (Babbel)
 * Full support for your mental health at work and home via Auntie Program
 * A friendly, diverse, and sociable workplace
 * Great colleagues from all over the world
   
   

In Norway


 * Group life insurance, health insurance, and a pension scheme
 * Nice office space, easily reachable by public transport
 * 25 vacation days per year
 * Internet reimbursement is max 500 NOK per month
 * Mobile phone and subscription
 * Dental discount in Oslo
 * Flexible hours that focus on work/life balance
 * Possibility to work up to 3 days/week from home
 * Language learning platform (Babbel)
 * Full support for your mental health at work and home via Auntie Program
 * A friendly, diverse, and sociable workplace
 * Great colleagues from all over the world
   
   

In Finland


 * Be part of a dynamic, international Finnish growth company with talented and skilled professionals from all around the world
 * Wide scope of tasks and responsibilities; chance to learn and develop professionally every day
 * Work-life balance matters: option for a hybrid work-from-home policy and flexible hours
 * Comprehensive occupational health care plan, with health insurance, dental care, and support for mental wellbeing
 * Benefit from other perks such as lunch benefit, yearly wellbeing budget, bike & commuting benefit...
 * Nice office space in Espoo Keilaniemi, free beverages and fruits, ergonomic equipment, and supportive tools
   
   

Be yourself at Qt

At Qt, we appreciate the individual differences of our employees and aim to promote diversity through all our practices. We provide a workplace that generates equal opportunities regardless of gender, religion, national origin, age, disabilities, and any other factors. We have unique products, but our people make us exceptional. We strongly encourage people from all groups to apply ‚Äì we welcome you as you are.

We would like to know more about you. Tell us about your skills, strengths, and knowledge, but even more importantly about yourself.

About Qt

Qt Group (Nasdaq Helsinki:‚ÄØQTCOM) is a global software company, trusted by industry leaders and over 1.5 million developers worldwide to create applications and smart devices that users love.‚ÄØWe help our customers to increase productivity through the entire product development lifecycle - from UI design and software development to quality management and deployment.

Our customers are in more than 70 different industries in over 180 countries. Qt Group is headquartered in Espoo, Finland, and employs almost 700 people globally. To learn more, visit www.qt.io

description:
Senior Cloud Engineer

Helsinki - 3 days per week, 2 days remote

Up to ‚Ç¨6000 per month + company bonus




Our client, a global leading medical technology company is not just building technology ‚Äì they are creating solutions that positively impact lives. They are looking for a Senior Cloud Engineer to design and develop cutting-edge cloud-native solutions. A solid understanding of cloud applications and modern software development is key for this role.




Responsibilities

 * Develop reliable, scalable cloud applications for cloud-native solutions.
 * Contribute to design decisions and discussions with cross-functional teams.
 * Implement software applications, including design, testing, and documentation.
 * Translate user requirements into detailed software specifications.
 * Maintain high standards for software quality
 * Get involved in initiatives to improve engineering practices, tools, and infrastructure.




What You Bring

 * Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and cloud technologies like Kubernetes.
 * C# experience with RESTful service development
 * Strong cloud experience using Azure, GCP
 * Understanding of agile/scrum methodologies.
 * Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.




Why Join Our Client?




Our client offers you the opportunity to improve healthcare outcomes globally.




 * Attractive holiday
 * Attractive pension scheme
 * Contribution to wellness activities
 * Comprehensive occupational healthcare insurance
 * Mobile phone benefit
 * Hybrid work




If you are looking to make a meaningful impact in the medical technology space, this is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking team!




Please APPLY NOW with your updated CV.
title: Senior Cloud Engineer

description:
We are now looking for an Embedded Software Developer for our client project. We design software for both physical devices and the cloud environment, and we solve problems from the product design stage, throughout development, to the end of the product lifecycle. You can work on projects involving intelligent machines, energy, production, telecom, or health and wellbeing technologies. Our client base consists of organisations such as AGCO, The BMW Group and Bosch.




We expect

 * We hope you master either the secrets of essential embedded technologies (C / C++ programming, hardware interfaces, and Real-Time Operating Systems) or Qt / QML development or embedded Linux customization
 * You have experience in either software architecture design, programming, or testing of embedded systems
 * It is a big plus if you are familiar with unit and integration testing
 * You master agile software development methods
 * You are an open and positive person with a strong desire to learn something new
 * Helping customers to solve technical problems through a friendly approach and good interaction skills
 * You communicate fluently in English
 * We want to find you a role that supports your talents and interests




We offer

As an employer and a community, we promise to take care of you, because happy and healthy employees are the heart of our company. Our reputation for producing excellent services for our customers is entirely thanks to our team of top professionals. Our low hierarchy allows for a self-directed and transparent company culture. Our diverse team of professionals share a pioneering spirit and a desire to work for a company whose purpose goes beyond making a profit ‚Äì we strive to create a more humane, sustainable and ethical digital world.




With us, you get to develop your skills and gain experience in diverse customer projects. You also get to choose how you wish to develop your expertise. We offer, for example, support for self-study in addition to other training and events. At Gofore, you can create a meaningful role and career path for yourself.




The community spirit of Goforeans also extends outside the workplace: you can join your colleagues in various leisure activities, such as video game sessions and events for families ‚Äì or a traditional Finnish sauna evening! We want to support you in finding a work-life balance that works for you, so we offer you flexible working conditions as well as tools and equipment according to your needs. We offer our employees a diverse package of benefits, including:




 * Certification bonuses, training opportunities (Udemy business)
 * Lunch, exercise and commuter benefits
 * Sick child care benefit, you can also request paid leave when a family member gets sick
 * Comprehensive occupational healthcare
 * Massage and dentist benefits
 * Share savings plan offered to all Goforeans




Salary development

For us it is important that Goforeans receive reasonable total compensation for their work. The compensation is the outcome of, not only experience and skills but also active work for our two values: being a good workplace for everyone and considering customer perspective in everything we do. The feedback that you receive, your utilisation rate (we are consultants, after all!) and your own professional development are central in the salary discussions with your People Leader (i.e. supervisor). We have different salary models, and in addition to the monthly salary, we have separate bonuses linked with the company‚Äôs success. Bonuses can be related to, for example, recruitment, sales or actions advancing Gofore‚Äôs employer brand.
title: Embedded software developer for intelligent industry projects

description:
A growing consultancy based in Helsinki is seeking a Senior Embedded Software Engineer to join their client's team.




This is an exciting opportunity to work in an international team, where you can focus fully on your technical expertise while the consultancy takes care of all background operations.




In this role, you will become a key member of a team focused on developing transmitter solutions for monitoring e.g. indoor temperature, pressure, and moisture levels. You will have the opportunity to enhance functionalities such as energy efficiency and safety. The product is already operational, and you will contribute to its ongoing development.




You will work hands-on with technologies including Python (including UI) and C (or C#/C++), as well as with embedded systems in general. A key focus of this position is UI development, utilizing technologies like Qt or similar frameworks.




We are looking for candidates with substantial experience in these technologies. Familiarity with additional programming languages such as Java, Rust, and Go is advantageous but not required. As our team operates in English, strong proficiency in the English language is essential.

Location: Helsinki

Hybrid Working: minimum 3 days in the office in Helsinki




What‚Äôs in it for you?

With a wide array of clients and personalized career plans, it‚Äôs an excellent place for professionals aiming to advance their careers. You‚Äôll have the chance to work on diverse, impactful projects across various industries, with a competitive salary to match.




If you‚Äôre ready to explore this opportunity, contact Katriina Haataja or simply click ‚ÄúEasy Apply‚Äù to hear more about the role!




katriina.haataja@cathcarttechnology.com

description:
IQM is the European leader in superconducting quantum computers, established in Espoo, Finland. Since 2019, we have grown to 270+ employees and have established subsidiaries in Germany, Spain, France, the US and Singapore. We build quantum computers for research laboratories and supercomputing centers. For industrial customers, we deliver quantum advantage through our unique application-specific co-design approach.

We build world-leading quantum computers for the well-being of humankind now and for the future.

(www.meetiqm.com)

We are growing our software engineering team and looking for Senior Software Engineers to join us either in Espoo, Finland, or Munich, Germany.

We are developing and maintaining a software stack that enables the practical use of quantum computing to solve complex computational problems for our customers. Our current tech stack includes Python, Docker, GitLab, and Linux.

You will bring solid professional software development experience, having been a part of teams creating and maintaining released software products. Strong teamwork and collaboration skills are highly valued.

In particular, we are looking for at least one new team member with expertise in designing and developing the software's persistence layer. We currently utilize PostgreSQL for this purpose.

What will I be doing?


 * Write high-quality, high-performance code that is a joy to maintain.
 * Design features, plan releases, and shape the architecture of our software stack, while participating in refining technical requirements.
 * Develop automated testing, perform code reviews, test software, and create documentation.
 * Contribute to the release process of our software products.
 * Collaborate closely with team members from diverse backgrounds in software engineering and quantum physics to enhance our software stack.
   
   

What skills do I need?


 * At least 5 years of relevant experience in software development.
 * Experience in developing and maintaining software products.
 * Proficiency in multiple programming languages and tech stacks, with a passion for continuous learning.
 * Fluency in spoken and written English.
   
   

We Value Candidates Who Have


 * MSc or BSc in Computer Science, Physics, or equivalent.
 * Experience in API design, implementation, and maintenance.
 * Experience in planning, developing, and testing timing performance-critical software products.
 * Experience in database design, development, and maintenance (PostgreSQL experience is a plus).
   
   

What can I expect from IQM?


 * A chance to be part of a world-class R&D team.
 * Opportunities to learn and contribute to the cutting-edge field of quantum computing.
 * Access to quantum computers for testing and prototyping as part of your role.
 * A creative, diverse, and open start-up environment that supports growth and professional development.
   
   

Meet our people and hear more about IQM by visiting our Youtube channel here and explore our scientific publications here.

We'll proceed with the interviews immediately, so please submit your application soon.
title: Senior Software Developer

description:
The company

Doublepoint creates gesture recognition software for smartwatches. Our technologies are being used to control AR/VR, IoT, wearables, automotive, AI assistants, TVs, and much more. Our smartwatch algorithms detect subtle hand gestures and need to be accurate, responsive, low power, and generalizable across populations. We're a small team of 15 people based mostly in Helsinki, with 6m euro in funding from VCs and angels, and our technology is being used by over 65k people today.

The team and the role

At Doublepoint, we need to collect a significant amount of high-quality data in order to train world-class gesture detection models.

At the core of this is our Data Infrastructure team, which builds tools to allow the User Research team to collect a lot of targeted data easily, as well as tooling to enable the Machine Learning team to access this data seamlessly for training models.

To support this work, we're looking for a dynamic full-stack engineer to join our Data Infrastructure team to help us develop and maintain modern data infra, as well as build tooling for people across the company to access our data and derive valuable insights from it.

While we are the owners of our main data stores and the pipelines going in and out of them, our responsibilities extend beyond that, and include full-stack projects that involve building UIs for collecting data and interfacing with our hardware (Doublepoint Kit), managing and tracking data collection, visualizing model performance, creating automations, as well as enabling anyone in the company to access and run aggregations on raw data to inform decisions.

This means we're looking for someone dynamic, who's able and willing to jump into different projects and enjoys doing so. There is also the possibility to specialize within the team and become an owner of larger pieces of our infrastructure, but at the same time we'd like you to be able to contribute to different areas.

Requirements


 * Experience as a full-stack engineer shipping things to production with relevant technologies
 * We mostly use Python (Flask) and TypeScript (React) and would prefer direct experience with these but experience with other equivalent stacks is also valid
 * Having worked with relational databases at a reasonable scale in production
 * Having solid knowledge of SQL
 * Experience with setting up and managing services using established cloud providers (e.g. AWS)
 * Great communication. Our team operates async and it's important that we communicate effectively - particularly in written form - and document things. Most of our work happens in the Helsinki office, but not all!
   
   

Nice to have


 * Having managed a relational database like Postgres in production
 * Experience setting up automations using CI/CD tools
 * Experience managing and overseeing high-availability production servers and clusters
 * Our services stack includes Grafana, Sentry, Metabase, Cloudfare, PostHog, GitLab, AWS, and Fly.io. Extensive experience with any of these is a bonus.
   
   

Hiring process


 * Culture interview with CEO Ohto (30min)
 * Technical interview with team lead Yakko (60min)
 * Take-home challenge
 * Offer
 * Meet the team and get started

description:

description:
WithSecure‚Ñ¢ protects businesses all over the world from modern threats. We do this through a Co-security approach born from first-hand knowledge that no one can solve every cyber security problem alone. Every single day, our diverse, growing team fights against online extortion, threats to national infrastructure, the unlawful spread of sensitive information, and everything in-between. The best part about working for WithSecure is our people! We are a community of dedicated and passionate professionals that take workplace happiness seriously. If you‚Äôre looking for something that‚Äôs more than just a job ‚Äì we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Are you interested in learning what it takes to build highly scalable production grade distributed systems and want to work with the most modern cloud technologies, then this role is for you! We, in Detection and Response R&D unit, are looking for a Backend Developer to join our new and exciting cloud project. The technologies we build provide industry leading capabilities to detect and respond to advanced cyber attacks.

Key Responsibilities


 * Designing, developing, maintaining and operating backend systems
 * Understanding the business requirements and finding elegant solutions to fulfil them
 * Stay up to date with public cloud technologies and understand how to apply those
 * Building observability into the systems so that they are easy to operate
 * Building CICD pipelines to deploy your code all the way to production
 * Take ownership of the systems you develop and resolve any issues should they rise
   
   

What Are We Looking For


 * Knowledgeable with Python/JavaScript/TypeScript
 * Hands-on working experience using public cloud services and deployment automation. We use mostly AWS but Azure and GCP experience are strong plus!
 * Good communication, team work skills and positive attitude.
 * Security mindset
 * Understanding of modern software development practices that ensure safe, reliable and continuous deployments using cloud native tools
 * Fluent written and spoken English
   
   

About The Team

We are a high performing team working on world class systems. We have people from multiple cultures and backgrounds, spread across multiple sites and we use remote-first approach when collaborating within the team. However, this is not a remote-only position.

We work in close co-operation with other teams at WithSecure such as Threat Hunters who provide the Managed Detection and Response service to our clients and with teams who are specialised in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to name a few.

What Can You Expect From The Job


 * Well established remote working culture, suited for the current global pandemic situation
 * Real meaning for your work, make an impact and help to protect organisations and individuals from cyber threats
 * Work in the domain that is the fastest growing market in cyber security (XDR)
 * Use of the most modern cloud based technologies
 * Work with highly scalable systems that process billions of events per day as well as Serverless REST & GraphQL APIs
 * Emphasis on deployment automation and immutable infrastructure
 * Something new to learn, even after months and years!
   
   

The applications will be considered on a rolling basis, so don't hesitate to apply!

A security background check will be conducted for the selected candidate, in accordance with the Finnish Security Clearance act 726/2014.

description:
About us

At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients‚Äîincluding some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers‚Äîto enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.




Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year‚Äôs Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. We recently launched Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.




Join RavenPack:

RavenPack is searching for a Quantitative Researcher / Data Scientist to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters. The role is based in Marbella. We offer a relocation package, competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.

As a Quant Researcher, you will be participating in the development of new agentic workflows utilizing our semantic search engine, showcasing the value of our RavenPack data for excavating insights.

The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must.

European legal working status is required.

We offer competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.




Your Responsibilities:

As a Quant Researcher, you will join the ‚ÄúQuantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) Team,‚Äù consisting of four quant researchers dedicated to feature engineering and developing systematic trading strategies. Your work will primarily involve data-driven research. You will create research workflows to enhance RavenPack‚Äôs reputation as a thought leader in the alternative data industry and present systematic workflows to conduct fundamental analysis. You will work jointly with the Head of QIS on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:

 * Understanding accurately the fundamental implications of a topic on the macro and microeconomy.
 * Developing chain-of-thought agents to mimic a human professional analyst using our data, while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.
 * Offering data-driven insights, engaging in research discussions, and presenting features to leading financial analysts, quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.
 * Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.




What We're Looking For:

 * A MSc in Data Analysis, Quantitative Finance, or Economics.
 * 2+ years of relevant work experience as a data scientist or quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering.
 * Outstanding analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to conduct fundamental analysis in a systematic and quantitative way.
 * Demonstrated proficiency in Python, and in at least Dash, StreamLit, or RepLit web applications.
 * Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in language models is highly advantageous.




What's in it for you?

 * You will work with the latest technologies.
 * Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Following the onboarding period, we offer a hybrid work model, allowing for up to 2 days remote per week.
 * Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, Riviera and Estepona.
 * You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
 * You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
 * As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
 * Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate

on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
We are looking for a Software Engineer interested in Cyber Security to work in our Application SOC team. This team is part of the Service Integration unit within Nixu‚Äôs Managed Services department. Managed Services is a tech-savvy group of people, with a common interest in improving the security of our customers. In this role, you would be focusing on further strengthening our capabilities in both protection and detection domains.




You will be part of an experienced team, which provides you with the necessary support and capabilities to further develop your professional skills. As we use many technologies and constantly develop our services and operations, you have the possibility to take part in the creation of comprehensive cyber security monitoring solutions.




In this role, you will:

 * Lead customer assignments, ranging from simple engagements to more complex deployment projects.
 * Conduct threat modelling exercises and work with customer stakeholders which are mostly the technical software engineers and security team. Thus, this is a customer-facing role.
 * Have the chance to influence the projects that you get. Thus, you can affect where you personally develop, so you can develop in the way that you want.
 * Drive continuous improvements in our customers‚Äô environments.
 * Enable us to build scalable, efficient, and high-quality managed services, especially focusing on further enhancing our protection and detection capabilities.
 * Work closely with other internal stakeholders to enhance the capabilities of the Nixu Security Operations Center




We hope you have experience from the following:

 * Software engineering and software architecture
 * Threat modeling
 * Log collection technologies and agents
 * General information security concepts




Following is seen as beneficial for the role:

 * SIEM or log management technologies
 * Modern DevOps -practices and ways of working
 * Building and operating scalable managed services in public cloud platforms
 * Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC)
 * In depth knowledge of OWASP




Be one of us

We have recently embarked on an exciting journey ‚Äì formerly known as Nixu, now combined forces with DNV and Applied Risk, with the goal of creating a leading European cyber security services business.




As DNV Cyber, we are passionate about cyber security and take pride in the way we are impacting the society we live in. We encourage you to excel professionally through knowledge sharing and demanding cases. At DNV Cyber, you'll have 500 colleagues who share an interest in cyber security with you.




At DNV Cyber, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of cases and customers from various industries. Join us on an exciting adventure of growth, meaningful work, and shaping the future through cyber security!




Apply now!

Need more information?

If you have any questions regarding this position, please reach out to the hiring manager Mikko Hyv√§rinen, mikko.hyvarinen@dnv.com




A security background check will be a part of the recruitment process.

description:

At Nosto, we‚Äôre on a mission to make every impression relevant. We‚Äôre a global leader in the booming e-commerce space and work with amazing customers like FIGS, Muji, Dermalogica and Douglas. Utilizing behavioral data, deep integrations, machine-learning technology, and automated workflows, the Nosto Commerce Experience Platform makes it easy for brands and retailers to quickly deploy fully personalized commerce experiences at scale. As an Engineer at Nosto, you‚Äôll be solving one of the biggest challenges brands and retailers face today: How to offer customers relevant and authentic shopping experiences that drive results. title: Software Engineer

description:
Description

What We‚Äôre Looking For

Join Meltwater's Client Insights team, where you'll step into the role of an Insights Analyst, contributing to our bespoke reports and project management for esteemed clients. Your analytical skills will shape customized reports and assist in managing key projects, utilizing both quantitative and qualitative media analysis to offer actionable insights. Working closely with internal teams and clients, you'll ensure timely delivery of high-quality reports, continuously refining techniques to meet evolving client needs. As a pivotal member of our data-driven approach, you'll collect, organize, and analyze customer research metrics to inform critical business decisions. Your duties will encompass data compilation, analysis, insight generation, and assisting in report development methodologies.

At Meltwater, you'll immerse yourself in an environment fostering continuous growth, where mentorship and inclusive leadership are fundamental principles rather than mere catchphrases. Collaborate with experienced colleagues and respected leaders, continually evolving alongside industry trends. Within this dynamic environment, you'll thrive within a culture emphasizing empowerment and autonomy, making significant contributions to our expanding organization's success.

What You'll Do:


 * Interpret customer requirements, translate them into reporting deliverables, and assist in generating dashboards, report templates, and query building.
 * Track deadlines and deliverables to ensure prompt report delivery to clients, maintaining overall formatting and visual consistency of reports.
 * Craft contextual and qualitative analyses based on KPIs, proofread/edit reports for accuracy, and verify numbers and report findings.
 * Address customer inquiries and concerns regarding delivered reports, contributing to training and initiatives to enhance team knowledge and efficiency.
 * Conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis of media data to provide clients with insights on brand perception, media performance, and industry trends.
 * Project management to ensure customer satisfaction throughout the delivery process, analyzing mainstream and social media content to inform strategic communication objectives.
 * Utilize Meltwater software, Excel, and PowerPoint to extract data, produce reports, and collaborate with internal teams and clients to enhance value-added initiatives.
 * Develop strategies to improve report quality and objectives based on client feedback, ensuring timely completion of deliverables with high quality by effectively coordinating with the team.
   
   

What You'll Bring:


 * 1-3 years of relevant work experience (client-facing roles are advantageous).
 * Exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English, with a particular emphasis on proficient report writing in English.
 * Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint & Excel, including PivotTable, VLOOKUP, and similar functions.
 * Meticulous attention to detail, adept at handling recurring tasks and ensuring data integrity.
 * Proficient report writing skills, covering both qualitative and quantitative aspects.
 * Customer-focused mindset with a commitment to exceptional client servicing.
 * Critical thinking skills, facilitating insights derived from data analysis.
 * Strong interest in current affairs, mainstream media, and social media trends.
 * Comfortable working autonomously and collaborating effectively with remote team members, including reporting to managers situated in distant locations.
 * A keen interest in learning, adaptability, and resilience in a dynamic work environment.
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills in Finnish, Swedish and English, particularly in report writing.
 * Willingness to embrace the best of both worlds with our hybrid work schedule. This role requires you to be in the office 3 days a week.
 * The ability to legally work in the country of hire is required for this position.
   
   

What We Offer:


 * Enjoy 30 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
 * Access comprehensive health and pension benefits through Mehil√§inen, providing you with a holistic approach to well-being and financial security.
 * Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
 * Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
 * Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
 * Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.
   
   

Where You'll Work: Mikonkatu 15a, Helsinki, Finland 100

When You'll Join: December 2024

Our Story

The sky is the limit at Meltwater.

At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.

Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do ‚Äì from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products ‚Äî and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.

We‚Äôre proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you‚Äôll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.

So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.

All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.

Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.

description:
About this role:




We‚Äôre a close-knit, ambitious team of 30, driven by a mission to make this world a better place by bringing affordable, environmentally sustainable cloud capacity to organizations.




As our OpenStack Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, deploying, and maintaining solutions using OpenStack. You will work on greenfield projects to build scalable and reliable cloud infrastructure that meets business needs.




What you will do:

 * Participate in designing OpenStack environments.
 * Automate deployment and management using tools such as Ansible.
 * Ensure high availability and disaster recovery.
 * Monitor and resolve issues in OpenStack environments.
 * Work with DevOps and operations teams for CI/CD integration.
 * Support infrastructure incidents and promote IaaS best practices.
 * Complete other tasks as necessary to contribute to the progress of the company.




For this role you will need:

 * Experience with OpenStack deployment and maintenance.
 * Strong network administration skills in Linux.
 * Familiarity with Ansible.
 * Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities.
 * Excellent communication skills in English.
 * Ability to work in an agile environment and manage multiple tasks.
 * Strategic thinking to leverage data for impactful outcomes.




It's a plus if you have:

 * Knowledge of BGP, load balancing, networking (VLAN/VXLAN), storage systems (Ceph), and security in cloud environments.
 * Experience with messaging systems (RabbitMQ) and modern databases (MariaDB).




What we offer:

 * Company equity - you‚Äôre in this with us!

description:
We are now looking for an AI and Analytics Engineer(s) in UPM Sourcing to learn and grow with us. This is a permanent position, located in Wroc≈Çaw, Poland or Helsinki / Tampere, Finland.







Greetings from your future manager




We warmly welcome you to our team of Sourcing AI, analytics and data management professionals. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to gain a comprehensive view of our businesses, sourcing & procurement, market dynamics and AI and analytics development across the organization. You‚Äôll be able to showcase your expertise in AI and analytics engineering, while also expanding your skill set and working with the latest tools and technologies. We encourage innovation and look forward to seeing the unique perspectives and insights you'll bring. This is a collaborative environment where not only will you learn from the experts around you, but we are also eager to learn from you. Petri, Senior Manager, Sourcing AI and Data Strategy







What you will do

 * Designing, developing, and implementing AI and analytics solutions that support prioritized business objectives, with a focus on scalability, maintainability, and performance
 * Building and maintaining machine learning models and AI algorithms that enable faster decision-making and drive end-to-end process automation
 * Staying up to date with AI trends, incorporating the latest technologies and methodologies into ongoing projects
 * Supporting AI project lifecycle management, including use case identification, feasibility analysis, and model deployment, in collaboration with third-party providers
 * Developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure efficient data integration from various sources
 * Evaluating and integrating external data sources, market intelligence, and APIs to enhance data ecosystems and analytics capabilities







Who you are

 * You are self-directed, responsible, proactive and doer with customer service mindset
 * You are fluent in English and appreciate working in a truly international environment; other languages are considered beneficial
 * You have master‚Äôs degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering/Economics, Management Science or Mathematics and 3+ years of working experience in Sourcing / Source-to-Pay / Finance process organization in similar position
 * You have strong experience in analytics and AI use case development, data engineering, database design and data storytelling through visual analytics
 * You possess solid experience in cloud technologies, tools, and architecture; thorough understanding of Snowflake, SQL Server, Microsoft Azure platform, Azure AI services, Generative AI & LLMs, and Power Platform tools (Power BI, Power Apps) is essential
 * You have experience working with APIs and integrating external data sources and market information services into analytics solutions; experience with SAP or the Ariba data model in the Source-to-Pay process area is a great asset
 * You are proficient in data engineering programming languages such as SQL and Python







This is what we offer to you

 * A meaningful job ‚Äì We have an inspiring purpose ‚ÄòWe create a future beyond fossils'. Our work is impactful and transformative.
 * A caring community ‚Äì Our community is built on great team spirit and shared commitment. We care about each other and the well-being of our colleagues. We support the work-life balance of all our employees.
 * Development opportunities ‚Äì We offer you great opportunities to learn and grow throughout your career. We are an international, multi-business organization offering plenty of avenues for personal growth.
 * Responsible employer - Sustainability is at the core of everything we do. We are committed to ambitious, science-based sustainability targets in all areas from climate change to biodiversity. We foster diversity and inclusivity, offering a work environment in which everyone can be themselves.




Learn about our Rewarding and our Ways of working







Additional information




The position is located in UPM Business HUB in Wroc≈Çaw (Poland), UPM Biofore House in Helsinki (Finland) or UPM Business HUB in Tampere (Finland).




Please apply by clicking the Apply button and attach your CV, and optionally a cover letter in English latest by 19.10.2024. We highly appreciate you applying at your earliest convenience, as we are reviewing the applications continuously. Please note that we will be conducting preliminary interviews already during the application period.




For support with submitting your application, please contact HR Service Center at careers@upm.com or tel. +48 12 399 94 99

description:
Do you get excited when hearing about trademarks and brand protection news? YES?! So do we! At Corsearch, there‚Äôs no pushing trademark solutions and brand protection from our thoughts. We‚Äôre thinking about coined trademarks in the car, a detailed design search over lunch, counterfeits while sitting with the in-laws, and anti-piracy while working out

We are a mission-led company, driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. It‚Äôs what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued üëç













‚úÖThe Role

AI team is responsible for researching, designing, implementing and optimizing cutting edge data science solutions in fields like image tech, NLP or fraud. We‚Äôre looking at different methodologies/models and validate them to find the most promising solution to our actual problems.

As a Data Scientist - working in the AI team - you will be involved in projects of different products lines/business area. As NLP data scientist you‚Äôll be responsible to apply SOTA (state of the art) NLP models to our problems including, but not limited to handling orthographic / semantic / phonetic representations for similarity scoring. Additionally you‚Äôll be researching / applying computer linguistic based search/retrieval algorithms as well.










Learn more about our Data Science org, and wider business here










‚úÖResponsibilities And Duties

 * Research and implement NLP based solutions in online brand protection and trademark business line
 * Try different SOTA models for topics like text similarity / search
 * Work closely with subject matter experts to validate results and share knowledge about the used methodology
 * Take care of the continuously increasing training/test datasets, verify consistency, offer solution for revisiting labeling issues
 * Implement the solution based on continuous training principle as user feedbacks and expert reports are available
 * Think creatively about the implemented solutions, advise new features or tools, innovate
 * Collaborate with other Data Scientists to share knowledge and continuously improve NLP solutions
 * Take part in other machine learning projects utilizing your experiments and general understanding of deep learning principles













‚úÖAbout You

 * You are excited about working in NLP team and interested to keep track the latest advancements in the field
 * Have excellent technical skills to apply new methodologies to make more accurate / efficient solutions
 * Strong desire to always learn new technologies, techniques, and tools
 * Ability to work through problems and figure out next steps
 * Open-minded to different ways of accomplishing tasks
 * Ability to work collaboratively in a geographically distributed team environment
 * Able to effectively prioritize work in a highly dynamic work environment
 * Ability to proactively reach out and facilitate communications













‚úÖEssential

 * MSc or Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence or related field
 * Minimum 3 years relevant industry experience in researching/building data science applications
 * Hands-on experiment with Transformer based models, like fine-tuning, transfer learning
 * Knowledge of search/retrieval algorithms (TF-IDF, n-gram, Aho-Corasick, Suffix trees, etc)
 * Proficient programming skills in a high-level DS languages (python, R), R shiny experience for prototyping is a plus
 * Experience with working in cloud (AWS, GCP, Kaggle, etc. )
 * Broader knowledge of large dataset processing pipelines and distributed computing architectures (Apache Beam/Airflow, Spark/Hadoop architectures)
 * Knowledge of relational databases, noSQL, memory database technologies, graph processing (Elastic Search, MongoDB, Redis)
 * Experience with GPU backed modeling/inference













Corsearch is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and does not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, nationality, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. Together, we are working proactively to build a workplace where everyone can belong and be at their best selves. Together, we make an Impact.













Trusted by over 5,000 customers worldwide, Corsearch delivers AI-powered data, deep analytics, and professional services that support brands to market their assets, drive growth, and optimise brand presence against infringement.

Corsearch enables brand owners to discover, monitor and control the use and misuse of their brands and associated products and services online and is the industry market leader.

Corsearch does this in an increasingly complex global digital environment, with online brand protection solutions that cover everything from anti-counterfeiting to anti-piracy.

description:
Hello and welcome to start your next journey with Sellforte! üëã

We are on a mission to help retailers and consumer brands accelerate their growth by making smarter data-driven marketing decisions. Sellforte is a Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM) SaaS for marketing teams and agencies to holistically evaluate and improve the effectiveness of marketing and promotional activities.

We are not a company that only shows cool marketing metrics or fancy dashboards ‚Äì we deliver real impact based on Bayesian methods and data science. For example, check out the video below how C&A's Analytics Director Gina de Ryck and Marketing Director Dr. Maik Kleinschmidt use Sellforte as an integral tool in their teams to improve marketing performance.

Serving modern data-driven marketing leaders like Gina and Maik, we have grown rapidly, and we have an ambitious plan to continue growing the company to new markets. It is an exciting opportunity also due to the current bigger developments in the marketing industry, where new privacy norms are eradicating measurement by user-level attribution, and probabilistic and econometric solutions like Sellforte are expected to gain ground.

You will join a team of roughly fifteen bad-ass data scientists, who are the spine for our business, and you‚Äôll work closely with many experts from various fields (for example Customer Success Managers, Software Developers, Sales). In addition, you'll get the chance to work with smaller and bigger marketers and consumer brands and make a real impact in their marketing by offering insights based on the data and modelling.

üéØ What you will do‚ÄØas a Customer Data Scientist:

As a Customer Data Scientist, your ultimate goal is to support our enterprise customers, i.e. to ensure Sellforte service is running smoothly and that they get value from the service. To achieve these goals, you are working in a Customer Delivery team with Customer Success Managers and other Data Scientists. Specifically, you will


 * Do exploratory data analysis with customer data (using e.g. Python and pandas), solve customer-specific issues and business problems.
 * Help onboard new customers to our marketing analytics service/platform: set up data flow from customer to Sellforte, configure the modelling, and communicate technical solutions to customers.
 * Meet customers, e.g. in weekly/monthly meetings.
 * Participate in product development: communicate new learnings and insights, as well as develop new features and automation directly to the product.
 * Collaborate with other data scientists and data engineers to implement and train predictive machine learning models, such as time series forecasting Bayesian models to statistically infer causal impacts.
   
   

What we hope from you: üå§


 * Previous experience working as a data scientist, analytics consultant, or a similar role in the industry, having applied data analysis or ML/AI to real business problems.
 * Good communication skills in English. This is a customer facing role and it is crucial to be able to explain deeply technical issues to non-technical people.
 * Ability to identify and solve business problems based on data and quick analysis.‚ÄØPositive and get-things-done attitude in general.
 * Hands-on technical skills especially with Python.
 * We hope that you would already be located in the Helsinki/Espoo region in Finland, or you would be willing to relocate there. Relocation support to Finland is possible. For GDPR and contractual reasons, the job needs to be done within Europe.
   
   

üéØ‚ÄØWhat Sellforte offers to you:


 * Work in an open and easy-going startup/scaleup environment with nice colleagues üöÄ
 * International and multi-cultural team. We have 13+ different nationalities working in 5 different countries!
 * Globally‚ÄØunique product which is developed with modern technologies (such as Python, AWS, Airflow, Stan etc)
 * A low hierarchy and enjoyable ride. We try to find that extra spark of fun that makes the journey worthwhile to ourselves and to the people around us. Sellforteans are bunch of warm hearted and kind people who enjoy delivering impact and growing the business together!
 * Growth ‚Äì both business and individual. We try to build product and data science culture within the company, including regular data science or data engineering talks and presentations. üçï
 * Flexibility to find your work-life balance - We understand that nine to five doesn't fit for all. We have also flexible remote culture and f2f working possibilities. As a company, we are trying to support different type of working, whether it is online or office. This means that teams and team members can choose what is the best way of working for them. As an example, we have fully remote employees and those, who like to work from the office on daily basis. Of course, your opinion matters!
 * Benefits, such as healthcare,‚ÄØlunch and activity benefits, full holidays‚ÄØfrom the start of your employment‚ÄØ(5 weeks/year), phone and other working equipment,‚ÄØoption program, and home care services in case of sick children.
   
   

How to apply:

Do you feel that this position matches what you are looking for? Let‚Äôs start this‚ÄØincredible journey together by getting to‚ÄØknow each other!

The‚ÄØrecruitment process consists of intro call with our Co-founder & Chief Science Officer, and one or two interview sessions, including both a more traditional interview discussion and a data science case exercise. We try to include members from your future teams in the interview process for the best outcome.

During the process you‚Äôll meet a lot of Sellforteans and get to see the product we‚Äôre working with. ‚ÄØWe will keep you informed every week during the process.‚ÄØ If you need additional information about the job, please reach out to our Co-founder & Chief Science Officer Mikko Ervasti via email (mikko@sellforte.com).

We hope to hear from you soon! üòä

description:
Type: Full-time, permanent

Location: Aleksanterinkatu 15, 00100 Helsinki, Hybrid
