description:
Are you a technical expert in Machine Learning technology and are you interested in its application to Cybersecurity? Are you looking for a new job opportunity in this field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in cybersecurity and machine learning? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you.‚ÄØ

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Get to know us further by exploring‚ÄØ VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for Research Scientist to join our‚ÄØCybersecurity research team in Espoo.

As a Research Scientist, you have a role in performing cutting edge applied research on the applications of AI/ML for cybersecurity. This research covers both the usage of ML to improve cybersecurity solutions and its usage to enhance cyberattacks. You will design, develop, study and test ML solutions to solve diverse cybersecurity problems. In this position, you will work under the guidance of experts in ML and cybersecurity. You can also contribute to the definition of the long-term roadmap for ML & cybersecurity research and contribute to its execution. You will work in customer projects and collaborative research projects with industrial and academic partners. You will write and communicate about your research results through peer-reviewed publications, reports, patents and oral presentations.

Our team counts 15+ researchers working on applications of ML to solve cybersecurity problems, the security of ML systems, cybersecurity testing and the security of future networks (e.g., 6G). It is a main contributor to VTT‚Äôs mission for building digital trust in society.

As‚ÄØa Research Scientist,‚ÄØyou will:


 * Perform research on applications of ML to solve cybersecurity problems.
 * Contribute to our strategy on ML & cybersecurity research.
 * Participate to research projects, commercial and public, on both a national and international level.
 * Communicate about your research results through peer-reviewed papers, reports, patents and oral presentations.
 * Support knowledge building for ML in the team.
 * Continuously acquire knowledge and learn new skills.
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * You have an MSc or a PhD degree in machine learning, cybersecurity, computer science, mathematics or another relevant field.
 * You have theoretical knowledge of conventional supervised and unsupervised ML techniques such as SVM, Random Forest, Boosting methods, DNNs, DBScan, etc.
 * You have hands-on experience with Python ML libraries such as ScikitLearn, Pytorch, Keras, Numpy, etc. and ML development platforms.
 * You have practical hands-on experience in applying machine learning to solve cybersecurity or other type of problems.
 * You have critical thinking and an adversarial thinking mindset.
 * You have good problem-solving skills
 * Optional: You have good scientific writing and presentation skills.
 * Optional: You are knowledgeable and have practical experience with LLMs
 * Optional: You have a track record of research publications in machine learning, cybersecurity, or other relevant publication venues.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * Visionary and motivated
 * Committed and flexible
 * A team player with good collaboration skills
 * Project management skills and experience are considered as a plus.
 * Experience with customer projects is considered as a plus.
   
   
   

With VTT, you‚Äôll‚ÄØenjoy:


 * Visionary work in technology.‚ÄØWe offer positions at the cutting-edge of technology and engineering, from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy ‚Äì‚ÄØ the path of exponential hope .
 * Fascinating projects, excellent research environment.‚ÄØOur researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects locally and internationally. At VTT, you'll have state-of-the-art research facilities, such as Micronova, the Finnish research infrastructure for micro-, nano-, and quantum technologies. ‚ÄØ
 * Great career opportunities, superb colleagues.‚ÄØAt VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over ten years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun. Read more about‚ÄØ our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.
 * Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture excellent team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation and cognitive ergonomics training.
   
   
   

Apply now‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our community of brilliant minds!

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut‚ÄØat the latest by 15 September 2024.‚ÄØWe will process applications as they come in and fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.‚ÄØA security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.

Interested and want to know more?

description:
Do you want to start changing the world for the better this year? Are you all about science and technology? Would you like to develop your skills and use them to tackle the greatest challenges of our time? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you.‚ÄØ

VTT is one of the leading applied research organizsations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Get to know us further by exploring‚ÄØ VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for a Research Scientist or Rese to join our Applied Cryptography team in Oulu and/or Espoo!

As a Research Scientist, your key goals are to join our theoretical work, hardware implementation and testing, project preparation and customer front in the field of Applied Cryptography. In this position, you will have an essential role in strengthening cybersecurity and privacy through modern cryptography. Also in this position, you will have an essential role for in the national and European research of cryptography and its latest development.

Our team, Applied Cryptography, works on state-of-the art cryptographic development, including quantum- resistant algorithms, cryptography testing and verification, quantum key distribution, privacy-enhancing technologies and cybersecurity. Our team is located mainly in Oulu, but also in Espoo and Tampere.

As‚ÄØa Research Scientist,‚ÄØyou will:


 * You‚Äôll research novel use of cryptography to strengthen cybersecurity and privacy. The topic might be mathematical, (e.g. research of lattice-based cryptography) or technical (e.g. implementing or testing).
 * You‚Äôll verify the research results either by publishing and/or developing and evaluating a proof-of-concepts and cryptographic solutions.
 * You‚Äôll use your advanced skills in English to write research reports or blog that help the team communicate the research results clearly.
   
   
   

Who we are we looking for?


 * You have at least master‚Äôs degree an MSc. iIn Mathematics, or Computer Science andor other studies related to Cryptography.
   
   
   

In addition, you have experience in one or more of these:


 * Programming experience e.g. in Python, C++, Go, Java
 * Operating systems, e.g. Windows, Linux, Unix
 * Low-level programming, e.g. embedded devices, FPGAs
 * Cybersecurity metrics and evaluation
 * Telecommunication and networking technologies
 * Quantum phenomena
 * Mathematical Statistical tools, e.g. Matlab or R,
 * In order to succeed in this rolerole, we hope you have good Finnish and English skills.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * A computer scientist, mathematician or physicist interested in cryptography, privacy, cybersecurity and/or quantum.
 * Curious and interested in learning.
 * Open to share your thoughts, ask questions, discuss about your opinions.
 * A team player, sharing not only results but also problems with others.

 * Great career opportunities, superb colleagues.‚ÄØAt VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us over 10 years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. description:
We are looking for a Product Engineer to join our Product Engineering team and play a key role in shaping the future of Evac‚Äôs innovative solutions. As part of this team, you will hold technical responsibility for our product lines, focusing on evaluating and consolidating the component catalogue in our product database and managing requests for new component creation. This role is based in Espoo, Finland, and reports to the Manager of Product Engineering.

PLEASE NOTE - This is a 12 Month Contract

Responsibilities

As a Product Engineer, your work will be central to the development of our business and future solutions. Your responsibilities will include:


 * Database Evaluation: Assess our product database to identify process components and streamline the catalogue by defining specifications and eliminating redundancies.
 * Component Creation: Assist with sourcing and creating new components, ensuring they meet technical standards and business needs.
 * Spares Support: Collaborate on defining spares, working closely with sourcing and process engineering teams.
 * Stakeholder Collaboration: Work alongside internal and external stakeholders, including lead product engineers, to support product development and ensure alignment with business objectives.
   
   

Keys to Success

To excel in this role, you should bring a blend of technical expertise and proactive problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate will have:


 * Educational Background: M.Sc. or B.Sc. in process or mechanical engineering.
 * Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with process equipment such as pumps, blowers, valves, and instrumentation; solid experience with CAD (with Creo Parametric as a plus); and a good understanding of PDM/PLM tools like Windchill.
 * Product Development Experience: Experience in product development or product management, with a strong foundation in evaluating and consolidating technical components.
 * Language Skills: Full proficiency in English.
 * Advanced Spreadsheet Skills: Expertise in managing and analyzing data using spreadsheets.
 * Personal Attributes: Proactive, well-organized, and an outgoing team player with a can-do attitude. Experience in wastewater treatment is an advantage.
   
   

What We Offer

This is a highly interesting role within a global setting, offering the chance to influence the future of Evac‚Äôs business and solutions. You will work closely with colleagues, internal and external customers, and the entire value chain, contributing to our mission of driving towards a zero-waste future. At Evac, we foster an inclusive and safe culture where colleagues know and trust each other.

Our office is located in the modern and easily accessible S√§terinportti area in Espoo, Lepp√§vaara, with frequent visits required to our testing facility in Hyryl√§, Tuusula.

Evac has been a pioneer in sustainable technologies and solutions for decades. Today we are the world‚Äôs leading provider of integrated Evac¬Æ water, waste and wastewater technologies, Cathelco¬Æ corrosion protection and marine growth prevention and HEM¬Æ freshwater systems.

Our technologies address the increasing need for innovative solutions driven by the megatrends of climate change, circularity, and increasingly scarce freshwater resources. We contribute to a better environment and cleaner seas by helping our customers eliminate waste, conserve water, mitigate emissions, and lengthen the lifecycle of their vessels or buildings. Together with our 500 colleagues in 14 countries, we strive for a future with no waste.
title: Product Engineer (Data Quality)

description:
Are you interested in artificial intelligence (AI) and the ways it impacts Science Technology and Innovation, and looking for a postdoctoral opportunity in the field? Would you like to develop innovative research solutions with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you. If you are an international talent searching for a new opportunity, read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation here !

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2300 brilliant minds from almost 60 different nationalities is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for a Postdoctoral Researcher to join our Quantitative Science and Technology Studies team for a fixed-term three-year contract starting in January 2025!

VTT started a Postdoc programme in 2023 to develop new ways to support scientific excellence and to strengthen career paths from universities to VTT. We want to provide development opportunities for recent university PhDs in applied research and industry collaboration. As a Postdoctoral Researcher at VTT, you are able to make an impact on our customers and society. Our researchers work closely together with industry, often in interdisciplinary research groups.

In this Postdoctoral Researcher position, you will have an essential role in advancing research on AI and its impact using LLMs (large language models). You will have the opportunity, and expectation, to contribute to a variety of projects ranging from academic to industry focused. Our team, Quantitative Science and Technology Studies, focuses on analyzing changes in our technological world using large data sets and advancements in natural language processing, generative AI, particularly in the LLMs domain, so you will be offered tremendous support with the current solutions and cases we have developed using LLMs. The research results are adopted by decision-makers from private and public sectors and they support forward-looking decisions.

Read more about our research: https://cris.vtt.fi/en/organisations/quantitative-science-and-technology-studies-2

Your responsibilities as a Postdoctoral Researcher:


 * Advancing research in AI and its impact in Science Technology and Innovation in specified projects.
 * Designing and developing new methods and tools for analyzing the impact of emerging technology on firms and society.
 * Contribute to the teams' development regarding the LLM based applications.
 * Collaborating in a research team and project group, including co-writing research articles involving research design, data collection, analysis, methodology execution, and drafting.
 * Participating actively in dissemination with journal publications and also interactive discussion with our customers.
 * Supervising or tutoring junior team members .
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * You have recently (max 5 years ago) gained your doctoral degree in fields such as AI, Data Science or Science Innovation and Technology Studies, or a closely related field. Applicants who are close to completing their doctorate (with a thesis scheduled by 30 September 2024) will also be eligible for the position.
 * You have experience in methods for analyzing large texts, such as natural language processing or use of LLMs.
 * You have excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
 * Hands-on experience with coding (e.g., Python) and software programming concepts is required.
 * Experience in international and EU projects is highly valued.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * An open-minded and innovative person with a vision of longer-term research needs.
 * You are eager to work with new topics and methods, even out of your comfort zone to achieve the set ambitious goals.

At VTT, you‚Äôll enjoy flexibility and independence in your work, with a blend of academic research and engaging customer projects for an exciting career path.
 * Open culture of innovation. We have 80 years of experience in science-based innovation, a strong international reputation and global networks. We work truly across disciplines, and house all the cutting-edge sciences from quantum computing to synthetic biology under one roof. At VTT, you‚Äôll join a community of over 2200 multidisciplinary experts who foster a culture of trust, openness and sharing knowledge. Collaborating with amazing colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.

With a strong background in integrated circuit design in analog/RFIC domain, as a postdoctoral researcher at VTT, you will have an essential role of developing and carrying research in RFIC design. You identify and solve problems independently and creatively, while working closely and flexibly with a team of experts. You focus on the design but also integrating the IC in part of a larger system and contribute to the packaging aspects of the RFIC and MMICs.

Our team develops components and sub-systems for applications ranging from cryogenically cooled quantum computing readout and control circuits to large THz phased-array antennas for 6G wireless systems. We cover all abstraction levels of IC design and characterization from component level to system level using silicon (CMOS and SiGe BiCMOS) and III-V (InP, GaAs and GaN) technologies. The developments are made in close collaboration with our industrial, research institute and academic partners.

Your responsibilities as a Postdoctoral Researcher:


 * Design of RFIC/MMIC circuits
 * Contribute to the system specifications for the application in hand
 * Communicating and solving the problems in tight collaboration with others at VTT
 * Supervising or tutoring junior team members, contributing to new project preparation and proposal work

 * You have recently (max 5 years ago) gained your doctoral degree in integrated circuit design
 * You have experience in designing RFICs using silicon technologies (CMOS and/or SiGe BiCMOS)
 * You have hands-on experience of testing RFICs in lab
 * Excellent communications skills in English are required

description:
Are you interested in how corrosion impacts sustainability and looking for a postdoctoral opportunity in the field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field? Do you want to build an excellent science career and work at the interface of academy and industry? Are you enthusiastic about working with fascinating projects in state-of-the-art research facilities? VTT might be just the place for you. If you are an international talent searching for a new opportunity, read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation here !

‚ÄØ

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time‚ÄØand turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2300 brilliant minds from almost 60 different nationalities is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation.‚ÄØIn recent years, we have created ground-breaking innovations such as the world's fastest and most accurate radiation detector, a cancer-sniffing sensor device for smartphones, and a headphone set entirely made of microbial materials. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for a Postdoctoral Researcher to join our materials Performance and interactions team for a fixed-term three-year contract starting in January 2025!

VTT started a Postdoc programme in 2023 to develop new ways to support scientific excellence and to strengthen career paths from universities to VTT. We want to provide development opportunities for recent university PhDs in applied research and industry collaboration. As a Postdoctoral Researcher at VTT, you are able to make an impact on our customers and society. Our researchers work closely together with industry, often in interdisciplinary research groups. VTT has excellent research infrastructure and internal services to support your research work.

We are now recruiting four Postdoctoral Researchers in the Knowledge Driven Design research area to boost the concept of a Materials Acceleration Platform (MAP).

The MAP (Materials Acceleration Platform) concept is a next era of materials science beyond integrated computational materials engineering. It comprises set of highly automated building blocks merging experimental and modelling capabilities. It utilizes quantum computing, and application of data analytics and AI for the generation of new information and knowledge of materials.

In this Postdoctoral Researcher position, you will have an essential role in defining the corrosion behaviour of materials in aggressive conditions, utilising electrochemical and characterisation methods. Our team ‚ÄúMaterials performance and interactions‚Äù works on studying the degradation of materials related to mainly corrosion and tribology. To create new sustainable solutions, materials‚Äô durability in increasingly aggressive environments is often the key ‚Äì and understanding the reasons for materials‚Äô degradation is one of the essential factors in developing new materials, as well as making better materials selection for the applications.

We focus on solving material challenges in diverse industrial applications. In our‚ÄØteam you will be working‚ÄØin close collaboration with researchers and scientists from many different domains in material research and testing as well as microbiology.

The position is located‚ÄØin Espoo, Finland.

Read more about our research:‚ÄØ

A day in the life of a Corrosion scientist -read what a typical day for looks like for your future colleague Andressa

Corrosion in biomass power plants ‚Äì | VTT News (vttresearch.com)

‚ÄØ

Your responsibilities as a Postdoctoral Researcher:‚ÄØ


 * Actively engaging in experimental research, monitoring and modifying the laboratory set ups: participating in conducting experimental work, its analysis and characterisation
 * Creating a process to enhance our ability to use and commercialize the research results and data, and how to make our data usable in computational materials science
 * Advancing the knowledge of material behaviour in association with alternative fuels and circular economy in specified projects
 * Collaborating in research team and project group with co-writing and project work
 * Utilizing our existing data and co-writing articles about the results: You‚Äôll use your advanced skills in English to write research reports and publications that help the team communicate its results impactfully
 * Tutoring junior team members
 * Collaborating in project preparations
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * You have recently (max 5 years ago) gained your doctoral degree in corrosion engineering, materials science or chemistry, or a closely related field.
 * You have experience in electrochemistry and knowledge of materials and their characterisation methods.
 * You have excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
 * You understand also the wider general as well as practical implications of material challenges in the changing industry and society and are willing to tackle those issues
 * You have hands-on experience in electrochemistry
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * An open-minded and innovative person with a vision of longer-term research needs.
 * You are eager to work with new topics and methods, even out of your comfort zone to achieve the set ambitious goals.
 * You like to network, and tackle challenges as a part of even a bigger group of experts across various fields ‚ÄØ
   
   
   

With VTT, you‚Äôll‚ÄØenjoy:

‚ÄØ


 * Science with‚ÄØan‚ÄØimpact.‚ÄØAt VTT, we‚ÄØseek to solve large societal challenges and drive a sustainable future through‚ÄØapplied research‚ÄØand innovation. With us, you‚Äôll get to work on‚ÄØresearch‚ÄØprojects that‚ÄØmake a‚ÄØconcrete, positive impact in the world. Read more about our strategy, the path of exponential hope , and our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.
 * Support for your postdoc research. During your postdoctoral term, we offer training in project management, scientific writing, communication, and commercialisation. You‚Äôll have the opportunity collaborate with industry on projects, access our research infrastructure and internal support services, explore interdisciplinary research, and secure funding for your postdoc term. At VTT, you‚Äôll enjoy flexibility and independence in your work, with a blend of academic research and engaging customer projects for an exciting career path.
 * Open culture of innovation.‚ÄØWe have 80 years of experience in science-based innovation, a strong international reputation‚ÄØand global networks. We work truly across disciplines, and house all the cutting-edge sciences from quantum computing to synthetic biology under one roof. At VTT, you‚Äôll join a community of over 2200‚ÄØmultidisciplinary‚ÄØexperts who foster a culture of trust, openness and sharing knowledge. Collaborating‚ÄØwith amazing colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.
 * Nordic work-life balance.‚ÄØWorking in‚ÄØFinland, the happiest country in the world, enables a‚ÄØgreat quality of life. At‚ÄØVTT, we‚ÄØmake our people‚Äôs well-being a strategic priority. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), our benefits include extended occupational healthcare, and a range well-being services, such as exercise and culture benefits and hobby clubs. Read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation .
   
   
   

Apply now‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our community of brilliant minds!

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut‚ÄØat the latest by 30th September 2024.‚ÄØWe will process applications as they come in and fill in the position as soon as we find the right candidate.‚ÄØA security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.

Interested and want to hear more?

For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Vilma Ratia-Hanby, vilma.ratia-hanby@vtt.fi, tel. +358 406 887 168 on 11.9. at 9-11 EET or 19.9. at 13-15 EET.

We look forward to hearing from you!

This postdoc position is part of Postdoctoral Programme for Research Institutes. The Programme has been granted 40 million euros in funding based on the Finnish government's multi-annual research and development (R&D) funding plan. This funding enables recruitment of 85 PhD-level experts to 12 Finnish government research institutes between 2025 and 2028. The aim of the Programme is to strengthen RDI competence in areas important to society and business . Postdoctoral researcher will conduct goal-oriented high-level research at the interface between the academic community, industry and administration. The Programme supports postdoctoral researcher‚Äôs networking and mobility between sectors.

VTT

VTT is a visionary research, development and innovation partner. We drive sustainable growth and tackle the biggest global challenges of our time and turn them into growth opportunities. We go beyond the obvious to help the society and companies to grow through technological innovations. We have 80 years of experience of top-level research and science-based results. VTT is at the sweet spot where innovation and business come together.

VTT ‚Äì beyond the obvious.

description:
Are you interested in material development for new powder metallurgical and additive manufacturing applications and looking for a postdoctoral opportunity in the field? VTT might be just the place for you.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

If you are an international talent searching for a new opportunity, read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation here !‚ÄØ

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time‚ÄØand turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2300 brilliant minds from almost 60 different nationalities is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .‚ÄØ

We are now looking for a Postdoctoral Researcher to join our Sustainable materials design team for a fixed-term three-year contract starting in January 2025!‚ÄØ

VTT started a Postdoc programme in 2023 to develop new ways to support scientific excellence and to strengthen career paths from universities to VTT. We want to provide development opportunities for recent university PhDs in applied research and industry collaboration. As a Postdoctoral Researcher at VTT, you are able to make an impact on our customers and society. Our researchers work closely together with industry, often in interdisciplinary research groups. VTT has excellent research infrastructure and internal services to support your research work.‚ÄØ

We are now recruiting four Postdoctoral Researchers in the Knowledge Driven Design research area to boost the concept of a Materials Acceleration Platform (MAP).‚ÄØ

The MAP concept is a next era of materials science beyond on integrated computational materials engineering. It comprises set of highly automated building blocks merging experimental and modeling capabilities. It utilizes quantum computing, and application of data analytics and AI for the generation of new information and knowledge of materials.‚ÄØ

In this Postdoctoral Researcher position, you will have an essential role in the development of new streamlined and automated material processing and characterization workflows including both actual physical steps and data analysis. The position is highly integrated to the other hired postdocs for the MAP theme.‚ÄØThis position is located in Tampere.

Our team focuses on the development of materials and solutions that enable resource savings and higher operation performance for the entire life cycle. We specialize in powder-based materials and manufacturing technologies such as powder metallurgy and additive manufacturing. The three themes form the backbone of our projects:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


 * Resource sufficiency via substitution strategic and critical raw materials, and solution for long-life cycle.‚ÄØ
 * Energy efficiency via minimizing wear, friction, and power losses during operation and manufacturing.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
 * Material and manufacturing solutions to support rising technologies such as electrification, hydrogen economy and additive manufacturing.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
   
   
   

See more about our research on YouTube‚ÄØ VTT PowderPiloting ‚ÄØ

Your responsibilities as a Postdoctoral Researcher:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


 * As a member of the MAP core group, advancing development of Materials Acceleration Platform on the fields of powder metallurgy and additive manufacturing in specified projects.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
 * Building up new blocks for MAP such as streamlined processing, characterization steps and/or automated data processing.‚ÄØ
 * Help us on deepening our knowledge about new possibilities of processing and characterization technologies, such as high temperature x-ray diffraction combined with other thermal analyses.‚ÄØ
 * Participating actively in dissemination with journal publications and conference presentations.‚ÄØ
 * Preparing projects and writing project proposals in cooperation with the research team and MAP project core group.‚ÄØ
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:‚ÄØ


 * You have recently (max 5 years ago) gained your doctoral degree in materials science or physics, preferentially connected to metals or ceramics (candidates graduating within few months can be accepted).‚ÄØ
 * You have experience in hand-on working at laboratory as well as proven track record about planning and reporting of research tasks.‚ÄØ
 * You have hands on experience at least some of the following processing and characterization methods:
    * Casting, Gas atomization, laser based additive manufacturing, sintering‚ÄØ
    * Thermal Analysis, X-ray diffraction, Microscopy, Dilatometry, Magnetic measurements, Powder analyses.‚ÄØ

 * Basic knowhow of materials modelling tools such as CALPHAD, FEM, DFT is advantageous‚ÄØ
 * You have capability to make basic mechanical designs, basic knowledge about practical mechatronics is advantage.‚ÄØ
 * You have good understanding about data analysis and programming such as Python or Matlab.‚ÄØ
 * You have excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.‚ÄØ

As a person, we hope that you are:‚ÄØ


 * You have ambitions for development of methods to speed up materials development and manufacturing solutions to support emerging technologies such as electrification, alternative fuels like hydrogen etc.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
 * You are curious to find new solutions for the problems as well as new ways of working, especially willingness to find ways how to combine experiments and modelling effective way. You are willing to work both hands-on in the laboratory and on a desktop with a computer.‚ÄØ
 * You can work in a flexible and independent manner and collaborating with colleagues across different application areas.‚ÄØ
 * Most importantly, you are well motivated for the learning of new methods and willing to take new challenges and responsibilities in the rapidly evolving field of materials engineering.‚ÄØ
   
   
   

With VTT, you‚Äôll‚ÄØenjoy: ‚ÄØ


 * Science with‚ÄØan‚ÄØimpact.‚ÄØAt VTT, we‚ÄØseek to solve large societal challenges and drive a sustainable future through‚ÄØapplied research‚ÄØand innovation. With us, you‚Äôll get to work on‚ÄØresearch‚ÄØprojects that‚ÄØmake a‚ÄØconcrete, positive impact in the world. Read more about our strategy, the path of exponential hope , and our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.‚ÄØ
 * Support for your postdoc research. During your postdoctoral term, we offer training in project management, scientific writing, communication, and commercialisation. You‚Äôll have the opportunity collaborate with industry on projects, access our research infrastructure and internal support services, explore interdisciplinary research, and secure funding for your postdoc term. At VTT, you‚Äôll enjoy flexibility and independence in your work, with a blend of academic research and engaging customer projects for an exciting career path.‚ÄØ
 * Open culture of innovation.‚ÄØWe have 80 years of experience in science-based innovation, a strong international reputation‚ÄØand global networks. We work truly across disciplines, and house all the cutting-edge sciences from quantum computing to synthetic biology under one roof. At VTT, you‚Äôll join a community of over 2200‚ÄØmultidisciplinary‚ÄØexperts who foster a culture of trust, openness and sharing knowledge. Collaborating‚ÄØwith amazing colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.‚ÄØ
 * Nordic work-life balance.‚ÄØWorking in‚ÄØFinland, the happiest country in the world, enables a‚ÄØgreat quality of life. At‚ÄØVTT, we‚ÄØmake our people‚Äôs well-being a strategic priority. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), our benefits include extended occupational healthcare, and a range well-being services, such as exercise and culture benefits and hobby clubs. Read more about the benefits of living in Finland and VTT‚Äôs support for relocation .‚ÄØ
   
   
   

Apply now‚ÄØand‚ÄØjoin our community of brilliant minds!‚ÄØ

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut‚ÄØat the latest by 30 September 2024.‚ÄØWe will process applications as they come in, and fill in the position as soon as we find the right candidate.‚ÄØA security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.‚ÄØ

Interested and want to hear more?‚ÄØ

For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Tomi Lindroos, tomi.lindroos@vtt.fi , +358 50 3020227. ‚ÄØ

We look forward to hearing from you!‚ÄØ

description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know our Team:

The Data department oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

The Opportunity:

We think of Data Science in Agoda differently. For us, a data scientist is a fusion of core production skills with analytic and business skills. We‚Äôve brought top talents from (literally) all over the world who focus relentlessly on building products which utilize ML and AI as their main edge. We know that when you infuse ML and technology, you move from good to great and that is our mission. Our Data Science managers are action driven leaders that can form vivid vision and successfully direct their people to execute it while being strongly rooted in the details and practice.

As a Data Science Manager, you will:

Drive the growth of your team and build a diverse, entrepreneurial team. You are a developer of people. You love leading diverse teams of professionals with both qualitative and quantitative backgrounds using data-driven and insights-led approaches to respond quickly in a dynamic, competitive, and fast changing industry.

Get your hands dirty. Tackle complex problems in the online travel and ecommerce space using a range of ML and data analysis methods. Use our huge data repositories to push our business metrics to their bounds, directly and indirectly. Foster a culture that constantly raises the bar for us and others and supports the freedom to explore and innovate.

Work on tough problems. Can we detect causation between metrics and bookings? How can automatically answer our users‚Äô questions? How do we tune our AB testing platform to ensure we aren‚Äôt optimizing noise? How do we measure experiment success to properly trade off type I and II errors? What is the ideal caching strategy for prices and how do build an ML model to implement it? How can you detect anomalies within more than one million time-series that we track daily? Can you separate between bots and human traffic? Can you make our across-data-centers replication into smart replication using ML models? These are just a few of the diverse questions we tackle and some which you will lead your team to crack. You will be impacting every aspect of the business and it will require various techniques, from diving deep into data with SQL and Big Data tools, all the way to deploying modern machine learning models.

Deliver results. Work directly with the heads of the business departments and the product management team. Influence them with compelling product ideas based on data insights that can move the dial on our business.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:


 * Balance quantitative data analyses with qualitative user insights to uncover how our users book travel to drive new and existing product impact
 * Build, validate, test, and deploy machine learning or other data science models to predict and influence the behavior of consumers with the goal of optimizing products & processes
 * Test and validate insights via rapid experimentation and deployment
 * Interface with business/operation teams and key stakeholders at all levels to formulate solutions & product changes informed by your findings
 * Leverage data to help the business answer questions around further expansion, products, process optimization, cost optimization, customer acquisition/retention/churn and any other business goals that can be addressed through data insights
 * Form strong, cross-functional relationships with designers, product managers, software developers, and marketers who build, design, and optimize our technology and tools
   
   

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:


 * Vast analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
 * Experience in leading a team of both researchers and analysts preferably in an ecommerce, tech, banking, advertising or management consulting environment
 * Statistical knowledge and extreme proficiency in SQL. Comfortable with R, Python and Tableau. Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop/Vertica) is a plus
 * Strong understanding and implementation experience of predictive modeling algorithms such as regressions, time series, neural networks, clustering, decision trees and heuristic models, with familiarity dealing with tradeoffs between model performance and business needs
 * Experience combining user research and data science methodologies across multiple products and teams
 * Experience with research applications pertaining to user experience, marketing, and market insights
 * Fantastic communication skills that enable you to work cross-functionally with product managers, tech geeks and design gurus, building solid relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders
 * The ability to convey complex solutions to a less technical person
 * Bias for action
 * Advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Physics or Mathematics/Statistics preferred
   
   

We welcome both local and international applications for this role. Full visa sponsorship and relocation assistance available for eligible candidates.

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

description:
Open position for a Postdoctoral researcher in Inflammation and Infections research group

The laboratory of Karita Haapasalo at the Faculty of Medicine, Department of Bacteriology and Immunology is looking for a postdoctoral researcher or experienced PhD student.

The research is funded by the Research Council of Finland. The aim is to elucidate the role of complement activation and regulation in beta-Amyloid oligomerization and clearance. The research is multidisciplinary but is focused on immunology, biochemistry and cell biology.

Group website: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/researchgroups/inflammation-and-infections .

Position requirements: We are looking for a person who can complement our team. The applicant should be highly committed to research and have willingness to explore and interest in both molecular-based research and biomedicine. The project involves performing and designing experiments, data-analysis, writing and presenting data in English and supervision of students. The applicants should have a strong background of at least one of the major skills; biochemistry, immunology, microbiology or cell biology. Previous experience in iPSC and 3D culturing is considered a benefit. The candidate should be able to work both independently and as a part of a team.

Starting date and salary: The appointment will start asap and will be funded for 2 years with the possibility of continuation. A trial period of 6 months will be applied. The monthly salary will be determined according to the salary system at the employment unit.

The University of Helsinki offers comprehensive services to its employees, including occupational health care and health insurance, unemployment and pension fund, a generous holiday package, sports facilities, and opportunities for professional development: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/about-us/careers

How to apply: Applications should be submitted through the University of Helsinki Recruitment System via the "Apply now" button.

Internal applicants (i.e., current employees of the University of Helsinki) submit their applications by using the Employee Login button.

Applications should include:


 * A motivation letter
 * Transcript of records with grades
 * CV including publication list
 * At least one reference letter with contact details
   
   
   

Please submit your application, together with the required attachments in one pdf file.

The deadline: 13th October 2024

For further information please contact Karita Haapasalo: karita.haapasalo (at) helsinki.fi.

The University of Helsinki welcomes applicants of any gender and age, linguistic or cultural background, or minority group.

About us:

The University of Helsinki (UH), founded in 1640, is a vibrant scientific community of 40,000 students and researchers. It is one of the leading multidisciplinary research universities and ranks among the top 100 international universities in the world. It is currently investing heavily in life sciences research. UH offers comprehensive services to its employees, including occupational health care and health insurance, sports facilities, and opportunities for professional development.

The Faculty of Medicine promotes high quality scientific research. It provides research-based undergraduate and postgraduate education in medicine, dentistry, psychology and logopedics, and an international Master's Programme in Translational Medicine. It also offers psychotherapist education. In addition to its teaching and research activities, the faculty serves as a significant expert organisation in the healthcare sector and contributes to the discourse on ethics in the field. The faculty aims to be one of the best medical research faculties in the world, while reinforcing its status as a distinguished institution of multidisciplinary education in healthcare: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/faculty-of-medicine.

The Faculty of Medicine at the University of Helsinki constitutes the academic medical centre together with HUS Helsinki University Hospital and the Helsinki Institute of Life Science (HiLIFE). This medical centre has been successful in international comparisons, ranking among the top 10 medical campuses in Europe and the top 50 globally.

JOIN US TO BUILD A BETTER WORLD ‚Äì TOGETHER!

title: Postdoctoral researcher

description:
The Faculty of Agriculture and Forestry invites applications for the position of

POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCER / DOCTORAL RESEARCHER

for a fixed term position starting on 1 January 2025, or as agreed. The position is suited either for a Doctoral researcher, or for a Postdoctoral researcher. A Doctoral researcher is expected to work full time on the PhD thesis and to complete their thesis in three years.

The employment will extend over a period of 2-3 years, depending on the starting date of the contract and the type of the position (shorter for a Postdoctoral researcher, longer for a Doctoral researcher).

The position is located at the Department of Forest Sciences in the research group Forest Bioeconomy, Business, and Sustainability (FBBS). The position connects with the following projects:


 * Reduced emissions through wood use: Mitigation pathways towards carbon neutrality (REDEEM, funded by the Research Council of Finland)
 * Navigating European Forests and Forest Bioeconomy Sustainably to EU Climate Neutrality (ForestNavigator, coordinated by IIASA, funded by European Commission H2020)
   
   
   

REDEEM investigates the scale and timing of net greenhouse gas emissions in the event of an expanding bioeconomy and aims at realistic estimates of the forest sector‚Äôs contribution to the Paris Agreement by considering market dynamics and alternative carbon neutrality pathways. The project combines several methodological approaches and involves life cycle assessment (LCA), econometric analysis, simulation modelling, and future-oriented market research.

ForestNavigator assesses the climate change mitigation potential of European forests and forest-based sector through modelling of policy pathways, informing the public authorities on the most suitable approaches to forest policy and bioeconomy. The project relies on an integrated policy modelling framework for the EU forests and forest bioeconomy covering all relevant climate impacts and feedbacks, mitigation strategies, and forest ecosystem services. The University of Helsinki takes responsibility in assessing the future outlook of the European forest product markets and the climate change mitigation potential associated with industrial wood uses .

We are looking for a new team member to strengthen quantitative data analysis within the two projects, focused on consequential life cycle assessment (C-LCA) to estimate the avoided fossil emissions attributed to changes in wood uses and, more generally, climate change mitigation pathways in selected sectors.

Duties

Depending on the orientation and interests of the candidate, the duties may include:


 * Contributing to building a system dynamics model for the textiles sector for examining the climate change mitigation potential of industry strategies and policy interventions.
 * Modelling indirect market effects of chosen substitution cases, for example, with an open-source general equilibrium model (GTAP).
 * Determining carbon parity periods for selected substitution cases, and comparisons to carbon budgets.
 * Consequential LCA cases with an emphasis on market dynamics.
   
   
   

The duties may also include teaching and student supervision. Teaching tasks can account for up to 5 % of the annual working time.

Qualifications:


 * PhD (for Postdoc) / MSc (for Doctoral researcher) in a relevant discipline (applied economics, engineering, sustainability science, industrial ecology, etc.)
 * Strong background in one or more of the following: consequential LCA, simulation modelling (agent-based, system dynamics, or equilibrium modelling), programming (R or Python), econometrics and statistics
 * Proficiency in spoken and written English (at least level C1)
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, the ability to prioritise and organise her/his daily task, and the ability to work both independently and as a part of a research group
   
   
   

The appointee is expected to reside in Finland while employed by the University of Helsinki.

The appointee to a Doctoral researcher‚Äôs position should either already have the right to pursue a doctoral degree at the University of Helsinki by the start of the appointment or apply for the right and obtain it within the probationary period of six months of their appointment. If the appointee does not already have the right to pursue a doctoral degree at the University of Helsinki, it must be applied for separately, please see: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/admissions-and-education/apply-doctoral-programmes/how-apply-doctoral-programmes and https://www.helsinki.fi/en/research/doctoral-education/the-application-process-in-a-nutshell

Advantages:


 * Peer-reviewed publications in areas of expertise
 * Knowledge in life cycle assessment (LCA)
 * Knowledge in climate change mitigation
 * Openness to learning new skills
   
   
   

What We Offer

We are an equal opportunity employer and offer an attractive and diverse workplace in an inspiring and interdisciplinary research environment with a variety of development opportunities and benefits. The monthly gross salary will start from between ‚Ç¨2,400 to ‚Ç¨2,700 for a Doctoral researcher or between ‚Ç¨3,400 to ‚Ç¨3,800 for a Postdoctoral researcher, depending on the level of experience of the appointee. In addition, the University of Helsinki offers comprehensive services to its employees, including occupational health care and opportunities for professional development. Further information at https://www.helsinki.fi/en/university/working-at-the-university and https://www.helsinki.fi/en/research/doctoral-education .

The employment contract will include a probationary period of 6 months.

How To Apply

Applicants are requested to enclose with their applications the following documents as a single pdf file (file named: Application_family name_first name):


 * Curriculum vitae (maximum of 2 pages).
 * List of publications (if applicable).
 * Free-form motivation letter describing the applicant‚Äôs research interests, motivation toward the position, and qualifications for the subject, including relevant publications and specific software/programming skills which the applicant wants to highlight (1-2 pages).
 * Contact details for 1-2 referees (no support letters accepted).
   
   
   

Please submit your application via our recruitment system by 21.10.2024 (23.59 EEST).

External applicants, please submit your application using the University of Helsinki Recruitment System via Apply Now button.

Applicants who have a helsinki.fi -username and a valid employment contract, a grant researcher‚Äôs contract or a visiting researcher‚Äôs contract at the University of Helsinki are requested to leave their application by using the employee login.

FURTHER INFORMATION


 * About the position: Dr. Elias Hurmekoski, elias.hurmekoski@helsinki.fi, +358 50 414 0312.
 * Recruitment system: HR Specialist Mirkka Juntunen, mirkka.juntunent@helsinki.fi, tel +358 50 556 0748
 * Faculty of Agriculture and Forestry: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/faculty-agriculture-and-forestry
 * Viikki Campus: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/about-us/campuses/viikki-campus
 * Support for international staff: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/about-us/careers/welcome and https://ihhelsinki.fi (International House Helsinki)
   
   
   

The position is located in the Forest Bioeconomy, Business and Sustainability research group, based at Department of Forest Sciences. More info: https://www.helsinki.fi/en/researchgroups/forest-bioeconomy-business-and-sustainability .

The Faculty of Agriculture and Forestry is nationally unique faculty with a high international standing. The mission of the faculty is to promote the sustainable use of renewable natural resources through scientific research and research-based teaching. We focus on agricultural and forest sciences, food and nutrition, microbiology, as well as on economics and management.

description:
The Finnish Museum of Natural History invites applications for a

Postdoctoral Researcher in Data Science/Evolutionary Biology

a fixed-term employment for two years starting between January‚ÄîApril 2025. The work will be based at the Finnish Museum of Natural History, Helsinki, Finland.

About The Position

The postdoctoral researcher will join the project ‚ÄúPhenoBees: a knowledgebase and integrative approach for studying the evolution of morphological traits in bees‚Äù funded by the Research Council of Finland .

The main goal of the project is to develop a semantic data workflow to integrate comparative information from different phylogenetic datasets and address hypotheses about the evolution of the mouthparts of bees. The research will result in a knowledgebase of phenotypic traits of bees (PhenoBees) and new tools to analyze comparative semantic data.

The postdoctoral researcher will work under the supervision of Diego S. Porto ( https://researchportal.helsinki.fi/en/persons/diego-sasso-porto , https://diegosasso.github.io/ ) to develop a workflow for processing and analyzing comparative phenotypic data employing a common framework based on semantic data and computational ontologies. The workflow will be a core component in the development of the PhenoBees knowledgebase (for more details, see: https://github.com/diegosasso/PhenoBees/wiki ).

The main tasks of the postdoctoral researcher will include developing and testing a workflow to input, process, and output semantic descriptions of organismal phenotypes (e.g., morphological traits of bees). The workflow will be based on a newly developed computer language to describe organismal phenotypes: Phenoscript (for more details, see: https://github.com/sergeitarasov/PhenoScript/wiki ).

Additionally, the candidate will have the opportunity to supervise master‚Äôs students and participate in teaching, if desired. However, no more than 5 % of annual working time is used for teaching, and it is recommended that teaching is linked to the individual‚Äôs own research interest when possible.

Qualifications


 * The appointee to the position of postdoctoral researcher shall hold a doctoral degree. The default assumption is that the degree requirement must be met by the beginning of employment.
 * The ability to conduct independent scholarly work as well as possess the teaching skills necessary for the position.
 * Experience with the development and/or application of computational tools for working with biodiversity data..
 * Knowledge of semantic data models and semantic web technologies and/or experience with ontological engineering is highly regarded.
 * Clear motivation to perform the work in the team.
 * Excellent communication skills in English.
   
   
   

In addition, the ideal candidate would have previous experience in any of the following fields: taxonomy, phylogenetics, ecology, or evolutionary biology.

The postdoctoral researcher is expected to be capable of working both independently and collaboratively to achieve the main goals of the project, in addition to taking part in writing manuscripts and attending international conferences. Given the interdisciplinary nature of the research project, the candidate should be open to learn new skills from different fields of science (e.g., taxonomy/phylogenetics, computer sciences) and communicate effectively with researchers with different backgrounds.

What We Offer

The salary of the postdoctoral researcher will be based on level 5 of the demands level chart for teaching and research personnel in the salary system of Finnish universities. In addition, the appointee will be paid a salary component based on personal performance. The starting salary of the postdoctoral researcher will be ca. 3500-3800 euros/month, depending on the appointee's qualifications and experience. A six-month trial period will be applied.

The project includes a diverse team of international collaborators with different expertise, ranging from hymenopteran anatomy, evolutionary biology, ecology/conservation, statistical modeling, and computer science. Thus, the candidate will have the opportunity to network with different research communities and establish connections in various domains of science. If successful, the efforts of the postdoctoral researcher will contribute to the advance of an exciting emerging research program integrating data science and evolutionary biology: onto-phylogenetics.

The University of Helsinki invests in the welfare of its employees by offering preventive occupational health services and general medical care, sports facilities, and opportunities for professional development. For further information please check: Staff benefits . Luomus is an equal opportunity workplace committed to advance wellbeing and diversity and promote gender equality in science and education. We welcome applicants from a variety of gender identities, and linguistic and cultural backgrounds, and minorities.

The appointee is expected to reside in Finland while employed by the University of Helsinki. The University assists employees from abroad with their transition to work and life in Finland. Finland is a member of the EU, has high quality free schooling (also in English), generous family benefits and healthcare. Read more about why the University of Helsinki is an excellent career choice working at the University of Helsinki and living in Finland .

How to apply?

The application should include the following documents in English as a single pdf called ‚Äúlastname_firstname_app_phenobees‚Äù:


 * Motivation letter (max 1 page).
 * Researcher¬¥s CV (max 4 pages). Please follow these instructions: TENK .
 * List of publications. Please, also indicate the 5 most relevant publications for the position.
 * Contact information of two persons who can provide a reference letter based on request.
   
   
   

Please submit your application via our recruitment system by 31.10.2024 (23.59 EET). External applicants, please submit your application using the University of Helsinki Recruitment System via Apply Now button. Employees of the University of Helsinki must submit their applications through the SAP Fiori portal: https://msap.sap.helsinki.fi

About LUOMUS

The Finnish Museum of Natural History LUOMUS is an independent institute of the University of Helsinki and the national museum in the field of natural history in Finland. The museum‚Äôs duties are to amass, maintain and display its collections, and to conduct related research, particularly in the field of species-level biodiversity. The collections serve research, teaching, and public education in biology, geology, and biodiversity, and form part of the international network of natural history repositories. The Finnish Museum of Natural History has five units: Botany and Mycology, Zoology, Earth Sciences, Biodiversity Informatics and Public Engagement. It has about 250 staff members, from which the Zoology Unit has a staff of about 85 persons, including both permanent and temporary employees.

Further information

Further information about the position can be obtained from Dr. Diego S. Porto: diego.sassoporto(at)helsinki.fi.

Further information about the recruitment process can be obtained from HR: hr-erla(at)helsinki.fi
title: Postdoctoral Researcher in Data Science/Evolutionary Biology

description:
Aalto University is where science and art meet technology and business. We shape a sustainable future by making research breakthroughs in and across our disciplines, sparking the game changers of tomorrow and creating novel solutions to major global challenges. Our community is made up of 13 000 students, 400 professors and close to 4 500 other faculty and staff working on our dynamic campus in Espoo, Greater Helsinki, Finland. Diversity is part of who we are, and we actively work to ensure our community‚Äôs diversity and inclusiveness. This is why we warmly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to join our community.

About The Position

We are now looking for a DOCTORAL RESEARCHER in ‚Äúapplication of machine learning for model development in hydrogen reactive flows‚Äú. We are also open to receive applications by those who have not finished their Master‚Äôs thesis yet. You may start as a research assistant to finalize your Master's degree and start the doctoral research position right after that.


 * Are you familiar with machine learning concepts and programming?
 * Are you interested in obtaining hand-on practice in computation fluid dynamics for reactive flows?
 * Are you passionate about application of machine learning in computational fluid dynamics?
   
   

If you answered YES to these questions, this position is definitely suitable for you!

The research will be carried out at Aalto University‚Äôs Energy Conversion and System research group at the Department of Mechanical Engineering. In this position you will have a chance to make an impact on developing advanced numerical models for turbulent reactive flows of e-fuels including ammonia/hydrogen blends using machine learning techniques.

You will develop advanced numerical models using detailed CFD data such as direct numerical simulations (DNS). Also, you will gain experience in conducting high-fidelity numerical simulations and analyzing your data using machine learning techniques. You will have the opportunity of research visits to the best research groups of the field around the world as well as meeting highly-talented researchers of the field through international seminars and conferences.

Your research will be part of a research project in which your work will consist of computational studies to find proper numerical models for turbulent reactive flows. In this work, you will be able to interact with other computational researchers in our group working on various other applications (e.g. combustion in burners/engines, numerical modeling, programming, etc). As part of your doctoral candidate duties, you will also gain experience in teaching and instructing other students.

Your Experience And Ambitions

We are looking for a passionate person that would have the following skills:

Essential


 * Master‚Äôs degree in physics, mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, computer science or a closely related field. If you don‚Äôt have your Master‚Äôs degree yet, you may also start a research assistant
 * Strong interest in fluids physics, modeling, and numerical simulation
 * Experience in programming e.g.in Python or C++ and ability to work in Linux environment
 * Academic background in machine learning techniques
 * Basic knowledge in computational fluid dynamics
 * Demonstrated academic excellence in previous studies
   
   

Beneficial


 * Experience with using/programming in OpenFOAM
 * Knowledge on advanced data analysis tools
   
   

What We Offer

The salary of a starting Doctoral researcher is currently 2720 ‚Ç¨ / month (gross), increasing as milestones for the PhD are achieved (highest PhD researcher level is currently 3403 ‚Ç¨/month). The annual workload of research and teaching staff at Aalto University is currently 1612 hours. The employment contract includes occupational health care, and Finland has a comprehensive social security system. The employment relationship is full-time, fixed-term employment at Aalto University. The first contract will be made for 2 years, with a possibility of extension, based on your performance, after passing the midterm review. The doctoral candidate will be expected to contribute also to teaching (max 20% of her/his time).

Join us! How to apply

To apply, please share the following application materials with us through our recruitment site ("Apply now!‚Äù).


 * A one-page motivation letter detailing 10 most important and concrete aspects (e.g. most relevant courses and grades, software skills, M.Sc. education, publications, etc) that would support selecting you
 * Your CV
 * Your study certificates on Master‚Äôs and Bachelor‚Äôs degrees
 * Your study records from Master‚Äôs and Bachelor‚Äôs degrees
 * A copy of your Master‚Äôs thesis and most important publications (if any)
 * Contact details of at least two referees
   
   

Please note that the applicants are not expected to apply to the Aalto doctoral programme at this point ‚Äì only the successful candidate will do this at the next application window.

The deadline for applications is no later than 27th of October 2024, at 23:59 Finnish time (UTC +2). Possible interviews (via MS Teams) will take place after the shortlisting process. Please note that we want the successful candidate to start as soon as possible and by 1st of February 2025 the latest, and we ask the applicants to only apply if this timeline is feasible for them.

Please note: Aalto University‚Äôs employees should apply for the position via our internal HR system Workday (Internal Jobs) by using their existing Workday user account (not via the external webpage for open positions). Aalto University‚Äôs students and visitors should apply as external candidates with personal (not aalto) email.

Aalto University reserves the right for justified reasons to leave the position open, to extend the application period, and reopen the application process.

Further information

For additional information, please contact Dr. Shervin Karimkashi (shervin.karimkashiarani@aalto.fi). In questions related to the recruitment process, please contact elmeri.martikainen@aalto.fi.

Want to know more about us?

Check out our new virtual campus experience: https://virtualtour.aalto.fi/

About Finland

Finland is a great place for living with or without family ‚Äì it is a safe, politically stable and well-organized Nordic society. Finland is consistently ranked high in quality of life and was just listed again as the happiest country in the world: https://worldhappiness.report/news/its-a-three-peat-finland-keeps-top-spot-as-happiest-country-in-world/. For more information about living in Finland: https://www.aalto.fi/en/careers-at-aalto/for-international-staff .

description:
The Finnish Institute for Verification of the Chemical Weapons Convention (VERIFIN) is looking for a PhD researcher for an EU project focusing on research in the field of biological toxins.

A person who has previous experience with chromatographic methods and mass spectrometry as well as experience with different sample preparation methods is best suited for the position. However, the key qualities are a passion for scientific research and the ability to work with a degree of independence. The applicant must have a master's degree in biochemistry, analytical chemistry, or organic chemistry. Fluent English language skills are required from the applicant. Finnish language skills are considered an advantage.

The position is expected to start in January 2025, and it is for a duration of three years. The applicant should either hold a doctoral study right at University of Helsinki or be able to attain one within the 6 months trial period at the beginning of employment.

How To Apply

Please submit your application, together with the attachments, through the University of Helsinki Recruitment System via the link "Apply now". Applicants who are currently employed by the University of Helsinki are requested to submit their application via the SAP Fiori portal at https://msap.sap.helsinki.fi. The closing date for applications is November 14, 2024.

Additional information regarding the position can be inquired from the Director of VERIFIN Hanna Hakulinen (hanna.hakulinen(at)helsinki.fi) and LC-MS laboratory manager Matti Kjellberg (matti.kjellberg(at)helsinki.fi).
