description:
This is a fast-paced engineering role in Linux-based software-defined infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM) and containerization (Docker/LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), up to OpenStack and Kubernetes, and the open source applications running on top of them. It will challenge you to show the breadth of engineering skill needed to work on almost any aspect of Ubuntu and the open source things people run with it.

This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have an affinity for open source development, great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.

Location: This is a remote role, we have teams in all time zones.

This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require software engineering for upstream bug fixes. Our engineers have to be able to work productively at any level of the stack above the kernel, in a wide range of languages, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our enterprise customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.

You will help with troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and bug fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.

What your day will look like


 * Resolve complex customer problems related to Ubuntu, Kernel, Ceph, OpenStack, or Kubernetes and other open source software
 * Maintain a close working relationship with Canonical's field, support and product engineering teams
 * Participate in upstream communities
 * Develop bug fixes, backport patches, and work with upstream for inclusion
 * Review code produced by other engineers
 * Demonstrate good judgment in technical methods and techniques
 * Prioritize work and manage your time effectively against those priorities
 * Participate in team discussions to improve processes, tools, and documentation
 * Maintain clear, technical and concise communications
 * Work from home and travel internationally up to 10% of work time for team meetings, events and conferences
   
   

What we are looking for in you


 * Professional experience as a software engineer
 * Background in Computer Science, STEM or similar
 * Strong experience with Linux, and at least one of the following:
    * Ceph, OpenStack, Kubernetes or other cloud technologies

 * Strong development-level experience with at least one of Python, Go, C or C++ on Linux
 * Ability to troubleshoot with debugging tools like gdb
 * Familiarity with git source code repositories and branches
 * An exceptional academic track record
 * Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events
   

Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring


 * You love technology and working with brilliant people
 * You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
 * You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
 * You have interest in, and experience with most of the following: Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, Kubernetes, OpenStack, Ceph, QEMU/KVM, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, C, Postgresql, Mongo, Debian packaging, distributed systems
   
   

What we offer you

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


 * Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
 * Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
 * Annual compensation review
 * Recognition rewards
 * Annual holiday leave
 * Maternity and paternity leave
 * Employee Assistance Programme
 * Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
 * Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
   
   

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
title: Software Engineer, Sustaining Engineering

description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, edge computing, and IoT. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Your role will be to help us provide easy to deploy, secure, and customizable industrial edge solutions. You will work on designing and implementing applications that run on constrained IoT devices to powerful gateways. Embedded systems and Linux will be at the core of your everyday challenges.

In our team we value collaboration, peer reviews, good integration/unit testing and writing maintainable code. General knowledge and experience with Linux as a developer platform is required.

What you'll do


 * Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
 * Develop and maintain open source IoT application packages
 * Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
 * Review code produced by upstream and/or other engineers at Canonical
 * Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
 * Experiment with Ubuntu Core and showcase industry-grade IoT solutions
 * Work on Matter, the connectivity standard unifying smart homes
 * Contribute to the development of IoT platforms
 * Participate in IoT standardisation working group discussions and planning (Connectivity Standards Alliance, Web of Things, etc)
 * Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events
   
   

Who you are


 * Proven track record of at least 3 years of professional software development using Go or C++.
 * You have experience working with RESTful APIs, MQTT or other messaging protocols
 * You are familiar with wireless communication protocols such as WiFi, BLE, Zigbee, Z-Wave, and Thread
 * You have interest and experience with a few of the following:
    * Containers (docker, kubernetes)
    * Linux distributions
    * Snap, debian, or RPM packaging
    * Shell scripting
    * CI/CD (Github Actions, Gitlab CI, etc)
    * IoT frameworks and protocols
    * Real-time applications

 * You value soft skills, communication and advocacy, and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
 * You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
   

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
title: Software Engineer - Industrial IoT

description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.

Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.

Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.

Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

What you'll do


 * Proactively collaborate within and contribute to design, architecture, and feature-selection for solutions across distributed teams
 * Write high-quality, API-first Python code with unit tests
 * Debug issues and produce high-quality fixes
 * Review code produced by other engineers
 * Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 times a year for internal and external events
   
   

Who you are


 * You love technology, working with brilliant people, and solving interesting problems
 * You are a strategic thinker
 * You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
 * You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
 * You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
 * You have proficiency delivering robust code to production, preferably written in Python.
 * You have experience and enjoy maintaining and improving large and mature web applications.
 * You have experience with databases, ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus), data management, and data modelling.
 * You have an interest in, or experience with, integration, infrastructure and operations.
 * You believe that robust security requires conscious efforts at every stage of delivery.
 * You have familiarity with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
 * You have a solid understanding of the structure of various software packaging systems, including Debian/Ubuntu packages.
   
   

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

UI Developer




Integrify is an upskilling and recruitment services provider that brings together software developers and Finnish tech teams. We recruit, train, and connect talented developers to teams seeking new expertise. Over 150 organizations trust us, with companies like ABB, Telia, TietoEvry, Digia, and Fujitsu hiring experts through our services. Our goal is to ensure that our client companies can rely on the quality of our tech talents and their technical expertise to advance their business.

description:
Can‚Äôt find an open position to match your niche of tech competence? üëá

We are always looking for new talent to grow our team of tech professionals. If you are a developer, data scientist or data engineer with interest in marketing analytics, we want you to join us and be part of the team finding and designing smart solutions to challenging technical problems in our unique product.

üéØ We‚Äôd like to hear from you if you have:


 * Several years of experience working as a developer, data scientist, consultant, or in a similar role in the industry
 * Experience with AWS or other cloud platforms
 * Fluent English skills, other languages are considered an advantage
 * Hands-on skills with our tech stack (python, vue.js, node.js)
 * Willingness to work in Finland
   
   

üéØ What we offer you:

We are a fast-growing team of 40+ exceptionally talented people and our story will be something you don't want to miss! We are on a mission to enable retailers & consumer brands to accelerate their growth by making smarter data-driven decisions. Our SaaS is an AI tool for marketing teams to holistically evaluate and improve the effectiveness of marketing and promotional activities. We are not a company that only shows cool marketing metrics or fancy dashboards ‚Äì we deliver real impact.

With us you'll get the chance to be part of journey like no other: Our product is globally unique, it's giving measurable impact to our customers and we have some of the most talented experts within their field to share the journey with. Sellforteans are a team that works globally together to conquer challenges and we strive for a low hierarchy where best ideas win over titles or authority.

Developing and managing such a complex product like ours isn't always only rainbows and butterflies, but our successful journey so far has proved that teamwork makes the dream work (or at least that together nothing‚Äôs impossible). We believe that sharing information enables us to tap into the collective brainpower of the whole team to find the best solutions to hardest problems.

We offer you flexibility to find your work-life balance - We understand that nine to five doesn't fit for all. Also, we offer you lunch and activity benefits, full holidays from the start and option program. As a fast growing company we can offer growth - both business and individual.

üéØ How to apply:

So tell us, potential future colleague: what kind of technology talent do you represent, and what would you like to do at Sellforte?

Send us your application and answer few questions about your technical skills and future dreams. Applications are only accepted through the form below. Please note that we review open applications on an irregular basis. Due to the volume of applications we receive, it's possible that we may not be able to respond to each one individually. We appreciate your understanding in this regard.

During our recruitment process and couple of interview rounds you'll get to meet your future team members and stakeholders and you'll be showing us your skills in a case task. Our talent acquisition team will keep you informed along the way.

We hope to hear from you soon! üòä

description:
Senior Data Scientist - Product Company - Growth Opportunity




The role:

The Senior Data Scientist will be part of the Data Science team in the Engineering Department. You will report directly into the Data Science Team Lead.




As part of your main responsibilities, you will:

 * Bring strong expertise and know-how in Data Science and Machine Learning (ML) Engineering.
 * Be the primary go-to person for data Analysis and ML topics.
 * Reinforce the company's technical project management capabilities by effectively coordinating project development across the Data Science stack.
 * Contribute his/her experience and fresh ideas to the team for building and maintaining ML models at scale.




Your task:

Our client believes in setting clear objectives. Here are their expectations for your first 6 months as a Senior Data Scientist:

 * After 2-3 weeks, you will add value as an Individual Contributor on data analysis, model development and machine learning productization.
 * After 4 months, you will demonstrate a thorough understanding of the company‚Äôs business domain and application-specific features.
 * After 6 months, you will effectively drive a project and be in charge of communication with the Product team.




What leads to success:

With 5yrs+ experience in building ML models with multiple data sources, operating ML models at scale and sales predictions using different types of data or marketing mix modelling, you will be a great team player with excellent communication skills with technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technologies you are expected to master: Python, SQL, AWS or other cloud infrastructures.




To be successful in this role, you will be:

 * Results-driven, by always looking for solutions, not excuses. Willing to go the extra mile when needed.
 * Quality-driven: committed to building robust, maintainable, and high-performance code.
 * A holistic thinker who looks at the bigger picture, striving to include both what the company customers and the business need.
 * Highly ambitious, with a proactive approach to your own professional growth.
 * Flexible and effective in a hybrid working environment.




They offer:

 * Opportunities for professional growth in a fast-growing, evolving company
 * Office with a view in downtown Helsinki, remote work possible
 * Employee benefits
 * Occupational Pensions
 * Lunch benefits
 * Equity




This is a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.

Email: s.king@nigelfrank.com

Phone: +358 75 326 6584

I will call you to discuss your skill-set further.

description:
Are you interested in electromobility and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Would you like to develop innovative technology with superb colleagues who are top experts in their field? Are you enthusiastic about working with fascinating projects in the state-of-the-art research facilities? VTT might be just the place for you.

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2300 brilliant minds focuses on creating impact through science-based innovation. In recent years, we have created ground-breaking innovations such as the world's fastest and most accurate radiation detector, a cancer-sniffing sensor device for smartphones, and a headphone set entirely made of microbial materials. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for Research / Senior Scientist to join our Electromobility team for a fixed-term period until 31.12.2025.

In this position, you will have an essential role in developing our expertise on charging infrastructure design, focusing especially on cost-effective, bi-directional and interoperable slow-charging solutions. Another focus area is megawatt charging systems aimed for electrification of heavy-duty vehicles such as electric trucks. You will be working in ambitious EU projects and national projects, contributing to a variety of topics such as use case definition, requirements specification, conceptualization of charging solutions as well as planning and implementation of demonstrations and testing of prototype solutions in our EV charging laboratory.

Our team, Electromobility works on the electrification of transport to tackle climate change by accelerating the shift from the use of fossil fuels towards sustainable transport. We work on electric vehicles and their components, and we have a strong focus on both experimental work and modelling of components and vehicles.


 * Video about our electric vehicle and battery technology research
 * Electric vehicles
 * Batteries
 * Blog post about developments in electric transport
   
   
   

The position is fixed-term until 31.12.2025. Start of employment preferably in November or December 2024, at latest in January 2025.

Your responsibilities as Research / Senior Scientist:


 * Advancing charging infrastructure design methodology development.
 * Collaborating in research team and project group with co-writing and project work.
 * Participating in new project preparations, especially within the Horizon Europe work programme.
 * Participating actively in dissemination with journal publications and presenting results in conferences and seminars.
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * You have at least a Master of Science (Tech.) degree in Electrical Engineering or similar related field. PhD is considered an asset.
 * You are interested in electric vehicle research field and have knowledge of power electronics, electric vehicle charging systems, electrical powertrains, and related technologies.
 * You preferably have some experience in project preparation or experience in coordinating, managing or applying for projects.
 * You have an interest in scientific publication. Existing peer-reviewed publications are considered an asset.
 * You have excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * A fast learner, capable of working in a flexible and independent manner and collaborating with colleagues across different fields of science and technology. We appreciate curiosity, passion as well as the ability to take the long-term perspective and find beyond-the-obvious solutions. We hope that you enjoy versatile projects, and you have willingness to learn new things.
   
   
   

With VTT, you‚Äôll enjoy:


 * Visionary work in technology. We offer positions at the cutting-edge of technology and engineering, from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy ‚Äì the path of exponential hope .
 * Fascinating projects, excellent research environment. Our researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects locally and internationally. At VTT, you'll have state-of-the-art research facilities, such as Micronova, the Finnish research infrastructure for micro-, nano-, and quantum technologies.
 * Great career opportunities, superb colleagues. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over ten years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun. Read more about our organisational culture as the builder of the world's most meaningful place to work.
 * Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture excellent team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation and cognitive ergonomics training.
   
   
   

Apply now and join our community of brilliant minds!

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut at the latest by 20 October 2024. We will process applications as they come in and fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate. A security clearance procedure may be conducted during the recruitment process.

Interested and want to know more?

For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Ari Hentunen, ari.hentunen@vtt.fi, +358 40 5500161 on Thursday 3.10. at 9:30‚Äì11 or Friday 11.10. at 13‚Äì14 (Europe/Helsinki).

We look forward to hearing from you!

Location: Tampere (Visiokatu 4) or Espoo (Tietotie 4 C).

VTT

VTT is a visionary research, development and innovation partner. We drive sustainable growth and tackle the biggest global challenges of our time and turn them into growth opportunities. We go beyond the obvious to help the society and companies to grow through technological innovations. We have 80 years of experience of top-level research and science-based results. VTT is at the sweet spot where innovation and business come together.

VTT ‚Äì beyond the obvious.
title: Research Scientist / Senior Scientist, Electromobility (fixed-term)

description:
Do you want to make a real impact accelerating global energy production transitioning to zero-carbon systems and work in a startup-like environment?

In Elisa‚Äôs International Digital Services, you can join a multidisciplinary team that is harnessing data and AI to overcome issues arising from wind and solar becoming the main forms of energy production. As a Senior Software Engineer, you would bring your expertise on developing complex mission critical software systems to the team and enable us pilot and scale the new solutions to commercial reality. Most of our work is backend heavy (Python) but as with all the small teams we appreciate broad set of skills. If you have skills and interests to work with frontend and data, great!

Are you excited about energy ecosystem transforming to zero-carbon era? Do you enjoy developing new solution concepts from idea stage to pilot installations to full-scale commercial launch? Can you see what should be technically feasible and progress towards that by iteratively removing the largest uncertainties first building high quality code? Can you conquer complex problems by dividing them into easier to track sub-components, and keep stakeholders involved on where the current priorities are?

The easiest analogy of what we‚Äôre building is to think of connecting thousands of Tesla powerwalls into a virtual powerplant. Read more about our project to use telecom towers to build a more energy-efficient future.

We are functioning like a startup within the larger Elisa corporation, proving that it is truly possible to combine the perks of a lean startup business with the resources and financial stability of a corporation. As we are growing fast and changing all the time, you will have a great chance to evolve the role yourself.

What the role is all about?

You will be designing and implementing software and systems to build up a comprehensive and high-quality distributed system in the technical domain of Smart Energy Solutions.

Our working environment is agile and fast-paced and we are constantly looking for ways to improve our processes. Hopefully, you‚Äôll enjoy this type of atmosphere as much as we do!

We‚Äôre working with a broad stack ‚Äì all the way from embedded battery management systems to ETL pipelines, distributed systems and mobile applications.

What do we expect from you?


 * Solid experience in modern software development (DevOps, Test Driven, Agile, clean code) building products
 * Python is very familiar to you, especially in the context of mission critical and data intensive applications
 * You are a team player used to working in a startup-like environment
 * Experience with highly distributed near real time systems
 * Great but not mandatory: If you have frontend development experience (React) and mobile experience (Flutter)
 * Nice to have: AWS experience, experience building ETL pipelines and datalakes (Databricks), Machine Learning experience and energy market knowledge is a plus
   
   

Here are some of the techs we‚Äôre using: Python, Pytest, SNMP, Asynchronous development, Machine Learning, Databricks, AWS, Azure, React, Flutter

Most of our team is based in Helsinki (some in Tampere and Turku), but like the rest of the elisians, we can work flexibly (in Southern Finland).

Why join us?

You will be given a large portion of responsibility, but equal amounts of freedom and trust. We‚Äôre a small team of 10+ engineers working on a new disruptive solution to the energy markets ‚Äì a true startup but inside Elisa.

Elisa has been ranked as one of the Finland's best employers for many years, for many reasons: huge amounts of flexibility, a friendly and laid-back working environment, great leadership that we are truly proud of, a continuous curiosity and an innovative aim to develop, as well as a fundamental invitation to come as you are. We understand and honor the fact that each Elisian comes with families, hobbies, problems, backgrounds and lives of their own. Read more about Elisa and the elisians here.

We can't wait to get to know you a bit better! We will start the interviews immediately with promising candidates, so submit your application through the link below as soon as possible! If you have any questions about the role, please turn to Pekka Kosonen (https://www.linkedin.com/in/pekkak) at pekka.kosonen (a) elisa.com or +358 50 5066763.

The chosen candidate will undergo drug test and a security clearance vetting, which in turn requires having stayed in Finland for multiple years.

description:
Are you interested in experimental materials research, and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Are you enthusiastic about participating in projects with scientific impact? VTT might be just the place for you.

VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning, and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2000 brilliant minds from almost 60 different nationalities is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation. Get to know us further by exploring VTT's tech & infra .

We are now looking for a Research Scientist to join our Fatigue and Fracture Mechanics team.

As a Research Scientist, your key goal is to create impact to society and our customers through scientific excellence. In this position, you will have an essential role in carrying out strategically aligned project work involving experimental research on fusion materials. Your role may be as an expert, project manager or both.

Our team, Fatigue and Fracture Mechanics works on a range of topics related to structural integrity and ageing phenomena of metals across a range of industries targeting low carbon solutions, in particular the materials utilized in nuclear power plants. We create impact through reliable high quality experimental research conducted to thoroughly understand and quantify the mechanical behaviour of materials in demanding applications and environments. Our materials research laboratories are located in Otaniemi in Espoo. They include modern facilities for safely testing neutron irradiated materials in the radiological laboratory of the VTT Centre for Nuclear Safety, and another laboratory for other industrial sectors more broadly. The latter will move to a totally new materials research laboratory currently under construction on the same campus.

See more about our research: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJK4GEfgKvg

Your responsibilities as a Research Scientist:


 * Participating in project preparation and planning your own research work as a subject matter expert.
 * Developing, producing, and characterising novel structural, functional, or wall materials for fusion applications and assessing their response to intense heat and radiation loads.
 * Reporting progress and results to stakeholder groups, including external customers.
 * Acting as a project manager in research or customer projects.
 * Guiding, developing and supervising experimental research with laboratory personnel. One particular focus area is small punch testing of irradiated materials.
 * Additional responsibilities can be tailored based on the applicant‚Äôs background.
   
   
   

Who we are looking for:


 * You have a university degree (Master‚Äôs or PhD) in mechanical engineering, materials engineering or similar.
 * You are familiar with the mechanical behaviour of materials and strength of materials.
 * You have previous working experience in R&D oriented or engineering projects.
 * You have English communication skills for at least professional working.
   
   
   

It is beneficial, but not mandatory, if you also have:


 * Practical laboratory experience with (small-scale) mechanical testing techniques.
 * Understanding of surface analyses including electron microscopy and ion-beam analyses (e.g., secondary ion mass spectrometry).
 * Project management experience.
 * Communication skills in Finnish.
   
   
   

As a person, we hope that you are:


 * Curious to learn and develop new skills through creative problem-solving.
 * Capable of both individual and teamwork, including leading project teams.
 * Willing to work in a multidisciplinary organization.
 * Prepared also for practical laboratory work with strict quality and safety standards. Your duties may involve work with pressure equipment or remote-handling of radioactive material samples using specialized Hot Cell facilities.
    * Read more about VTT‚Äôs Hot Cell laboratory: https://www.vttresearch.com/en/ourservices/vtt-centre-nuclear-safety#hot-cell
    * Watch a video about Hot Cells: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJK4GEfgKvg
      
      

What we offer you:


 * Visionary work in technology. We offer positions at the cutting edge of technology and engineering from next-generation microelectronics and quantum technology to automation and robotics, energy systems, and more. Our research agenda is dedicated to creating sustainable growth by solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating a real, positive impact. Read more about our strategy ‚Äì the path of exponential hope .
 * Fascinating projects, excellent research environment. Our researchers get to work on a combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects, both locally and internationally. In our team, you will have state-of-the-art research facilities at your disposal in the Centre for Nuclear Safety laboratory , and work with topics at the forefront of carbon-free energy production technologies.
 * Great career opportunities, and superb colleagues. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us for over 10 years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. Collaborating in a cross-disciplinary community with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.
 * Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture great team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good work-life balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays annually (after one year of work), we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation programs and training on cognitive ergonomics.
   
   
   

Apply now and join our community of brilliant minds!

Please‚ÄØsend your CV and application with your salary request via our recruitment system as soon as possible‚ÄØbut at the latest by 13 October 2024. We will process applications as they come in, and fill in the position as soon as we find the right candidate. A security clearance procedure will be conducted for the person selected for the role.

Interested and want to know more?

For further information, please contact Research Team Leader Tommi Sepp√§nen, tommi.seppanen@vtt.fi , +358 40 130 4618 on 27 September at 13‚Äì14 or 4 October at 11‚Äì12 (Finnish time UCT+3).

We look forward to hearing from you!

VTT

VTT is a visionary research, development and innovation partner. We drive sustainable growth and tackle the biggest global challenges of our time and turn them into growth opportunities. We go beyond the obvious to help the society and companies to grow through technological innovations. We have 80 years of experience of top-level research and science-based results. VTT is at the sweet spot where innovation and business come together.

VTT ‚Äì beyond the obvious.

Please see our other open positions and read more about us from our career pages .

description:
Do you get excited when hearing about trademarks and brand protection news? YES?! So do we! At Corsearch, there‚Äôs no pushing trademark solutions and brand protection from our thoughts. We‚Äôre thinking about coined trademarks in the car, a detailed design search over lunch, counterfeits while sitting with the in-laws, and anti-piracy while working out

We are a mission-led company, driven by a passion for making the world better and safer for our brand customers and their consumers. It‚Äôs what we do. And people come to Corsearch to be challenged, developed, supported, and valued üëç













‚úÖThe Role

This opportunity offers the chance to work on a new project with a modern tech stack, within a community of skilled software developers.

It features flexible working hours in a hybrid model, allowing you to work from home or at our central Helsinki office.

The role comes with significant responsibility, creating personal growth, and the ability to make a meaningful impact on the product.













‚úÖResponsibilities And Duties

 * Work in an agile Kanban team
 * Plan and design and implement software applications, components, and interfaces.
 * Perform pair programming and pull request reviews
 * Trusted to work in the best way possible and have flexible working hours













‚úÖEssential

 * At least 2-3 years of experience with React and TypeScript
 * Solid experience in CSS and Sass
 * Love to practice functional programming
 * Experience using, designing, and building REST APIs
 * Experience in Git
 * Capability to work both autonomously and as a part of a team
 * Fluent in both verbal and written English
 * Great communication and social skills
 * Good eye for visual details










Understanding of Node.js, Deno, Docker, Scala, SQL, cloud computing (preferably AWS) with monitoring/logging tools like NewRelic, and other backend technologies is an advantage. Experience with Figma and Storybook is a plus







Corsearch is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and does not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, nationality, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other protected characteristic. Together, we are working proactively to build a workplace where everyone can belong and be at their best selves. Together, we make an Impact.










Trusted by over 5,000 customers worldwide, Corsearch delivers AI-powered data, deep analytics, and professional services that support brands to market their assets, drive growth, and optimise brand presence against infringement.

Corsearch enables brand owners to discover, monitor and control the use and misuse of their brands and associated products and services online and is the industry market leader.

Corsearch does this in an increasingly complex global digital environment, with online brand protection solutions that cover everything from anti-counterfeiting to anti-piracy.

description:
Unlock your full potential and join Accenture Quality Engineering today!

We offer roles in fascinating client projects of complex software deliveries that will develop you further as a Quality Engineering professional. In the Accenture Finland Quality Engineering Services (QES) you will also be part of the Nordic QES pool of highly skilled quality engineers and architects, test automation and non-functional engineers fully enabled with modern test automation and agile approaches and delivering modern quality engineering services to leverage Accenture expertise to support our clients' businesses. You‚Äôll be part of our strategic focus areas taking our client on a journey to cloud. Depending on your professional interests you can grow your career, skills and experience towards the architecting and planning test automation or focus on deepening your skill set test automation creation and other hands-on test automation activities in new technologies or development projects.

What‚Äôs In It For You


We believe in bringing the best to our clients through continuous learning & improvement ‚Äì from basic skills to industry-specific content

Mentoring and continuous evaluation that ensure your career continues to progress

We offer a performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities

Flexible work arrangements for maintaining work-life balance

Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks


Who we are looking for:


At least 2 years of hands-on experience of Test Automation in Robot Framework, automating the following areas (one or several): front-end, back-end, web services,

Experience of working in software development and understanding/actual experience of software development practices: BDD, TDD, Scrum, Kanban, SAFe

Proactive, solution driven mindset, eager to learn and comfortable with delivering a variety of tasks in a changing environment, both as individual contributor and part of a team

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Experience in test management and defining overall test strategies and approaches for different environments and solutions.

Excellent verbal and written communications skills in Finnish and English

Experience on Financial Service or other regulated business that build for highest quality

Master's/Bachelor‚Äôs degree from a relevant field


Technical skills and experience:


Test automation tools: Robot Framework experience (others like Selenium, Cypress, Cucumber or other similar tools for cloud based test automation tools are an advantage)

Hands-on with test automation in the following languages (one or several): Python, Java, JavaScript

Version Control in Git, eg. GitLab, GitHub, Bitbucket

Test automation with CI/CD or DevOps toolchains Jenkins and other cloud tools Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, AWS CodePipeline

Test planning, management and reporting with JIRA and JIRA plugin integration

Cloud for setting up and operating tests and test environments: Azure or AWS, GCP

Experience in building test automation frameworks from scratch is an advantage


Why Accenture?

Because people enjoy working here; the work we do is challenging, interesting and meaningful.

Accenture offers a unique career experience and unparalleled opportunity for you to grow and advance. We are driven by the best results, but we never forget to support each other. We like to challenge our employees and give them the opportunity to shine and succeed. We invest heavily in our people‚Äôs growth and knowledge development.

Our best and only asset is our people. We believe they‚Äôre at their best when knowing what is expected from them and we want to support them in different life phases. Our extensive MyWellbeing ‚Äìprogram is one of our key tools for that.

Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Interested? Make your move - apply online and attach a CV and letter of application as well as your transcript of records and salary request in English. We look forward to meeting you!
title: Test Automation Engineer (Robot Framework)

description:
Job description:

We are looking for a Senior Software Developer to join our Vaisala Compass team at the Vantaa headquarters (hybrid work available). Compass is a cloud-based weather intelligence platform used by wind and solar energy producers for planning and managing renewable energy farms. Help us create software that benefits the planet!




Vaisala is a global leader in measurement instruments and intelligence helping industries, nations, people, and the planet to thrive. From predicting hurricanes to optimizing renewable energy production, our technology is used where it matters the most ‚Äì from data centers, windfarms and laboratories to airports, the Arctic and even the surface of Mars. Our team of over 2,300 experts and 59 nationalities around the world is committed to taking every measure for the planet. Driven by our shared purpose, curiosity, and pioneering spirit, we stay ahead and make a difference. At Vaisala, you don't have to fit in to belong.




Why join us?




 * Be part of making a difference - Weather is the fuel and the enabler of renewable energy. From initial site selection to ongoing operations, Vaisala Compass addresses the industry‚Äôs most pressing weather-related challenges.
 * Modern tech stack - Vaisala Compass is recently launched and based on chosen technologies to carries us forward long time in the future.
 * Chance to work with cutting-edge science ‚Äì and scientists
 * Our culture is trust-based and diverse ‚Äì Team members are in three countries and multiple nationalities.







What's your role?




You will be part of our Vaisala Compass Team of 15 passionate Developers and Architects. We generally use Scrum best practices, but we are not constrained by them and have the freedom to choose practical ways of working to foster productive collaboration.




Your daily tasks would vary between writing code as a member of Team, participating in software design and planning as well as implementing and running test cases.




As part of Team, you will have an excellent opportunity to be part of building and designing hands-on the next capabilities of this world-class Product for the Renewable Energy industry Vaisala transforms weather-based decision-making for renewable energy industry.




We value your willingness to engage, learn, and contribute actively. Expectations and responsibilities of this position will be adjusted based on your experience.




What will you bring?




 * 7 to 10+ years of experience with software development hands-on
 * We have a lot of development of both backend and frontend ‚Äì based on your own interest you can choose to work in either of them, or both if you like.
 * Excellent teamwork, communication and problem-solving skills and mindset
 * Ability to produce quality software with test automation and continuous delivery
 * Working with cloud platforms and tools (e.g. AWS, Kubernetes)
 * Fluent spoken and written English




Our current buzzwords: Java, Spring, React, TypeScript, Message brokers, REST API, CI/CD, Infra-As-Code, Kubernetes, Docker, Keycloak




For additional information please contact the hiring manager Tuomas Hautala via email: tuomas.hautala@vaisala.com. Please note that applications sent via email cannot be processed due to privacy reasons. The recruitment process consists of 2-3 meetings.




Ready to take every measure for the planet? Apply at the latest on October 30th, 2024 via the application form.
sector: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing and Technology, Information and Media
title: Senior Software Developer, Renewable Energy

description:
I'm helping one of my clients in finding a talented and hands-on Software Architect to join their growing team in Finland. The company operate within the MedTech space and are on a mission to expand their expertise locally.




In this role, you will work closely with companies within the industry to customize software solutions that support their vital work. Their enterprise-level software solutions ensures their clients‚Äô work is of the highest quality, properly documented, and compliant with international standards.




Position Overview: They are searching for a hands-on Software Architect. While your role will involve coding, you'll also mentor junior developers and play a key role in shaping the technical direction of their product. The company is currently in the midst of a technological transformation and is eager to adopt modern technologies.




You will join an international team based in Espoo, where English is the primary working language. They also offer flexible hybrid working model.




Key Responsibilities:

 * Provide mentorship to junior developers
 * Lead technical decision-making for the product‚Äôs direction and hands on development




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

 * Strong proficiency in Java; familiarity with React is a bonus
 * Experience with container technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, or OpenShift
 * Solid understanding and experience of microservices and monolithic architecture
 * A hands-on approach and a passion for leading technical projects




What‚Äôs in It for You?

 * Competitive salary: ‚Ç¨5,500‚Äì‚Ç¨6,000/month, depending on experience
 * Annual financial bursary for work commuting
 * Comprehensive training package: you can complete relevant courses during work hours
 * Mehil√§inen occupational health services, including an annual dental check-up
 * Various insurances and cultural benefits




About the Company: This company is a SME in Finland, and in this role, you‚Äôll have a direct impact on the direction and vision of their product. They are in an exciting phase of growth and change, and you‚Äôll be part of a team driving that transformation.




If you are passionate about making a difference for end users in many different areas e.g. pharmaceutical, petrochemical, food and beverage industries and eager to work with a company that is doing something meaningful, we want to hear from you! The company is ready to hire as soon as they find the right candidate.




If you‚Äôd like to hear more about this opportunity, get in touch with Katriina Haataja (katriina.haataja@cathcarttechnology.com, +358 9 4245 2477)
title: Software Architect

description:
We don‚Äôt just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with Cancer.

The Senior Software Engineer will lead the design and development of software applications. You will mentor junior engineers, contribute to architectural decisions, and ensure the successful delivery of high-quality software solutions.

What You‚Äôll Do At Elekta

Would you like to be part of our driven global team, where we aim to attract and invite the best competences to Elekta? We are offering you an exciting opportunity to join our engineering team at Helsinki (Finland), which is currently a team of six members.

In this exciting and diverse role, you will actively seek to provide meaningful feedback on product architecture and shaping the future direction of the product.

Responsibilities


 * Lead the design, implementation, testing, and maintenance of the software applications.
 * Oversee all stages of feature development, from initial design through testing, deployment,
 * and support.
 * Actively contribute to and make strategic decisions in design sessions. Mentor junior
 * engineers in design principles and new technologies.
 * Collaborate with stakeholders to translate user requirements into clear, actionable software requirements and design specifications.
 * Ensure the maintenance of software quality standards through comprehensive documentation, thorough risk analysis, and robust testing methodologies.
 * Work closely with product owner, architect, and shared service teams to efficiently manage
 * dependencies and deliver integrated solutions.
   
   

What You Bring


 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills, effectively articulating technical
 * challenges and solutions to stakeholders.
 * Proven experience in healthcare, medical technology, or another regulated industry,
 * demonstrating a deep understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements.
 * Proficient in modern programming language, with a track record of developing high-quality
 * software solutions.
 * Experienced in designing and implementing RESTful services, event driven architectures and frontend development. Hands-on experience with infrastructure services and tools, with a strong understanding of their deployment and operational aspects.
 * Experience with Kubernetes and other cloud technologies is highly beneficial
   
   

What You Will Get

In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.

Overview of some of our benefits for Finland as below.


 * Flexible work @ Elekta (this is a hybrid role ‚Äì you will need to be in our Helsinki office 3 days a week)
 * Lunch Benefit
 * Sport and culture Benefit
 * Occupational Healthcare
 * OP Extra Health Insurance
 * Mobile Phone Benefit
   
   

Hiring process

We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resum√© in English, via the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.

Your Elekta contact

For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Sarkar, nidhi.sarkar@elekta.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

About Elekta

Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.

We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer

description:
At Qvik, we are elbow-deep in the consultancy business, but above all in the people business. Since 2008, we at have been building mobile experiences for consumers, e.g. in the fields of media, finance, travel and mobility, and retail. We create digital solutions for millions of end users every day by doing design, development and consultation work with our clients. And not just any clients, but the most desirable ones in the consumer market ‚Äì such as Suunto, S√§√§st√∂pankki, Oura and Kesko, just to name a few.

Our international community consists of 140+ designers, developers and consultants based in Helsinki and Stockholm. We've been rocking the industry for 16 years now. We are not a typical top-down corporation, but an inclusive work community where individuals can affect how we roll.




Are you the one, a new Qvikie?

At Qvik, we hire talented people that are more than a pair of coding hands.

This means that, besides coding amazing software, you have the ability to discuss the best technology choices and solutions with clients, including in the sales phase of a project. We take pride in our work, have the curiosity to take our personal development to the next level, and want to share our know-how with our colleagues. We want to see the same kind of spark in you.




But let's talk about tech. Modestly put, we offer the best possible tech solutions for our B2C customers' needs. To be able to contribute to this, your tech skills should heavily rely on:




Swift / Objective-C and/or Kotlin




Also experience with cross-platform technologies such as Flutter or React Native is considered a plus.




Experience in any other languages, platforms, technologies or environments are a definite plus for you as a future Qvikie. Responsive design and native apps are the things that make you tick. Any apps already in the store will show a good case for your experience. Seniority in leading projects, mastering agile methodologies, and passion for solving multifaceted tech problems is a definite plus. You probably have comprehensive knowledge in a couple of the mentioned languages and frameworks but, more importantly, you have an interest in learning new ones too. Currently, we are searching for pros who are located in Finland, Uusimaa.




The people you work with will be from different backgrounds and have different strengths. This means that we cherish a culture of open-mindedness, equality and empathy toward all people. At the moment, we are reinventing our DEI practices on the company level to make Qvik the best place to work for everyone ‚Äì but there‚Äôs always more work to be done, and we hope that you want to be a part of it.




Oh, those projects

At Qvik, you'll be working in small and autonomous tech teams. Our projects are typically a combination of application and web design and development (hybrid or native), and some APIs in the backend.




You work in our customers‚Äô development teams, usually together with other Qvikies. The end products you are working with are something you can show to your family and friends ‚Äì products you can and want to use yourself. We don‚Äôt deliver off-the-shelf tricks, but build new solutions from scratch to fit our customers' demands. So you will usually work with cutting-edge software and not so much with legacy ‚Äì what could be better than that!




Our offer

We want to care more. We are concentrating on creating an even more inspiring and safe culture, learning by doing, deepening our professionalism, and building an even stronger community.




The salary level in this position will be somewhere between 5,000 ‚Äì6,500 ‚Ç¨/month + bonuses.

Our basic benefits package is also pretty nice: lunch, commuter, culture and sports benefits, and a bike benefit. Obviously, we provide you with the tools of your choice. We also offer occupational health care with extra health insurance, travel and accident insurance and many company-supported sports and hobby opportunities with other Qvikies.




Supporting the Qvikies' health and work-life balance is essential for us. We offer a sick-child care service for smoother sailing over the flu season, as well as personal support for life challenges via the Auntie service. And don't forget the community glue, aka parties ‚Äì we are pretty good at setting up some jams, too :)




In addition, we offer our low-hierarchy culture; flexible working hours; opportunities to try, fail and succeed; as well as a chance for you to concentrate on your actual work. Because that's what you are coming here to do, right?




Ok, what next?

*Please apply through our recruitment system to ensure that all personal information is processed appropriately.
title: Senior Mobile Developer (iOS/Android)

description:
Join our a+ team! At Accountor Software , we are forerunners for the future. Together, we help and support thousands of companies to manage their business better and more efficiently. We do this by providing the best financial management software and services on the market.




What your future looks like at Accountor




Are you an experienced software developer with passion?

At our core, we share a bold vision of becoming the most preferred business software and solution partner for SMEs, and we are proud to develop one of the largest B2B SaaS solutions in the Nordics ‚Äî Procountor.

We are looking for a dynamic software developer to join our journey. In this role, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with your scrum team and other experts to design and develop new features, where your insights on functionality will directly shape the future of Procountor. You will also be part of the journey as we continue developing market-leading financial software that empowers businesses across the Nordics.

We run Procountor in both Azure and in private cloud. We have our own public API, which you can explore here: https://dev.procountor.com/.

We value agile processes, proper release processes, and test automation. We aim for continuous improvement in everything we do, and we enjoy experimenting with new tools‚Äîlike AI‚Äîthat can make our work more efficient. If you can do something easier, faster, or more efficiently, why not just go for it.

But our true superpower? Our people. The Procountor software development team.

Together with your team, you‚Äôll play a key role in modernizing Procountor's technologies, driving the innovation that will shape the future of the product.

Most of our multinational Product organization is located at our headquarters in Espoo and our team meets regularly at our Espoo office. We also have locations in Turku, Tampere, Oulu, Jyv√§skyl√§, and Stockholm, and we work with a flexible hybrid model.




With these skills you are one step ahead




As an experienced software developer, you are always looking to stay one step ahead by embracing new technologies and sharing your expertise with others. We are searching for a senior software developer who is not only passionate about building innovative solutions but also enjoys coaching and mentoring others to succeed.

You write beautiful code that is easy to read, well-documented, well-tested, and easy to maintain. Continuous development is very important to you, and you keep customer value at the forefront of everything you do.

Over the years you have worked on multiple business-critical applications in cross-functional product teams, where your past and present colleagues recognize you as a wonderful collaborator.

You contribute by providing constructive feedback during code reviews, and do not shy away from questioning decisions made by others. You also take the time to step back and reflect and recognize on your and your team‚Äôs achievements.




Key responsibilities:

 * Building intuitive, scalable and well-performing applications that deliver real value to our customers.
 * Excellent communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 * A collaborative mindset to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and other product team members, all working towards delivering the best experience for our users.
 * Mentoring and coaching mindset, and ability to share your knowledge and help onboard new developers, and to empower others to grow and stay up to date with the latest technologies.




Key skills and attributes:

 * Strong skills in REST APIs and Java, to build next-level solutions that enhance customer experience and deliver real value.
 * Experience with continuous deployment pipelines.
 * Genuine interest in staying ahead by leveraging modern tools, including AI, to optimize development processes.
 * Nice to have: React coding skills would make you stand out.




Technologies we currently use

 * front-end - React, TypeScript, interacting with our REST API
 * backend - Java 17, Spring Boot, MySQL, JOOQ, Vaadin
 * API - Java 17, Spring Boot, MySQL, JOOQ
 * Jenkins, Junit, JBehave, Cucumber, Playwright, JMockit, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Azure, Copilot




So why should you choose to work with us? Well, let us tell you!




 * Our people are the best in the business. We have a truly international team of professionals who are passionate about what they do. We are proud to have around 15 nationalities under our roof and to have achieved a gender division of 50-50 in our workforce, a rare feat in the tech industry. With a team of almost 400 spread across Finland and a tight-knit group of 15 in Stockholm, we are an industry forerunner in Finland and hopefully soon is Sweden too!
 * We offer fantastic opportunities for professional growth and development. With our in-house trainings and a yearly personal budget for professional development, we want to make sure that you can develop yourself as an expert in your field. Our company offers great career paths within our different products, projects, and countries.
 * We have a comprehensive set of benefits that are designed to support your well-being and help you grow both personally and professionally. From a competitive bonus program (paid twice a year) to modern devices, we've got you covered. And with extensive occupational health services and a range of recreational benefits, we're committed to helping you maintain a healthy work-life balance.




Please note that we are actively following the process and might proceed with interviews also during the application period. If you want to know more about the position or Accountor Software, Tiina Lahdentausta (hiring manager) will gladly tell you more. You can email her directly to tiina.lahdentausta@finago.com. If you have any recruitment-related questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at talent.fms@finago.com However, please note that we are unable to accept applications via email and ask you to kindly submit your CV via our recruitment portal.

Apply between 3 October 2024 and 17 October 2024 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)




Accountor FMS (Financial Management Software)

Accountor Software is a leading cloud-based financial management and HR SaaS software company supported by its tech-enabled services business. Our mission is to help our customers use the possibilities of modern technology and digitalization in their everyday work. For more information on our product portfolio, please visit our websites: Procountor, Ecom, Isolta, Apix, eTasku.
title: Senior Software Developer

description:
RELEX Solutions create cutting-edge optimization software to help retailers and consumer brands drive profitable growth. With growth comes opportunities, and we embrace both. Within our platforms, our teams are driving change, working with international colleagues and the latest tech stack to develop solutions that transform into a pioneering end product; it‚Äôs tangible, impactful and sustainable ‚Äì for our customers and the world.

Our Technology Team

Our Technology team enjoy a challenge. They‚Äôre eager to learn, and don‚Äôt hesitate to ask what, why, and how. They create high-quality scalable code (just imagine, thousands of stores, millions of products, and billions of rows of raw data!) Their expertise positively impacts the environment and business processes around the world; alongside international colleagues, they drive change and develop solutions that become our pioneering end product. From functional programming, machine learning and interesting algorithms, to building big data pipelines, they‚Äôre behind it all. They can work in a flexible way, remote or in-office ‚Äì after all, they contribute to all our achievements, so in return, we provide a genuine work-life balance and access to every opportunity.

We are now lookig for a full-time‚ÄØSenior‚ÄØFullstack‚ÄØDeveloper‚ÄØto join our RELEX family in Helsinki. You‚Äôll join the On-The-Go team of 5 people‚ÄØdeveloping our Space and assortment solution,‚ÄØwho will help you succeed in your new role.

Together the team develops and maintains tools to help retail workers in keeping the shelves full (but not too full). You will help the team achieve this goal by writing clear and robust code (frontend and backend) and by helping your fellow team members to do so too.‚ÄØ

Join us as a (Senior) Full-stack Develop, and this is some of what you‚Äôll be doing:


 * Develop and maintain a microservice architecture using C# and .NET Core for the backend, and Angular for the frontend
 * Collaborate with the scrum team to work on our Space and Assortment solution
 * Manage messaging between various microservices and handle integrations with external systems
 * Participate in code reviews to ensure high-quality code standards
   
   

We‚Äôre looking for:


 * Solid skills in writing clean, efficient and maintainable code‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
 * Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS,‚ÄØAzure)‚ÄØ
 * Experience with C#, .NET Core‚ÄØ
 * Experience with modern frontend development (Angular,‚ÄØReact)‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
 * Interest in learning new things‚ÄØ
 * Problem-solving‚ÄØmindset‚ÄØ
 * Good communication skills in English (both written and spoken)‚ÄØ
   
   

You don‚Äôt have to know everything, but you should have solid experience and skills in one of the fields, either backend or frontend. We are all somehow specialised, but what we are looking is the willingness to develop a real product and learn new skills ‚Äì not just produce code.

What we consider as an advantage:


 * Familiarity with distributed and scalable systems
 * Familiary with microfrontends
   
   

RELEX‚ÄØFinland

RELEXians can be found around the world, but here we‚Äôre based in Helsinki. We‚Äôre passionate about using our technology to improve sustainability and change the world. Our office provides a great space for you to socialise, exercise and even take time out in our relaxing areas. We make sure our unique approach to flexibility and work-life balance comes across loud and clear; we‚Äôre conveniently located, there‚Äôs plenty of public transport and you can even bring your pet to the office!

Across RELEX, our people are supported and rewarded. In Finland, we go even further. As well as:


 * Flexible and hybrid working
 * Extensive physical and wellbeing support
 * Up to 8 weeks of annual leave per year
   
   

We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we‚Äôre a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.

We‚Äôre on a journey with our pioneering technology and exciting growth, which is why we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We can‚Äôt wait to see what challenges you‚Äôll overcome and what problems you‚Äôll solve. Join us and work with the best.‚ÄØBe curious. Be RELEX ‚Äì Apply today.

Being part of RELEX means being heard, feeling valued and knowing that you can be yourself because you belong. We believe in actions, not words, regarding diverse hiring and employment practices. We take DE&I seriously. We champion and benefit from global diversity. We‚Äôre creating and evolving our culture to welcome everyone and value every idea.

Are you the one we‚Äôre looking for? Apply today and become a part of RELEX!

You can apply by sending your resume through the application form as soon as possible, but latest by 18th October.‚ÄØPlease note that we will fill this position as soon as‚ÄØwe‚Äôve‚ÄØfound the right person, so we recommend that you act quickly.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

If you have any questions about the position, Rebekka from our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to answer them (rebekka.gotter@relexsolutions.com).

Apply now

 * A competitive salary
 * Flexible and hybrid working
 * Extensive physical and wellbeing support
 * Up to 8 weeks of annual leave per year
 * A true hybrid-working policy (home and office)
   
   

We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we‚Äôre a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, host monthly sports and culture events (think kayaking, brewing club and more), offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.

We can‚Äôt wait to see what challenges you‚Äôll overcome and what problems you‚Äôll solve. Join us and work with the best. Be curious. Be RELEX ‚Äì Apply today.

Being part of RELEX means being heard, feeling valued and knowing that you can be yourself because you belong. We believe in actions, not words, regarding diverse hiring and employment practices. We take DE&I seriously. We champion and benefit from global diversity. We‚Äôre creating and evolving our culture to welcome everyone and value every idea.

Are you the one we‚Äôre looking for? Apply today and become a part of our RELEX family!

You can apply by sending your resume through the application form as soon as possible. Please note that we will fill this position as soon as we‚Äôve found the right person, so we recommend that you act quickly.

description:
FINNPLAY Technologies Oy is a Finnish software development company specialized in applications for the iGaming industry. We have been over 15 years in the market and are recognised as one of the leading platform technology providers. Our customers include some of the top online casino operators in regulated markets in Europe and elsewhere around the world. Our technology and services provide the technical framework on which iGaming operators build their successful businesses. The industry is dynamic and fast growing, especially as more jurisdictions legalize iGaming and provide a regulatory process for online gambling. Finnplay is also strongly committed to helping players enjoy the iGaming experience safely using technology to provide a safer and more responsible online gambling environment.




Our team consists of over 100 talented professionals in four offices, with headquarters in Espoo. We offer a flexible working environment and plenty of opportunities for career growth. Our company is also a part of Entain Group PLC - one of the largest businesses in the industry - stock-listed in London and employing over 24,000 people around the world. So our employees get the benefit of being part of a large international network of like-minded professionals. Learn more about Finnplay and our team at http://www.finnplay.com. Here you can learn more about our platform: https://www.finnplay.com/titan-platform.




Now we are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our team in Espoo Finland. In this role, you will collaborate with our DevOps/Delivery/Development teams to support, maintain, and enhance Finnplay‚Äôs platform and production environments, focusing on improving system reliability and performance. This role requires a proactive approach to problem-solving, a passion for automation, and a commitment to continuous improvement. The ideal

candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be dedicated to maintaining high standards of system reliability and performance. The salary for this role will be 5000-6500‚Ç¨/month gross.




YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL:




 * Build and maintain reliable and scalable infrastructure for Finnplay‚Äôs platform, applications, and production environments.
 * Continuously evaluate and optimize release plans, including database alteration and migration.
 * Monitor system health and performance, identifying and fine-tuning to maximize performance and reliability.
 * Collaborate with teams and clients to provide recommendations for site performance and reliability improvements.
 * Meet delivery commitments and take ownership of the outcomes.
 * Swiftly diagnose and resolve production issues.
 * Participate in on-call rotations to ensure 24/7 system reliability.
 * Participate in releases.




IN ORDER TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE, THESE ARE SOME OF MUST-HAVES:




 * Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science
 * 3+ years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering or DevOps
 * Proficiency in containerization and orchestration technologies, particularly Docker and Kubernetes
 * Expertise in CI/CD practices and tools, including Jenkins, Nexus, Rancher, ArgoCD, and GitHub Actions
 * Rich experience in Linux system management and shell languages
 * Good knowledge and experience in database systems management and operation (MySQL, Clickhouse)
 * Strong analytical and troubleshooting abilities, with a focus on root cause analysis
 * Experience with monitoring and alerting platforms such as Prometheus and Grafana
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
 * Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and bare metal
 * Understanding of Java-based systems
 * Good understanding of networking protocols and concepts
 * Understanding of security best practices and compliance standards in cloud environments







WHY FINNPLAY?




Finnplay offers a very international work environment being the leading provider of platform technology in the Nordics. This is a great opportunity to take part in the development of a growth- and innovation-driven company and build its future. Our work culture is easy-going with low hierarchy and we want that everyone‚Äôs voice is heard.




Finnplay provides a comprehensive package of employee benefits:




 * Opportunity for career development & dedicated budget for your training and development
 * Epassi lunch & flex benefits
 * Occupational Healthcare
 * An extra day off on your birthday
 * Dedicated days off for your physical and mental health
 * Additional vacation days depending on the length of employment
 * Wellness and team-building events
 * Annual company performance bonus
 * Paid online consultations with certified therapists
 * Opportunity to book a workcation apartment in Spain or Latvia
 * 2 Corporate Social Responsibility -days in a year
 * Gym in the office building




What will happen next, and how does the recruitment process look like at Finnplay?




 1. Leave your application by 18.10.2024 together with your resume
 2. Our recruitment partner Linda Joyner will be in touch with you
 3. 1st meeting with Linda Joyner
 4. 2nd meeting with Finnplay‚Äôs Infrastructure Manager
 5. Assignment
 6. Discussing the assignment results
 7. Reference check
 8. Offer
