description:
NetSuite Developer at Addovation

After being honored as the NetSuite Partner of the Year 2023, we're thrilled to see a rise in requests for initiating projects with new customers. Therefore, we need to expand our Addovation NetSuite team with more innovative developers.

What You Will Be Doing

As a NetSuite Developer at Addovation, you will be part of agile project teams responsible for implementing new NetSuite solutions and supporting existing customers, improving their current systems. You will play a central role in designing and developing custom solutions in NetSuite to make our customers' business processes more efficient and automatic. This includes:


 * Specify, design, and develop enhancements to NetSuite standard functionality based on Customer requirements using SuiteScript, Freemarker and Typescript/Javascript.
 * Design, build and configure integrations using standard NetSuite web services (SOAP and REST) and CSV.
 * Design and build custom integrations using SuiteScript
   
   

Our customers are either private equity-owned startup companies that want to go global or companies within the Finance, Services, or Software Industry. We operate in agile projects with two-week sprints, utilizing tools like Jira, Confluence, and Slack for effective collaboration.

What You Will Be Part Of

You‚Äôll be part of a leading NetSuite partner with a highly skilled team that puts great value on helping each other and our customers. You'll also have the chance to collaborate with a variety of interesting businesses, making your workdays diverse and engaging. The NetSuite team consists of functional consultants, solution architects, developers, and project managers working from our Swedish offices and in Helsinki.

Who We Are Looking For

We are seeking a person that is a communicative team player with an analytical and solution-oriented mindset. You describe yourself as innovative and possess the ability to understand customer needs. Other qualifications we are looking for include:


 * Relevant bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT
 * Experience with NetSuite development (SuiteScript 2.x, SuiteFlow, SDF, SuiteAnalytics, SuiteQL, Javascript, Typescript, Freemarker)
 * Minimum of 3 years of experience in integrations to surrounding systems based on modern technologies such as SOAP, REST, XML and JSON
 * Proficient in Finnish, Swedish or Norwegian, as well as English, both spoken and written.
 * Experience with the Celigo integration platform is a big plus.
   
   

If you have certifications within NetSuite SuiteFoundation, SuiteCloud Developer I or II, SuiteAnalytics User, NetSuite Administrator, ERP Consultant, we will be extra happy.

Welcome to Addovation!

We are a Nordic IT service company specializing in business and operational solutions, helping companies streamline their processes. By leveraging powerful platforms such as Oracle NetSuite, IFS, and Microsoft 365, we adopt a comprehensive approach to facilitate processes within our customers' various business-critical areas. Team Addovation currently consists of 190 consultants, experts, and developers working together to create simple and innovative solutions. Today, we operate in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Sri Lanka. Our strength and key to success‚Äîclich√©d as it may sound‚Äîlie in our fantastic employees. We believe in a flexible work life with a balance between work and leisure; hence, we offer you the opportunity for hybrid work.

How To Apply

Submit your application today; we process applications continuously. For more information about the position, contact our HR & Talent Acquisition Partner, Therese Matsson, at therese.matsson@addovation.com

We look forward to receiving your application!

description:

CUJO AI¬Æ is the leading provider of artificial intelligence solutions for network service providers. We use machine learning and real-world data to develop and deliver cutting-edge cybersecurity, device intelligence, and parental controls that enable network operators to offer better and safer connected experiences to millions of households.




We are currently seeking an experienced software engineer with iOS development expertise to join our OTM (On The Move) team, which is working on the OTM product.




This role is open to candidates based in:

üá´üáÆFinland: Helsinki

description:
Job Title: Senior Full Stack Developer




Location: Helsinki, Finland




As Management Events successfully turned the concept virtual, now we aim at taking our concept to the next level to capture the opportunities to accelerate our growth! We have operations and operations in the Nordics, Benelux, DACH and South-East Asia, employing our staff of 250+ employees, generating annual revenue of 30+M‚Ç¨. We serve customer base across the globe via our virtual platform.




As we continue to grow, we‚Äôre are seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our team in Helsinki and play a key role in driving the evolution of our platform.




Your role:




As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you‚Äôll build, maintain, and enhance our platforms, working with a variety of technologies. You‚Äôll contribute at every stage of the development lifecycle ‚Äì from design to deployment ‚Äì while improving both new and existing features. In this role, you‚Äôll:




 * Take part in technical design discussions
 * Write clean, functional code for both front-end and back-end development
 * Ensure system consistency and create exceptional user experiences
 * Write reusable, maintainable code that aligns with best practices
 * Collaborate closely with the development team to elevate our technical standards
 * Impact the stability, performance, and usability of our products for customers and internal users alike







What you‚Äôll bring:

 * Extensive experience with both front-end and back-end development
 * Hands-on expertise with server-side technologies such as PHP or Node.js, and the ability to learn new tools and languages quickly
 * Solid experience with APIs, GraphQL.
 * Strong experience with relational databases (MySQL, MariaDB).
 * Familiarity with AWS Cloud platforms and Services (EC2, ECS, Lambda, VPC, API Gateway, Route53‚Ä¶)
 * Proficiency with JavaScript frameworks (Angular, React) and front-end languages/libraries (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).Familiarity with DevOps practices (Git, Docker, AWS CI/CD pipelines).
 * A good eye for layout aesthetics and design.
 * Analytical mindset with excellent time management
 * Strong communication and problem-solving skills
 * Passion for automation and finding efficiencies‚Äîaiming to automate tasks wherever possible
 * A team-oriented mindset, eager to share knowledge and collaborate with others




How we‚Äôll support you:

 * Work-life balance: Rewarding extra max. 12 days off per year addition to your annual holidays, supportive team and hybrid working model and office in central area in Helsinki
 * Perks: Lunch vouchers, culture and sport benefit, massage benefit and social gatherings and events
 * Continuous development: We embrace a growth mindset with ongoing development and culture of feedback
 * Embrace the new: We‚Äôre constantly evolving ‚Äì we will hear you with your ideas!




About Our Software Development Team

We currently have 25 members. Our designers and many of our developers and testers are from our outsourced partners from different locations of the world. Though efficient, our growing business demands increased delivery capacity.




We follow Scrum framework to organize our work and aim for "delivery of values" and "continuous improvement" as a team.




Our key techonologies: Sprint, Wordpress, Angolia, Amazon EC2, GraphQL, Microsoft GraphQL, Serverless, Amplify, Azure, MariaDB, Aurora, Elasticsearch, PHP, Angular, NodeJS, Next.js, React, API, Jenkins, RabbitMQ, pipelines, server, cron jobs, Hubspot, Sendgrid, Twillio
title: Senior Full Stack Developer

description:
Accenture is looking for Full stack Developers to join our team of open-minded, multinational and technology-driven people. In Accenture, we help our clients to improve their systems, processes and business in the new and continuously evolving digitalized world.

As part of Accenture‚Äôs global team, you will have the opportunity to work with likeminded and inspiring colleagues with the latest technologies. With our broad global resources and deep technical know-how, we collaborate with clients to cultivate ideas and deliver high-performing results.

As a Full stack Developer, you will participate in implementing full lifecycle solutions for modern application and system platforms from requirements analysis, platform selection, technical architecture design, application design and development all the way till testing, and deployment.


Job Description


Do you follow new technologies and have a desire to change the way business gets done? Do you want to implement emerging solutions for some of the most successful companies? If you answer yes to these questions and you are passionate about helping clients effectively improve their businesses, then we want to meet you.

Your key responsibilities will be in implementing end-to-end projects on cloud and on client premises. You will participate in development, designing, building integrations to various systems, and overall testing.

Basic Qualifications:

You preferably have work experience from some of the following qualifications and interest to grow on the others:


Degree in Computer Science or Technical Science or similar

Experience in software development projects; front-end and backend development

Experience in unit, integration, system, and regression testing

Hands-on coding experience in Java programming language or other e.g., JavaScript, Python, Typescript

Experience in frameworks like: React, Spring boot, Spring MVC, Angular, Vue.js, and Java Spring

Experience in software development tools e.g., Jira, Confluence, Git, SVN,Jenkins

Experience and interest in designing and building solutions using cloud platform such as Azure, AWS or GCP

Strong interest in growing own technical skills

Ability to be an innovative, resourceful, and collaborative problem solver

Good presentation and communications skills in written and spoken on Finnish and English


We also value previous experience in some of the following and interest to grow on the others:


Experience and/or interest in container technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Openshift

Knowledge of UNIX or Linux environments

J2EE, Restful Webservices, Node.js

Advanced proficiency in Build Management, Configuration & Release Management, Design & Build Enablement


Why Accenture?

Because people enjoy working here; the work we do is challenging, interesting and meaningful.

Accenture offers a unique career experience and unparalleled opportunity for you to grow and advance. We are driven by the best results, but we never forget to support each other. We like to challenge our employees and give them the opportunity to shine and succeed. We invest heavily in our people‚Äôs growth and knowledge development.

Our best and only asset is our people. We believe they‚Äôre at their best when knowing what is expected from them and we want to support them in different life phases. Our extensive MyWellbeing ‚Äìprogram is one of our key tools for that.

Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Interested? Make your move - apply online and attach a CV and letter of application as well as your transcript of records and salary request in English. We look forward to meeting you!
title: Java Full Stack Developer

description:
The purpose of this role is to develop best in class strategies and management of all Insights and Analysis activity on assigned clients, to manage and develop the team and serve as a point of escalation as needed.

Job Description:

We are looking for an experienced colleague with a strong background in a quantitative field to strengthen our team and help drive our marketing data science business further. Are you motivated by challenging our clients to make their data actionable on a strategic level by turning data into insights? We want to meet you!

As a Data Science Consultant, you will work closely with our clients‚Äô most senior stakeholders to find best-in-class solutions for enabling data-driven marketing. Based on developed insights, you will, together with your team, advise the client to optimize their marketing activities. You will be at the center of the action when it comes to explaining outcomes (and caveats) to the business owners.

Data modeling and AI practices keep developing in the marketing and media sector. You will be part of growing the practice at dentsu. Together with a group of highly competent data professionals in Northern Europe, you will help apply new methods and techniques to answer marketing and communication questions. Think about use cases such as Marketing Mix Modelling, Attribution, Churn models, Customer Data Analytics & Segmentation, Content and Topic modelling, Recommendation Engines, and Predictive analytics enhanced with AI.

You will ensure that meaningful client value is delivered through a mix of best-practice solutions, skills, capabilities, and original thinking.

Tasks include:


 * Actively promote and increase penetration of Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) among our clientele through coordinated sales efforts.
 * Expand our service offerings to include new solutions rooted in data, supporting dentsu‚Äôs strategic focus on Customer Experience (CX) consultancy.
 * Lead the development of cutting-edge AI solutions in advertising, ensuring dentsu remains at the vanguard of modern marketing capabilities.
 * Foster client relationships by being a trusted advisor who consistently delivers high-quality solutions.
 * Act as a thought leader in the area of data science & AI for our clients.
 * Build and maintain day-to-day relationships with key clients‚Äô senior stakeholders.
 * Act as a subject matter expert and lead consultant, particularly in the areas of Data Science & AI for our existing & future clients.
 * Provide assistance & mentoring to project and/or other consultants in overcoming challenges and support them in driving the projects to completion.
   
   
   

Considerations for success in this role:


 * Utilizing existing capabilities within dentsu to bolster data science adoption, including go-to-market materials and co-developing technical solutions.
 * Identifying potential clients for projects in customer data analytics, developing & offering engagements for reference building.
 * Initiating sales of Data Science & AI solutions using existing concepts enhanced with new capabilities. Collaborating with internal stakeholders across media, creative & CXM practices for solution refinement and client acquisition.
 * Taking ownership and responsibility, and proactively seeking solutions.
 * Language: Working proficiency in Finnish and English.
   
   
   

Why Join Us?


 * Be part of a trendsetting team that recognizes data science as an essential factor for modern data-driven marketing & utilizes modern, cutting edge tools & technologies
 * Contribute to dentsu‚Äôs reputation as a versatile leader in data-driven marketing by expanding into various customer data analytics.
 * Pioneer AI solutions in advertising, seizing short-term sales opportunities and securing long-term business growth.
   
   
   

About Dentsu

Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in marketing, data, technology, CX strategies, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.

Joining dentsu is an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a rich variety of clients, cultures, and experiences.

We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information, please visit www.dentsu.com.

Additional information:

We offer a full-time permanent position with a 6-month probationary period, and you will be based at our office in Helsinki, Finland. The position will be filled as soon as we have found the right candidate. Please note that we can only accept an application from you if you are already permitted to work in Finland (EU/EEA nationals, work visas, etc.) and are already locally present.

We look forward to receiving your application!

For further questions, please contact: Henri Maunuksela, Head of Data

Helsinki

Full time

Permanent

description:
RELEX Solutions create cutting-edge supply chain and retail planning software. Within our platforms, we have the power and potential to increase adaptability, efficiency and sustainability in the consumer goods and retail value chain. Our impact is tangible; from sustainability and eliminating waste to delighting customers and delivering great tailored tech solutions, we‚Äôre curious and passionate challenge-seekers creating the future of retail today.

Our Technology Team:

Our Technology team enjoy a challenge. They‚Äôre hungry to learn, and don‚Äôt hesitate to ask what, why, and how. They get to work with our unique, in-house database engine to create high-quality scalable code (just imagine, thousands of stores, millions of products, and billions of rows of raw data!) Their expertise positively impacts the environment and business processes around the world; alongside international colleagues, they drive change and develop solutions that become our pioneering end product. From functional programming, machine learning and interesting algorithms, to building big data pipelines, they‚Äôre behind it all. They can work in a flexible way, remote or in-office ‚Äì after all, they contribute to all our achievements, so we reward them with genuine work-life balance and access to every opportunity.

Join us as a full-time Senior Software Developer in the Build Engineering Team under Supply Chain Optimization Solution ‚Äì in Helsinki or Lisbon.

The main responsibility of the team is making developers‚Äô life easier in general by building the pipeline of RELEX Supply chain optimization solution, enabling fast and reliable builds and pipelines. As we are currently working towards containers, the development and maintenance of the container will be the natural responsibility of the team. On top of that, the team will also be responsible for the common development tools and configurations of the monolith.

What you will be working on:


 * Help make other developers‚Äô lives more joyful by providing them with faster, easier-to-use, and more reliable tools and pipelines.
 * Tie together all the teams‚Äô work on our monolith product by creating a shippable product that is ready to be deployed and configured for customer needs.
   
   

What you‚Äôll bring to the table:


 * Strong experience in the Java Ecosystem, Java software development, and Java Build Tools.
 * In depth Gradle Build Tool knowledge.
 * Experience in building pipelines.
 * Maintain and develop services managed by Terraform and mainly deployed to K8s.
 * Drive to help others become more productive by providing easy and faster tools for them to use.
 * Willingness to explore new things and deepen your knowledge in the field of DPE (Developer Productivity Engineering).
   
   

What we see as an advantage:


 * Previous experience in DPE (Developer Productivity Engineering) matters.
 * Knowledge of building containers and especially running a JVM inside containers.
 * Experience with building, maintaining, and optimizing GitLab pipelines.
 * Experience in other JVM languages such as Scala, Groovy, Kotlin or JRuby.
 * Experience with JetBrains IntelliJ Platform Plugin SDK.
   
   

Our Helsinki office

RELEXians can be found around the world, but here we‚Äôre based in Helsinki. We‚Äôre passionate about using our technology to improve sustainability and change the world. Our office provides a great space for you to socialise, exercise and even take time out in our relaxing areas. We make sure our unique approach to flexibility and work-life balance comes across loud and clear; we‚Äôre conveniently located, there‚Äôs plenty of public transport and you can even bring your pet to the office!

Across RELEX, our people are supported and rewarded.

In Finland, we go even further. As well as:


 * A competitive salary
 * Flexible and hybrid working
 * Extensive physical and wellbeing support
 * Up to 8 weeks of annual leave per year
 * A true hybrid-working policy (home and office)
   
   

We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we‚Äôre a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.

Are you the one we‚Äôre looking for? Apply today and become a part of our RELEX family!‚ÄØ

You can apply by sending your cover letter and resume through the application form as soon as possible, but no later than‚ÄØ8th of October 2024. Please note that we will fill this position as soon as we‚Äôve found the right person, so we recommend that you act quickly.‚ÄØ

If you have questions,‚ÄØSanober Masalawala (sanober.masalawala@relexsolutions.com) from our Talent Acquisition team is‚ÄØhappy to answer‚ÄØthem by email.‚ÄØKindly note that we cannot process any applications through email. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Apply now
title: Senior Software Developer for Build Engineering Team

description:
About Airwallex

Airwallex is the only unified payments and financial platform for global businesses. Powered by our unique combination of proprietary infrastructure and software, we empower over 100,000 businesses worldwide ‚Äì including Brex, Rippling, Navan, Qantas, SHEIN and many more ‚Äì with fully integrated solutions to manage everything from business accounts, payments, spend management and treasury, to embedded finance at a global scale.

Proudly founded in Melbourne, we have a team of over 1,500 of the brightest and most innovative people in tech located across more than 20 offices across the globe. Valued at US$5.6 billion and backed by world-leading investors including Sequoia, Lone Pine, Greenoaks, DST Global, Salesforce Ventures and Mastercard, Airwallex is leading the charge in building the global payments and financial platform of the future. If you're ready to do the most ambitious work of your career, join us.

About The Team

The Payments team spans China, the Netherlands, and Singapore, embracing a rich tapestry of cultures and perspectives.

Our mission is to simplify the complexities of payments for businesses by designing solutions that seamlessly integrate into their workflows, enhancing efficiency and driving customer conversion rates. Within our diverse and dynamic team, you'll find yourself at the intersection of innovation and practicality, where every contribution is essential in making payment processes effortless.

Joining us means becoming part of a global community of engineers leading the charge in reshaping the payments landscape while actively contributing to the operational success of businesses worldwide.

What You‚Äôll Do

In this role, you will play a key part in diverse initiatives across our international payments platform. We highly value your expertise in constructing, designing, and engineering payment systems, whether it's a gateway, acquiring, issuing, or equivalent. If you're not already familiar, you'll gain comprehensive knowledge of Visa and Mastercard payment platforms. Collaboration with the payments product team and occasional interaction with partners' engineering teams are encouraged. As a vital member of our core acquiring payment team, you'll contribute to building the next-generation Payment Acceptance infrastructure with a constant focus on Merchant needs.

This role is based in Amsterdam.

Responsibilities


 * Design and implement new capabilities aligned with our product roadmap
 * Develop various REST services and integration components within a backend microservices architecture, connecting with our React frontend
 * Conduct architectural reviews for current and upcoming solutions
 * Address tech debt, and enhance operational effectiveness
   
   

Who You Are

We're looking for people who meet the minimum qualifications for this role. The preferred qualifications are great to have, but are not mandatory.

Minimum Qualifications


 * Over 5 years of expertise in contemporary engineering methodologies, emphasizing continuous integration and quality engineering.
 * Possesses robust computer science fundamentals, with a recent focus on Java or Kotlin, Spring / Spring Boot technologies.
 * Specialized in designing and constructing REST APIs, adept in handling high-volume distributed systems, Kafka event streams, and distributed data storage systems such as Cassandra, Hazelcast, Oracle Coherence, or similar technologies.
 * Demonstrated proficiency in cloud platforms like GCP or AWS (EC2, RDS, ELB, CloudFront), along with exposure to containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
 * Skilled in Javascript / Typescript and well-versed in operational tooling, including but not limited to New Relic, StatsD, Elk, Datadog, and Prometheus.
   
   

Preferred Qualifications


 * Extensive experience in the development of payment gateways, acquiring platforms, or issuing platforms
 * Expertise in integrating Local Payment Methods (i.e., iDeal, Klarna, Trustly) or major Cards (i.e., Visa, Mastercard)
   
   

#berlin, #brussels, #helsinki, #london, #paris

Equal opportunity

Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don‚Äôt regard color, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status when making our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters. Airwallex will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Airwallex on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.

description:
RELEX Solutions create cutting-edge supply chain and retail planning software. Within our platforms, we have the power and potential to increase adaptability, efficiency and sustainability in the consumer goods and retail value chain. Our impact is tangible; from sustainability and eliminating waste to delighting customers and delivering great tailored tech solutions, we‚Äôre curious and passionate challenge-seekers creating the future of retail today.

Our Technology Team:

Our Technology team enjoy a challenge. They‚Äôre hungry to learn, and don‚Äôt hesitate to ask what, why, and how. They get to work with our unique, in-house database engine to create high-quality scalable code (just imagine, thousands of stores, millions of products, and billions of rows of raw data!) Their expertise positively impacts the environment and business processes around the world; alongside international colleagues, they drive change and develop solutions that become our pioneering end product. From functional programming, machine learning and interesting algorithms, to building big data pipelines, they‚Äôre behind it all. They can work in a flexible way, remote or in-office ‚Äì after all, they contribute to all our achievements, so we reward them with genuine work-life balance and access to every opportunity.

Join us as a Senior Test Automation Engineer!

You will join the Customer Monitoring team which forms part of the Cloud Platform department. This will be a new team with a focus on engineering actionable monitoring and alerting tools (such as APIs, status pages etc.) for RELEX customers. Ideally, you will also consult other development teams from the department. As a Senior Test Automation Engineer, you will work closely with developers, product owners, and other QA team members in an agile environment to ensure the delivery of high-quality software through automated testing. You will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and executing automated test scripts and contributing to the continuous improvement of our testing processes.

This is some of what you will be doing:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


 * Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts
 * Integrate automated tests into the CI/CD pipeline to ensure continuous testing and rapid feedback
 * Conduct exploratory testing to assess the quality of new features
 * Report and track defects, collaborating with the development team to resolve them
 * Engage in agile ways of working, enabling adaptability, continuous improvement, and a strong focus on collaboration to deliver value efficiently.
 * Provide input on testability and quality aspects during the design and development phases.
 * Stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in test automation and agile methodologies
   
   

What We Expect From You


 * Passion to create maintainable and versatile automated tests with readable reports
 * Proficiency in programming languages such as Python
 * Experience with test automation tools and frameworks (e.g., Robot Framework, Cypress, Playwright )
 * Interest in collaborating on building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
 * Enthusiasm in creating effective test strategies and delivering clear test reporting
 * Experience with exploratory testing
 * Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
 * Excellent communication skills in English
 * Ability to collaborate within an agile environment
 * Ability to work independently and maintain quality of your work
   
   

Considered as an advantage


 * Experience with cloud technologies and container technologies is a plus.
 * Experience testing UIs
 * Experience with performance/load testing
 * Experience with Agile frameworks
   
   

RELEX Finland

RELEXians can be found around the world, but here we‚Äôre based in Helsinki. We‚Äôre passionate about using our technology to improve sustainability and change the world. Our office provides a great space for you to socialize, exercise and even take time out in our relaxing areas. We make sure our unique approach to flexibility and work-life balance comes across loud and clear; we‚Äôre conveniently located, there‚Äôs plenty of public transport and you can even bring your pet to the office!

Across RELEX, our people are supported and rewarded.

In Finland, we go even further. As well as:


 * Flexible and hybrid working
 * Extensive physical and wellbeing support
 * Up to 8 weeks of annual leave per year
   
   

We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we‚Äôre a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, and offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.

Being part of RELEX means being heard, feeling valued and knowing that you can be yourself because you belong. We believe in actions, not words, regarding diverse hiring and employment practices. We take DE&I seriously. We champion and benefit from global diversity. We‚Äôre creating and evolving our culture to welcome everyone and value every idea.

Are you the one we‚Äôre looking for? Apply today and become a part of our RELEX family!‚ÄØ

You can apply by sending your cover letter and resume through the application form as soon as possible, but no later than‚ÄØ22nd October 2024. Please note that we will fill this position as soon as we‚Äôve found the right person, so we recommend that you act quickly.‚ÄØ

If you have questions,Rebekka (rebekka.gotter@relexsolutions.com) from our Talent Acquisition team is‚ÄØhappy to answer‚ÄØthem by email.‚ÄØKindly note that we cannot process any applications through email. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Apply now

description:
We're looking for an experienced Senior Software Architect with a passion for hands-on coding to join our fun-loving bunch!

What is the job like, really? ü§î

The job we're offering is to work as a Senior Software Architect on our customer projects with modern web, mobile, IoT, or product-based solutions. Your specialty is to think about the technical solutions that match our customer's needs and are efficient to implement and maintain. Designing purposeful architecture and choosing the best technologies and tools for our projects are your bread and butter. Most of your time is still spent on hands-on development, tweaking, and integrating the systems that we‚Äôre building for the client.

Our customer base and the scope of our projects are wide, from small start-ups to globally large enterprises, and from legacy-type maintenance to advanced projects in generative AI. You can find examples of our work on our customers page.

The life cycle of our projects and the size of teams varies so there is no need to worry about getting stuck or bored. Our projects can be demanding, but you'll be able to handle that together with your future teammates as they are at the top of their game.

What are we looking for?

üéØ If you have a solid and versatile history in software development as well as experience in designing modern software architectures, you're just the person we‚Äôre looking for!

üéØ Our projects make use of diverse technologies (like React, Angular, Vue, Java/Kotlin, Node.js, C#/.NET, and Python/Django), so we hope you‚Äôre well-versed in at least a couple of them.

üéØ Proficiency in cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, and Azure is essential, as our codebase primarily operates on these platforms.

üéØ In addition to having a diverse skill set, we expect you to approach consulting with a can-do attitude and to confidently claim your space in our clients‚Äô projects

üéØ When it comes to defining what "culture fit" means to us, we believe in positivity and willingness to be part of our community

üéØ To ensure effective communication, including with Finnish-speaking customers, proficiency in both English and Finnish is essential for many of our customer projects.

Cool, but what's in it for me?

üåü Maximal flexibility and location independence ‚Äì set up your workstation wherever you want and utilize our awesome office spaces in the way you feel is most suitable for you.

üåü Solid pay ‚Äì your monthly base salary will be based on your experience and expertise + you‚Äôll naturally get to enjoy Vincit‚Äôs bonus model, personnel fund and transparent salary weeks.

üåü More than generous employee benefits ‚Äì lunch benefit, free snacks and drinks, healthcare and dental care services, extensive insurance, childcare services, high-quality work equipment ‚Äì the list goes on!

üåü Best place to grow ‚Äì We want to ensure your Vincit career is filled with learning and growth. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve set up Univincity to support your professional development, offering a wide range of workplace learning opportunities.

üåü Various career opportunities ‚Äì pursue the role that's right for you, be it a new position, lateral move, or venturing into a different direction. Read inspiring examples of career paths in our career stories.

üåü Work-life balance ‚Äì We encourage you to shape your work life according to your personal needs. Whether it's family commitments, a side hustle, a sporty career, or simply the desire to downsize, we're always ready to discuss how we can tailor your work to fit your lifestyle.

üåü Modern, transparent, and humane organization culture ‚Äì thanks to these traits, we're an award-winning workplace to be proud of.

üåü Active communities - Our belief, "extraordinary things are created together", is best seen in our various communities. We believe in togetherness and support each other in finding their place and peeps in the organization, whether it‚Äôs office communities, hobby clubs, project teams, or more.

üåü Local and international work environment ‚Äì engage in various activities and hobby clubs in your local community or explore exchange opportunities in our European or US talent hubs.

üåü We are committed to making the digital world more inclusive ‚Äì we take our DEIB (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging) journey seriously to create a safe and welcoming workplace for everyone.

üåü A team of skilled experts at least equal to yourself ‚Äì our way of working and thinking usually suits those who are, or want to be, at the top of their profession. Work with us and you get to be part of our Vincit community which consists of the country‚Äôs top developers, designers, and other experts.

üëâ Explore real-life examples of our human-centric Vincit culture in our People & Culture blog.

Curious but still on the fence?

If there‚Äôs anything you‚Äôd like to chat about the job, don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch with us. To get to know us as an employer, we recommend checking our career site, blog, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.

P.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, you need to have the necessary permits for working in Finland.




We‚Äôre a leading digital business agency committed to accelerating and transforming our clients' businesses without the fuss. We believe that technology is key to solving the global challenges of our time. Together, we can achieve amazing things by breaking the norms of work-life and offering the best possible environment, tools, and growth opportunities for our employees. We aim to create better Mondays‚Äîfor our people, our clients, and our planet.

Our community is made up of top professionals from a diverse range of IT fields, united by a passion for what digital tools, empathy, and sharp thinking can accomplish. At Vincit, you'll get to work alongside skilled experts and with customers that include everything from small start-ups to multinational giants.

Explore more about us and our story. Learn more at our career site.
title: Senior Software Architect

description:
We are looking for two Front-end Developers to join our client‚Äôs team in Finland. This is an opportunity for you to play a part in building a better company and help achieve their goals.

Working with skilled, international teams in a fast-paced and inspiring working environment, you‚Äôll be a key player in their digital transformation. In their rapidly changing environment, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to learn and will be empowered to make decisions in your daily work with the newest technologies. Will you help them lead the way in creating the future?

You‚Äôll join their IT organization where they are responsible for building new front-end solutions in-house, including a new partner portal.

Requirements:


 * At least 4-5 years within frontend development
 * Proficiency in Angular, JavaScript, Agile methodologies, and web development.
 * Looking for driven individuals to extend the team.
 * 2 days a week in the office in Helsinki
   
   

Secondary Skills - Nice to Have:


 * Java
 * Microservices

Job Title: Senior Frontend Developer

Location: Helsinki-Uusimaa, Finland

Rate/Salary: 1.00 - 1.00 EUR Hourly

Trading as TEKsystems. Aston Carter International Ltd UK Filial. Drottninggatan 27,111 51 Stockholm, Sweden. No. 516404-0163. Aerotek, Aston Carter, EASi, Talentis Solutions, TEKsystems, Stamford Consultants and The Stamford Group are Allegis Group brands. If you are resident in the UK, EEA or Switzerland, we will process any access request you make in accordance with our commitments under the UK Data Protection Act, EU-U.S. Privacy Shield or the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield.
title: Senior Frontend Developer

description:
Is your next step joining us? At Roima, we are both cutting-edge and experienced, and working hard at the forefront of the ongoing industrial revolution. We aim to boost our customers‚Äô profitability and help them face the increasing demands of today‚Äôs world. Through our solutions, companies are able to add intelligence to their enterprise resource planning, product lifecycle management, supply chain, manufacturing processes and logistics.




We are seeking a hands-on Software Architect who will be a key role in development of new functionalities and ensure that our SaaS application is performant, scalable, and secure across both cloud and on-prem environments. This role requires a versatile architect who can lead feature development while staying deeply involved in hands-on development tasks. You will work with technologies such as C#, .NET, Angular, SQL Server, microservices and containerization, with a strong focus on new development, scalability and performance. In this role, you can be based preferably in Finland, but also other Nordic Roima locations are possible.




Your main responsibilities will be:

 * Architect and ensure the performance, scalability, and security of a SaaS application in Azure and on-prem environments.
 * Utilize modern technologies such as microservices, containerization, and distributed systems.
 * Build and maintain full-stack applications using C# .NET, Angular, and SQL Server.
 * Lead feature development while solving complex hands-on tasks.
 * Translate high-level requirements, functionalities, and epics into actionable features and tasks by collaborating with the appropriate stakeholders and conducting research to gather the necessary information.
 * Collaborate with a globally distributed development team, fostering a positive team spirit and communication.




We expect you to have:

 * Strong ability to comprehend and develop complex solutions while keeping them simple.
 * Full-stack proficiency with C# .NET and Angular (JavaScript/TypeScript).
 * Expertise in SQL Server.
 * Knowledge of when to apply the right technologies to different scenarios.
 * Experience in leading development tracks and architecture, with the ability to delegate tasks and mentor others.
 * Strong communication skills in English and the ability to maintain team spirit with developers across the globe.
 * A proactive, can-do attitude, with the ability to independently research and acquire new knowledge.




It‚Äôs also a plus if you have knowledge or experience in:

 * Experience with Docker, Terraform, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
 * Knowledge of IaaS and SaaS.
 * Knowledge of machine learning pipelines.
 * Familiarity with LLM models, agents like LangChain and other AI technologies.
 * Experience with the SAFe framework, Snyk, SonarQube, and development processes.




We're seeking a expert with outstanding problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to tasks. You are comfortable working independently to research and learn what's needed to deliver effective solutions. You can propose solutions to narrowly defined requirements or ask the right questions to clarify them. You are a collaborative team player who can lead feature development while contributing to an easy-going, positive atmosphere. We value a growth mindset and appreciate colleagues who are not only dedicated but also enjoyable to work with. Take the next step in your career and join us!




For more information about the position, please contact Casper Schwartz, casper.schwartz@roimaint.com
title: Software Architect

description:
Our mission at Oura is to empower every person to own their inner potential. Our award-winning products help our global community gain a deeper knowledge of their readiness, activity, and sleep quality by using their Oura Ring and its connected app. We've helped 2.5 million people understand and improve their health by providing daily insights and practical steps to inspire healthy lifestyles.

We are now looking for a curious Product Analyst Intern (Hardware) to join our team and help shape the future of hardware products that our customers will love. At Oura, we believe that great insights are the foundation of breakthrough products, and this role is an exciting opportunity to work at the intersection of data and innovation. As a Product Analyst Intern, you'll be working with analysts, product managers, designers and engineers to transform data into actionable insights that fuel product development and elevate customer experiences.

Full-time, 4-month internship.

What You will do:


 * Analyze sales and warranty data using SQL and Tableau, to help engineering improve product performance and quality
 * Assist in research, analytics and insights projects by gathering, organizing, and analyzing data
 * Collaborate with global cross-functional teams to validate product assumptions and contribute key insights to the development process
 * Communicate findings and recommendations to a diverse internal audience, ranging from technical to commercial teams
   
   

What You Will Learn:


 * How to translate complex data into compelling stories that drive decision-making
 * Practical experience in product analytics, consumer insights, and project management
 * A deeper understanding of hardware product development and the iterative process behind creating products customers love
 * Hands-on exposure to using data visualization tools and techniques to convey insights effectively
   
   

We would love to have You on our team, if You:


 * Are currently pursuing a Master's Degree in a quantitative field, e.g. business, economics, or engineering
 * Have strong analytical skills with a passion for turning data into actionable insights
 * Are comfortable working with data and are familiar with SQL
 * Have a proactive, organized, and adept approach to managing multiple tasks and priorities
 * Have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and enjoy working with people
   
   

If this sounds like the next step for you, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible, but by October 11 at the latest. We will start reviewing the applications immediately, as we receive them.

Oura is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Individuals seeking employment at Oura are considered without regards to age, ancestry, color, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, socioeconomic status, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

description:
Who are we?

Kumorion offers cloud infrastructure solutions and services for all cloud environments. We are experts in building programming interfaces, automating system functions and providing high availability managed services. Kumorion specializes in multi-cloud, local and edge environments, utilizing technologies such as Kubernetes and OpenStack.

Kumorion is a truly multinational company ‚Äì there are currently 25 of us and our team already has people from 11 different countries! As a team, we are fully committed to excellence in our work, but not at the expense of our personal lives. We understand the importance of balance and prioritize the health and happiness of our team members. Because in the end, our most important asset is our people, and their well-being is the most important thing to us.




Job description:

As a Kubernetes architect, you work as a technical consultant in customer projects that match your strengths and interests. You design and build cloud-based solutions that meet our customers' technical and business needs. Your tasks include creating scalable, reliable and secure cloud architectures. In this role, you will need to stay up to date with the latest trends in cloud development.




What we expect from you:

 * Experience with container orchestration tools such as Kubernetes
 * Expertise in at least one cloud service provider: Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, OpenStack etc.
 * Experience in software development, preferably in Go, Typescript or Python
 * Experience with DevOps tools such as: Ansible, Terraform, ArgoCD
 * Independent working style and good communication skills
 * Fluent knowledge of English and Finnish, both written and spoken




Certifications are helpful but not mandatory, for example:

 * Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD)
 * Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA)




Why work at Kumorion?

 * A multicultural company with a start-up mentality
 * Experienced colleagues to share knowledge with
 * Challenging, project-based work
 * Hybrid work model and flexible working hours
 * Strong learning environment
 * Comprehensive benefits package, which includes, for example: lunch, exercise, recreation, massage and dental care benefit, HSL public transport benefit, city bike season ticket and internet connection to your home




How to apply?

Send your CV and application letter, in which you briefly describe your current situation and why you want to work at Kumorion.




Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Kumorion, we value everyone's unique identity and welcome all our employees as they are. Based on research, we know that members of underrepresented communities do not apply for jobs unless they meet all the requirements, so we encourage you to apply, regardless of your background. You could be just the person we're looking for!

description:
Position Description

CGI is one of the largest IT and business consulting companies in Finland and the world. Our strong experience from different industries helps our customers in the public and private sectors succeed in digital transformation and achieve their goals even more efficiently.

In this task

We are looking for a Salesforce architect with strong experience to join our team. In this position, you produce high-quality solutions for our customers' business needs. You play a key role as part of our team, where Salesforce expertise is combined with strong business expertise and technical expertise.

We hope from you

Strong technical knowledge of the Salesforce platform and products, as well as configuration and development experience in the Salesforce ecosystem. You have previous experience in an architect role. We see work experience in finance or insurance as an advantage, but this is not necessary.

We see as strengths


 * A bachelor's degree or university degree suitable for the position
 * Versatile knowledge of Salesforce products and platform
 * Several years of experience in the role of architect
 * An active and customer-oriented working approach and a positive and solution-oriented attitude
 * Analytical and creative problem solving skills
 * Excellent cooperation and interaction skills in Finnish and English
   
   

In addition, we value experience


 * From the insurance and finance industry
 * Agile methods (DevOps, SAFe, SCRUM)
   
   

The team you join

You will become part of an industry unit working with insurance clients. Our team's responsibility is to provide application maintenance and consulting services for customers in the insurance industry. Our team consists of an iron group of experienced professionals. We are united by the desire to help our customers succeed and to act as a long-term trusted partner of our customers.

We offer you

We know that success is based on people and culture, without forgetting functional tools and technology. With CGI, you can create a career path that is just right for you through interesting tasks and an internal career cycle. You can also constantly develop your skills and deepen your knowledge, e.g. Courtesy of CGI Academia.

We offer you a job where you can develop in the direction you want and the opportunity to own shares in the company with the help of our unique share savings program. 85% of our personnel are shareholders and that is why we are CGI Partners.

Our work is flexible when your life situation requires it. We take care of you and your well-being with versatile personnel benefits and offer e.g. comprehensive occupational health care, leisure insurance, care service for a sick child and the possibility of an employee bicycle. By participating in the activities of CGI's well-being communities, you also get to know colleagues from different parts of the house through common hobbies.

Were you interested?

Excellent! Next, we would like to hear more about you and your expertise.

Please apply for a position through our recruitment system at

www.cgi.fi/ura.

The last application date is 17 September 2024. However, we review applications already during the application period and proceed with the recruitment process as soon as a suitable candidate is found - so you should send the application right away!

If you have any questions, Hanna-Mari Holst, Director Consulting Services, will be happy to provide more information. The best way to reach Hanna is on 0400 936 737.

Please note that due to the nature of the task, a basic security clearance will be done if the task requires it.

Get to know us more

CGI Career

facebook,

Instagram,

LinkedIn,

X,

YouTube

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let's turn Meaningful Insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
title: Salesforce Architect

description:
Digia's Digital Experience unit consists of iron professionals in software development who produce mobile, online and e-commerce services with excellent technical and user experience using agile methods. We believe in transparency, fair play and long-term customer relationships. Our team includes around 105 software development professionals who have a passion for coding.

Above all, we want to be involved in making Finland's best digital services. Our projects include e.g. The mobile applications of Helsingin Seudun Liikente (HSL) and Ecker√∂ Line, Liiga's mobile services and Holiday Club & Woikoski's online stores.

We are now looking for our team and the project we are just starting

Experienced Fullstack and Frontend developers (React/Next, Typescript, Node/Java, Azure)

In an interesting project for a socially important actor, your responsibility would be to develop the client's critical core system. In the position, you can work flexibly via remote connections or at the Digia office of your choice, either in the capital region, Tampere, Turku, Jyv√§skyl√§ or Vaasa.

You are a much-needed addition to our team if you have experience with the following technologies and skills used in the project:


 * React.js and/or Next.js, at least 5 years of project experience
 * Experience using TypeScript, at least 3 years
 * Azure, preferably for at least 3 years
 * Problem solving, teamwork skills and you like working with customers
 * Experience with IT projects and projects with large project teams
 * You have fluent Finnish and English oral and written skills
 * Fullstack role: additional experience with Node and/or Java, at least 5 years of project experience
 * Frontend role: experience in accessibility and the implementation of accessibility in projects
   
   
   

We also appreciate it if you have:


 * Completed cloud certificates
 * Experience with Contentful or other CMS
   
   
   

The Digital Experience team wants to grow and develop continuously. We value curiosity, as well as a relaxed and humorous attitude, helping others and continuous learning. We encourage and support learning new things, so we can build many different paths for your career.

We want to offer our developers the best possible environment to do their work: freedom and responsibility, flexible working hours, combining work and free time. We have a very flexible approach to remote work.

We have several active OpenClub clubs, which help you find exciting things to do in your free time too! Would you be interested in, for example, beer, movies, swimming, wines, padel or video games? There are many possibilities! There are also several active eSports enthusiasts working at Digia, which you can read more about as told by our developers Juha and Tom here.

With us, you get great colleagues - developers, flexible working hours and the opportunity to develop your own skills. We offer you the advantages of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you can become part of Digia's team of more than 1,500 experts, where people are met as people.

We are a profitably growing domestic company, so we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies. We learn more together all the time and every digital employee has the attitude of a Senior Trainee. The work will be done, but we won't! For example, we have active tribal activities, where you can get peer support, lessons and the opportunity to share ideas about different topics.

Does that sound good?

Send us your CV or LinkedIn profile as soon as possible! We are particularly interested in what kind of tasks you would be interested in and what skills you have.

Hope to hear from you soon!
title: Experienced Fullstack and Frontend developers (React/Next, Typescript, Node/Java, Azure)

description:
Digia is a software and service company that combines the possibilities of technology and the abilities of people to build a smarter business and society and a sustainable future. There are already more than 1,500 of us digital experts and we work in flexible models all over Finland, both remotely and in different offices. Our personnel is a key factor for success and our business is built through well-being professionals. Happy people, sustainable growth. In this order.

Join the group of more than 1500 digital people now, you can code with us!

We are looking for several experienced Fullstack developers who have work experience in customer projects in the IT sector and at least 3.5 years of coding experience in Java and a couple of years of front-end experience with Javascript. We also value experience in containerization and application orchestration with, for example, Kubernetes or OpenShift. Experience with cloud development, databases and SQL language is definitely an advantage.

With us, you can get involved in interesting projects where reliable and data-secure solutions based on products, integrations, our customized applications and third-party software are worked on. You have the opportunity to be part of important national customer projects (e.g. Suomi 112 application).

Our experts work in agile teams of 2‚Äì15 people depending on the needs of customer projects. Sharing of information is done in teams constantly, and new features and technologies can be studied together, for example, in the spirit of mob programming. Some of the teams work on projects under the guidance of the customer. Take a look at more information about what we do here!

The employee benefits do not pale in comparison to other companies, and the hybrid working model and flexible atmosphere enable the smoothness of everyday life. Taking into account the advantages, the most important thing is our team and the brilliant types, from whom you get really good colleagues. Also take a look at our Java-l√§nder, because it gives you more information about what it's like to work at Digia.

Each of us works in the Senior Trainee spirit, which means that one of the most important cultural principles drawn up by the Digiaians tells us that we are not ready and that constant learning is our basic everyday life. You can train and certify your skills with us. Your predecessor will help you build your career path, and there are many career opportunities. We always enable work rotations if necessary.

You could find, for example, these skills: Javascript, Java, Spring Boot, React/Angular, Typescipt, AWS, Azure, OCI, Ansible, Terraform, microservice architecture, relational databases, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), DevOps, CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins /Github actions).

We also value:


 * experience in the banking and insurance industries
 * geographic information skills
 * customer orientation, teamwork skills, management of agile methods and self-direction
 * sense of responsibility and courage to ask and question, hunger for learning and desire to develop
 * good interaction and communication skills
 * fluent communication both orally and in writing in Finnish
   
   
   

We require Finnish citizenship from those working in information security projects and must pass a basic personal security clearance.

The application period ends on 29 September 2024. However, don't wait until then, because we process applications all the time and move forward quickly with suitable applicants. If you have any questions about the job or working at Digia, Tiia and Anssi will be happy to answer them:

Tiia Leskinen, phone 0400-270475 or by email tiia.leskinen(at)digia.com

Anssi Yl√∂nen, phone 050-3843771 or email anssi.ylonen(at)digia.com
title: Fullstack Developer

description:
Position Description

CGI is one of the largest IT and business consulting companies in Finland and the world. Our strong experience from different industries helps our customers in the public and private sectors succeed in digital transformation and achieve their goals even more efficiently.

In this task

We are looking for a Salesforce developer with strong experience to join our team. In this role, you will work in projects and services as an application developer. Your goal is to implement and also participate in designing modern customer-oriented solutions for the Salesforce platform.

We hope from you

Previous work experience as a Salesforce developer (JavaScript/LWC, Apex, OmniScript/OmniStudio) and technical understanding of the Salesforce platform. We see work experience in the finance or insurance industry as well as experience in Salesforce SFI solutions as an advantage, but this is not necessary.

We see as strengths


 * A bachelor's degree or university degree suitable for the position
 * Previous work experience on the role of a developer in Salesforce solutions (using JavaScript/LWC, Apex and OmniScript/OmniStudio technologies)
 * Versatile technical knowledge of Salesforce products and platform
   
   

In addition, we value experience


 * From the insurance and finance industry
 * Agile methods (DevOps, SAFe, SCRUM)
   
   

The team you join

You will become part of an industry unit working with insurance clients. Our team's responsibility is to provide application maintenance and consulting services for customers in the insurance industry. Our team consists of an iron group of experienced professionals. We are united by the desire to help our customers succeed and to act as a long-term trusted partner of our customers.

We offer you

We know that success is based on people and culture, without forgetting functional tools and technology. With CGI, you can create a career path that is just right for you through interesting tasks and an internal career cycle. You can also constantly develop your skills and deepen your knowledge, e.g. Courtesy of CGI Academia.

We offer you a job where you can develop in the direction you want and the opportunity to own shares in the company with the help of our unique share savings program. 85% of our personnel are shareholders and that is why we are CGI Partners.

Our work is flexible when your life situation requires it. We take care of you and your well-being with versatile personnel benefits and offer e.g. comprehensive occupational health care, leisure insurance, care service for a sick child and the possibility of an employee bicycle. By participating in the activities of CGI's well-being communities, you also get to know colleagues from different parts of the house through common hobbies.

Were you interested?

Excellent! Next, we would like to hear more about you and your expertise.

Please apply for a position through our recruitment system at

www.cgi.fi/ura.

The last application date is 17 September 2024. However, we review applications already during the application period and proceed with the recruitment process as soon as a suitable candidate is found - so you should send the application right away!

If you have any questions, Hanna-Mari Holst, Director Consulting Services, will be happy to provide more information. The best way to reach Hanna is on 0400 936 737.

Please note that due to the nature of the task, a basic security clearance will be done if the task requires it.

Get to know us more:

CGI Career

facebook,

Instagram,

LinkedIn,

X,

YouTube

Your future duties and responsibilities

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Together, as owners, let's turn Meaningful Insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
title: Salesforce Developer

description:
We are looking for a data analyst for the financial authority reporting of the Savings Bank Center, who will play a key role in our authority reporting development project, where an important focus is the development and quality management of data and related processing.




The Financial Authority Reporting of the Savings Bank Center is centrally responsible for the financial authority reporting of the Savings Bank Group. We produce and develop official reporting in close cooperation with our reporting partner, and we have an extensive development project for official reporting in which we are renewing our reporting solutions extensively. The first introductions have already been made and the journey continues towards modernized reporting tools and processes.




We want a data tamer to join our team, who will take over our new authority reporting database. You will become a deep expert in our information model for official reporting, who will support the team in the implementation of various data extractions, impact analyzes and reports. You help data users find what they are looking for and support official reporting in the use of the database. If necessary, you are ready to dig down to the source of the data and develop data processing processes and quality management controls. You validate our data and related processing and calculations with a critical eye, thus being an important support for e.g. in various testing tasks in the official reporting development project. You are also strongly involved in identifying and solving future information needs as regulation develops.




The goal of the task role is to guarantee regulatory compliance and efficiency of the Savings Bank Group's reporting to the authorities and to support stakeholders such as Finance, Risk Control and Data & Analytics with in-depth expertise. The development of reporting processes, systems and data quality is at the heart of the operation. The most important tasks include various data investigations and validation tasks, preparing impact analyzes in change situations, developing and testing reporting systems and processes, participating in development projects and developing documentation.




We want a team player who is brave to take on new challenges and eager to learn new things. The position requires strong SQL skills for data processing and validation. It will be an advantage if you have experience in banking, finance, reporting to authorities or understanding of accounting (profit & balance sheet). You will work together with several teams, internal customers and partners, which requires excellent collaboration and interaction skills. You are expected to be able to communicate and produce content in Finnish and English.




We offer you a versatile and extensive set of tasks in a top work community; our iron professionalism and will are the support for your success. The employment benefits are excellent; your well-being is taken care of comprehensively and your personal savings banker takes care of your financial peace of mind. However, the best thing is our culture that values ‚Äã‚Äãcompetence, curiosity and courage. Modern working facilities in Helsinki's Vallila guarantee smooth working. In addition, flexible hybrid work is our way of combining remote and local work according to individual needs and tasks.




Send your application by 22 September 2024. We start processing applications already during the application period and will fill the position as soon as a suitable person is found.




For more information about the permanent position, please contact recruiting manager Riikka Toivola on 050 3533 959.

description:
Almost 50 top experts work in Greenstep's analytics team, and our business is growing steadily. With growth, we are now looking for a new teammate!

Greenstep is a family business, growth partner and expert organization, which offers various services to support the growth and development of companies. We do e.g. CFO, accounting, payroll and analytics assignments and e.g. we help with tax, legal and HR matters!

We have grown organically, and today Greenstep has more than 700 employees in Finland, √Öland, Sweden, Norway, Estonia, Great Britain and the Netherlands. We all have a common goal to help growth companies become leaders in their respective industries.

With growth, we are looking for more people to our analytics team for Greenstep's internal BI solution development tasks!

Your role as a Data Analyst


 * You work with Greenstep's various business functions on internal development tasks for BI reporting. In addition to the actual BI development, you will e.g. define requirements, guide and assist users and lead development meetings.
 * You help us develop our BI SaaS service BI Book, which already has hundreds of customers in several different countries.
   
   

We are a growing work community, where new ideas are pushed forward quickly and every Greenstep resident can develop professionally!

You can read the article here, where our experts Antti Valtonen and Juha Kapanen tell more about our analytics team!

What do we expect from a future team member

You are a goal-oriented expert with a desire for development. You are precise and careful about the details of the work, but at the same time you also grasp the bigger picture. Financial reporting and other business reporting experience is an advantage. We expect you to take initiative and have the courage to try new solutions outside the box as well!

We expect from you:


 * Experience using Power BI reporting tool. You are familiar with DAX, M and SQL as languages, and you have the desire to develop into an expert in Power BI, using the latest tools and features.
 * Knowledge of business reporting. You know how to discuss the content of reporting with both the financial and technical director, and you understand the needs of the business.
 * Education suitable for the position, e.g. MA or DI in analytics, accounting, finance or information technology.
 * Understanding of data warehousing and data architecture. Knowledge of Python and R is considered an advantage.
 * The job requires fluent knowledge of Finnish and English. You have good communication skills - you can communicate clearly and proactively to different stakeholders.
   
   

Part of the Greenstep family company

Greenstep Oy is a family company founded in 2010 that offers high-quality services to support its customers' business and growth. Every Greenstep resident is important to us, and in addition to interesting tasks, we want to offer excellent working relationships to everyone. With us, you can become part of a work community where expertise, responsibility and caring for others can be seen. We already have a network of more than 700 experts throughout Greenstep! Together, we move forward while also accumulating our personal substantive expertise.

As a resident of Greensteppe, you can e.g.

üíö With Greenstep's together bonus, we distribute 10% of the annual operating profit equally and regardless of role to all our employees.

üíö monthly salary corresponding to your responsibilities and experience. When it comes to hiring, we want to be absolutely equal throughout the team and the house. We open our salary bases in the initial rounds of recruitment.

üíö flexible working hours & hybrid work possibility. For us, the hybrid model means both office and remote days in a suitable ratio.

üíö an employer who takes care of the well-being of our employees. For example, the benefits of the E-pass, our responsibility work and our specialized occupational health for people who do thinking work are for you.

üíö a team that genuinely cares about their work and each other, and our extensive internal network of experts. We already have a network of more than 700 experts throughout Greenstep! Together, we move forward while also accumulating our personal substantive expertise.

üíö your skills in a company that actively does social good. You can read more about our responsibility work HERE.

üíö the opportunity to be involved in the growth of a privately owned, solvent and profitable family business. Our growth is organic and our operations and everyday life are strongly guided by our shared value base.

Were you interested in us and the task?

With growth, we are looking for more skilled professionals all over Finland - now also in the capital region! Greenstep is a modernly functioning and versatile service partner for companies. We have approximately 15 offices in Finland, and we also operate in Estonia, √Öland, Sweden, Norway and the Netherlands. In terms of location, we welcome you from anywhere in Finland.

The application period ends on 29 September 2024. We are already reviewing applications during the application period, so we look forward to hearing from you as soon as possible!

You can also get to know us more here: https://greenstep.fi/rekrytointi/kulttuuri

As part of our recruitment process, the references and credit information of those selected for the job are checked.
