description:
Azure cloud architect, come design and build the cloud for Gofore!

Have you designed and built cloud solutions on top of Azure, and do you still want to continue developing as a hands-on cloud architect? You may be the new colleague we are looking for in our cloud team.




As a cloud architect at Gofore

With Gofore, you would do challenging, individual cloud implementations for clients in varying projects. With our work, we enable the success of demanding software development projects by planning and implementing infrastructure and its automation. From the technology angle, containers and containerization, IaC and CI/CD are hard currency in our projects. Sometimes we also jump into migration cases and planning governance models. We follow the best practices of the cloud, but our projects are not duplicates, but there is a genuine variation in them that takes the author forward as a professional.




Gofore's team of 50 cloud experts offers a sparring club in front of tough nuts. You can find out more about our cloud work in our cloud project radar.




From short to beautiful

Applying for a position with just a Linkedin profile is enough. Press "Easy Apply" and we will contact you and arrange virtual coffees in Teams. We want to get to know your wishes and expectations better. Let's discuss and openly think together whether our cloud team and Gofore would meet your expectations for a good job and your next career move.
title: Azure Cloud Architect

description:
Digia's growing and internationalizing Data analytics business is looking for an experienced data expert for the role of Senior Data Engineer.

In this position, you participate in the planning, implementation and maintenance of Data Platform projects based on cloud technology. Depending on your skills and experience, you can also participate in, for example, defining requirements, creating a solution architecture and, if you wish, in sales support.

We have the opportunity for versatile customer work and professional development, because Digia has a large customer base. We deliver projects, offer maintenance services and also work in larger teams under the guidance of our customers. The data analytics unit also works extensively in cooperation with Digia's other service areas.

You are strong if some of these describe you:


 * You have experience in Azure or AWS-based data warehouse or data pool deliveries and are also familiar with the Lakehouse architecture and Databricks
 * You are actively using the SQL and Python languages
 * You have insight into the planning and setting up of the analytics environment in cloud environments, taking into account the requirements related to e.g. for automation, data security, performance and access rights management
 * Broader knowledge of technologies is also considered an advantage, e.g. Teradata, DB2, PostgreSQL, MS SQL, and various ETL tools
 * You know database modeling methods, especially dimensional modeling, and you also understand conceptual modeling
 * You also understand the requirements of the reporting / analysis layer for the data platform, or even know how to create visualizations with e.g. Power BI
 * You have previous experience in consulting
 * Colleagues appreciate your fluent communication and documentation skills in Finnish and English
   
   
   

We don't expect deep knowledge of generative AI (or any other artificial intelligence) from you, but it is an advantage if the topic interests you and you think about how you could apply new tools to improve your own work and create more detailed analyzes of our customers' data.

The aforementioned list describes the ideal background. If you find us an interesting employer and you have enough self-confidence for the role according to the title, feel free to apply to join our happy team!

Happy people, sustainable growth. In this order.

What does digitalism mean to our experts? Genuine and friendly colleagues. Uncomplicated management and the advantages and possibilities of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. So just the right size.

Meaningful projects. Learning new things in the Senior Trainee spirit. A job where you can focus on giving your best.

No surprises there. Only very important things that we promise to work on every day. Digia is a company designed for people - a workplace where it's good to be and things work.

Were you interested?

Our summer application ends on 13 October 2024. If you have any questions about the assignment or working for us, please contact us at rekry@digia.com.

description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer / Senior Data Engineer to join us in building the future of Finnish media! The position is located in Sanomatalo in the center of Helsinki, and the position requires a residence and work permit for Finland. However, we are flexible when it comes to hybrid work, so your wishes can be taken into account. Our team is multicultural, but knowledge of the Finnish language is a plus.




Sanoma Media Finland is Finland's leading multi-channel media company. Our products, such as Helsingin Sanomat, Aamulehti, Radio Rock, HitMix, Ilta-Sanomat, Me Naiset, Gloria, Nelonen, Ruutu, Supla and many others reach the majority of Finns every day. You would start your career at Sanoma by working with Nelonen data, where rapidly accumulating data is processed and utilized in an agile media environment.




Where could you be involved?




Nelonen's data engineering focuses on the collection, editing and provision of rapidly accumulated data from the network and applications for business use, e.g. in analytics and reporting. You would work closely with engineers, data scientists and business representatives in an agile team. We expect from you:

 * Experience working with data scientists and analysts
 * About teamwork
 * Agile development
 * About documentation
 * Finnish and English language skills
 * Valid work permit to Finland
 * Place of residence in Finland




Technical skills we are looking for:

 * Programming skills (Python, Terraform, JWT token handling, basic level bash scripting)
 * Application development skills (CI/CD with Github Actions, unit testing with Pytest/fixtures/monkeypatching, integration testing, Docker)
 * Database and API development (AWS DynamoDB, Fast API)
 * AWS cloud skills (AWS managed services, IAM, networking, ECS, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, dynamic scaling of resources, Azure policy management)
 * Azure cloud expertise (Azure policy management)




In addition, no necessary technical skills, which are useful:

 * Databricks
 * Nginx




What we offer:

 * I have access to a modern and well-maintained data infrastructure
 * Unique, versatile and large-scale data sources to work with
 * The opportunity to experiment and come up with ideas for improvements
 * Balance between work and free time
 * Flexible telecommuting opportunities, but also a job in Sanomatalo - one of the finest office buildings in the city
 * To develop the skills of the online training environment and time to utilize it
 * Employee health care, phone and laptop, free gym, lunch and culture/exercise benefits and many other benefits from our partners
 * A central role in interesting and challenging tasks, a good view of the internal operations of a modern media company and excellent opportunities for professional development. You are part of a motivated and experienced team in an open and relaxed environment, where independence is valued and rewarded.




Join the exciting change towards the future of media. Welcome to Sanoma!

If you are interested, please fill out the application form and attach your CV. You can add a link to GitHub or your portfolio if you want. You can ask questions to Niko Kotiniemi: niko.kotiniemi(at)sanoma.com.




The review of applications will start in mid-September, and the first rounds of interviews will take place soon after.




The application starts on September 9, 2024 and ends on October 31, 2024, at 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)




Type of employment: Permanent




We offer

 * Personnel fund
 * High-quality occupational health care
 * Lunch allowance
 * Telephone benefit
 * Sports and cultural benefit
 * Gym in Sanomatalo
 * Holiday apartments, e.g. In Ruka and Teijo
 * Activities of Sanomain Club (e.g. sports section, cultural events, etc.)
 * Discounts on products from Sanoma and partners

description:
We are now looking for experienced Power Apps developers with a strong background in consulting tasks to join our dynamic team. In this position, you get to utilize your skills by designing and implementing Power Apps solutions for our customers for a wide range of business needs.




Job description:




 * You develop Power Apps applications, e.g. With Power Platform's Canvas technology.
 * You implement back-end integrations from Power Platform to customers' business systems and to Power Platform's back-end systems.
 * You work as a consultant in customer projects, map customer needs and offer them value-producing solutions.
 * If necessary, you are ready to jump into the client's existing teams and quickly and proactively take responsibility for assignments.
 * You are able to understand our customers' management models, processes and ways, and use and develop suitable Power Platform solutions for them.




We expect from you:




 * Strong expertise on the Power Platform platform, both in the development of user interfaces and other functionality.
 * Consulting experience, ability to work in the customer interface and strong communication skills.
 * Ability to quickly adopt the customer's operating methods and culture, as well as a proactive attitude in the face of new challenges.
 * Excellent Finnish and English language skills.
 * Understanding of common Power Platform practices such as managing environments, using Dataverse, Power Platform data models, and proven experience in leveraging Power Platform features.




We consider it an advantage:




 * Associate and Expert level certifications related to Power Platform and the Microsoft ecosystem.
 * Experience in the financial sector and understanding of its special requirements.




What do we offer you?




At Soget, you get to do interesting and challenging projects with Finland's largest companies and public sector actors. We are part of the global Capgemini group, but don't worry: Sogeti, which has around 150 people, works independently and agilely - and we hope the same from you. With us, you are among top IT professionals in a low-hierarchy culture, where everyone's professional skills are valued and supported, and the balance between work and free time is maintained. At Soget, we encourage courage, aim high, respect everyone and have fun. For us, everyone gets to be their own unique self, because we believe that a combination of different people and their ideas is the key to success. We guarantee you a happy and growth-oriented work community! Take a look at the link to see what our everyday life is like https://www.sogeti.fi/tule-meille/elamaa-sogetilla/.




Sogeti also offers you comprehensive employment benefits, which include:

 * Continuous learning : a global learning platform through which you get access to more than 250,000 study units or certificates (Coursera, Pluralsight, Harvard Spark, etc.)
 * Great modern office premises in Ruoholahti (or Lappeenranta). The crown jewel of our Ruoholahti office is the free Spa & Wellness area, where you can find e.g. swimming pool, jacuzzi, saunas, gym, gym and yoga studio.
 * Lunch allowance and comprehensive wellness benefits (Edenred), which can be used for massages, business trips or dental care in addition to sports and cultural services.
 * Active sports and hobby opportunities with colleagues, e.g. with chess, basketball, skiing, and board games.




Were you interested?




You can easily apply by sending us your information via the Apply link on this page.




Due to the nature of this job, we will ask the person selected for the position to complete a background check, which includes a credit check, a security clearance (SUPO) and a drug test.
title: Power Apps Developer

companyName: Bank of Finland (Suomen Pankki - Finlands Bank)
description:
Strong expertise is the currency of stability.




We value your expertise. With us, you can do socially significant work, challenge with your thoughts and ideas. Reliability, continuity and balance create sustainability. We also appreciate a good weekday, a rewarding combination of freedom and responsibility. Although we are stable, we are by no means serious. It's no secret that we are proud of our banking.




We are known as a forward-looking and efficient central bank and as a constructive and influential member of the Eurosystem.




We are now looking for you to join us,




SOFTWARE DESIGNER (data management, Azure)




About 75 experts in information technology and information management work in our information management department. We are looking for an application developer oriented towards Microsoft technologies to join our team, who, in addition to general coding experience, is especially interested in data management solutions. The position is permanent and the actual job title is IT expert.




You will work in a team that is responsible for the entire IT services of the Bank of Finland's market operations and payment systems, as well as the systems needed by the general administration. Your team's experienced experts develop and maintain the complex system services in a challenging area in close cooperation with the business departments on a long-term basis. In your future work, you will get to know these critical system services of the central bank. Your contribution will have an important impact on the IT services of the central operations of the Bank of Finland.




In addition to the implementation of business systems, your tasks include the technical planning of solutions related to data management as a clear focus. The solutions use even more cloud services in this area as well. If you are not familiar with data management solutions, you can develop your skills in this direction. The role is not pure coding, but your input is needed holistically, for example also in specification work and architectural design.




What can you expect from us?

 * challenging, responsible and versatile tasks with critical systems in an international operating environment
 * the support of an inspiring, competent and committed team
 * a flexible, stable employer that invests in skill development
 * high-quality tools and flexible hybrid work at the office and at home
 * the opportunity to develop as a professional managing demanding IT solutions.




You also get good benefits from us: e.g. comprehensive occupational health care services, generous annual holidays, extensive nutrition benefit, exercise, cultural and work-related travel ticket benefit, and bicycle benefit. In addition, we have versatile leisure club activities and the opportunity to use common leisure facilities in Saariselka and Helsinki. We are a family-friendly workplace, and we have flexible working methods and good remote work opportunities. Our office is located in the heart of Helsinki.




The position is placed in the Bank of Finland's salary system in demand category 16 (job-specific salary component 4272 eur/month). In addition, a salary component based on performance and professional management is paid at a maximum of 48% of the task-specific salary. The personal part is defined according to the experience and skills of the selected person, and typically at the beginning of the assignment it ranks between approx. 10‚Äì20%.




And what do we expect from you?

 * a suitable university degree, preferably in the field of data processing
 * at least three years of work experience in software engineering tasks as part of a software development team
 * experience and burning interest in high-quality application development in the Microsoft environment (.NET, C#)
 * desire and ability to quickly adopt new things
 * self-initiative, systematic and responsible approach to work
 * interest in the operation of business processes
 * flexibility, customer-oriented attitude and ability to cooperate
 * willingness to challenge oneself with critical systems
 * in addition to strong Finnish language skills, we require good English language skills




We also appreciate

 * experience with cloud technologies, especially Azure
 * experience with different data management technologies, e.g. databricks




What does meaningfulness of work mean to you?

"The opportunity to use one's own expert capacity in a wide range of challenging tasks. Seeing the results of one's work in practice". - Internal investigation of the Bank of Finland




Office manager Petri Salminen provides more information about the position. Contact requests via e-mail petri.salminen@suomenpankki.fi




You can also find out about IT Business Partner Aurora's career story on our website.




Please also read what our chief architect Anthony says about his work in our information management.




Did you know that the Bank of Finland destroys an average of 1.8 million banknotes in poor condition per month. It produces 1.5 changeable banknote shreds.




With his consent, the applicant can undergo a security clearance (security clearance act 726/2014), a health check and a drug test. An aptitude assessment can also be used as part of the recruitment process.




Diversity, equality and equality are important values ‚Äã‚Äãfor us, and we do continuous work to ensure diversity and non-discrimination. We value everyone's expertise and work together as equals. Our work atmosphere is safe and we see everyone's individual background and perspective as a valuable resource. We encourage applicants from different backgrounds to apply to be part of our organization.




The Bank of Finland is Finland's national central bank and a member of the Eurosystem. We build financial stability. We are a stable and responsible employer offering socially relevant, versatile and challenging tasks. We invest in the development of our personnel's skills and good management. International cooperation is our everyday life. The well-being of our personnel and the balance between work and free time are important to us. We value each other and have a good working atmosphere. Our main office is located in the heart of Helsinki.




The application period ends: 16.09.2024 23:59
sector: Banking and IT System Data Services
title: Software designer

description:
Digia is a software and service company that combines the possibilities of technology and the abilities of people to build a smarter business and society and a sustainable future. There are already more than 1,500 of us digital people and we work in flexible models all over Finland, both remotely and in different offices. Our personnel is a key factor for success and our business is built through well-being professionals.




Happy people, sustainable growth. In this order.




Digia's growth continues and we need it




APPLICATION ARCHITECTURE




to build demanding and socially significant solutions in interesting projects.

In this role, you work at the center of our projects that implement Java architecture in the Secure and Scalable unit, where more than 200 professionals in the field work. We have focused on high security projects and our solutions are based on our customized applications, third-party software and our own software products. The solutions are reliable and secure, and our work is characterized by solid and versatile know-how, high-quality implementations and long-term customer relationships.




With us, you can get involved in interesting projects and clients and a role where we can build many kinds of opportunities for your career and your individual development, taking into account your motivation and wishes for the future. Digia already has more than 1,500 colleagues and hundreds of customers to learn and develop with. You can take a look at more information about our security here!




You are the expert we are looking for when, as a software developer, you have experience with the demanding systems of IT projects and perhaps also in managing a team, and your problem-solving abilities are top-notch. You are not alien to different architectural models or principles and you have the ability to evaluate their suitability for customer needs. You have a routine for describing and documenting the various components of the architecture and system. As part of the team, you participate in presenting solutions to customers as well as actively guiding the team and also in concrete development work.




You are also genuinely customer-oriented and have excellent oral and written communication skills. You are responsible, have coordination skills and want to constantly develop your skills. Customer work with you is done by competent and experienced professionals who are able to take over complex entities.




Your toolkit could include, for example: C/C++, Linux administration, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Docker, Gitlab, Maven, Hibernate, Artifactory, Ansible, Spring Boot, Kotlin, Java and/or Python and experience in at least one public cloud environment (AWS, Azure or GCP) .




You too would be a Senior Trainee like all of us digital people. So you don't need to know everything, because we encourage and support learning new things, and we can guarantee that your skills will constantly develop.




These will support your success in the task:

 * You are interested in secure software development with modern tools and want to constantly learn new things and develop in your career
 * You have experience working with SQL databases and REST interfaces
 * You have the courage to express your opinion and the courage to ask and question
 * Your working style is self-directed while you work together with our experts from other agile teams
 * Communicates fluently in Finnish orally and in writing




So with us, you get to work with modern technologies. Check out Digi's Tech Radar: https://techradar.digia.online/




Acting in information security projects requires Finnish citizenship and the selected person will be commissioned by the clients to complete a basic personal security report.




In our work, we use the hybrid model of office and remote working within the framework of projects. So you can work as needed from Digia's offices, at the customer's premises or remotely.




We want to offer our experts the best possible environment to do their work; freedom and responsibility, flexible working hours, coordination of work and free time, free time activities and versatile tribal activities. As a plus, you get good employment benefits and great colleagues.




The application period ends on September 8, 2024, but we process applications already during the application period. If you have any questions about the task or working with us, Juha Kyl√§np√§√§ will be happy to answer your questions. You can reach Juha at 040-6736 391 or by email at juha.kylanpaa(at)digia.com.
title: Application Architect
required skills: C++, Java, Scala, C, Excel, Python, R

description:
Happy people, sustainable growth. In this order.

What does digitalism mean to our experts? Genuine and friendly colleagues. Uncomplicated management and the advantages and possibilities of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. So just the right size.

Meaningful projects. Learning new things in the Senior Trainee spirit. A job where you can focus on giving your best. Digia is a company designed for people - a workplace where it's good to be and things work. Could this role be for you?

We are now looking for experienced specification experts in Helsinki

for BUSINESS ANALYST positions.

With us, you can get involved in interesting and versatile projects. We work on reliable and secure solutions based on, for example, products, integrations, our customized applications and third-party software, but also much more. The assignment gives a vantage point into the world of meaningful projects and what happens in IT projects.

Depending on the needs of customer projects, 2‚Äì15 experts work in our agile expert teams. Some of the teams work on projects under the guidance of the customer. Our employee benefits do not pale in comparison to other companies, and the hybrid working model and flexible atmosphere enable the smoothness of everyday life.

As a Business Analyst, you understand the customer's business needs and are able to produce high-quality specification material for the technical development team for implementation. You know how to prioritize the most important goals to make them practical and you manage large and complex entities. You like to work in the customer interface and you have the ability to put yourself in the position of both the customer and the developers.

Your work week consists of workshops, needs reviews with the architect and the client, and writing user stories and documentation. You will work in close cooperation with the customer's representatives and expert teams, and if necessary as an interpreter between the technical experts and the customer. You are a solution-oriented professional and your way of working helps you move forward towards your goal and new solutions.

You are the expert we are looking for when you have accumulated experience working in similar positions in IT projects, and you are well versed in Jira and Confluence. You have the ability to define and describe the customer's business needs into features, for example for workload evaluation and future implementation, taking into account the impact of the implementation on the whole. You can also interpret the effect of interfaces to define. You have previous experience in defining requirements, describing specifications and user stories, documenting and analyzing specifications, and modeling data and processes.

In addition to work experience in the IT sector, we value experience in financial and/or insurance operations.

They support your success with:


 * You have the ability to produce clear documentation for both the customer and the technical team
 * You know the working methods of agile methods
 * You are active and self-initiative and you dare to ask and question
 * You may have a background in working as a software developer in IT projects
 * Communicates fluently orally and in writing in both Finnish and English
   
   
   

Helping colleagues is important to us, so we hope for a relaxed and positive attitude and team spirit.

Working in high-security projects requires Finnish citizenship, and the selected person will be assigned a basic personal security report by the clients.

We offer you a role where we can build a wide range of opportunities for your career and individual development, taking into account your motivation and wishes for the future. Digia has more than 1,500 colleagues and hundreds of customers to learn and develop with. We want to offer our experts the best possible environment to do their work; freedom and responsibility, flexible working hours, coordination of work and free time, free time activities and versatile tribal activities. As a plus, you get great colleagues.

We are trying to organize the opportunity to work with a hybrid model of office and remote working. In some cases, our customers wish for regular close working days.

If you have any questions about the assignment or working for us, June will be happy to answer them. You can reach June at june.poiskelka(at)digia.com or at 050-5319 423.

The application period ends on 29 September 2024.
