title: Business Analyst

description:
We are looking for software architects to join our growing team for various and different-sized projects for both the public and private sectors. There is plenty of choice in the projects and the technologies used include Java, Node.js, Typescript, React, React Native, Vue.js, Angular, C#, .NET, Python, AWS, Azure. The important thing is that we find exactly the project that interests you!




You can get involved, for example, in a development or reform project in the healthcare, early childhood education, or transport industry - there are truly meaningful public and private sector projects that affect the lives of hundreds of thousands of Finns. Our customer projects are usually long-term and you usually get to focus on one project at a time. Come build and develop meaningful digital services with us. Examples of our customers: Metso, Aimo Park, TE-Digi, Digi- and Population Information Agency and DigiOne.




What we hope from you




 * You have a long and diverse experience in the software industry and are fluent in numerous technologies and programming languages
 * Practical knowledge of some of the technologies used in our projects: React, Java, Node.js, Typescript, C#, .NET, Azure and AWS
 * Fluent Finnish and English skills
 * Previous coaching and sparring experience is considered an advantage




As a software architect, you get to plan and lead nationally significant software projects. You work as part of an agile development team and participate in development with your hands in clay. In addition to development work, you are comprehensively involved in the customer or project throughout its life cycle and work closely with the customer in converting the business plan into a technical roadmap. You support both the team and the customer's product owner in the architectural work and you develop long-term sustainable solutions. A personal security clearance can be made for the person selected for the position.




We value versatile experience, but at the same time we want to offer opportunities for growth both in terms of new technologies and industries. With us, you can truly influence your own career path and what your role will be like. At the core of being a Goforer is also sharing your own expertise, and you can act as a mentor to younger developers or organize internal knowledge attacks if you wish.




What we offer you




As an employer and a community, we promise to take care of you, because healthy employees are the core of our company. Our reputation for providing quality services to our customers is solely due to our top experts. Our low organizational model enables a self-directed and transparent operating culture. Our diverse team of experts is united by a pioneering spirit and a desire to work in a company whose existence has a greater purpose than just making a profit - striving for a more humane, sustainable and ethical digital world.




We consider it important to develop the professional skills of our personnel. You have the opportunity to participate in various trainings and to complete business-supporting certificates. In addition, all our software architects belong to Gofore's community of software architects, where we organize, for example, various knowledge attacks, sparring and developing our expertise together. Our community takes care of the development of the members' skills and at the same time also offers excellent peer support.




The sense of community of Gofore residents also extends beyond work in the form of various activities such as sauna evenings, video games and family days. In order for work and free time to find the balance you need, we offer you flexible working conditions and work tools that you can choose according to your needs. In addition to the above, we offer you:




 * Certification bonuses and study opportunities (e.g. Udemy)
 * Lunch, exercise and commuting benefit
 * Massage, dental and bicycle benefit
 * Comprehensive occupational health care
 * Care benefit for a sick child and the possibility of paid time off if a close relative becomes ill
 * Share savings program for all Gofor residents




Salary development




For us at Gofore, it is important that a decent total compensation is paid for the work. Salary is influenced not only by experience and skills, but also by our two values: active actions to ensure that Gofore is a good workplace for everyone, and taking the customer's perspective into account in everything we do. In salary discussions with your supervisor, the feedback you receive, the invoicing rate (after all, we are consultants!) and the development of your own skills are central.




We have different salary models, and in addition to the monthly salary, separate bonuses related to the company's success are used. Bonuses can be related to, for example, recruitment, sales or increasing Gofore's reputation.
title: Software Architect
required skills: Java, C, Excel, Python, C#, R

description:
As an AI Lead, you are at the forefront of Cloud1 AI initiatives, enabling enterprise-level intelligence with leading Finnish companies. With your strong AI/ML experience, you help our customers integrate AI/ML into the company's software systems, not only with GenAI-assisted co-development or intelligent search. You understand what it means to take AI to production, not just conceptualization.




You act as an expert, directing AI strategies in the company and at the client. You will be responsible for promoting the power and potential of AI technologies, developing and delivering compelling presentations, demos and talks that increase AI awareness and understanding. In addition, you will stay up-to-date on the best AI practices at the enterprise level, acting as an expert and advisor and taking a stand in the AI ‚Äã‚Äãcommunity.







Areas of responsibility

 * Advance the power and potential of enterprise AI technologies (IT/OT) for Cloud1 and our customers
 * Develop and deliver production-grade, embedded AI solutions, while maintaining conversations that increase enterprise AI awareness and understanding
 * Leads customer meetings, offering expert advice to ensure successful implementation of AI solutions as needed
 * Stay up-to-date on industry trends, technologies and best AI practices, acting as an expert advisor
 * Participate and stay in touch with the AI ‚Äã‚Äãcommunity




Skills and qualifications

 * Strong understanding of AI technologies and their business applications, preferably in a Microsoft context (Azure AI)
 * Good communication and consulting skills in Finnish and English
 * Proven ability to create engaging content and maintain meaningful dialogue that resonates with both technical and non-technical audiences
 * Experience in customer work and the ability to manage customer relationships
 * Passion for continuous learning and staying at the forefront of AI development
 * Proven track record of successfully delivering production-grade AI/ML implementations
 * High level understanding of technical architecture and ability to design and communicate complex AI solutions




Technical requirements

 * Design, implementation and development of cloud data platform solutions using Azure tools
 * Acquiring data from different sources, building integrations and converting data into AI solutions
 * Knowledge of AI-based analytics and the ability to improve the efficiency of travel experiences through built-in analytics dashboards and cross-cutting insights into the travel experience
 * Familiarity with Azure Integration Services and ability to navigate evolving integration scenarios




Why work as an AI Lead at Cloud1

 * You will be part of a dynamic team specializing in the latest Microsoft technologies and enabling built-in enterprise-grade AI while building smart businesses
 * Work with a leading MS Data Engineering house, our experts have an average of more than 5 years of experience in Azure and more than 10 years of experience in Microsoft technology
 * Possibility to participate in challenging large-scale migration and data engineering projects
 * Work in an environment that values ‚Äã‚Äãcustomer focus, inclusiveness, agility and learning
 * Join a company known for implementing demanding integration, architecture and data solutions




Benefits

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer professionals a suitable overall package, which includes, in addition to financial benefits, the opportunity to participate in the success of our company as a partner. We also invest in your health and well-being through comprehensive occupational health services and insurance. The continuous development and learning program includes training, coaching, mentoring and certification opportunities.




We have a nice working environment, where you can get support and it is possible to work remotely (flexible hours). Employees also have a fair vacation and absence policy, as well as paid parental leave and child care allowance. Welcome to a collaborative and innovative work culture where you can work with talented and passionate people who contribute to Cloud1's growth and success.




Were you interested?

Apply using the button below or send your application and CV to petteri.mikkonen@cloud1.fi. Tell us why you are the right person for this role and what you expect from us. We look forward to hearing from you! Applications by 30.9.
title: Lead AI Engineer

description:
Do you want to come and improve the efficiency of our customers' operations and the effectiveness of doing things with the help of better data solutions? Come and work in HiQ's AI, data and automation team, where we identify and solve e.g. inefficiencies in our customers' business processes. We actively follow industry trends, we constantly strive to develop our knowledge and abilities to produce innovative solutions. We offer expert solutions through project deliveries and consulting services according to our customers' needs.




We expect you to have experience:

 * Cloud services: Azure, GCP or AWS
 * Backend: Python, SQL and e.g. Spark, Databricks, ADF, Snowflake
 * Database knowledge: e.g. DB2, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Big Query




We hope that you are used to working with these technologies and have an excellent command of one or more of the areas. We also hope that you are interested in adopting new technologies.




We also expect:

 * Consultative approach and the ability to help the customer build and maintain database-based solutions.
 * Ability to design and build effective ETL processes to collect and process data for reporting
 * If you have experience working with Power BI, Tableau or Qlik, we consider it an advantage, however, this is not a prerequisite for success in the job.
 * The work can mostly be done remotely, but customer projects may require an average of 1-2 days a week presence in the capital region.




Several of our clients require fluent Finnish and English. We also see previous experience in, for example, the financial or energy sectors as an advantage. Some of our clients require a security clearance and e.g. credit check.




We offer:

 * An interesting role in interesting and often long projects.
 * HiQ's fun and relaxed work community and experienced teammates. We spend time together at HiQ e.g. in hobby clubs and doing things together. We also actively share information, learnings and successes, for example on Fullstack Friday every month.
 * Flexible hybrid work opportunity. You can work at the customer's premises, at our office in Otaniemi or Kamppi, or from your home office.
 * Comprehensive personnel benefits from extensive occupational health to sports and cultural benefits, hobby clubs, events and professional development. We are flexible in the different life situations of HiQ people and we want to make it easy to combine work and free time.




Apply now

Were you interested in the position and would you like to hear more about the role? You can ask more about the position from Roosa-Maria Ahosen (roosa-maria.ahonen@hiq.fi) or apply for a position directly via the link - it won't take long!

After applying, we will try to contact you as quickly as possible. You will first get to talk with our recruiter about your background and suitability for the position. In the second step, you will talk with our more technical expert, who can better explain the work at HiQ and the customer. Finally, we might want to take a look at some of your previous projects or check your references. Then we're already in that most important moment and we'll agree on whether you'll come to work for us!




HiQ as a workplace

With us, you'll find a great mix of diverse talents: creative developers, innovative designers, disruptive thinkers and data-native engineers, all playing smoothly in the same team. With our deep technological know-how and multidisciplinary understanding, we help hundreds of our customers turn the ever-accelerating digital change into business strengths.




HiQ builds truly valuable services for the customer. With us, everyone takes responsibility for what they do and we try to keep things simple in a good way - we don't engage in unnecessary bureaucracy. With us, everyone gets to be themselves at work and that also enables a creative, happy and flexible atmosphere.
title: Data Engineer
required skills: C, Excel, Python, Power BI, R, Qlik

description:
Do you want to improve the business of our current and future customers? Are you interested in working for an organization in several different industries? Are you excited about solving customer challenges?

If you answered YES three times, continue reading, because we are looking for an Azure Data Engineer for a permanent position to do meaningful work!

About the task

As an Azure Data Engineer:

ü§ù you translate our customers' business needs into technical solutions that you can also implement yourself

üíé you design and build Azure-based integration and data warehouse solutions for our customers, where you use your knowledge of, for example, the Data Vault modeling method

üß† depending on your skills, you can be involved in doing hands-on configurations, installations and scripting as well as designing architectures.

In addition, depending on your desire and abilities, you can also participate in sales and be involved in designing what we offer. Your knowledge and skills are of great importance in the success of projects and solving customer challenges. So come and do work that matters!

Success in the task requires:

‚úÖ previous experience and know-how in solving customers' business challenges

‚úÖ knowledge of various technical solutions (e.g. Data Vault, Data Lake)

‚úÖ experience using various tools (SQL, SQL Server Management Studio, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, WhereScape, DBT, Snowflake)

People who are curious and interested in self-development and have good communication skills do best with us. Fluent communication in Finnish and English and a consultative approach will help you succeed in the task.

We read for your benefit:

‚ûï previously completed Azure certifications

‚ûï knowledge or understanding of optimizing data warehouses

As a consultant with us, you can influence your role and tasks yourself. As a team, we strive to help you identify and utilize your own strengths and interests when planning projects. So a lot of consultants and our active sales organization work to help and support you. You get comprehensive responsibility for your customers and free hands to act. This is also supported by our salary, which consists of a fixed share and a bonus based on the invoicing of your team and unit.

About us and the team

Our current Data Platform team consists of entrepreneurial professionals who value their expertise and constantly develop their skills. At Innofactor, we give teams freedom and responsibility, and the task of our supervisors is to support and help the team to succeed, not to dictate how work should be done. As a low-hierarchy organization, our employees have numerous opportunities to influence and develop their own and collective activities.

We offer you:

‚ú® a work community where you have the opportunity to develop together with our great customers and competent colleagues

üéì the opportunity to learn more about Microsoft technologies through training and certifications

üí° interesting and challenging projects with Microsoft's latest technologies and varied project management methods

üí∞ incentive reward system

üèãÔ∏è flexible working time arrangements as well as versatile, employer-supported hobby opportunities and joint events

‚≠ê nice colleagues and a fast-paced atmosphere, where work is done closely together with a twinkle in the eye, with diamond professionalism

Were you interested?

We will start interviews for the position as soon as we find a suitable candidate, with the aim of reaching an agreement as soon as possible, so please send us your application and salary expectations as soon as possible.

Innofactor grows and develops every day, together with our customers and employees. We employ almost 600 enthusiastic and competent people in Finland, Sweden, Denmark and Norway. Innofactor Oyj's shares are listed on the main list of the stock exchange NASDAQ Helsinki Oy.

#PeopleFirst | #BeTheRealYou | #CreatingSmiles | #ModernDigitalOrganization

Innofactor grows and develops every day, together with our customers and employees. We are the leading suppliers of Microsoft-based solutions in the Nordic countries. We offer companies, public administrations and other communities all of Microsoft's core solutions. Our entrepreneurial orientation always keeps the customer's needs at the center of our work.

Innofactor's customers are around 1,000 companies, communities and public administration organizations in Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway and elsewhere in Europe. More than 550 enthusiastic and skilled people work at Innofactor in Finland, Sweden, Denmark and Norway. Innofactor Oyj's shares are listed on the main list of the stock exchange NASDAQ Helsinki Oy, where it is one of the fastest growing companies in terms of turnover.

#PeopleFirst | #BeTheRealYou | #CreatingSmiles #ModernDigitalOrganization
title: Azure Data Engineer
Data Base Applications: Databricks, Data Lake, Data Platform, Data Warehouse, SQL

description:
At Fellowmind, we are pioneers in digital solutions and our special expertise is comprehensive business solutions and enterprise resource planning systems. We help our customers improve business efficiency and competitiveness by holistically utilizing Microsoft's offerings and our strong industry expertise to find the most effective solutions for our customers. Our success is supported by long-term cooperation with Microsoft and our investment in the implementation of cloud-based technologies such as AI, Copilot, Dynamics 365 and Fabric. As a result, we have received prestigious recognition and Fellowmind has been selected as a 2024 Microsoft partner.

As a Data Engineer at Fellowmind

Our data vision is strongly focused on the customer's business; we are solving our customers' core challenges and enabling new business opportunities. So you get to build modern and scalable Data Platform solutions with us, which enable efficient utilization of data in business development. In addition, we produce comprehensive Business Intelligence and business analytics solutions that help our customers better understand their own business and make better decisions.

For your work, you get a responsible and independent job description and the full support of the team in everyday life. You not only get to create meaningful data solutions for our customers, but also share your know-how, develop operating models and influence how we build our solutions in the future. We appreciate that, as an experienced specialist, you share the knowledge of the subject area while sparring with younger practitioners of data art. Here at Fellowmind, you don't need to be boxed in, but we do our best to build a role according to your skills and interests.

Read more about our references, for example in real estate or logistics. Or would you perhaps like to join us at the forefront of implementing customer projects with Microsoft Fabric?

What kind of skills do we expect from you?

‚úîÔ∏è Fellowmind's data management solutions are especially based on Azure's cloud services (Microsoft Fabric, Synapse and Databricks), so we appreciate your expertise in: Spark, Data Lake, Data Factory, KQL and SQL.

‚úîÔ∏è You can handle data fluently and build data pipelines with Python.

‚úîÔ∏è Experience and insight in the processing and development of large data sets, as well as experience in how data is utilized as part of an operational system.

‚úîÔ∏è Solution-oriented attitude. You visualize problems quickly and proactively approach them by looking for effective and sustainable solutions. You are ready to take on challenges with a positive attitude and take projects to the finish line in cooperation with customers and your team.

‚úîÔ∏è What you do is characterized by the ability to manage things and take responsibility, combined with the ability to cooperate. The world is not always completely ready for us either, so you need flexibility, but on the other hand, you also need an attitude that wants to improve. However, you are not alone, our strength is in cooperation.

‚úîÔ∏è As our customers and environment become more international, we expect you to speak fluent English in addition to Finnish.

Why should you choose Fellowmind?

‚û°Ô∏è We work across team boundaries: Our expert team at Fellowmind consists of dedicated experts in various fields. You are surrounded by a group of almost 500 strong experts in the fields of customer management, operations management, project management, application development, and reporting and analytics. Our projects often cover more than one of the solutions mentioned above, so in your work you are guaranteed to get involved in demanding and versatile customer projects and your expertise will expand to cover the entire business of our clients.

‚û°Ô∏è You become part of a team of top experts: More than 30 experts in the field already work in our data team, and team members can be found in several locations, most of them focusing on Helsinki, Tampere and Turku. We offer the possibility of flexible hybrid work - so you can work in a style that suits you from your home office or at any of our offices.

‚û°Ô∏è The opportunity to influence your own role: At us, the consultant's roles are versatile, we want to offer you the opportunity to influence your own career path. We will be happy to discuss with you how we can build a meaningful and developing role for you together.

‚û°Ô∏è Always Personal, Act with Courage, Better Together and Serious about fun: These are our values ‚Äã‚Äãthat define the core of Fellowmind's corporate culture. At Fellowmind, you are welcome just as you are, we don't have any mold to fit into, but we believe that everyone is the best just the way they are. We invest in the well-being of our personnel and continuous training. Our goal is to create an environment where work and free time are balanced and where development at work and experiences of success are commonplace.

üëâ Due to our unique corporate culture, our collective agreement and comprehensive employee benefits are also inspired by our people and created together.

Interested in talking with us more?

We'd love to get to know you better! Please tell us more about your skills and interest by sending us your application, CV or LinkedIn profile with contact information. We are very flexible when it comes to starting, and we constantly conduct interviews for our open positions, and we strive to find the right role for our future needs based on your interests.

üì© More information about Fellowmind and our open opportunities is provided by our recruitment team

Riikka Ketola, 040 610 2627, riikka.ketola@fellowmind.fi‚ÄØ

Laura Paananen, 050 406 3641, laura.paananen@fellowmind.fi

Would you like to get a massage at the company's gym for an hour every month or get a company bike? With us, in addition to these great benefits, you also get a lunch discount and Epassi Flex, where you can use the 600 euro annual amount loaded into it as you wish for hobbies, culture, the dentist or, for example, public transport.

The snacks in our offices come to the rescue when hunger strikes, and the gym is at your disposal when you want to raise your heart rate as a counterbalance to work. To support your well-being, we have extensive occupational health services in Mehil√§inen and, in addition, the Auntie service for maintaining mental well-being. We support studying and skill development with a separate study grant, and you will certainly find courses you like to participate in from Fellowmind Academy's extensive training offer. So there are plenty of advantages and we are actively developing our selection - we have a habit of implementing good ideas quickly!

Our collective agreement is also tailored by listening to the wishes of our employees. Our agreement, which came into force in April 2023, emphasizes, among other things, the importance of a good salary solution and additional time off from long careers at Fellowmind. Not forgetting the green bonus!
title: Azure Data Engineer
Data Base Applications: Databricks, Data Pipeline, Data Lake, Data Platform, Data Pipelines, Data Management, SQL

description:
For our client Optomed Software Oy, we are looking for a software developer to work on IT solutions related to the monitoring of gambling activities. Read more below and apply for a place!

Location: Espoo

Industry: IT

Type of employment : Full-time

Start date : As soon as possible

Type of work : Direct recruitment

Job description

"Commit is the leading provider of IT solutions for regulated gaming. With the help of online signing services and reporting interfaces, our solutions enable Gaming operators to provide adequate and timely reports for Gaming regulators, tax offices, and government social services."

In this position, you work in the software development team of Optomed Software Oy's Commit unit. You have about a few years of work experience in software development using Java and Python technologies, good communication skills, you like teamwork and are quick to learn. Plus, you like problem solving! A lot is happening in the gambling industry now and in the future, so your work will be versatile and responsible!

As a rule, the work is done at the Keilaniemi office in Espoo.

A security clearance will be made for the person selected for the position.

We offer


 * Good orientation and professional team support
 * Office with good transport links in Keilaniemi
 * A small, flexible, low-hierarchical team
 * Good work-life-balance: 7.5 hours of work a day is enough and your free time is appreciated!
 * Flexible working hours and partial remote work possibility 1 day/week. The person selected for the position will be given a security clearance.
   
   

Job duties


 * Software development using Java and Python: technical plans, coding, version control, viewing
 * Technical specification and documentation
 * Quality and performance monitoring and continuous improvement
 * Maintenance and renewal tasks
 * Testing
 * Other software development tasks
   
   

We're looking


 * An IT degree suitable for the position or similar skills acquired in working life
 * About 2-4 years of relevant work experience in similar positions
 * Good skills in Java and Python
 * Good problem solving skills and you are quick to learn
 * Genuine motivation and interest in backend coding
 * A solution-oriented way of thinking and the ability to write high-quality code
 * Fluent oral and written skills in Finnish and English
   
   

We appreciate it if you have


 * Knowledge of the Linux environment (the assignment uses Linux command line tools)
   
   

Competence can be acquired through studies, work experience or self-study.

To be successful in the role, you are


 * Persistent
 * Skilled in interaction
 * Systematic
 * Responsible
 * You like problem solving
   
   

Our recruitment process

Academic Work handles this search on behalf of its client, whose wish is to address all questions regarding the assignment to Academic Work.

Applicants are constantly interviewed and if we have already progressed further in the recruitment process, we may close the search before the final selections. The selection process includes tests measuring character traits and cognitive ability. The tests serve as tools for finding the right person for the task and guarantee equal and fair evaluation.

In this position, you will be employed directly by our client. So you can take it easy and calmly wait for the announcement of the next steps.

Do you have any questions about this job?

Maria Dmitrienko or her colleagues from the recruitment team will answer questions at krs01@academicwork.fi Mention the job-specific ID number in your message: 15106940
title: Software developer, Optomed Software Oy, Espoo

description:
Do you want to participate in building future software solutions in a top team? Do you want to work on a variety of solutions with one of the leading providers of digitalization and cloud solutions in the Nordics?

If you answered ‚úÖYES and ‚úÖYES, continue reading because we are looking for D365 BC software developers to join our team!

About the task

As a software developer, you will be part of our more than 70 intellectual Business Solutions business unit, which focuses on Microsoft's D365 solutions with CRM and ERP technologies and the task:

ü§ù you help our customers in the planning and implementation of D365 BC-based solutions

üß† you can participate in e.g. in implementation projects, integrations and further development as a technical expert

üíé you can improve our customers' operations and help them in the best possible way through understanding their business

Our customers are from both the private and public sector. Depending on your own interests, you can focus on either delivery projects or ongoing service clients.

You can work at any of our offices in Finland, but you will find the most BS colleagues in Espoo, Turku and Tampere. Remote working is also a natural part of our everyday life, which means you can choose where you do your work.

Success in the task requires that:

‚úÖ you already have previous experience with Business Central (or NAV) for several years

‚úÖ you have worked in previous BC projects, for example as a developer, technical consultant or architect.

‚úÖ You are already familiar with the AL language and you want to deepen your skills as a software developer with Dynamics 365

We hope that you will be happy to take on new challenges and share your lessons with the whole team, as well as make use of the skills of your teammates. You want to be proud of your own work and earn the trust of our customers together with your team every day. You are not afraid of learning new things and want to develop your own skills together with your team. We hope that you will be able to use Finnish as your working language, but that you will not be speechless even in English-speaking situations.

‚ûï We don't mind if you already have experience with Azure and Power Platform, because they are more present in our everyday life.

In addition to various responsibilities, we offer you:

‚ú® a work community where you have the opportunity to develop together with our great customers and competent colleagues

üéì opportunity for training and certifications in Microsoft technologies

üí° interesting and challenging projects with Microsoft's latest technologies and varied project management methods

üí∞ incentive reward system

üèãÔ∏è flexible working time arrangements as well as versatile, employer-supported hobby opportunities and joint events

‚≠ê nice colleagues and a fast-paced atmosphere, where work is done closely together with a twinkle in the eye, with iron professionalism

At Innofactor, we give teams responsibility and freedom, and the role of supervisors is to support and help the team, not dictate how they should do their work. We have a low-hierarchy organization where employees have the opportunity to influence and develop operations.

BS has a total of over 70 Innofactorians from all over the country. We work with a team model, where self-directed teams and not individuals are responsible for customer relations. This way you can focus on what is essential and work together with your team towards common goals.

Were you interested?

Leave us your CV and tell us why you would be a suitable addition to our team! We actively go through applications and try to advance in recruitment even with fast schedules.

For more information about the position, please contact People Manager Johanna Ljungqvist (firstname.surname@innofactor.com / +358407294540).

Innofactor is a leading promoter of modern digital organization in the private and public sector in the Nordic countries for more than 1,000 customers. Innofactor has the largest Microsoft ecosystem solution offering and leading expertise in the Nordics. About 600 enthusiastic and motivated top experts work at Innofactor in Finland, Sweden, Denmark and Norway. Innofactor Oyj's shares are listed on the main list of NASDAQ Helsinki Oy in the technology sector. www.innofactor.fi

#ModernDigitalOrganization #BeTheRealYou #PeopleFirst #CreatingSmiles

Innofactor grows and develops every day, together with our customers and employees. We are the leading suppliers of Microsoft-based solutions in the Nordic countries. We offer companies, public administrations and other communities all of Microsoft's core solutions. Our entrepreneurial orientation always keeps the customer's needs at the center of our work.

Innofactor's customers are around 1,000 companies, communities and public administration organizations in Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway and elsewhere in Europe. More than 550 enthusiastic and skilled people work at Innofactor in Finland, Sweden, Denmark and Norway. Innofactor Oyj's shares are listed on the main list of the stock exchange NASDAQ Helsinki Oy, where it is one of the fastest growing companies in terms of turnover.

#PeopleFirst | #BeTheRealYou | #CreatingSmiles #ModernDigitalOrganization
title: Software Developer, D365 Business Central

description:
Are you at home in the middle of containers? Do you deploy without waking everyone up from 24/7 duty? If your life were a script, would you run it as sudo or as root?

¬†

As you might have guessed, we are looking for an experienced DevOps expert to join the POP Insurance development team.

¬†

Do you think Dev and Ops are separate things that happen in their own black boxes? In our opinion, this should not be the case, but we strive to build modern solutions without artificial silos. We have a good Dev model, but would you be the latest confirmation of our Ops skills?




If you have a passion for the development and integration of software development and operations, and the ability to see entities and architectures, you may be the person we are looking for. In this role, you will work closely with both software developers and various stakeholders to ensure that development and operational functions run smoothly and efficiently.




Together with the team, you do your part to ensure that the solutions we implement are exported to the cloud efficiently and automatically, that they are run securely and in accordance with the best practices in the industry, and that a surprising hiccup or somersault causes chaos. In addition, you actively participate in the development of information security and the implementation of related DevSecOps principles.




As someone who has a deeper than average understanding of devices, access rights and related magic, you may occasionally find yourself in an IT support role. However, it is not the focus of your role, but rather a nice side hobby, because you feel comfortable helping people in need.

¬†

Keywords: GCP, IaC, CI/CD, Kubernetes, Terraform, Robot Framework, EntraID, SCC, Cloud Armor, Ingress, interconnect, Cloud Storage

¬†

Job requirements:

 * Several years of experience in software development operations and DevOps tasks.
 * Solid understanding of information security and its development, especially DevSecOps principles and their implementation.
 * Ability to see the whole and architecture, and support efficient software development and operation in cooperation with development teams.
 * Communicative way of working and desire to work in close cooperation with software developers and different stakeholders.

¬†

We appreciate and you will be a great fit for us if you have:

 * Practical experience with agile methods and their application throughout the development process.
 * Experience with monitoring tools and their application in the GCP environment.
 * A brisk attitude and courage to take on new challenges and tasks and a solution-oriented approach to work.
 * The ability to get along with different stakeholders and the desire to be involved in the team's success.
 * The desire to develop one's own skills and to be actively developing the team's working methods.
 * Experience with Platform Engineering methods and/or knowledge of the insurance industry is also not a disadvantage.

¬†

POP Insurance's IT team is investing

 * For DevSecOps practices and technologies.
 * For an agile software production process.
 * For software automation testing.
 * To an open discussion and feedback culture.
 * For team spirit and relaxed community.
 * For continuous learning.

¬†

Our hierarchy is low and the work is built around the strengths of our experts. We work in a relaxed work environment, using agile development methods in a competent and comfortable team.

We offer you a responsible, stimulating and challenging job in a modern digital and growth company. We work in a hybrid model, which enables working remotely as well as in the office and the tools that support it. Our office is located in Lepp√§vaara, Espoo, along excellent transport links.




Send your application and resume with salary expectations via the attached application link. We will fill the position once a suitable person is found.




For more information about the position, please contact Miika H√§rk√∂nen, 040 709 2513 / firstname.surname(s) suomenkumpivakuutus.fi.




The person selected for the position will undergo the necessary background checks.




POP Insurance is the marketing name of Suomen Vahinkovakuutus Oy. The company is jointly owned by L√§hiTapiola group and POP Pankki group. POP Insurance began operations in 2012. According to the EPSI Rating Insurance 2023 study, POP Insurance has the most loyal customers and the most satisfied with the price-quality ratio in its field.
title: DevOps specialist

description:
Moontalk is a SaaS company and operator specializing in business call management. The company's business is growing rapidly. In the completed fiscal year, our turnover was 10.3 million euros. In the spring of 2024, Moontalk became a subsidiary of Elisa.¬†




We are looking for a software developer for the product development of Moontalk products and services, who is interested in both front end and back end development. With us, you can develop both high-quality user interfaces and efficient background code with modern tools and technologies. Your job description includes participating in the design, implementation and testing of products and their features. Product development takes place in two-week sprints following agile methods. The position follows the Hybrid model, so you can perform your tasks partially remotely. We expect that you can work occasionally either at our office in Espoo or Oulu.




The position requires experience in working with modern technologies. A few years of work experience gives a good starting point for successful cooperation with our relaxed development team.¬†

You don't have to be a complete guru or know everything, although that doesn't hurt. Our operating principle is continuous learning and development. Together as a team, by carefully doing and learning, we achieve goals.¬†¬†




We expect and hope for these things and skills from you¬†

 * React/JavaScript¬†
 * C#/asp.net web api¬†
 * Entity Framework / SQL / Redis¬†
 * Gitlab or similar version control¬†
 * CI/CD¬†

¬†

We also value previous experience with test automation and running applications in a Docker environment. Previous development of mobile applications is also considered an advantage. We value problem solving and teamwork skills.¬†¬†




We offer you¬†

 * A relaxed and comfortable working environment¬†
 * The opportunity to develop as an expert¬†
 * Excellent tools¬†¬†
 * Extensive orientation and continuous support to develop your skills¬†
 * Flexible remote work opportunities¬†
 * Comprehensive personnel benefits, e.g. lunch and exercise benefits. After the trial period, the possibility of a car and bicycle benefit.¬†
 * Fair salary according to your skills¬†¬†

¬†

The application period for the position ends on September 25, 2024.¬†The position will be filled as soon as a suitable person is found.

Send your application to¬†rekry@moontalk.com¬†with the subject ‚ÄúFull Stack rekry‚Äù.¬†

For more information about the task, please contact Product Development Director Tero Paavilainen, tel. 050 5874125, email tero.paavilainen@moontalk.com.¬†¬†




Technology bingo:¬†

 * React¬†
 * JavaScript¬†
 * Redux¬†
 * OTHER¬†
 * C#¬†
 * asp.net¬†
 * Entity Framework¬†
 * Radish¬†
 * SQL¬†
 * Docker
title: Full stack - Software developer

description:
At HiQ, we simplify people's lives by using technology, design and creativity to build smart solutions and businesses. We are convinced that investing in technology is the best way to make the world better, more sustainable, smoother, safer ‚Äì and more fun. Our service offering covers the entire development chain from the idea to the finished service and to support and further development during the service's life cycle. If working in HiQ's fun and relaxed team and working with long-term customers sounds interesting, keep reading!




Your role as a Test Automation Engineer

We are looking for a competent and experienced Test Automation Engineer. You get to work on interesting customer projects and contribute to testing and quality assurance of solutions that are relevant to customers and users. You are surrounded by a group of experienced HiQ colleagues and the client's team, where you work with agile methods. At HiQ, we value your expertise and you get to act in projects in a self-directed manner and manage your own work.




We expect from you:

We are looking for a Test Automation Engineer to join our team, who has several years (+5) of experience in demanding development projects and expertise in the following technologies:

 * Robot Framework
 * Jira, Confluence, Jenkins
 * AWS
 * Python
 * Experience with CI/CD techniques
 * REST API
 * Playwright and Cypress skills are also useful




We hope that you are used to working with these technologies and have an excellent command of one or more of the areas. We also hope that you are interested in adopting new technologies.




We also expect:

 * Experience with automation testing and its adaptation to the overall picture of quality assurance
 * Ability to take care of the quality of digital services as a whole
 * Experience in integration testing
 * The ability to understand the needs for services and mirror them in the entity being tested
 * Work can mostly be done remotely, but some of our client projects require an average of 1-2 days a week presence in the capital region.




Many of our clients require fluent Finnish and English. We also see previous experience in, for example, the financial sector as an advantage. Working with our customers often requires a security clearance and e.g. credit check.




We offer

In this role, you will work on interesting projects for our customers and you can enjoy HiQ's great working community and benefits. We offer you:

 * An interesting role in interesting and often long projects.
 * HiQ's fun and relaxed work community and experienced teammates. We spend time together at HiQ e.g. in hobby clubs and doing things together. We also actively share information, lessons learned and successes, for example on fullstack Friday every month.
 * Flexible hybrid work opportunity. You can work at the customer's premises, at our office in Otaniemi or Kamppi, or from your home office.
 * Comprehensive personnel benefits from extensive occupational health to sports and cultural benefits, hobby clubs, events and professional development. We are flexible in the different life situations of HiQ people and we want to make it easy to combine work and free time.




Apply now

Were you interested in the position and would you like to hear more about the role? You can ask more about the position from Oona Muilu (oona.muilu@hiq.fi) or apply for a position directly via the link - it won't take long!




After applying, we will try to contact you as quickly as possible. You will first get to talk with our recruiter about your background and suitability for the position. In the second step, you will talk with our more technical expert, who can better explain the work at HiQ and the customer. Finally, we might want to take a look at some of your previous projects or check your references. Then we're already in that most important moment and we'll agree on whether you'll come to work for us!




HiQ as a workplace

With us, you'll find a great mix of diverse talents: creative developers, innovative designers, disruptive thinkers and data-native engineers, all playing smoothly in the same team. With our deep technological know-how and multidisciplinary understanding, we help hundreds of our customers turn the ever-accelerating digital change into business strengths.




HiQ builds truly valuable services for the customer. With us, everyone takes responsibility for what they do and we try to keep things simple in a good way - we don't engage in unnecessary bureaucracy. With us, everyone gets to be themselves at work and that also enables a creative, happy and flexible atmosphere.
title: Test Automation Engineer

companyName: Bank of Finland (Suomen Pankki - Finlands Bank)
description:
Strong expertise is the currency of stability.




We value your expertise. With us, you can do socially significant work, challenge with your thoughts and ideas. Reliability, continuity and balance create sustainability. We also appreciate a good weekday, a rewarding combination of freedom and responsibility. Although we are stable, we are by no means serious. It's no secret that we are proud of our banking.




We are known as a forward-looking and efficient central bank and as a constructive and influential member of the Eurosystem.




We are now looking for you to join us,




(JUNIOR) SOFTWARE DESIGNER (backend coding, integrations)




Meaningful work is inspiring, challenging and rewarding.




About 75 experts in information technology and information management work in our information management department. We are looking for an application developer in the early stages of his career to join our team, who is interested in developing, especially in backend coding and integrations.

The position is temporary and will be filled until June 30, 2026.




You will work in a team that is responsible for the entire IT services of the Bank of Finland's market operations and payment systems, as well as the systems needed by the general administration. Your team's experienced experts develop and maintain the complex system services in a challenging area in close cooperation with the business departments on a long-term basis. In your future work, you will get to know these critical system services of the central bank. Your contribution will have an important impact on the IT services of the central operations of the Bank of Finland. The Central Bank's IT systems are a unique entity, and we do not expect to find an applicant who has worked in a completely similar operating environment. The most important thing is the desire and ability to develop.




Your tasks include backend coding and implementation of integrations with Microsoft technologies (on-prem and cloud). In addition, you get to participate in a significant development project, and deepen your development experience and your knowledge of the business area through this as well.




What can you expect from us?

 * challenging, responsible and versatile tasks with critical systems in an international operating environment
 * the support of an inspiring, competent and committed team
 * a flexible, stable employer that invests in skill development
 * high-quality tools and flexible hybrid work at the office and at home
 * the opportunity to develop as a professional managing demanding IT solutions.




You also get good benefits from us: e.g. comprehensive occupational health care services, generous annual holidays, extensive nutrition benefit, exercise, cultural and work-related travel ticket benefit, and bicycle benefit. In addition, we have versatile leisure club activities and the opportunity to use common leisure facilities in Saariselka and Helsinki. We are a family-friendly workplace, and we have flexible working methods and good remote work opportunities. Our office is located in the heart of Helsinki.




The position is placed in the Bank of Finland's salary system in demand category 15 (job-specific salary part 3697 eur/month). In addition, a salary component based on performance and professional management is paid at a maximum of 48% of the task-specific salary. The personal part is defined according to the experience and skills of the selected person, and typically at the beginning of the assignment it ranks between approx. 10‚Äì20%.




And what do we expect from you?

 * a suitable university degree, preferably in the field of data processing. Studies can also be in the final stages
 * work experience as part of a software development team
 * burning interest in high-quality application development in the Microsoft environment (.NET, C#)
 * desire and ability to quickly adopt new things
 * experience in utilizing new technological opportunities in practical work
 * self-initiative, systematic and responsible approach to work
 * flexibility, customer-oriented attitude and ability to cooperate
 * willingness to challenge oneself with critical systems
 * in addition to strong Finnish language skills, we require good English language skills




We also appreciate

 * experience with cloud technologies, especially Azure
 * experience in implementation of integrations, e.g. REST API, XML




What does meaningfulness of work mean to you?

"The opportunity to use one's own expert capacity in a wide range of challenging tasks. Seeing the results of one's work in practice". - Internal investigation of the Bank of Finland




For more information about the position, please contact office manager Petri Salminen. Contact requests via e-mail petri.salminen@suomenpankki.fi




You can also find out about IT Business Partner Aurora's career story on our website.

Please also read what our chief architect Anthony says about his work in our information management.




Did you know that the Bank of Finland destroys an average of 1.8 million banknotes in poor condition per month. It produces 1.5 changeable banknote shreds.




With his consent, the applicant can undergo a security clearance (security clearance act 726/2014), a health check and a drug test. An aptitude assessment can also be used as part of the recruitment process.




Diversity, equality and equality are important values ‚Äã‚Äãfor us, and we do continuous work to ensure diversity and non-discrimination. We value everyone's expertise and work together as equals. Our work atmosphere is safe and we see everyone's individual background and perspective as a valuable resource. We encourage applicants from different backgrounds to apply to be part of our organization.




The Bank of Finland is Finland's national central bank and a member of the Eurosystem. We build financial stability. We are a stable and responsible employer offering socially relevant, versatile and challenging tasks. We invest in the development of our personnel's skills and good management. International cooperation is our everyday life. The well-being of our personnel and the balance between work and free time are important to us. We value each other and have a good working atmosphere. Our main office is located in the heart of Helsinki.




The application period ends: 16.09.2024 23:59

title: Software Engineer (Junior)

description:
We are strengthening our team and are now looking to join our team




SOFTWARE DESIGNER




Do you feel that the most interesting part of your job is solving new problems? Are you wondering what types of problems you could think about in your work with us? With us, as a software engineer, you get to participate in varied projects. We provide our customers with varying solution sets consisting of up to over a hundred devices for the theater and industrial industries.




Stage technology may be a new field for you and without a touch surface it may be difficult to get access to the solutions that you could think about with us, so here is a practical example:




"There are 6 (1m wide, 5m high) LED walls on one horizontal rail (e.g. stage board 22m long). Each wall has its own control/location information. The task is to make all the walls move together and separately at a speed of 0.1-1m/s so that the displayed image is consistent all the time. Each wall must "know" where its neighbors are, which would avoid collisions and be able to speed up/slow down if necessary. The user has the opportunity to program each movement of the wall through the intuitive user interface, and the program must be able to repeat and monitor the movement in real time with an accuracy of a few mm. And of course, all of this is implemented taking into account possible failure situations, such as if for some reason one wall stops in the middle of movement, how will the others react?"




With us, as a software designer, you participate in the product development work that takes place according to the need from the customer and in the planning of the final solution. You prepare the implementation of projects and discuss the implementation with the customer alongside our project manager.

We use C++ as the programming language and Twincat/Codesys as the environment. Your final job description will be shaped by the areas in which you feel you are strongest and which you enjoy doing. The task description can be modified and expanded according to your interests.




You have a technical educational background suitable for the position and possibly a few years of experience in similar tasks, in software or automation design. You want to develop and have an open-minded attitude towards new things and technologies. You do your work carefully and invest in long-lasting solutions. As a person, you are long-term, self-initiative and problem-solving. You have the ability to communicate in English as well.




With us, you get to work as part of a motivated and highly competent work community, where support is always nearby if needed. Our company offers genuinely good employee benefits, from extensive occupational health to comprehensive sports and cultural benefits. We offer a versatile set of tasks, where you will hardly encounter two completely alike working days. You get to solve problems close to the customer and, if you want, see the world. We offer a great framework for self-initiated activities, where you can truly influence and develop your own area of ‚Äã‚Äãresponsibility.




Here you can see one of our recent projects:

https://www.royalcaribbean.com/icon-of-the-seas







Piqued your interest?

You can apply for a position by registering your CV and application by 30 August 2024 at eezypersonnel.fi







Do you want to chat in more detail?

For more information, contact Eezy Personnel consultant Heidi Tuomikorpi on 043 824 3261.







SKS Control Oy designs and implements stage technology and overall solutions of stage technology control systems for demanding customer needs. Important values ‚Äã‚Äãin our operations are reliability, functionality, safety, customer orientation and sustainability.

We deliver solutions from Finnish theaters to cruise ships of the Royal Caribbean shipping company. Our professional know-how is best noticed when the solutions we implement go unnoticed by the public. On the industrial side, we serve e.g. Finnish machine builders with various motion control solutions.




Get to know our activities at www.sks.fi
title: Software designer

description:
We, the people of Intrum, help each other, develop ourselves and our activities, face challenges bravely and keep our promises. With us, you get to do meaningful work as part of an international working community.







We are now looking for our Data & Analytics team to strengthen a new colleague. In your work, you build and design analytics solutions with internal and external stakeholders as part of an agile team. We are starting our journey towards cloud migration (Azure), so the role has the opportunity to build our new data platform and participate in future technology choices.




We expect from you

 * strong experience with ELT/ETL solutions and tools (e.g. Python, Airflow, dbt)
 * knowledge of modern development (e.g. version control & CI/CD)
 * the ability to quickly absorb new things and perceive broader entities
 * positive and solution-oriented attitude
 * fluent communication in Finnish and English




The following skills are useful in the task

 * cloud technology experience (Azure, AWS, GCP)
 * understanding of modern data platforms (Snowflake, Databricks)
 * experience with a BI tool (e.g. Qlik Sense, PowerBI, Tableau)
 * analytical skills (statistical methods)




Intrum offers you the work environment of an international market leader and the opportunity to do meaningful work and develop your skills in a versatile role in an interesting industry. We have a supportive work culture where your work is valued and we promise that you will get to work in a motivated group with top colleagues. Our brand new and comfortable premises are located in Herttoniemi, Helsinki, with good connections. We work with a hybrid model, where you can flexibly combine remote work and office days.




According to the contract, the work starts as soon as possible and the position is permanent. According to our practice, the credit information of the person selected for the position is checked, and passing the credit information check is a prerequisite for entering into an employment relationship.




For more information about the task, contact the team leader Juho Kolmonen, tel. 0451188911.




The application period for the position ends on September 15, 2024. However, please apply as soon as possible, because we start contacting applicants already during the application period!
title: Senior Data Engineer

We focus on producing services and software that make the everyday life of thousands of companies easier and make their business more efficient. Accountor HR Solutions is part of the Accountor Group. spoon in Keilaniemi.

title: Software Developer

description:
What kind of role are you getting into?
We are looking for an engineer with customer service spirit and strong IT skills to join our international team, who works with customer deliveries and maintenance of RFID systems.

Our systems are already in use by around 150 customers and we are constantly delivering new solutions. You play an important role in ensuring the functionality of the systems, and you work closely with our customers, your team and other company employees.

What type of person is this role suitable for?

Your daily tasks:

 * You take care of the support of existing customers (about 60% of working time):

- Management of support requests with the ticketing tool and by phone.
- Problem solving, technical support and maintenance visits via remote connections.


 * You participate in the delivery of new project deliveries (about 40% of working time):

- System testing, user training and implementation at customers.
- Supporting the project team in various tasks.
- Equipment configuration and maintenance coordination.
- Preparing and updating documents and instructions related to customer solutions.
- Your tasks are central to ensuring the functionality of the systems. We will tell you more about the versatile work tasks during the interview.

You will succeed in this task if:

 * You are experienced with IT systems and devices: you know how to examine log data, read code, understand databases and data communication.
 * You are solution-oriented, quick to learn, self-initiative and you take care of completing the work independently.
 * You speak and write fluent Finnish and English; we also value other language skills.
   
   

Why would you come to us?
We offer a position for an active System Engineer in our technical support team. Our RFID- and IoT-based tracking systems serve large industrial companies and public transport around the world, in a total of 40 countries. By working with us, you get to follow the digitalization of industry from the front.

We believe that an enthusiastic and motivated staff is the cornerstone of success. We have a relaxed work environment, and our team consists of many different personalities. We offer opportunities for professional development and career paths. Our parent company is the German family company Turck, where nearly 5,000 colleagues work worldwide.

Did something leave you wondering?
You can call your future manager Heidi Pinomaa at +358 50 323 6644.
We will fill the job as soon as we find a potential applicant.
title: System Engineer

description:
Are you interested in Azure technology and data processing? Are visionaryness, modern technologies, work environment and reasonable operating methods key factors for you? We work in a good spirit in cooperation with partners and customers. We genuinely promote both our own and our customers' abilities, utilizing Azure technologies and practices.




About us

We are a consulting house specializing in Azure data and analytics solutions, which helps companies to maximize the potential of data-based decision-making and its utilization. Our values ‚Äã‚Äãinclude ‚Äì Innovation, Professionalism and Responsibility, which are reflected in our operations. Cloud1 was founded in 2012 by four Microsoft technology experts. Today, the company with more than 90 employees consists of hard-working experts and promises for the future. We have a solid understanding of integrations, databases, reporting and infrastructure. We are Microsoft's partners in the Digital & App Innovation, Data & AI and Infrastructure categories, which enable you to be among the first to access new technologies and work in challenging and interesting projects. There are already 800 Azure and data platform projects behind.




With us, you get to implement varied and even challenging projects together with the hardest experts in the field. Although you get the freedom and responsibility to do your job, at Cloud1 we don't work alone. The team and the entire Cloud1 community are always at your side in a relaxed and good mood without unnecessary bureaucracy. Welcome to an inspiring and developing work community!




From work

In the role of Azure Data Engineer, you design and implement technical solutions in various cloud projects using the latest technologies in the field. You will use your knowledge of databases, integrations and data modeling to develop our customers' business. You can influence your own job description according to your skills, strengths and wishes.




You have a few years of experience with Databricks or Fabric-based data solutions in Azure and know SQL and Python languages ‚Äã‚Äã(including PySpark). In addition to technical skills, we require you to have experience in teamwork in the customer interface and the ability to promote development work independently. We also value experience in the following: DevOps, Terraform/Bicep, DBT, Power BI, Open AI, MLOps, Snowflake




The duties of an Azure Data Engineer may vary from project to project, but your duties may include, for example:




 * Design and implementation of data platforms in the Azure cloud
 * Data integrations between SaaS, cloud and on-premises solutions
 * Planning and implementation of analytics solutions in the Azure cloud
 * Data modeling and metadata processing
 * Ensuring data security in data processing
 * Teamwork with customers and other stakeholders




Job-related benefits

We want you to have fun and perform at your job. To support this, we offer:




 * Competitive salary, performance-based bonus model and personnel fund
 * A comfortable working environment, where you can get support and it is possible to work remotely (flexible hours)
 * Extensive and comprehensive health and wellness package including occupational health, dentist, leisure and vision insurance, reduced gym membership and wellness activities
 * Exercise, culture, massage, commuting and lunch benefits
 * Fair vacation and absence policy as well as paid parental leave and childcare allowance
 * Continuous development and learning program including training, coaching, mentoring and certification opportunities
 * Various hobby clubs
 * Collaborative and innovative work culture where you can work with talented and passionate people who contribute to Cloud1's growth and success
 * Annual remote work trip




Our office is located on Vuorikatu right in the heart of Helsinki, next to good transport connections. The work is done in a hybrid model, i.e. partly in the office and in a place of your choice.




Were you interested?

Apply for a new permanent position via the button below, or contact us and ask more! Give more information about the task; petteri.mikkonen@cloud1.fi / 0407232551
title: Azure Data Engineer

description:
We are looking for an experienced and skilled cloud services Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our growing team in Helsinki. You will play a key role in ensuring the reliability, scalability and performance of the Azure-based infrastructure. You are responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of reliable and scalable systems, proactively identifying and mitigating potential risks and promoting continuous improvement. This is a hands-on role that requires a deep understanding of Azure technologies, a desire to automate, and a passion for building resilient and efficient systems.

To succeed in the task you must:


 * Real-world experience in designing, implementing and maintaining high-availability and scalable systems in a cloud environment
 * You are able to plan and implement cloud environments and solutions
 * Experience with DevOps tools and practices: Terraform, CI/CD, Azure pipelines
 * Experience in automating operations using scripts and automation tools (e.g. Bicep, PowerShell, Azure CLI, Terraform)
 * You proactively identify risks to system stability and performance and are able to translate them into measures
 * Existing Azure cloud certificates
 * Good oral and written Finnish and English language skills
   
   
   

For strength we read:


 * General experience of CI/CD implementations in different cloud services.
 * Experience with container platforms (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes) and its plugins (Helm, Prometheus, Jaeger)
 * Windows/Linux/Network root user background
 * Experience working in collaboration with application developers
   
   
   

We use a hybrid model of office and remote working, and in this position we would like to work in the office a few days a week due to our client's needs. Working in certain of our projects requires a credit check.

We are a profitably growing domestic company, so we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies. We learn more together all the time and every digital employee has the attitude of a Senior Trainee. The work will be done, but we won't!

We offer you the advantages of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you get great colleagues, flexible working hours and the opportunity to choose your own tools.

The application period ends on 3 November 2024! Do you want to hear or ask more about the assignment? Contact Niko Puokka, +358 40 759 3677 or Juha Laihosalo, +358 40 413 8740
title: Cloud Services Site Reliability Engineer, Azure

description:
We are looking for experienced Java developers to join our team!

This permanent job includes versatile tasks in software design - the role will be tailored according to your own preferences and skills. You can work with, for example, web development, industrial systems, cloud services or embedded software. With our work, we support our customers in developing their business through digitalization.

With us, you become part of a team of experienced professionals, where you have the opportunity to work partially or completely remotely. You will naturally have access to modern tools and strong support from your colleagues.

Who are we looking for?

You have a lot of experience in developing applications using Java or, for example, the Spring application framework. You have also become familiar with the Java software development platform and have been involved in implementing applications utilizing its features. You may also have expanded your skills by getting to know modern application architectures or cloud service platforms.

We Hope You Have Experience With Most Of The Following


 * Java SE or Jakarta EE
 * Spring application framework (e.g. Spring Boot, Spring Cloud)
 * SQL or NoSQL databases
 * Maven, Gradle
 * Git
 * JUnits
   
   

We also value experience in the following


 * Azure or AWS cloud services
 * Application servers (e.g. Apache Tomcat, Jetty, Payara)
 * Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
 * Integrations
 * ActiveMQ, Kafka, RabbitMQ
 * DevOps tools
   
   

What does Etteplan offer you?

Etteplan is a technology service company that specializes in software and embedded solutions, planning and technical documentation solutions. We help our customers create a better world through design, innovation and digitization. Our customers represent a wide range of industries, which enables very versatile work opportunities with challenging and interesting issues.

We have a fascinating, international work environment and are proud of our relaxed company culture. We are also proud of our know-how and our ability to help our customers succeed with our services.

We hope to hear from you as soon as possible!

Were you interested?

Please send your application through our recruitment system as soon as possible, but no later than 30 October 2024. We review applications already during the application period and also start the interview rounds at the same time.

Diversity, equity and inclusion

At Etteplan, we believe that embracing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion is key to our innovation and success. Our global community Happy DEIs, helps create an environment where every voice is heard and valued and every employee feels included and empowered.

We provide a platform for open discussion, networking, and continuous learning, ensuring that DEI is woven into the fabric of our workplace. Join us and you'll be part of a company that doesn't just talk about DEI ‚Äì we live it.

Our purpose and values

Our purpose is the reason we exist as a company ‚Äì it is our north star that guides us in everything we do.

We bring people and technology together to change things for the better.

Our values, in turn, are what define who we are. Through Bold Thinking and a Forward-Focus mindset, we choose to be Smarter Together.

description:
Would you like to take a central role in supporting the smoothness of our business as a business analytics expert and help us convert insights into practical measures? Do you want to follow the transition from fossil fuels towards renewable energy solutions and build a cleaner tomorrow with us?




We are looking for a Business Analyst for St1 Oy, an innovative trendsetter in the energy sector, for the Sales & Brands unit as part of the Business Intelligence & Pricing team. The employment is temporary until May 31, 2026.




In the position, you are responsible for analytics in a B2B operating environment. You will maintain and develop business analytics and produce analyzes to support business decisions. In the task, it is essential to understand the functions of the economy and their relationship with business analytics. You also get to participate in the budgeting and forecasting processes. Success in the task requires previous experience in analytics.




You work in close cooperation with the business and several stakeholders, so you must have the ability and desire to network and dig into the core of our business and learn from others. We value your openness, commitment, strong determination and your desire to develop in your own role together with other experts. We hope that you will regain the passion to bring new ideas forward and take them forward on your own initiative.




We expect from you:




 * Relevant higher education degree (e.g. M.Sc., trade economics)
 * Good Excel and Power BI skills and generally good IT skills
 * Ability to perceive details
 * Good interaction skills and a proactive approach to work in the middle ground between business and analytics
 * Good knowledge of Finnish and English




We offer you the opportunity to work on interesting tasks in a diverse environment, where you have a great opportunity to develop as a business analytics professional. For your support, you get nice and knowledgeable colleagues who are passionate not only about their own work but also about our mission of building a cleaner tomorrow. You will become part of a growing and innovative Nordic energy company with a clear vision and drive to drive change forward.




The workplace is located along good transport links in Tripla, Pasila, Helsinki. As a personnel benefit, we offer our employees, among other things, a bonus system, personnel fund, lunch, sports and culture benefit, leisure insurance and comprehensive occupational health care.




Are you our new colleague? Apply now!




Please submit your application with your CV as soon as possible - no later than 13 October 2024. We start reviewing applications and possible interviews already during the application period. The initial interviews are carried out by Barona, after which the process continues to potential customer interviews. For more information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact Juha Vilpas, Barona's recruitment consultant, tel. 050 404 1757 or juha.vilpas(at)barona.fi. For data protection reasons, we only process applications received through our application system.
title: Business Analyst

description:
Digia's Digital Experience unit consists of iron professionals in software development who produce mobile, online and e-commerce services with excellent technical and user experience using agile methods. We believe in transparency, fair play and long-term customer relationships. Our team includes around 105 software development professionals who have a passion for coding.

Above all, we want to be involved in making Finland's best digital services. Our projects include e.g. The mobile applications of Helsingin Seudun Liikente (HSL) and Ecker√∂ Line, Liiga's mobile services and Holiday Club & Woikoski's online stores.

We are now looking for our team and our already ongoing project

Experienced Java fullstack developer (Java, JavaScript, Typescript, Kotlin, AWS)

In an interesting and nationally significant project, your responsibility would be to develop the customer's critical core system. In the position, you can work flexibly via remote connections or at the Digia office of your choice, either in the capital region, Tampere, Turku, Jyv√§skyl√§ or Vaasa.

You are a much-needed addition to our team if you have experience with the following technologies and skills used in the project:


 * Strong knowledge of Java (Java 8+), at least 5 years of project experience
 * Experience with JavaScript, e.g. vue.js and/or react.js, also for at least 5 years
 * AWS (especially ec2, rds), preferably for at least 3 years
 * You have used Kotlin in project work, preferably for at least 3 years
 * Problem solving, teamwork skills and you like working with customers
 * Experience with challenging and complex IT projects and projects with large project teams
 * You have fluent Finnish and English oral and written skills
   
   
   

We also appreciate it if you have:


 * Completed cloud certificates
 * Experience with the following AWS tools: Cloudfront, S3, lambda and iam
   
   
   

The Digital Experience team wants to grow and develop continuously. We value curiosity, as well as a relaxed and humorous attitude, helping others and continuous learning. We encourage and support learning new things, so we can build many different paths for your career!

We want to offer our developers the best possible environment to do their work: freedom and responsibility, flexible working hours, combining work and free time. Of course, we have a very flexible approach to remote work.

We have several active OpenClub clubs, which help you find exciting things to do in your spare time with your colleagues! Would you be interested in, for example, beer, movies, swimming, crafts, wines, padel or video games? There are many possibilities! There are also several active eSports enthusiasts working at Digia, which you can read more about as told by our developers Juha and Tom here.

With us, you get great colleagues, flexible working hours and the opportunity to develop your own skills. We offer you the advantages of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you can become part of Digia's team of more than 1,500 experts, where people are met first and foremost as people.

We are a profitably growing domestic company, so we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies.

We learn more together all the time and every digital employee has the attitude of a Senior Trainee. The work will be done, but we won't! We have, for example, active tribal activities, where you can get peer support, lessons and the opportunity to share ideas about different topics.

Does that sound good?

If yes, then great! Send us your CV or LinkedIn profile as soon as possible so we can take a look at them. We are particularly interested in what kind of tasks you would be interested in and what skills you have.

We hope to hear from you as soon as possible!
