description:
Do you want to be involved in building comprehensive BI solutions in a fast-growing and international organization? Do you have the ability to combine business and technology needs and offer customers customized data solutions? Are you interested in working in the customer interface and helping our customers utilize data and build forecasts?




We are now looking for an experienced BI consultant to join our growing team in Helsinki!




The adventure that awaits you:




As a BI consultant, you will be part of the 14-person BI & Planning Service team, which is responsible for planning and producing the customer's BI environment. In the position, you will be responsible for data modeling and the construction of integrations, ETL data pipelines and automation. Individual development projects last a few weeks, but customer relationships are long and may include numerous development projects. The task emphasizes an understanding of business and finances, as well as the ability to work in the customer interface. The position has the opportunity to grow into a lead consultant, depending on your skills, even on a fast schedule.




Staria's own BI tool Naviloq combines planning, process control and BI, where we are typically used to seeing separate systems for each function. The user interface is built in-house (on top of PostgreSQL, Angular, Node.js) and product development is in Staria's own hands. You can find out more about the product here.




Your main areas of responsibility include:




‚Ä¢ Leading the implementation and expansion projects of the BI solution and their implementation, including everything from mapping customer needs to the finished report.

‚Ä¢ Mapping customer needs and proactive customer cooperation.

‚Ä¢ Planning and implementation of technical solutions such as PostgreSQL, API interfaces and data processing.

‚Ä¢ Cooperation with Staria's internal teams, such as Customer Care and the Dev team.




What we expect from you:




‚Ä¢ Strong experience in BI and data engineering tasks.

‚Ä¢ Understanding of combining business and technology needs and the ability to work in the customer interface.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and solution-oriented.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills in Finnish and English

‚Ä¢ Experience in financial management or accounting, and/or interest in working with financial data




To succeed in this role:




‚Ä¢ You have strong technical and business knowledge of BI solutions.

‚Ä¢ You are proactive and take initiative, and enjoy working with customers.

‚Ä¢ You can manage large entities and work flexibly in fast-paced and changing projects.




You can mainly work from wherever suits you best, but we hope you are willing to come to the Helsinki office at least 1-2 times a week. The salary for the position is agreed on the basis of the person's skills and experience, but is around 5000-6000e/month + bonus 0-1000e/month.




Why work for Staria?




 * You get to work in a low-hierarchical and fast-growing organization, where work is done with quality and seriousness, but with a twinkle in the eye.
 * We support your personal development. With the rapid growth of our business, we are able to offer versatile and even international career development opportunities. Let's build a career path just for you!
 * We want to offer a workplace where you can have fun and do well. We have received the Future Workplaces certification as proof of our excellent employee experience for many years in a row.
 * We also offer comprehensive employment benefits such as lunch, exercise and cultural benefits, as well as leisure time accident insurance.




Interested in hearing more?




It would be great to hear from you! Apply easily by sending us your CV or a link to your LinkedIn profile here on LinkedIn or here no later than Monday 14 October 2024. However, please apply as soon as possible, because we process applications during the application period and fill the position as soon as a suitable person is found.




If you want to hear more about the open position, Finders Seekers' Maria Vuorinen will be happy to tell you more about the position. The easiest way to contact Maria is maria@findersseekers.io.




Staria accelerates the success of growth companies by offering comprehensive accounting services, ERP consulting and BI and planning solutions on a global scale. We are the only operator in Europe capable of offering financial services in more than 40 countries through a single, committed team, and we are proud of our unique role in the market.




We currently have more than 550 experts in seven countries - and the growth continues! Starians are united by the attitude of growth and our values: Collaboration, Courage and Commitment. Join us in building the economic future of growth companies! üöÄ

description:
Agile Data, AI & Cloud unit is looking for a data engineer for our customer projects!




About 20 experts work in Gofore's data team, who build genuinely meaningful services that affect the lives of hundreds of thousands of Finns. Join us as a data engineer, part of our community, which values ‚Äã‚Äãa good working life, opportunities to grow as experts and opportunities to develop your own career paths. We greatly value curiosity and enthusiasm for learning new things. With us, you have the opportunity to be involved in influencing the growth story of the entire Gofore data team.




In our diverse projects, we work closely with cloud experts in particular ‚Äì in our unit, you can be exposed to data topics, e.g. for projects related to artificial intelligence and machine learning. Right now, our community is looking for an enthusiastic and pioneering data person - a data engineer! We are looking for an end-to-end data engineer: with us you get to work on the whole pipeline, i.e. participate in e.g. for architecture design, development of data storage and management solutions and also to work in close cooperation with reporting and analytics experts in the customer interface. Previous data architect experience is a significant advantage in the position.




What we hope from you




 * Desire to work in cooperation with others, develop and share expertise in teams
 * Your language skills include fluent SQL and Python
 * Several years of experience in building data warehouses or modern data platforms
 * Ability to take ownership of already existing data pipeline solutions and independently maintain and further develop them
 * Skills for information modeling
 * You understand the cause-and-effect relationships of data management and how its other areas are related to data platform creation
 * Fluent oral and written Finnish language skills: our company language is English, but Finnish is used for work in many of our client projects

These things have an advantage in our projects

 * Architectural experience
 * Consulting skills - especially communication skills and the ability to promote issues
 * Data domain certificates (especially Azure)
 * ETL/ELT tools (Azure Data Factory or Synapse)
 * Other experience with integrations, data migrations and interfaces
 * Developing reporting with BI tools (especially Power BI)
 * You have previous experience and enthusiasm for working with clients in the public sector, industry, healthcare or finance.




What we offer you




As an employer and a community, we promise to take care of you, because healthy employees are the core of our company. Our reputation for providing quality services to our customers is solely due to our top experts. Our low organizational model enables a self-directed and transparent operating culture. Our diverse team of experts is united by a pioneering spirit and a desire to work in a company whose existence has a greater purpose than just making a profit - striving for a more humane, sustainable and ethical digital world.




With us, you can enjoy the freedom and flexibility of working. The working hours can be adapted to your own daily life and there is the possibility to work completely remotely from home. However, it is good to note that some customer assignments may require traveling or occasional presence at the customer's premises. The sense of community of the people of Gofore also extends beyond work in the form of various activities such as sports clubs, board game nights and family days.

In addition to the above, we offer you:

 * Certification bonuses and study opportunities (e.g. Udemy)
 * Lunch, exercise, commuting and bicycle benefits
 * Massage and dental benefit
 * Comprehensive occupational health care
 * Care benefit for a sick child and the possibility of paid time off if a close relative becomes ill
 * Share savings program for all Gofor residents




Salary development

For us at Gofore, it is important that a decent total compensation is paid for the work. Salary is influenced not only by experience and skills, but also by our two values: active actions to ensure that Gofore is a good workplace for everyone, and taking the customer's perspective into account in everything we do. In salary discussions with your supervisor, the feedback you receive, the invoicing rate (after all, we are consultants!) and the development of your own skills are central.

We have different salary models, and in addition to the monthly salary, separate bonuses related to the company's success are used. Bonuses can be related to, for example, recruitment, sales or increasing Gofore's reputation.




Greetings from the team:

In my first project, I joined the public administration client of the health and social services sector, where I got to learn about an interesting industry. In the project, I was able to take part in spec'ing the movement and cleaning of the customer's data for reporting. The work has been supported by the opportunity to study various certificates and nice and competent co-workers who offer sparring. You can feel Gofore's sense of community alongside project work, and the energetic environment enables various encounters and opportunities to participate and influence the working community.

Minna, Data Engineer

description:
We are looking for Databricks data engineers for the Accenture Data & AI unit, where you will have the opportunity to work with like-minded and inspiring colleagues using the latest technologies.

For us, Databricks data engineer means a software developer of cloud-based solutions with a strong data focus. As part of a team, your task is to help our customers implement solutions related to the transmission, storage, processing and provision of data, such as


Forwarding the data streams produced by the applications to the applications that utilize and analyze the data

Transferring data from on-premise solutions to cloud services

Various data storage solutions and data transfer between storage methods

Data transfer and mirroring between cloud platforms

Editing, enriching, filtering, analyzing and responding to data as part of data transmission


The utilization of data requires that the data is available in the right place, in the right format, at the right time and with the right content. Without reliable and efficient data transmission, both human and automated decision-making is based on incorrect or outdated information. In this role, you will enable the development of a company or organization to operate in a truly data-based manner.

In the Databricks data engineer role, you work as part of the Nordic group of Accenture's global Data & AI unit. Your location is Finland and your clients are leading Nordic companies and organizations.

We hope from you


University degree

Understanding and interest in data and the development of its mediation solutions, from solution design to quality assurance and production

Hands-on experience working with the Databricks Platform

Hands-on coding and application development experience in e.g. SQL, Python, Java, Node.js

Preferably at least one AWS, GCP or Azure certificate

Experience and/or strong interest in technologies related to data streaming, such as Apache Kafka, Apache Flink or similar

Experience and/or strong interest in technologies related to batch-based data processing, such as Apache Spark, Apache Airflow or similar.

Experience with relational databases and NoSQL databases

Experience and/or interest in data integration products such as Matillion, SnapLogic, Talend or similar

Basic skills in information system development, such as using version control (Git) as a team member, documentation skills, testing skills and understanding the roles and practices of an agile-based team

Strong willingness and enthusiasm to learn and develop your own skills.

Ingenuity and sensitivity to identify solutions and be a cooperative problem solver

Fluent English and Finnish language skills (other Nordic languages ‚Äã‚Äãare considered an advantage)


Why Accenture?


Because people enjoy themselves here; the work we do is challenging, interesting and meaningful.

Accenture offers you a unique career experience and an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. We are driven by the best results, but we never forget to support each other. We want to challenge our employees and give them the opportunity to shine and succeed. We invest heavily in people's growth and skill development.

Our best and only resource is people. We believe they are at their best when they know what is expected of them, and we want to support them at different stages of their lives. Our extensive MyWellbeing program is one of our most important tools for that.

The well-being of the staff is one of our important values, that's why we want to make sure that everyone gets enough vacation in the summer. We offer all new employees 4 weeks of paid vacation in their first summer with us.


Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age, etc. We offer an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone brings their own experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be a part of this diversity!

Interested? Make your move - submit an application online and attach your CV and application letter as well as your salary expectations. We look forward to meeting you!

description:
Digia's Power Platform and D365 unit, which has been awarded Microsoft's Partner of the Year for several years in a row, is expanding and developing! We have ongoing and starting several smaller and larger projects in different industries, both with public sector operators and business customers.

We are now looking to support growth,

MS Power Pages expert (Power Pages Developer)

As a Power Pages developer, you plan and implement various portal solutions (Microsoft Power Pages, Power Apps Portals) with the client and the rest of the team. The work varies from new starting projects to further development and maintenance of portal solutions for existing customers (although our daily service tasks are handled by a separate consulting team, so you can focus on a controlled number of customers). You can find more information about our solutions here.‚ÄØ

Your final job description is influenced not only by your skills, but also by your own wishes for development at work, and for example participating in sales work is possible with us.‚ÄØ

We expect you to have at least 2-3 years of experience in Power Pages/Portals development and JS, CSS, Liquid and HTML skills. In addition, you have excellent problem-solving and teamwork skills.

We consider knowledge of Azure functionalities and certifications (e.g. Power Platform Developer Associate) an advantage.

Why Digia?

At Digi, you become part of a group of more than 1,500 experts, where you meet people as people. We are a profitably growing domestic company and we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies. Learning is one of Digia's cultural principles. We have active tribal activities, where you can get peer support, lessons and the opportunity to share thoughts about different topics.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We offer you the advantages of a large house combined with the community, relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you get great colleagues, flexible working hours and the opportunity to choose your own tools. We have a hybrid model of office and remote working. So you can work as needed from our different offices, the client's premises or from your home, which best suits your current situation.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Were you interested?

The application period is until November 3, 2024, but we process applications received already during the application period. If you have any questions about the assignment or working for us, please contact antti.alasaari@digia.com for more information.

description:
Are you looking for an inspiring workplace where you can design new solutions that really affect the world?

Do you like working with Microsoft's Power Platform and Azure?

We are now looking for new talent for Nortal's ever-growing D365/Power Platform team!




At Nortal, you get to work in a team where:

We constantly develop our skills, work together as a team and help the entire company horizontally.

You get to influence future projects and customers already in the initial phase.

You get to influence society by working on projects that make healthcare more efficient, save natural resources, digitize citizens' electronic services, saving everyone's time and much more.

We have great and humorous Teams and a relaxed atmosphere without unnecessary rules or hierarchies. Our team culture is based on doing things without micromanaging. Team members have broad areas of responsibility, and we trust people to handle their own tasks.




Job description:

Your task as a (Senior) Power Platform developer is to build innovative solutions for our customers that enhance their business and processes with the help of our technical and business expertise. You will apply your skills to Power Apps, data models, views, automation workflows and reports utilizing Power Platform, D365 and Azure. You will act as a trusted advisor to the client, working closely with them and colleagues in the Nortal team.




Skills that will help you succeed:

 * Practical experience in designing and implementing D365/Power Platform solutions
 * Experience with data modeling and Dataverse
 * Good cooperation skills, initiative and desire to work closely with our customers
 * Fluent English and Finnish language skills
 * You like to work in the customer interface and help them solve problems and challenges
 * Experience in some of the following areas: Power BI or plugins and system integrations.




The role can be either technical, including plugins and system integrations, or functional, such as Canvas apps, PowerBI, etc., depending on your strengths and interests.




In addition to everything else, here are a few reasons to join Nortal:

 * Flexible working; flexible working hours, working either at our office in the center or remotely. We even have a nomad program that allows you to work almost anywhere in the world for up to 3 months!
 * Nice benefits, such as support for learning (free digital library, certificate bonus, etc.), massage, holiday apartment in northern Finland
 * Great coworkers with whom you can have lunch, sing karaoke, walk in the forest or even try archery. You are more than welcome to suggest anything fun to do together!




Would you like to be part of our inspiring and growing team? Feel free to apply directly or contact our recruiter Nina, nina.nevalainen(at)nortal.com , for more information or to discuss your opportunities. We look forward to hearing from you! üòä
title: Power Platform Developer

description:
In Fennia, the biggest transformation project in our history, Future Fennia, is underway, the goal of which is to renew our operations to better meet the future needs of our customers.

In Fennia of the future, data and analytics are the basic pillars of operations. If you feel that your heart beats for us, for data, for the possibilities of analytics and for making customers' lives easier, take a closer look at the task below and seize the opportunity!

Job description

We are now looking for a Senior Business Analyst for our Data & Analytics unit. You are responsible for the development of the reporting of the Finance and Control business area, which includes not only the financial functions but also the group's HR, risk management and procurement. In addition, you act as an expert on the reporting application Tableau and participate in training other personnel and developing and maintaining reporting processes.

In this Task


 * You get to develop processes in cooperation with the business by producing reporting and analyses
 * You create informative and visually interesting solutions from data
 * You participate in the development of D&A workflows and processes in terms of reporting
   
   

More than 40 experts work in the D&A unit and we cooperate closely with various business functions. Our common goal is to get the most out of data and analytics for our customers' businesses and lives.

We are waiting for you


 * Strong experience in using a BI tool (Tableau, Qlik sense, Power BI etc.)
 * Management of the processing and analysis of large datasets, using Python and/or SQL as tools
 * Excellent cooperation and communication skills and knowledge of Finnish and English
 * Interest in acting as a mentor and trainer
   
   

We also value previous work experience in the financial sector and knowledge of the Salesforce platform.

Why should you take the opportunity?

In this position, you get to work with different stakeholders in a varied work environment in an environment where the utilization of data is at the center of the business and the work is supported by strong management.

We offer a permanent job in a solvent and well-founded insurance group with a culture of promotion. In addition to comprehensive orientation, we encourage our employees to continue self-development and actively offer opportunities for additional training. In this way, we enable you to have a developing task field and meaningful work tasks.

You will work along good transport links near Tripla in L√§nsi-Pasila. Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work make everyday life smoother. We feel that taking care of well-being at work is more important than ever before, and we support the well-being of our personnel, e.g. exercise, bike and insurance benefit. Our goal is that every Fennian can combine work and free time in a way that maximizes well-being.

Were you interested in the assignment? So apply now!

For more information about the task, please contact Data & Analytics Lead Ida Virtanen, who you can best reach on 14.10., 17.10. and 18.10. from 15-16 at 0442585217 or by e-mail ida.virtanen@fennia.fi.

We try to find a suitable person as soon as possible, so you should submit your application right away. However, please apply no later than 31 October 2024. We may start interviews already during the application period.

Our operations at Fenia are based on responsibility and trust, so the employee's business connections (side activities) are checked in accordance with Chapter 3 of the Employment Contracts Act.

Fennia values ‚Äã‚Äãequality and diversity in the work community. We welcome all applicants regardless of background, age, gender and different language, cultural and minority groups.

description:
Digia offers versatile and comprehensive solutions, with which customers get business benefits, for example through improving their own operations, better utilization of data or a better customer experience.

We are now strengthening our team and are looking for a Data Scientist for a new role

In the task, you get excited about identifying problems and gathering requirements, processing and analyzing data, continuing to visualize the results. We use the latest methods and technology (e.g. natural language understanding, machine vision, prediction, deep learning, data analyses, generative artificial intelligence) in solving our customers' challenges, for example to increase prediction, optimization or customer understanding. In our diverse projects, we work closely with data and cloud experts in particular. In our unit, in addition to artificial intelligence and machine learning, you will be exposed to e.g. projects related to data topics and cloud environments.

As an artificial intelligence expert, you work in the customer interface and plan, for example, how artificial intelligence and machine learning methods can be utilized in different situations. You design and implement methods both in the PoC spirit and for production use. You build prototypes or more productive applications to solve the business problem at hand or to use advanced analytics in data-driven management

You are the expert we are looking for if


 * You have at least 2-5 years of previous experience in similar positions.
 * You are mathematically proficient and competent and master concepts such as forecasting models, machine learning & statistical analyses.
 * You work smoothly with technologies such as Python, SQL
 * Genai: Azure OpenAI API, open source language models are familiar to you
 * You know the basics of software development, github, containers, microservices
 * Working with cloud services (e.g. Azure, AWS, Google) is not completely new to you, e.g. Azure artificial intelligence services and tools and Azure data platform components and tools are familiar to you
 * You are a self-starter and have the expertise, ability and courage to challenge our customers in their development projects.
 * You can communicate fluently in Finnish and English.
   
   
   

We also consider previous experience with artificial intelligence solutions in On Premises environments an advantage. Our projects also have the advantage of understanding artificial intelligence's road protection, information security and ethics.

You will fit in perfectly with us if, in addition to the aforementioned qualities, you also have the attitude that work can also be fun, even if you have a challenging project at hand. You are a positive and inspiring colleague who sees more opportunities than threats and doesn't panic at the slightest thing.

In some projects, Finnish citizenship is required, and in this case the selected person will typically be commissioned by the clients to complete a basic personal security report.

With Digia, you can be yourself and have the freedom to influence your own tasks and working methods, utilizing Digia's general processes. You come to Takuu to learn new things, develop and deepen your skills, when you are supported by versatile in-depth knowledge of different industries. We can build interesting opportunities for your career and take into account your motivation, passion and wishes for the future. You will get an interesting and versatile expert position in our active organization and a unique opportunity to learn something new. Of course, the deal also includes good employment benefits, such as leisure cottages, comprehensive medical insurance and dental care, as well as the conditions for flexible working.

Cultural principles guide what we do, you can read more about them here.

Were you interested?

Apply for the position by 30.10. We review applications already during the application period, so you don't have to wait until the application period is over. For more information about the position, please contact Minna H√§k√§mies, minna.hakamies@digia.com.

description:
We are looking for a Software Architect for our client Mezzoforte to be responsible for the software architecture and development of the Huutokaupat.com service together with the rest of the team. The position has a flexible telecommuting option, but presence at the Helsinki office is desired at least a few days a month.




What do your duties entail?

The role of the software architect is focused on new development and modernization. The work is guided by the needs identified from business, technological innovations and improvement needs identified from audits. Architecturally, performance and a sustainable life cycle are important, i.e. the functionalities would be better modified and developed in the future as well. You work as part of a software development team of 13 people and in close cooperation with the data and testing team, business managers and service planning.




The duties of a software architect include:

 * Main responsibility for the software architecture of the Huutokaupat.com service and development together with the rest of the team
 * Preparing technical implementation plans for the most demanding development and modernization projects
 * Acting as a technical expert in various liaison and development projects
 * Participation in software development according to work situations




The technology stack consists of e.g. PHP Symfony, React, Next.js, TypeScript, Python, MariaDB, SQL, Docker and AWS.




What does Mezzoforte expect from you?

In order to be successful in the task, you have experience in planning the architecture of large software packages and backend-focused fullstack software development for at least five years. You have an insight into different architectures, programming languages ‚Äã‚Äãand databases and an understanding of their advantages and disadvantages. We are hoping for the ability and desire to plan and implement the modernization of legacy systems, as well as the ability to act as a team expert in architectural solutions.




We consider experience in the technologies mentioned above and DevOps to be an advantage. You work fluently in Finnish and English.




What does Mezzoforte offer you?

You will become part of Finland's most interesting and reliable circular economy marketplace. Mezzoforte is a successful growth company, where you get to leave your own handprint through the development of the range. You work in a competent team where your expertise is valued.




In addition, Mezzoforte offers comprehensive employee benefits, such as occupational health care services in Mehil√§inen, Smartum's lunch and refreshment benefit, telephone benefit and high-quality work tools, leisure activities and one hour of working time for exercise every week, as well as four weeks of paid vacation for the summer period following the start of the employment relationship (May 2‚ÄìSeptember 30).




Were you interested in the assignment?

Apply by Wednesday 16 October 2024 at the latest by sending your CV with salary expectations via the attached link. However, act soon, because we process applications already within the application period. For more information about the task, please contact Avila's senior consultant Jarna Lehtola, jarna.lehtola@avila.fi

description:
We are looking for an experienced Backend developer to strengthen our team in a demanding and extensive project assignment, where public online services for consumers are developed. If you are an application developer who is not afraid of challenges and you want to work with the latest technologies, this could be the next step in your career!




Standard:

 * Fluent Finnish language skills
 * Very strong, several years of experience in application development
 * In the background, extensive development projects with public sector online services in the role of backend developer
 * Stack: Clojure, AWS, container technologies (e.g. Docker & Kubernetes), relational databases, REST, Key-value and/or NoSQL
 * Knowledge of messaging technology
 * At least two years of experience (within the last 4 years) in large-scale assignments where the weekly accessibility of the web service and page downloads are in the hundreds of thousands/millions/week. The assignments must be large, on which several application development teams have worked.
 * Excellent communication skills




Your tasks include the development and maintenance of applications using the technologies mentioned above. You will develop scalable and high-performance backend solutions as part of an experienced team and you will be able to utilize your versatile skills in a great team. In your work, you are a key factor in the team's technical orientation and you ensure the high-quality implementation of projects.




Why Mavericks?




By joining Mavericks, you get the best of both worlds: the freedom and reward of a software freelancer, and the security and benefits of an employment relationship. Low-level organization, transparency and fair compensation are part of our operating model. Sales, administration, tools - everything is taken care of for you, so you can focus 100% on your assignment.




Fair compensation ‚Äì All our consultants are compensated based on how much revenue they bring in. The salary base is the same for everyone. No salary discussions, equal treatment. The gross salary is 50.7% of the billing, which usually means around ‚Ç¨6750‚Äì8000/month.




Top projects to choose from ‚Äì Our consultants are free to choose their projects from large and small, domestic and international clients. In addition to our own sales, we cooperate with Finland's strongest consulting houses to find the most suitable and interesting projects for our consultants' needs.




Trust and flexibility - We are a group of mature professionals. We take good care of our customers, and at the same time we influence how, where and how much we work.




Simple and transparent ‚Äì ‚Äã‚ÄãFor us, simple means efficient, clear and extremely transparent. All aspects of our business communicate openly. In this way, everyone has a shared understanding of the business and can provide valuable feedback to improve the company.

description:
We are looking for an experienced DevOps and cloud technology expert in Helsinki. The role and tasks are adapted to the strengths of the person selected for the position. Even if you don't tick all the boxes on this technology list, that's not a barrier. At Digi, we encourage continuous learning, each of us is a Senior Trainee, regardless of title.

Cloud Engineer - Cloud expert, Azure

Our Cloud Operations team provides management and operation services for our customers' hybrid and cloud environments. We take care of the trouble-free operation of the systems, we design and implement development and change work related to the environment. We work closely with Digi's Service Center, which handles our customers' contacts centrally (SPOC / 1st. Level).

In your work, you will participate in the maintenance and development tasks of our customers' cloud environments, you will plan and develop the automation of management and maintenance tasks. You implement implementations of cloud environments and you prefer to do them with code, rather than from the user interface. The position requires regular presence every week in Helsinki due to the needs of our client. We therefore hope that you could work from the office a few days a week.

Our service promise is to ensure high availability of services, continuous development and data secure use. Digia's and our customers' cloud partners are Microsoft Azure, Google GCP and Amazon AWS.

To succeed in the task you must:


 * Experience in the development and maintenance of Azure cloud environments
 * You are able to plan and implement cloud environments and solutions
 * Experience with DevOps tools and practices: Ansible, Terraform, CI/CD, Azure pipelines
 * Experience with container technologies and orchestration such as Helm, Docker and Kubernetes
 * Good oral and written Finnish and English language skills
   
   
   

For strength we read:


 * General experience of CI/CD implementations in different cloud services.
 * Existing cloud certifications and training
 * Windows/Linux/Network root user background
 * Experience working in collaboration with application developers
   
   
   

Working in certain of our projects requires a credit check.

We are a profitably growing domestic company, so we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies. We learn more together all the time and every digital employee has the attitude of a Senior Trainee. The work will be done, but we won't!

We offer you the advantages of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you get great colleagues, flexible working hours and the opportunity to choose your own tools. We use a hybrid model of office and remote working, and in this position we would like to work in the office a few days a week due to our client's needs.

The application period ends on 13 October 2024! Do you want to hear or ask more about the assignment? Contact Niko Puokka, +358 40 759 3677 or Juha Laihosalo, +358 40 413 8740

description:
As a Web Cloud architect, you play a key role in designing and implementing scalable, secure and cost-effective cloud architecture solutions. Your tasks include being responsible for the planning, implementation and maintenance of cloud environments for our customers' online services and applications, as well as close cooperation with different development teams.

In your role, you also participate in continuous development, optimization and the introduction of new technologies, ensuring that our services are always top-class and meet the requirements of our customers and business.

Areas of responsibility:
 * Design and development of cloud architecture for online services (AWS, Azure Cloud)
 * Management and optimization of multi-cloud and hybrid cloud environments
 * Integration and automation of DevOps practices and tools (e.g. CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code).
 * Cloud infrastructure security, performance optimization and cost management
 * Cooperation with development, IT and business teams in the implementation of cloud solutions
 * Planning and implementation of cloud migration projects

Qualifications:
 * At least 7 years of experience in cloud services and designing their architectures
 * In-depth knowledge of AWS and/or Azure platforms
 * Experience with DevOps tools and practices (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform)
 * Experience with databases, e.g. MongoDB, OracleDB, PostgreSQL,
 * MySQL, MariaDB
 * Experience with programming languages, e.g. JavaScript, Node.js. React, TypeScript
 * Good information security and data protection skills in cloud service environments
 * Experienced in teamwork and ability to manage projects independently
 * Strong problem solving skills and the ability to make decisions in rapidly changing situations




We offer

 * Competitive salary
 * At the forefront of low vision technology
 * Flexible working hours, as well as humanity and fairness
 * The possibility to work in Helsinki or Oulu




We are looking for committed and talented professionals who want to be part of a dynamic and growing team. If this sounds like you, feel free to submit your application.




Join PehuTec's growing and developing team!

www.pehutec.com

description:

Studeo Oy develops electronic learning materials that combine pedagogy, high-quality content and the benefits of technology. We are a Finnish growth company and a pioneer in the digitization of learning.

In your position, you will work as part of our software development team, where you will specialize in the development of artificial intelligence functionalities. You will also work closely as part of our business development team and participate in our product development projects in the role of an expert. Experience with the programming interfaces of artificial intelligence systems and knowledge of the operating principles of generative artificial intelligence models is also a useful skill, but not a necessity.  * Relational databases

We consider experience of the following to be an advantage:

description:
Sogeti is one of the pioneers of generative artificial intelligence. Our first Customer solutions that utilized content-producing artificial intelligence (generative AI) went into production use already at the end of the 2010s. As a result of the attention raised by ChatGPT, our customers' interest in various GenAI applications and solutions has increased rapidly, and we are now looking for new reinforcements to support this growing activity.




We are now looking for software developers to join us, who implement customized solutions applying content-producing artificial intelligence technologies. In this position, you get to utilize your skills by designing and implementing GenAI solutions for our customers for a wide range of business needs.




Job description:




 * You develop applications that utilize GenAI, e.g. With Microsoft Azure OpenAI Services.
 * If necessary, you are involved in the entire software development life cycle, including planning, implementation and maintenance.
 * You work as a consultant in customer projects, map customer needs and offer them value-producing solutions.
 * If necessary, you are ready to jump into the client's existing teams and quickly and proactively take responsibility for assignments.




We expect from you:




 * Strong experience with the Microsoft Azure platform and Azure AI products.
 * Excellent programming skills and experience in application architecture.
 * Experience with DevOps pipelines and the entire software development lifecycle.
 * Experience in the use of language models (large language models) and their application to practical business problems.
 * Ability to quickly adopt the customer's operating methods and culture, as well as a proactive attitude in the face of new challenges.
 * Excellent Finnish and English language skills.




We consider it an advantage:

 * Relevant Associate and Expert level certifications related to Microsoft Azure and Microsoft artificial intelligence services.
 * Other AI and technology certifications.
 * Experience with RAG implementations.




What do we offer you?




At Soget, you get to do interesting and challenging projects with Finland's largest companies and public sector actors. We are part of the global Capgemini group, but don't worry: Sogeti, which has around 150 people, works independently and agilely - and we hope the same from you. With us, you are among top IT professionals in a low-hierarchy culture, where everyone's professional skills are valued and supported, and the balance between work and free time is maintained. At Soget, we encourage courage, aim high, respect everyone and have fun. For us, everyone gets to be their own unique self, because we believe that a combination of different people and their ideas is the key to success. We guarantee you a happy and growth-oriented work community! Take a look at the link to see what our everyday life is like https://www.sogeti.fi/tule-meille/elamaa-sogetilla/.




Sogeti also offers you comprehensive employment benefits, which include:




 * Continuous learning : a global learning platform through which you get access to more than 250,000 study units or certificates (Coursera, Pluralsight, Harvard Spark, etc.)
 * Great modern office premises in Ruoholahti (or Lappeenranta). The crown jewel of our Ruoholahti office is the free Spa & Wellness area, where you can find e.g. swimming pool, jacuzzi, saunas, gym, gym and yoga studio.
 * Lunch allowance and comprehensive wellness benefits (Edenred), which can be used for massages, business trips or dental care in addition to sports and cultural services.
 * Active sports and hobby opportunities with colleagues, e.g. with chess, basketball, skiing, and board games.




Were you interested?




Apply for a job via the link on our website!




Is there perhaps something left to think about? At a low threshold, you can contact Talent Acquisition Specialist Elsa Marttinen (elsa.marttinen@capgemini.com), who will be happy to tell you more about the recruitment process and what it's like to work at Soget.

description:

description:
AWS Cloud Architect, come design and build the cloud for Gofore!

Have you designed and built cloud solutions on top of AWS, and do you still want to continue developing as a hands-on cloud architect? You may be the new colleague we are looking for in our cloud team.




What do I do as an AWS Cloud Architect at Gofore?

At Gofore, we make challenging, individual cloud implementations for clients in projects. With our work, we enable the success of demanding software development projects by planning and implementing infrastructure and its automation. Sometimes we also jump into migration cases and planning governance models. We follow the best practices of the cloud, but our projects are not duplicates, but there is a genuine variation in them that takes the author forward as a professional.




Gofore's team of 50 cloud experts offers support and sparring company in the face of tough times. You can find out more about our cloud work in our cloud project radar.




From short to beautiful

Press the Easy Apply button and we will contact you and arrange virtual coffees in Teams. We want to get to know your wishes and expectations better, and let's openly think together whether our cloud team and Gofore would meet your expectations for a good job and your next career move.
sector: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
title: AWS Cloud Architect

description:
We are looking for an experienced and versatile Full Stack developer for an interesting position in the public sector. In your position, you will be responsible for the development and maintenance of extensive public online services aimed at consumers.




Standard:

 * Fluent Finnish language skills
 * Long and comprehensive experience in software development as a full stack developer
 * Stack: React, Node, TypeScript, AWS, REST, CSS + relational databases
 * Work experience of at least one assignment where WCAG accessibility guidelines have been followed (levels A and AA)
 * At least two years of experience (within the last 4 years) in large-scale assignments where the weekly accessibility of the web service and page downloads are in the hundreds of thousands/millions/week. The assignments must be large, on which several application development teams have worked.




The person we are looking for has excellent interaction and problem-solving skills and works effectively both independently and in a team. The expert selected for the position will work at the client's office in Helsinki or, alternatively, in a hybrid model. We offer the opportunity to work on significant projects in an expert and encouraging environment. Against these wishes, we promptly offer flexibility and responsibility and, of course, a fair compensation corresponding to the requirements of the job. If the development and maintenance of high-quality online services sounds like you, you might be the expert we're looking for!




Why Mavericks?




By joining Mavericks, you get the best of both worlds: the freedom and reward of a software freelancer, and the security and benefits of an employment relationship. Low-level organization, transparency and fair compensation are part of our operating model. Sales, administration, tools - everything is taken care of for you, so you can focus 100% on your assignment.




Fair compensation ‚Äì All our consultants are compensated based on how much revenue they bring in. The salary base is the same for everyone. No salary discussions, equal treatment. The gross salary is 50.7% of the billing, which usually means around ‚Ç¨6750‚Äì8000/month.




Top projects to choose from ‚Äì Our consultants are free to choose their projects from large and small, domestic and international clients. In addition to our own sales, we cooperate with Finland's strongest consulting houses to find the most suitable and interesting projects for our consultants' needs.




Trust and flexibility - We are a group of mature professionals. We take good care of our customers, and at the same time we influence how, where and how much we work.




Simple and transparent ‚Äì ‚Äã‚ÄãFor us, simple means efficient, clear and extremely transparent. All aspects of our business communicate openly. In this way, everyone has a shared understanding of the business and can provide valuable feedback to improve the company.

title: Senior Software Engineer

description:
We are looking for an experienced and skilled DevOps expert for our growing team in Helsinki, who builds and develops our client's strategic cloud platform (Azure). You will play a key role in advancing the client's DevOps capabilities and ensuring reliable and efficient delivery of applications. Your work includes hands-on coding, design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines, and providing technical coaching to development teams on their sustainable use. You participate in the development and implementation of scalable solutions based on modern best practices and act as a DevOps ambassador, promoting agile development and comprehensive automation.

To succeed in the task you must:


 * Deep understanding of DevOps principles and practices
 * Experience in designing and implementing IaC/CI/CD pipelines and integrations
 * Experience in applying Secure Supply Chain principles
 * Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) methods and automation
 * Ability to share knowledge and act as a mentor to development teams
 * Experience with microservice architecture and its best practices is a significant advantage
 * Experience with test automation and a comprehensive testing strategy is an advantage
 * Existing Azure cloud certificates
 * Excellent communication and cooperation skills
 * Ability to work independently and as part of a team
   
   
   

We use a hybrid model of office and remote working, and in this position we would like to work in the office a few days a week due to our client's needs. Working in certain of our projects requires a credit check.

We are a profitably growing domestic company, so we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies. We learn more together all the time and every digital employee has the attitude of a Senior Trainee. The work will be done, but we won't!

We offer you the advantages of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you get great colleagues, flexible working hours and the opportunity to choose your own tools.

The application period ends on 3 November 2024! Do you want to hear or ask more about the assignment? Contact Niko Puokka, +358 40 759 3677 or Juha Laihosalo, +358 40 413 8740
title: DevOps Engineer, Azure

description:
Do you want to take part in building the digital world of the future?




We are looking for a passionate Embedded Software Engineer who gets excited about cutting-edge technologies and has a passion for innovation. We are looking for you, a brave expert in embedded systems who takes professional pride in code. Your code is easy to read, further develop, maintain and test.




We at ALTEN are pioneers of the digital world, revolutionizing the way companies operate in various fields. Our agile and forward-looking team is committed to pushing boundaries and building next-level software solutions that shape the future. As an expert in embedded systems with us, you have the opportunity to work on pioneering projects alongside the best in the industry.




Success in the role enables:




 * At least 5 years of experience in embedded systems software development
 * Good command of at least one programming language (e.g. C, C++, Python)
 * Linux or Unix knowledge
 * At least a lower university degree in a suitable field,
 * and fluent Finnish and English language skills




In addition, we consider it an advantage:




 * Experience working with some of the following technologies:
 * Qt, QML,
 * C#,
 * GitLab, GitHub and Git
 * JavaScript, TypeScript
 * AWS and Azure




Please note that you do not need to be familiar with all technologies to be successful in the role.




We offer you:




 * Innovative work environment and challenges: You get to work in an inspiring environment where creativity and technical know-how are combined. Our goal is always to develop new and innovative solutions for our customers' needs.
 * Keys to professional growth and development: Continuous learning and professional development will increase your skills and expertise. You also have the opportunity to participate in Tech Week events and complete IT industry certifications.
 * Diverse work and a close-knit team: You get access to a stimulating and inclusive work environment, where your contribution is valued and personal growth is promoted. Join a team of skilled and enthusiastic developers who share a passion for programming. With us, every voice is heard, and cooperation is the key to our success.
 * Challenging projects: You get to work on versatile and meaningful projects. You develop software that directly affects people's everyday life and changes industry standards. You are helping to build the future!




We hope you are our future Embedded Software Engineer!




If you experienced vibration on that side of the screen and want to join our team, please send an application with salary expectations via the attached link no later than October 27, 2024.

You can get more information about the position from our recruiter Joona at joona.jarvinen@alten.fi.




Why ALTEN?




For us at ALTEN, it is important to offer our employees benefits that improve everyday life as a counterweight to their work. In addition to great coworkers and a humorous work community, the package also includes other benefits, such as flexible remote work/hybrid model, lunch, exercise and cultural benefits, and for the most sporty, we also offer the opportunity for an employee bicycle benefit. Part of our culture is spending time together, also outside of work, in various events. For those who are excited about the northern regions, please note that we also have the opportunity to use ALTEN's holiday cottages, which can be found, for example, in the beautiful landscapes of the Salla and Kustavi archipelagos. We take care of our employees' health by offering an extensive occupational health care service and comprehensive leisure accident insurance.
title: Embedded Software Engineer
required skills: C++, Java, C, Access, Python, C#, R

description:
If you get excited about troubleshooting, adventuring in the world of code and harnessing the subtleties of test automation to hunt bugs, you might be just the person we're looking for! Come make the future with us. We have a position open for an enthusiastic and inspiring Senior Test Engineer, whose work history includes expertise and working together with product development teams.




More than 50 professionals from all over Finland work at Personec F, developing electronic payroll and personnel management solutions. Our goal is reliable and smooth salary payment and personnel management. Personec F has a solid position in public administration organizations.







What kind of opportunity awaits you with us?

In the assignment, you will develop testing methods and practices for our products. An important task is expanding/developing test automation and making it an integral part of the release pipeline of our products. With us, you don't have to work alone, because you are surrounded by our entire competent product development team, which includes architects, developers, testers, specifiers and a lot of teamwork. We have a clear direction and it is the future. Will you come along?







What we hope from you

 * You have worked in quality assurance and have a good understanding of testing processes and practices
 * Experience with test automation and using test automation tools (e.g. Robot Framework)
 * Experience in planning and implementing automation testing
 * Programming experience with e.g. Python or Java
 * You are familiar with DevOps and CI/CD tools, e.g. Jenkins
 * You are good at finding and solving problems before they bother our users
 * You are a team player who likes to share ideas and learn new things together with colleagues
 * Experience/interest in AI tools for testing would be a plus
 * We require fluent Finnish language skills due to the job description




What is it like for us to work?

Work at Visma is never boring. We create a framework for success with a balance between work and free time, trust and a low hierarchy. Our company culture consists of many different spices and we flourish through different strengths. Our common values ‚Äã‚Äãare reflected in what we do every day and we believe that in the right company, Monday can truly be the best day of the week. With us, you get a comfortable and relaxed work community of almost 400 colleagues, modern work tools and employment benefits that support the harmony of work and leisure time. Our culture creates the conditions for learning new things, developing professional skills and promoting one's own career. Our work community is always there to support you in achieving your goals and ensuring that you are comfortable at work. There is no lack of significance in your work, because what we do has a real impact on the everyday lives of millions of Finns.







Apply now! We will be happy to tell you more!

In this position, you can work flexibly remotely. However, we hope to see you regularly, about once a month, at the office meeting teammates, because community and teamwork are important to us. The salary range for the position is approx. 5000-6000 euros, but we are happy to hear about your expectations. Our recruitment process includes two interview rounds and aptitude assessment tests. During the recruitment process, you also have the opportunity to get to know the members of your future team.




Please send your application no later than 20 October 2024. We will respond to all applicants no later than two weeks after the end of the application period, and the interviews will take place between October and November.




For more information about the task, please contact Team Lead Henna Tarvainen (henna.tarvainen@visma.com). You can reach us by phone (040-3519518) at the times below:

 * on Wednesday 2.10. at: 14:30-16
 * on Wednesday 9.10. at: 12-14
 * on Tuesday 15.10. from 14 to 16
title: Senior Test Engineer

description:
Hello, you, for example, a data expert at the beginning of your career! We are now looking for a Data Engineer for our client for a temporary position until the end of 2024. If you have a university background suitable for the position, previous experience in similar positions, and a willingness to learn, a solution-oriented and analytical attitude, this job position may be just for you! Read more below and apply for a position today!

Location: Helsinki

Industry: IT

Type of employment: Full-time, / part-time, approximately 20-37.5h/week, duration: until 31 December 2024

Start date : As soon as possible

Type of work : Rental assignment

Other : Possibility of remote working

Job description

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for data modeling. You work as part of the Data Engineer team and your work also includes cooperation with several different stakeholders. The work is done from the office in Helsinki, and our client uses a hybrid model, according to which you can also work remotely two days during the week if you wish.

We offer


 * The opportunity to become part of interesting projects in an international company
 * A nice and cozy work atmosphere and the support of an expert team
 * The opportunity to learn new things and develop
   
   

Job duties


 * Data modeling, design and construction of technical solutions
   
   

We're looking


 * University degree suitable for the position (e.g. IT or commercial field)
 * Previous work experience relevant to the task
 * Good IT skills and knowledge of related technologies: Snowflake, VS Code and DPT
 * Fluent knowledge of the English language, Finnish is seen as an advantage
 * Problem solving and technical skills
 * Positive attitude and communication skills
   
   

Our recruitment process

Academic Work handles this search on behalf of its client, whose wish is to address all questions regarding the assignment to Academic Work.

Applicants are constantly interviewed and if we have already progressed further in the recruitment process, we may close the search before the final selections. The selection process includes tests measuring character traits and cognitive ability. The tests serve as tools for finding the right person for the task and guarantee equal and fair evaluation.

Become part of Academic Work's success story

As an AW consultant, you get the opportunity to grow professionally, build your network and create invaluable contacts for your future. Along your journey, you will be supported by a recruitment consultant named for you.

Learn more about Academic Work here

Do you have any questions about this job?

Petra Joukio or her colleagues from the recruitment team answer questions at krn09@academicwork.fi Mention the job-specific ID number in your message: 15107771
title: Data Engineer, Helsinki

description:
Integrify is a Finnish technology consulting company. We recruit and connect talented developers to teams that are looking for new talent. More than 150 organizations trust us, and companies such as TietoEvry, Digia and Fujitsu have hired experts through us. Our goal is to ensure that our client companies can rely on the quality of our technology experts and that they have the necessary technical expertise to promote business.

We are looking for several experienced experts and software developers for our client companies. Are you the technology expert we are looking for who wants to take the next step in his career to new challenges.

You can be the person we are looking for if you have accumulated experience:


 * On modern C/C++ development
 * About logic programming (PLC)
 * On user interface development of embedded systems
 * In addition, you understand the principles of agile software development.
   
   

We also value a technical degree suitable for the position, excellent Finnish and English language skills, and good cooperation and interaction skills. A prerequisite for success in assignments is that work experience has already been accumulated over several years.

We offer

If you recognize yourself from this profile and want to be part of our team, apply for a position today!
title: Embedded systems software engineer

description:
Pharmadata is a Finnish pharmaceutical IT company founded in 1989. Our goal as a partner of pharmacies is to constantly offer, develop and innovate IT solutions, information systems and services that support pharmacy operations. Today, we employ 38 professionals who are enthusiastic about their work, each of whom is a significant part of Finland's pharmaceutical supply and proudly participates in ensuring security of supply.




For you to succeed with us




It would be good for you to have extensive knowledge of working with data platforms, databases and integration technologies.




Additionally, you would benefit from at least a few years of experience mastering some of the following techniques and tools:




SQL Server

ETL and ELT

SSIS

SSAS

DAX

Power BI

Cloud data warehouses, Azure or similar cloud environments

AI solutions




In short, your responsibilities include managing our data environment, collecting, processing and analyzing raw data, maintaining and developing the infrastructure of the data environment, managing integrations and downloads, as well as describing the integration and information architecture and maintaining documentation.




The most important thing for us is that you have enthusiasm and curiosity to learn new things, you enjoy solving our customers' challenges (maybe sometimes even exceeding and surprising their expectations) and that you see knowledge sharing and good teamwork as the way to success. It is also important to us that you have a genuine desire to take ownership of the themes relevant to your plot and their development, and that you even enjoy being given responsibility - because we are happy to give it. However, you can probably conclude from the job description above that this job does not seem to suit a complete beginner. Although school certificates are not the thing for us, perhaps you have a university degree in, for example, data processing or at least know-how acquired through several years of work experience. Please note that we work mainly in Finnish.




A few words about your future team and our culture




With us, you can join a twenty-person product development team, with Mika as your supervisor. We have quite nice office premises on Mechelininkatu in Helsinki, in Meclu's premises. We like to see each other in the office and thus share our know-how and build our culture, but we trust that you have an eye for the game to look at your workplace according to what makes sense at any given time. As a workplace and as a team, we are currently in the middle of a change in life. Old operating models have been dismantled and we are building a lot of new things starting from processes and our company culture. So a lot is happening on many fronts. Although as a general rule you can focus on your own work tasks, sometimes ad hoc tasks that require flexibility enrich your day. So if you enjoy a very predictable and harmonious work environment, we also offer pace and changing situations.




For us, the glue of work is the experience of working on meaningful things. We are each other's sources of inspiration. Our conscientiousness, competence and skills arouse admiration in each other. We are also precise and hardworking. Fewer seconds slip through our fingers. We even manage to act in the direction of our customers in such a way that we solve their issues without even realizing it.




In the work community, we have a nice "we spirit". If any negative aspects should be highlighted, it is said that we organize too many sauna evenings.




Benefits and specs




The position is full-time and the employment relationship is valid until further notice. Your salary will probably be in the range of around 5000-5500 euros. Of course, this depends on your background and experience, and your salary will also look like that. You can work from anywhere at any time, but meetings at the office are also important to us - hopefully for you too. We also have various benefits to offer, such as a lunch benefit, a cultural and sports benefit, and a bicycle benefit. You might also like to know that we comply with the IT service industry collective agreement.




Our application process proceeds as follows:




Our application period ends on Monday 21 October. However, we try to interview applicants already during the application period and move forward nimbly. We hope that you would be able to start with us as soon as possible.




1. If your skills match what we are looking for, Helena or Ville, who is responsible for our HR affairs, will first call you for a short phone interview.




2. First interview round with Helena and your future front person Mika Rajanen.




3. Second interview round with your future team member and Mika.




If it seems that way, it may be that we may also give a small task to be solved for the competence sample, but there is no need to stress about this. We guide you well and give you clear tools to succeed in this.




If you have any questions, call or message Ville on 044 297 4572 / ville@toolonvire.fi




The application period begins: 7 October 2024

The application period ends: 21 October 2024

description:
Church communication is responsible for the church's national communication and channels, promotes the church's social visibility and produces devotional programs for Yle's channels. We are part of Kirkkohallitus, which manages the joint administration, finances and operations of the Finnish Evangelical Lutheran Church. Our premises are located in the center of Helsinki.




We are looking for an experienced

project manager




For a three-year fixed-term position from 1 December 2024 or according to the contract in the Development and network unit of the Church's communications to lead probably the biggest WordPress project in Finland. ¬†




The development and web unit is responsible for demanding communication development projects and the development and production of the church's common websites and website platforms. We produce, for example, the Lukkari system used by the congregations, the evl.fi website shared by the entire church, and other campaign and theme websites.




Lukkari is a very extensive publication system used by almost all of the more than three hundred congregations, which is produced by Church Communications. Lukkari, which has been in operation since 2014, is undergoing a thorough renewal, and the current system implemented on the Liferay platform is to be made as a completely renewed WordPress implementation. The bidding phase of the implementation is currently underway, and its implementation is supposed to start in December with the partner selected in the process.




The project mainly implements a new technical platform during 2025 and the first pilot implementations are introduced. ¬†During the years 2026-2027, the development will continue, and at the same time we will coordinate and help with the transition of all over 300 church websites to the new platform. Other temporary project personnel are also recruited for the project, the project manager acts as their supervisor and the leader of the project team.




We require from you excellent project manager skills gained through experience, good knowledge related to online services and experience in demanding online service projects. Previous knowledge of WordPress is a big advantage in this position. You know how to communicate with the service's technical system provider. You are a good and communicative team player in the direction of the Kirkkohallitus team, and you certainly have a lot of threads in your hands. You are independent and productive in your tasks, but cooperative. We hope you master agile methods.




Our premises are located in a great location in Helsinki's Etel√§ranta, our remote working practices are flexible.

The position requires a university degree or equivalent theoretical knowledge and work experience, as well as good Finnish and at least satisfactory oral and written skills in Swedish. Salary for the position of project manager is in accordance with demand group 701 of the church's salary system (basic salary 4876.16 eur/month), on top of which an experience bonus of 0-654 ‚Ç¨/month based on work experience is paid.




The position has a six-month trial period. Before accepting the position, the selected person must present an acceptable certificate of his health status.




Apply for a job at evl.fi/tyopaikat no later than October 28, 2024 at 4 p.m. Online communication manager Lari Lohikoski responds to inquiries primarily by e-mail at lari.lohikoski@evl.fi.
title: Project Manager (WordPress)

description:
We are looking for a junior data analyst for a permanent job in the data team of our research company. We hope that we will soon have you as part of our competent and fun team!

T-Media is above all an expert community that offers the best research and consulting services for managing reputation and stakeholder relations. We proudly serve a large number of respected Finnish family businesses, start-ups that have become the best in the world, the largest listed companies and numerous industry associations. In four different decades, we have also done research cooperation with numerous public administration organizations, Finnish and foreign universities, and various organizations.

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for an expert with experience using Excel to join our professional data team. The main work task is producing research reports using Excel and checking them.

We expect from you:


 * analytical way of thinking and numerical accuracy
 * a systematic approach to working
 * self-direction
 * Fluent use of Excel software
   
   

Programming knowledge is helpful in the task, but in this role attitude and learning ability are more important than previous experience or competence. In addition, it is considered beneficial if the applicant has experience using statistical software (R, SPSS, etc.). We are not looking for a person who is ready for the role, but someone who is taking the first steps in their career, a top professional of the future, to develop into our expert team.

The position is primarily full-time, but the position can also be performed part-time, depending on the applicant's qualifications and life situation. The task therefore fits, for example, alongside completing university studies.

When and where?

The work starts as soon as a suitable person is found. Our office is located in the center of Helsinki, next to Kasarmitori. However, working with us is flexible, so some of the working days are done in the office and some are done remotely.

What do we offer?


 * the opportunity to get started with your own data processing career and influence your own development direction in the data field
 * access to interesting business projects from small family businesses to international and Finnish largest companies
 * for deep diving research business
 * Relaxed and fun coworkers
   
   

Ask more about the task or about working with us! The team leader of our data team, Joonas Tarpila, will be happy to answer you, phone +358 50 530 3684, email. joonas.tarpila@t-media.fi. Calling hours Mon-Wed 14:30‚Äì15:30. The application period ends on Sunday 20.10. or as soon as a suitable person is found.

We create our own track, trusting each other as people and professionals - so come as you are!
title: Junior data analyst

description:
Would you be interested in getting involved in building something new and exciting? Will Microsoft's data tools keep up? We are looking for a data engineer who is ready to take on challenges and excel in customer work. If you are interested in a young and agile operator in the data industry as an employer, this could be your thing!




Job description

As a data engineer, you build reporting solutions of different sizes from the source to the user interface. Someone else often makes the reports, but you can also twist them if it seems meaningful. The solutions are designed together with the customer, and depending on the project, the role can vary from top-level scrimmaging with hands in clay to writing SQL. The customer often doesn't know what he wants, so you take a role in your projects, guiding the development work on your own initiative.




 * Salary: 4000‚Äì6000 ‚Ç¨/month
 * Employment: permanent
 * Benefits: Among other things, lunch, recreation and commuting benefits, good occupational health, leisure accident insurance, flexible working hours and flexible hybrid work
 * Location: Our office is located in Helsinki on the edge of Hakaniemi market. The work may include occasional visits to customers. In this role, you cannot work 100% remotely.




Your days could look like this

You come to the office in the morning and participate in the client's daily. After the Daily, you wonder why all the source data is messed up again. When you're cleaning data, you gossip about the subject to your co-worker, who gossips back about the same thing. Then you build some pipeline-like thing that takes the data with style and skill directly to the customer's data warehouse. In the afternoon, you will think about the best practices for information modeling and data transfer orchestration together with your colleagues. At some point, you also brainstorm ideas with a neighbor to solve data model update problems. To take a break from work, you play ping pong or poker in the office and laugh to yourself when the customer's positive comments feel so good.




We hope from you




 * At least 2 years of experience in Data Engineer tasks, especially in the Azure environment and with the reporting context
 * Experience with ETL/ELT processes and building data pipelines
 * Understanding of data storage and reporting
 * Customer-oriented and self-initiated attitude
 * Problem solving skills
 * Interest in the latest technologies and desire to learn new things
 * Finnish and English language skills
 * Also considered an advantage: experience with Databricks, BI tools (especially Power BI), working with large data masses, and CI/CD and DevOps practices




Desired start: December 2024 ‚Äì February 2025.




Psst Not all points have to hit. If the place sounds like you, feel free to apply by answering just a few questions in the ad on Duunitor.




More information about the place can be found at:

Tommi Penttil√§

040 911 9306

tommi@dataclinic.fi




A few words about us

We are a young and smart data consulting company. We help our customers utilize data in their business. We specialize in Microsoft and Databricks technologies, and especially in Lakehouse implementations. A relaxed atmosphere, helping each other and the well-being of our team are important to us.
title: Azure Data Engineer
