description:
Merative is a globally recognized technology partner that provides innovative data and analytics solutions for health and social care providers. Merative is now expanding its operations to Finland and is currently building a new team that will implement the implementation project of the industry-leading C√∫ram system. Apply now and be among the first to join Merative's journey in Finland!




As a technical IT consultant, you will be part of a new team that will implement the C√∫ram system implementation project. You work in a very interesting role, being responsible for the technical implementation and commissioning of the C√∫ram system, while at the same time being able to influence our customers' business through our technology solutions. The work is done in the JEE environment and the team is jointly responsible for the end-to-end implementation of C√∫ram.




Your areas of responsibility include:




 * You define and monitor the quality standards of the development team
 * You plan, develop, program and test the implementation of C√∫ram in the JEE environment
 * You work closely with business and technical stakeholders, translating business challenges into technical implementations.
 * You maintain a positive working spirit within your team as well as towards partners and customers
 * You will maintain and develop your skills around C√∫ram while our operations grow - for example in the areas of reporting and analytics, cloud environments, data migrations, online services and information security
 * You are involved in developing and sharing know-how and best practices among our team around the world




We expect from you:




 * At least 2 years of experience working as an IT or technical consultant, preferably in public sector projects




The keys to success in the task are experience, e.g. from the following areas:




 * Java/JEE/XML
 * Development of web services and REST and SOAP interfaces
 * Design models and methods
 * UML
 * Agile development methods (DevOps, CI/CD, Jenkins)
 * Relational databases (DB2/Oracle) and SQL
 * Websphere or Weblogic
 * JavaScript technologies such as React JS
 * AWS and/or Azure
 * Kubernetes, Helm charts
 * Fluent Finnish and English, Swedish is an advantage




We offer you the opportunity to grow and develop in an international work environment together with experienced experts and the opportunity to significantly influence the future of Finnish health and social care. At Merative, you also get to work on top-class products and innovations that we truly stand behind.




Were you interested? If we managed to convince you that this opportunity should not be missed, send us your CV and application in English via the attached link as soon as possible, but no later than 20 October 2024. We start processing applications already during the application period, and the position will be filled as soon as suitable people are found.




Additional information:




The recruitment is carried out in cooperation with Northstar Talent and the employment relationship is concluded directly with Merative. Northstar Talent's recruitment consultants provide more information about the position:




Lassi Jyrinsalo, lassi.jyrinsalo@northstartalent.com, phone: 040 762 8992

title: IT Consultant, Java/JEE

description:
Merative is a globally recognized technology partner that provides innovative data and analytics solutions for health and social care providers. Merative is now expanding its operations to Finland and is currently building a new team that will implement the implementation project of the industry-leading C√∫ram system. Apply now and be among the first to join Merative's journey in Finland!




As a Senior Business Analyst, you will have the opportunity to utilize your skills and develop new ones together with colleagues who have deep expertise in health and social care processes and technology. Our customer base consists of national, regional and local administrative authorities that offer services in the fields of health and social services, child protection, employment services and social security. With the help of industry-leading products and targeted innovations, we help our customers improve decision-making and performance, so that together we can promote significant development in healthcare.




In this role, you get to collaborate with leading companies and help them renew their business processes using the latest technology. You will apply your deep expertise, experience and insights to solve clients' business problems - be it customer relationships, industry-specific challenges or technology issues - and deliver solutions that improve clients' return on investment.




In the coming years, population welfare management will change significantly, and Merative will be at the forefront of this development. We work with the industry's most forward-thinking partners and clients to transform the way we support the population to improve the quality of life of the most vulnerable people in our society. To be successful in this role, you must have a genuine and strong interest in developing activities to improve the well-being of the population and a track record of delivering effective solutions.




Your areas of responsibility include:

 * Researching, analyzing and documenting customer requirements. Analyzing business requirements and preparing functional documentation and user stories for technical consultants for software customization.
 * You act as a functional expert for the C√∫ram product, present the software's features, perform suitability and GAP analysis, and guide the use of the product to implement solutions.
 * You are responsible for handling business-related questions and problems and work closely with technical consultants to resolve them.
 * You will act as the main contact for the design and development team, facilitating discussions about design options and evaluating the merits of different approaches.
 * You guide and mentor less experienced members of the team.
 * Defining Proof of Concepts (POC) projects with technical support as needed.
 * Facilitation of Joint Application Development meetings.
 * Analyzing customer requests and requirements and preparing detailed work estimates
 * You prioritize and document (solution) definitions, including:




-Operation and process pipes

-User stories

-Definitions of databases and/or logical data models

-User interface views and related design images

- Matters related to quality assurance and testing




Required professional and technical expertise:

 * More than 5 years of experience as a business analyst in a large IT consulting company OR experience in the implementation of IT-related projects in a public sector agency.
 * Analysis of business processes (case and/or process flow) and GAP analysis techniques.
 * Documenting, understanding, analyzing and improving business processes.
 * Identifying and comparing optimal processes or methods of operation, measuring and evaluating results, and directing the team to achieve the best method of operation.
 * You help the Teams manage and visualize different solutions, prioritize tasks and work towards the realization of a "good enough product".
 * Excellent cooperation and leadership skills.
 * Facilitating meetings with customers, system integration partners and technicians.
 * Strong problem solving and decision making skills.
 * Strong written and oral skills in both Finnish and English.




We offer you the opportunity to grow and develop in an international work environment together with experienced experts and the opportunity to significantly influence the future of Finnish health and social care. At Merative, you also get to work on top-class products and innovations that we truly stand behind.




Find out more about us here: https://www.merative.com/company




Were you interested? If we managed to convince you that this opportunity should not be missed, send us your CV and application via the attached link in English as soon as possible, but no later than 20 October 2024. We start processing applications already during the application period, and the position is filled as soon as a suitable person is found.
title: Senior Business Analyst

description:
Do you want to be involved in making the built environment smart and responsible?

Assemblin Caverion is Northern Europe's leading provider of real estate technical services. Smart buildings, industrial facilities and infrastructure must be flexible, responsible and intelligent and adapt to ever-changing needs and requirements. To make this possible in practice, real estate engineering, technology and digital solutions must work seamlessly together. It's time to make significant choices for a more sustainable future.




We are now looking for new cavers for our team for permanent employment in Vantaa to develop digital products for our customers for property maintenance and sustainable development. We are looking for both an experienced and an early career Fullstack developer, as well as an experienced testing expert.

Our applications run in the Azure cloud service world and we work in a Scrum team.







The technologies we use include:




 * Node.js
 * Javascript, Typescript
 * NestJS, Kubernetes
 * ReactJS, HTML and CSS
 * PostgreSQL, CosmosDB or MysQL
 * Python and Databricks technologies







Are you the person we are looking for?




As an experienced Fullstack developer, we are looking for someone with a strong background in backend development, especially with Node.js. Several years of Javascript and Typescript experience is essential. In addition, we value experience with Kubernetes microservice architecture and integrations implemented with NestJS.




In the role of a Junior Fullstack developer, you help the team to plan, develop and implement Azure Fullstack solutions and you also participate in the development of the language model (LLM) system. This includes validating LLM's functionality and maintaining comprehensive and clear source documentation. Along with the rest of the team, you also participate in support activities and the development of automation tests. We hope to find a motivated person who has basic knowledge of the technologies mentioned above and a desire to develop with them.




As a testing specialist, you will take a leading role in the testing process of our SaaS product. You will use test automation and work closely with our development team to integrate testing as part of our development process.




We are looking for an experienced test automation expert with strong experience in modern JavaScript and TypeScript based test automation solutions. As a tester, you are responsible for planning, implementing and managing a comprehensive testing strategy, focusing on both user interface and REST API testing.




We are waiting for experience with a testing system such as Playwright, although we are not locked into any solution. The most important thing is the ability to implement effective testing strategies using the tools best suited to our technology. Familiarity with Azure DevOps CI/CD automation is also highly valued.







And what do we offer you?




üè† The support of our own team of experts, versatile tasks, good training and development opportunities and a work culture based on low hierarchy.

ü•Ö Clear goals that help you perform your work. We reward good performance.

‚úÖ Appropriate freedom and responsibility, as well as first-class tools to support your work.

üçé Extensive occupational health services, employee bicycle benefit and exercise, culture and well-being benefit.

üñ•Ô∏è The possibility to work flexibly according to our hybrid model.

üôå A coal-breathing and committed work community that helps you develop in your career. See here what it's like to work for us.







And most importantly - you are safe with us.




We want our employees to be well. Well-being at work is based above all on a sense of security. The level of our occupational safety is indeed one of the best in our field, but safety means much more to us. For us, security means trust, freedom to be yourself, career opportunities, meaningful work tasks, responsibility, stability, fair compensation for work, long working relationships, meaningful working life and humanity in varying life situations. At Assemblin Caverion, we take care of each other.







Did this sound like your next job?




Please send your application through our recruitment system. In your application, indicate which position you are applying for: Senior Fullstack Developer, Junior Fullstack Developer or Testing Specialist.




The last application date is 27 October 2024, but we will review applications already during the application period. So don't wait for nothing! The work begins according to the agreement.




For more information about the positions, please contact Laura Jalasto, a consultant at our recruitment partner Eezy Personnel, by phone on 050 514 1188 or by email at laura.jalasto@eezy.fi







Assemblin Caverion Group is a leading northern European technical service and installation company. The Group employs about 21,500 skilled professionals in 9 countries, sharing the passion for smart and sustainable solutions. We deliver installations, technical services and solutions along the full Lifecycle of the built environment to support our customers and their increasing demand for energy efficiency, sustainability, and Automation for buildings, infrastructure and industrial sites. Assemblin Caverion Group was formed in April 2024 through the combination of Assemblin Group and Caverion Corporation. Our combined revenue amounts approximately to EUR 3.7 billion.
title: Senior and Junior Fullstack Developer and Testing Specialist

description:
Are cloud environments and Azure on fire? Do you want to make cloud infrastructure as code with modern tools, solve customer challenges and develop as a cloud developer? Come to Cloud2 to work with Finland's best cloud experts on Azure environments in the role of Azure Engineer!




Your role as an Azure Engineer




As an Azure Engineer, you are one of the credit players in our Azure projects. You work in cloud implementation and modernization projects, developing our customers' production environments and act as a bridge between production, the customer and the project team in a few named customers. In addition, you participate in various development projects according to your skills and interests.




We don't limit anyone to a certain box, but the most important thing is that you get to use your full competence and potential in your work. Every person is different, therefore the content of the role is also modified for these individual needs. We have a strong culture of working together and helping, and in your role you also support the less experienced, promising cloud experts in your team in the most challenging work requests. If you wish, you can also work as part of our emergency call (24/7, which is implemented as a reserve).




Typical duties and responsibilities of the role:

 * Azure development projects for customer environments
 * Cloud and migration projects
 * Implementation of Managed Cloud continuous services related to Azure technologies
 * Participating in customer workshops and coming up with new ideas
 * Automation, scripting, implementation of AI solutions in customer environments
 * Development of managed services, technical sparring
 * Continuous development and sharing of Azure expertise




The monthly salary for the position is between 3500-5000 euros, depending on your experience and skills. The position is permanent and full-time.




Our offices are located near good transport links in Herttoniemi in Helsinki and Ratina in Tampere. Our work is done using a flexible hybrid model, from a place of your choice.




Welcome home, to the cloud house in eastern Helsinki




Cloud2 is a fast-growing, modern cloud service company that challenges traditional operators with top-class expertise, modern tools and superior customer experience. We are not an IT corporate moron stuck to formulas, but a unique group of exceptionally sincere professionals. Our story began in 2017, when our founders dreamed of a company where customers and staff would be genuinely happy to be and develop. Now we have a total of more than 100 professionals in two countries (Finland and Denmark) making this dream our job every day. Does it feel like yours? Welcome home, to the cloud house in eastern Helsinki.

Why us?




We asked our cloud experts what makes them choose to work with Cloud2 every single day. They highlighted four issues in particular:




1. Challenging, genuinely interesting jobs

In this task, you get to start the so-called from a clean slate and shape your role according to your wishes and skills. There will be versatile projects and customerships, where you can use your skills and challenge yourself. Our extensive technology stack enables versatile work that will certainly never get boring! You can learn more about our projects through our customer stories.




2. Diamond work team

With us, you will find an exceptional work team with a hearty and (bad) sense of humor, where a friend is never left alone. Your team consists of Finland's toughest and heartiest cloud experts, with whom sparring will not leave you cold. You can read more about your future colleagues on our career pages in the Career Stories section.




3. Visioning and doing together

Working together is at the core of our work. You are not a lone wolf or just hands on a client's project. You work as part of the C2 team, in close cooperation with our customers. With us, everyone gets to realize our vision of the cloud and its management, and you always have a strong back to lean on. We say "yes" to most crazy ideas and "no" to unnecessary bureaucracy. You can build your own plot in the way that suits you best.




4. Make dreams come true

With us, you won't be stuck in your place, because we will do everything we can to ensure that you succeed and develop in your career. Everyone from Cloudi gets to realize and shape their career according to their dreams with the support of superiors, colleagues and the company, and share their own expertise with others as well.

Read more about our values ‚Äã‚Äãand culture on our career page.




We also have employment benefits!




It is important to us that everyone has a good time and feels good with us. To support this, we have put together the following, constantly evolving benefits package. You can read more about our benefits on our career page.




We spend a lot of time together also in various recreational events, both in the office and outside. However, at the center of everything is work, and you won't find tribes or seas of balls at Cloud2.




is that you




You can be the Azure Engineer we are looking for if you have experience in the following titles:

 * Azure services, at least in some areas
 * M365
 * Migrations and cloud projects
 * Knowledge and modernization of Microsoft infrastructure
 * IaC / CI / CD
 * Terraform
 * Cloud Workspace solutions




Above all, the most important thing is that you have a genuine interest in the field and technology and a desire to learn more. You will certainly enjoy and succeed in this role if you bravely take on new challenges, get excited about technology and want to constantly improve in what you do. You enjoy solving challenges and developing production environments. You get the joy of success when you get to bring solutions to customers in better cloud environments. You have an independent and active approach to work combined with cooperation and teamwork skills.




In customer work, you also need fluent oral and written Finnish and English language skills. A great additional bonus would be if you have knowledge of other cloud technologies (AWS / GCP) or virtualization technologies such as Citrix or Azure Virtual Desktop.




Did you get excited?




If this sounds like you, send in an application. Let's find out together if this is the role for you!




Did you miss something?

Contact us:




About the task and the team's daily life:




Pekka Kujala

Vice President

tel. +358 442776170

pekka.kujala@cloud2.fi




About the recruitment process:




Karolina Rainio

Talent Acquisition Specialist

phone +358 50 568 0868

karoliina.rainio@cloud2.fi
title: Azure Engineer

description:
Type of employment contract: permanent, full-time

Location: Vantaa, Vaasa, Joensuu

Application DL: 22 October 2024




Atea is looking for a Senior Software Developer for the capital region, Joensuu or Vaasa. In this position, you will be part of a team of five software developers, where you will work in the product development of a leading industrial company in its field, whose head office is located in Joensuu.

Your job description includes comprehensive full stack development, including tasks related to software definition, programming, testing, maintenance and documentation, in addition to which the modernization and further development of the software is a key part of the job.




The most central technologies used in the system's architecture are .NET, Angular, Progress OpenEdge, Microsoft IIS, Microsoft MSSQL, Windows Server, in addition to which the software has a code base in C++ and BizTalk - therefore we hope that you especially have programming experience with Microsoft-based technologies and C - in derivative languages, in addition to which we value frontend expertise.







It is possible to customize the position according to your experience and skills as an overall architect (Enterprise Architect), if you have experience in a more strategic and comprehensive role in the company's system architecture and development as part of the IT strategy.







Atea offers you:

 * Support from a wide working community and a place at the core of our customer, a leading industrial player in its field, product development
 * Flexible working hours and the possibility of hybrid work - so you can tailor your working day and place of work to suit you
 * Freely selectable tools - you can choose the best tools for you to support your own work
 * Atean share savings program - you get the opportunity to invest in the future as part of a successful company
 * Extensive occupational health care and health insurance to support the well-being
 * Lunch, exercise and culture benefit and massage benefit to balance work and free time
 * Modern office premises
 * Telephone and bicycle benefits, as well as the possibility to rent Atea's cottage in Malaga







The applicant is expected to:

 * Convincing knowledge of .NET programming with C# accumulated through work experience - in addition, we value broader knowledge of Microsoft-based development tools
 * Frontend programming experience with, for example, Angular or similar
 * Understanding of the different stages of the software development pipeline
 * Independent way of working and interaction skills to participate in development as part of the internal team and customer interface
 * Intermittent availability to travel to our client's office in Joensuu
 * Good knowledge of Finnish and English







Practicalities:

In this permanent and full-time position, you will be employed directly as an employee of Atea. In the assignment, your workplace can be located at Atea's offices in either Vantaa or Vaasa. If you wish, you can also work remotely. The position requires the readiness to visit the customer's office in Joensuu approximately once a month. The position requires a passed security clearance.







Recruitment process flow:

 * The application period closes on 22 October 2024
 * Remote interview with aTalent
 * Interview with Atea
 * (If necessary, another interview with Atea)
 * Recruitment decision




If you are interested in the position, send your resume in PDF format no later than 22 October 2024 through the aTalent application system at: https://emp.jobylon.com/applications/jobs/256570/create/ . You can also mention your salary expectations and the earliest possible start date in your application documents. We do not receive applications by e-mail, but only process applications received through the application system.




You can read more about Atea at: https://www.atea.fi/. Questions about the application process and schedules are answered by Managing Recruitment Consultant Mikko Lahti (tel. +358 400 495 946, mikko.lahti(at)atalent.fi).
title: Senior Software Developer

description:
Hello, IT freelancer or entrepreneur - we are now looking for experienced IT architects and Fullstack developers!




Job description

We are now looking for IT architects and Fullstack developers for several different roles for our client in Helsinki. There are six different architect profiles and two different experience levels for Fullstack development. The tasks are perfect for freelancers or entrepreneurs looking for a long-term project.




Roles to apply for:

 * Technical architect (2 people)
 * Functional architect (2 people)
 * Integration architect
 * Data security architect
 * Performance Testing Architect
 * Environmental architect
 * Experienced Fullstack developer (3 people)
 * Fullstack developer (2 people)




Start: 1 January 2025

Duration: Long-term project

Working: Remote work possible, occasional meetings are required

Language requirements: Excellent Finnish language skills and good English language skills in all roles




What we expect from you:




Key requirements for architect roles:

 * Experience in similar architectural tasks (e.g. technical, functional, integration, security or performance testing architect)
 * Knowledge of agile methods
 * Hands-on experience with Java technology, REST API and microservice architecture
 * The ability to act as a coding architect is desirable in many roles
 * Knowledge of information security standards and data protection requirements is an advantage in certain roles




Requirements for fullstack developers (experienced and intermediate):

 * Experience in fullstack development, especially Java technology and Angular 2+ user interface development
 * Development of relational databases and containerized application (e.g. Docker).
 * Development of software based on microservice architecture
 * Expertise in version control and Continuous Integration tools (e.g. Gitlab)
 * Expertise in automation testing, performance testing and queue-based systems is considered an advantage for experienced developers




Additional information and application instructions

If you are a freelancer or subcontractor in the IT industry and are looking for new challenges in your career, this could be just the right place for you - send your application today!




For more information about the task, contact Markku Laak (markku.laak@poolia.fi).




If you are interested, please tell us more about yourself and your background by submitting your CV and short application as soon as possible together with the hourly billing request / salary request, because the application process is already underway and the position will be filled as soon as a suitable person is found. We are personally in touch with the applicants who are moving on and tell you more about the customer environment and tasks.




We perform various searches in our system, and as a job seeker you will receive e.g. tips and newsletters about our open positions. So you should be active and regularly monitor the situation of our open positions and attach yourself to the search!




Poolia IT Oy

Poolia IT is an agile and ever-growing recruitment company. We cooperate closely with various educational institutions and we have several customer relationships with whom seamless cooperation has been going on for years. We invest in a high-quality jobseeker experience, as well as good active communication in the different stages of the recruitment process. We value all our applicants and employees, which guarantees that the work is done in a humane manner. We create work comfort by e.g. acting flexibly as an employer and organizing various events for our employees throughout the year. As part of Poolia Oy, we are a member of the Human Resources HELA and an OMX-listed company.




Attention! By applying for this position, you consent to the storage and use of your data in accordance with our data protection and registry statement.

description:
Now would be a chance to jump into Lidl's international trainee program! We are once again looking for new stars of the future to grow into experts in the grocery trade under the wing of our Interational Trainee program. On this trainee trip, you will definitely get a shopping basket of new lessons, colleagues from around the (Lidl) world and memorable travel kilometers in Finland and Germany. As a cherry on top of the trainee period, you will jump into expert tasks according to your area of ‚Äã‚Äãresponsibility at our Espoo head office.




This time we are looking for three future experts for the real estate, logistics and analytics departments of our Head Office. If you have an education suitable for one of these departments, and you have recently graduated or will graduate during the fall of 2024, then we could have a unique opportunity for you to enter an international career and develop towards expert positions. We hope that you could start the position during October or at the latest at the beginning of November 2024, but we agree on the start on a case-by-case basis.




Below you can read more about what the trainee program includes. On the career pages, you can read more about the working day of the respective departments and the structure of the program.




The structure of the international trainee program




The international trainee program consists of three entities, the exact content of which is determined by your own field of orientation. You thoroughly familiarize yourself with the operations of your own department and support the department in daily work and projects. You will also get to know other departments and get a comprehensive picture of our entire company's operations, from the store floor to the head office.




During the trainee program, your location varies within Finland and culminates in a period in Germany, so it is important that you are ready to live in several different locations. In Germany, you will participate in a German language course and expand your knowledge of our company's operations in an internship. The duration of the trainee program is about 1.5 years, and we also take your wishes into account when planning the structure of the program.




After the program




After you graduate from the International trainee program, we guarantee you an interesting and challenging expert position in your target department. During the program, your future job description will be shaped according to your interests and the situation in your department. The understanding and know-how acquired during the trainee program will enable you to succeed in your expert role in the future. Our company offers excellent development and career opportunities, and many of our employees have advanced in their Lidl careers




These are the things we hope for from you




‚Ä¢ University degree. You can be a recent graduate or have already finished your studies a while ago. It is essential that you have gained a perspective on the topics related to the target department through your studies.

‚Ä¢ We will be happy if you have accumulated some work experience in a field corresponding to your education. You may have already taken your first steps into working life, but the most important thing for us is the interest in developing into a professional in the grocery trade.

‚Ä¢ Fluent Finnish and English language skills. Our official working language is Finnish, but you also communicate naturally in English. In the data and AI team, you communicate with your supervisor mainly in English. Knowing the German language is useful, but you can do great without it, as long as you have the enthusiasm to learn the language.

‚Ä¢ Flexibility and willingness to live in different locations during the program. Your suitcase is already packed for new experiences. During the trainee period, it hurts and happens, so you treat changes as opportunities.

‚Ä¢ Willingness to learn. You will get on an interesting journey to the heart of Lidl's business, where there is certainly more to learn than we can even tell you at this stage, but we are here to support you. It is important to us that you take responsibility for your own learning and that your attitude towards new things inspires others as well.

‚Ä¢ Ability to cooperate and team spirit. Our work is done in a good spirit of cooperation. You like to meet new people and network during the program inside the house.

‚Ä¢ Good IT skills. You control the use of Office programs and you are ready to quickly learn new systems. In the Data and AI team, we expect you to be familiar with the Data Scientist tools, and we also hope for knowledge or at least enthusiasm for ML/AI, the python programming language and BI tools. In the logistics department, we want fluent excel skills (e.g. Vlookup and SAM).

‚Ä¢ B driver's license and the opportunity to do mobile work. During the trainee period, you get to visit our different locations and get around the easiest when you can grab a dump truck for your use.






This is all we offer you

‚Ä¢ Permanent employment and a competitive salary. We pay you 3400e/month right from the start of the trainee program. The salary level develops with years of Lidl experience.

‚Ä¢ An interesting and demanding task field in an innovative and international environment. The position offers a broad overview of our company's operations.

‚Ä¢ A permanent job, valuable work experience abroad and good advancement opportunities. Many trainees have progressed in their careers and spent a long time with us. International work rotation is also possible at Lidl. Such opportunities are rarely offered!

‚Ä¢ Support with living arrangements during the trainee program, if the orientation is located further from your home during the program.

‚Ä¢ A personal mentor who has himself completed the International trainee program. Your mentor spars, shares his experiences and gives tips throughout the program. In addition, you have a direct line to HR and, of course, your own immediate supervisor. The program includes regular feedback discussions, the aim of which is to ensure that we have a common direction.

‚Ä¢ Modern working facilities at our head office in Niittykummu, Espoo, flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely after the initial orientation - we want your work and free time to remain in good balance.

‚Ä¢ As a Lidl member, you get a six percent staff discount in our stores, an e-pass and various partnership benefits. In addition, we organize events for the staff, offer baby packages and support the well-being of Lidl residents with occupational health care. You also get great opportunities to develop your own skills, because we have a comprehensive selection of training courses and we spend 2.5 million euros annually to train our employees.




Become our colleague!




Check out what our previous trainee Max says about the program in the video.




Do you want to hear what the daily life of an International trainee is like or what all the traineeship entails? Our recruitment expert Anna Jauhiainen (tel. 040 153 0929) will happily answer your questions on Thursday, August 29. from 14:00 to 15:30 and on Thursday 5 September. from 9 to 10:30 a.m.




In addition, we organize a Teams information event, where you can come and hear more about the contents of the trainee program and the recruitment process. The information event will be held on Tuesday 3 September at 12.00‚Äì13.00. You can join the information session HERE.




Apply for the position by filling out the electronic application form by September 15, 2024. In the application, tell us about your own background, your previous tasks, your way of working and why you would be interested in the trainee program and the trade sector. In addition, we are interested in hearing in which department you are willing to work.




Attention! This application is intended for applicants from all departments. We will transfer your application to the recruitment process of the department you have chosen, and you will receive a separate email about this transfer. You are not required to take any action after your application has been transferred.




RECRUITMENT PROCESS




Below you can see a description of the progression of the recruitment process. We use both e-mail and phone calls for applicant communication, so please actively follow these channels!




Week 38 Prequalification of applications based on application documents

Week 38-39 Ability and aptitude tests

Week 38-39 Telephone interviews

Week 39-40 1st interview round (analytics interviews are conducted in English)

Week 41 Selection day (Analytics Mon 7.10. (part of the selection day will be carried out in advance), Logistics 9.10. and Real Estate 11.10.)

Week 42 Review of recommendations and selection decisions

Week 43 Employment contract
title: International trainee, real estate, logistics and analytics
job_title_desc: International trainee real estate logistics analytics

description:
Digia's Digital Experience unit consists of experienced software development professionals who produce mobile, online and e-commerce services with excellent technical and user experience using agile methods. We believe in transparency, fair play and long-term customer relationships. Our team includes around 105 software development professionals who have a passion and joy for coding.

Above all, we want to be involved in making Finland's best digital services. Our projects include e.g. The mobile applications of Helsingin Seudun Liikente (HSL) and Ecker√∂ Line, Liiga's mobile services and Holiday Club & Woikoski's online stores.

We are now looking for our team

Senior DevOps experts (Kubernetes, Terraform, Gitlab)

In a long-term, socially significant project, your responsibility would be to develop the customer's core system. In the position, you can work flexibly via remote connections or at the Digia office of your choice, either in the capital region, Tampere, Turku, Jyv√§skyl√§ or Vaasa.

You are a much-needed addition to our team if:


 * you have strong experience with Kubernetes and Terraform, preferably at least 4-5 years in project delivery
 * you have used Gitlab and Gitlab CI in projects.
 * you have problem-solving skills, teamwork skills and experience working in a large agile development team and in complex environments
 * you have fluent Finnish and English oral and written skills.
   
   
   

We also appreciate it if you happen to have:


 * completed cloud certifications, especially from AWS
 * ability to utilize the following AWS tools and technologies: AWS Cloudwatch, AWS Lattice, S3, AWS Lambda
 * knowledge and experience with the following technologies and tools: ArgoCD, Helm Charts, Keycloak, Postgresql, APISIX.
   
   
   

The Digital Experience team wants to grow and develop continuously. We value curiosity, as well as a relaxed and humorous attitude, helping others and continuous learning. We encourage and support learning new things, so we can build many different paths for your career!

We want to offer our developers the best possible environment to do their work: freedom and responsibility, flexible working hours, combining work and free time. Of course, we have a very flexible approach to remote work.

We have several active OpenClub clubs, which help you find exciting things to do in your spare time with your colleagues! Would you be interested in, for example, beer, movies, swimming, crafts, wines, padel or video games? There are many possibilities! There are also several active eSports enthusiasts working at Digia, which you can read more about as told by our developers Juha and Tom here.

With us, you get great colleagues, flexible working hours and the opportunity to develop your own skills. We offer you the advantages of a big house combined with the relaxation and flexibility of a small house. With us, you can become part of Digia's team of more than 1,500 experts, where people are met first and foremost as people.

We are a profitably growing domestic company, so we can build many different paths for your career and your individual development with a wide and modern selection of technologies.

We learn more together all the time and every digital employee has the attitude of a Senior Trainee. The work will be done, but we won't! We have, for example, active tribal activities, where you can get peer support, lessons and the opportunity to share ideas about different topics.

Does that sound good?

If yes, then great! Send us your CV or LinkedIn profile as soon as possible so we can take a look at them. We are particularly interested in what kind of tasks you would be interested in and what skills you have.

We hope to hear from you as soon as possible!

description:
Join us and leave your mark on the European IT industry by helping our customers achieve the full potential of the public cloud in terms of infrastructure, migrations, data and security solutions!

We are currently looking for a Software Developer for our Finnish team.

You will work with these things:


 * You will work as part of our software development team, building applications that are our customer's core business (for example, efficient electronic distribution and transaction channels, information services, online stores and industrial internet applications
 * Supporting applications in technical and architectural design
 * You share your own expertise within the team and support others in their technical challenges
 * Occasional travel in Finland to an office or client (or in Europe) may be necessary depending on the task - as an employer, we try to take your preferences into account as well
   
   
   

Your skills and interests:


 * At least 2 years of work experience in relevant backend technologies (.NET) and frontend technologies (React)
 * About Virtu authentication user authentication (SOAP/REST API)
 * Operating principles of Suomi.fi authentication interfaces
 * You value code that is easy to read (humans) and efficient to execute (machines)
 * Smooth communication with both the client and the team
 * Motivation to learn new things, share what you have learned and grow as a professional
 * Smooth communication in Finnish and English
 * Finnish citizenship
   
   
   

What sets you apart (we consider any of these a big plus):


 * Experience with cloud-native solutions, Azure preferred
 * Terraform know-how
 * Previous experience in customer interface in an operational role
 * Agile understanding
   
   
   

Passing the security clearance is a prerequisite for salary.

We encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all the requirements. We appreciate your growth potential and enthusiasm!

What do we offer in return?


 * The possibility to complete the certificates of our partners (Amazon, Google, Microsoft) along with the work, for which we also pay a monetary bonus!
 * A training budget that can be used for seminars, internal trainings such as Nordcloud Academy or external virtual or on-site trainings
 * Hybrid work possibility and equipment of your choice
 * Local benefits in Finland, such as the Epassi lunch and wellness benefits and comprehensive occupational health services
   
   
   

Please read our Recruitment Privacy Statement carefully before applying. Every applicant must have a permit to work in Finland.

Nordcloud is Europe's leading provider of cloud services. We are the longest-term Finnish partner of Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud, which offer public cloud services, and one of the few service providers that have been granted certificates for all three. We have 1200 employees in 10 countries. We are known for our innovative cloud-native solutions and have delivered more than 1000 cloud technology projects. Both Gartner and the Financial Times have noted us as a leading provider of public cloud services. Nordcloud was acquired by IBM on December 21, 2020.

Read more: nordcloud.com and follow #NordcloudCommunity

Nordcloud values ‚Äã‚Äãdiversity and is dedicated to providing equal opportunities to all candidates and employees.

title: AWS Cloud Engineer

description:
Work at HiQ

At HiQ, we simplify people's lives by using technology, design and creativity to build smart solutions and businesses. We are convinced that investing in technology is the best way to make the world better, more sustainable, smoother, safer ‚Äì and more fun. Our service offering covers the entire development chain from the idea to the finished service and to support and further development during the service's life cycle. If working in HiQ's fun and relaxed team sounds interesting, keep reading!




What do we expect from you?

We hope that you have several years (+5) of experience in demanding software development projects and strong knowledge of several different technologies.

Typical tools used in our customer projects are e.g. JavaScript, React, Node.js, Java and cloud technologies (Azure, GCP, AWS). We hope that you are used to working with these technologies and that you have an interest in expanding your skills to new technologies as well, if necessary.




We also expect:

 * Fluent Finnish and English skills.
 * The work can mostly be done remotely, but customer projects require an average of 1-2 days a week presence in the capital region.




What we offer you:

 * The opportunity to develop and expand your own skills in versatile customer projects.
 * HiQ's fun and relaxed work community and experienced teammates. We spend time together at HiQ e.g. in hobby clubs and doing things together. We also actively share information, lessons learned and successes, for example on fullstack Friday every month.
 * Flexible hybrid work opportunity. You can work at the customer's premises, at our office in Otaniemi or Kamppi, or from your home office.
 * Comprehensive personnel benefits from extensive occupational health to sports and cultural benefits, hobby clubs, events and professional development. We are flexible in the different life situations of HiQ people and we want to make it easy to combine work and free time.




Apply now

Were you interested in the position and would you like to hear more about the role? You can ask Oona Muilu (oona.muilu@hiq.fi) more about the position or apply for a position directly via the link - it won't take long!




After applying, we will try to contact you as quickly as possible. You will first get to talk with our recruiter about your background and suitability for the position. In the second step, you will talk with our more technical expert, who can better explain the work at HiQ and the customer. Finally, we might want to take a look at some of your previous projects or check your references. Then we're already in that most important moment and we'll agree on whether you'll come to work for us!




HiQ as a workplace

With us, you'll find a great mix of diverse talents: creative developers, innovative designers, disruptive thinkers and data-native engineers, all playing smoothly in the same team. With our deep technological know-how and multidisciplinary understanding, we help hundreds of our customers turn the ever-accelerating digital change into business strengths.




HiQ builds truly valuable services for the customer. With us, everyone takes responsibility for what they do and we try to keep things simple in a good way - we don't engage in unnecessary bureaucracy. With us, everyone gets to be themselves at work and that also enables a creative, happy and flexible atmosphere.
title: Senior Full Stack Developer

description:
We are looking for a Software Developer who is enthusiastic about working independently, who has already accumulated work experience in software development for a few years, to join the Loihti team!

We offer you the opportunity for continuous professional growth, e.g. through common reading circles, education money and progress in projects.




We have space for experts who want to stay on the cutting edge of technical expertise and build their own career path by deepening their expertise through successes in customer projects.

You would become an important part of our Digital Services business unit team, where responsibility and freedom go hand in hand.




You are surrounded by a wide group of experts that you can rely on in your everyday life with a low threshold. We have a place for you who enjoy working independently and continuous learning is important to you.




What we expect from you:

 * At least 3 years of experience in software development, the ability to prioritize and take responsibility and support team members
 * Interest and ability to work as a full stack developer as part of both the client's and Loihti's team
 * You manage e.g. some of the following technologies: React.js, Node.js, Javascript, PostgreSQL, Java/Spring, C#, or .NET
 * You already have experience with cloud technologies and may have considered completing certifications for Azure or AWS
 * Depending on where you live, you would be willing to go to Helsinki or Oulu every once in a while to meet team members




What you can expect from us:

 * We are a motley and engaging group, where everyone has room to be themselves
 * Our digital services offices are located in the centers of Helsinki and Oulu, serving as pleasant meeting places for colleagues
 * We regularly organize joint events where co-workers get to know each other
 * We communicate openly and strive for immediacy, so that everyone has the opportunity to succeed in their work and stay with us for a long time




Why come to Loihte?

 * A professional and warm-hearted community where you can be yourself
 * A fair salary model that treats people equally
 * Interesting and versatile projects that you can influence yourself
 * The opportunity to influence one's own actions and career development, as well as resources and flexible opportunities for skill development




Our recruitment is carried out with a skills-based idea. Through discussions, we try to think together about what future challenges will support the development of your skills.




If you are interested and recognize yourself in the description, please contact us!

title: Software Developer Junior/Mid level

description:
Gofore is looking for experienced and test automation developers!

More than 100 test automation developers and a total of more than 180 testing and quality assurance professionals work at Gofor as part of customer projects, and we are the largest testing and quality assurance communities in Finland. We know that there is strength in the crowd, and support from the community is always available.




We earn our living as consultants in customer work. We do test automation development for many private and public sector organizations (e.g. Elisa, Kone, Tax Administration), whose customer projects are connected by challenging development tasks implemented with modern technologies. In addition, we work on projects for moving machines, the energy sector, the manufacturing industry, telecommunications or wellness and health technology. Our customers include Valtra, Bosch and AGCO.




What we offer you

Our test automation developers are united by pride in their own work in promoting quality in our customer projects and a desire to learn and develop as professionals. In addition to projects, we maintain our expertise through, for example, the test automation guild that meets once a month, where we exchange ideas and learn together about the most current issues in test automation. For competence development We also encourage e.g. supporting the completion of certifications and offering licenses for learning platforms.




In addition to our comprehensive benefit package, we offer all our employees the opportunity to become a Gofore owner at a low cost through the share savings program.




There is variation in our projects, and in them you can truly challenge yourself in the form of new technologies and roles. We typically serve medium-sized or large Finnish organizations and companies, and the projects are therefore often larger-scale efforts; In most projects, other Gofore people work alongside as test automation developers or in other positions.




What we hope from you

We are currently looking for experienced test automation development professionals to join our team. We hope that you always have enthusiasm for continuous learning and the courage to challenge yourself in the face of something new. As an experienced consultant, you also know how to challenge views and bring best practices to projects.




Since the contents and roles of our customer projects vary, our team includes experts with different backgrounds. However, there are recurring expectations that our customers present, so we hope you have the following experience:




 * You are an experienced test automation developer with versatile project experience spanning 5+ years
 * You have a good command of Robot Framework or a similar TA tool.
 * You program fluently with e.g. Python or Java
 * You have experience in DevOps work and CI tools, e.g. Jenkins or VSTS/Azure DevOps
 * You have already developed test automation libraries and keywords.
 * You have an understanding and interest in the whole of testing, and you are able to participate, for example, in the creation of test cases.
 * You communicate fluently in both Finnish and English




Depending on the customer project, the task may require a security clearance.




Salary development

For us at Gofore, it is important that a decent total compensation is paid for the work. Salary is influenced not only by experience and skills, but also by our two values: active actions to ensure that Gofore is a good workplace for everyone, and taking the customer's perspective into account in everything we do. In salary discussions with your supervisor, the feedback you receive, the invoicing rate (after all, we are consultants!) and the development of your own skills are central.

In addition to the monthly salary for this position, there are separate bonuses related to the company's success. Bonuses can be related to, for example, recruitment, sales or increasing Gofore's reputation.




Our recruitment process

Apply for the position conveniently by pressing Easy Apply at the top of this announcement. There is no need for a separate CV, your LinkedIn profile is sufficient.




Read here what happens after you send us your application and how recruitment with Gofore progresses. As part of the recruitment process, before offering a work contract, we make sure that you have a client project where you can start.




We are happy to take into account the requirements of neurodiversity in the recruitment process and, if necessary, modify the process according to your needs.

title: Senior Full Stack Cloud Developer

description:
Do you want to take part in building the digital world of the future?

We are looking for a passionate Mobile Developer who gets excited about cutting-edge technologies and has a passion for innovation. We are looking for you, an experienced mobile developer with a desire to create solutions on both iOS and Android platforms, system-independent or native.




We at ALTEN are pioneers of the digital world, revolutionizing the way companies operate in various fields. Our agile and forward-looking team is committed to pushing boundaries and building next-level software solutions that shape the future. As a mobile developer with us, you have the opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects alongside the best in the industry.




Success in the role enables:

 * Programming languages ‚Äã‚Äã(Kotlin, Swift, Dart, JavaScript/TypeScript, C#)
 * Knowledge of mobile application frameworks (Flutter, React Native, Xamarin)
 * Version control skills (Git, GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket)
 * Continuous integration and release implementations (Jenkins)
 * Mobile testing and mobile authentication experience (e.g. Appium, JUnit, OAuth, Firebase Authentication)
 * At least 5 years of previous experience in mobile development,
 * and fluent Finnish and English language skills




Please note that you do not need to be familiar with all technologies to be successful in the role.




In addition, we consider it an advantage:

 * Other software development skills and experience
 * A suitable lower or higher university degree




We offer you:

 * Innovative work environment and challenges: You get to work in an inspiring environment where creativity and technical know-how are combined. Our goal is always to develop new and innovative solutions for our customers' needs.
 * Keys to professional growth and development: Continuous learning and professional development will increase your skills and expertise. You also have the opportunity to participate in Tech Week events and complete IT industry certifications.
 * Diverse work and a close-knit team: You get access to a stimulating and inclusive work environment, where your contribution is valued and personal growth is promoted. Join a team of skilled and enthusiastic developers who share a passion for programming. With us, every voice is heard, and cooperation is the key to our success.
 * Challenging projects: You get to work on versatile and meaningful projects. You develop software that directly affects people's everyday life and changes industry standards. You are helping to build the future!




We hope you are our future Mobile Developer!

If you experienced vibration on that side of the screen and want to join our team, please send an application with salary expectations via the attached link no later than October 27, 2024.

You can get more information about the position from our recruiter Joona at joona.jarvinen@alten.fi.




Why ALTEN?

For us at ALTEN, it is important to offer our employees benefits that improve everyday life as a counterweight to their work. In addition to great coworkers and a humorous work community, the package also includes other benefits, such as flexible remote work/hybrid model, lunch, exercise and cultural benefits, and for the most sporty, we also offer the opportunity for an employee bicycle benefit. Part of our culture is spending time together, also outside of work, in various events. For those who are excited about the northern or archipelago regions, please note that we also have the opportunity to use ALTEN's holiday cottages, which can be found, for example, in the beautiful landscapes of Salla and Kustavi. We take care of our employees' health by offering an extensive occupational health care service and comprehensive leisure accident insurance.

description:
Have you come across job postings where the list of required technologies might be the longest part of the ad, and you end up not applying because you don't quite master all the acronyms? No worries, let's keep things simple this time!




We at VALA are looking for test automation professionals. Experience with test automation, technical skills and familiarity with some key tools is a must. In addition to this, we don't care so much about the numerous keywords found in your CV, but, along with your relevant work experience, it is at least as important that you share our values ‚Äã‚Äãand feel that our culture is suitable for you.

VALA's culture is more than inspirational quotes on mousepads and screensavers.




VALA's culture is a combination of actions, attitudes and relationships, spiced up with a touch of idealism.




We offer:




 * Meaningful work. Finding meaningful work for VALA residents is our single most important goal.
 * You and your well-being come first, even before our customers.
 * An empathetic, transparent and low-hierarchical organizational culture.
 * The opportunity to participate and influence VALA's development.
 * Excellent framework for professional development, including an annual personal training budget and opportunities for mentoring.
 * Professional communities where we share experiences and learn together about topics that are interesting and relevant to us, such as the latest TA tools.
 * Lunch, telephone and welfare benefits. We offer an annual wellness budget of ‚Ç¨500, which you can use as you wish (e.g. for sports, culture, well-being or business trips).
 * The salary level in this role is 2900-5350 ‚Ç¨/month depending on your skills and experience. In addition, we offer the opportunity to participate in future personnel commitment programs, for example with option or share programs.
 * Remote office in southern Spain.
 * Comprehensive occupational health care services and care service for a sick child if you wish.
 * We compensate for you the annual emissions corresponding to the carbon footprint of an average person living in Finland.




Here are some of the qualities we hope you have:




 * You value the same principles as we do: empathy, sustainability, prioritizing well-being, a self-directed way of working and a lifelong learning mentality.
 * You get excited about technical challenges and can master at least one test automation tool and programming language.
 * You want to help the customer choose test automation solutions that are both efficient and long-term maintainable.
 * You master the basics of DevOps and understand how test automation is utilized as part of an automated development and release pipeline.
 * You pay attention to details. However, you don't just think about technical solutions, you feel it is necessary to develop your team's cooperation as well.
 * You are flexible: you can quickly adapt to new teams, domains and ways of working.
 * You have the courage to bring out your own observations and ideas, and to discuss your own and others' ideas constructively.
 * Good communication skills in Finnish and English.




Next, you might be interested in hearing more about our customer projects. We have more than 40 customer projects underway, so it is challenging to describe them all, but in your daily work you could, for example, be creating a test automation solution for planning cancer radiotherapy or developing a test automation solution for a sports application. You can read more about our public references here: https://www.valagroup.com/fi/referensit/




VALA's recruitment process:




Our recruitment process is agile but thorough. The length of the process is largely up to you. Our recruitment process includes the following steps:




 * A conversation based on VALA's culture and values ‚Äã‚Äãwith our People team, the purpose of which is to find out on both sides whether VALA is a suitable workplace for you, where you can enjoy yourself, find meaningful work and develop professionally. In addition, we are interested in whether you could advance our culture, for example by sharing your know-how among colleagues, by participating in VALA's communities and their development, or by improving VALA's working methods.
 * Self-administered code test or similar for those who need programming skills in their work.
 * Another conversation with our customer management team, the purpose of which is to find out how well our customers' needs and our projects match your skills, wishes and interests.




Were you interested? Fill out the application in a couple of minutes!
title: Test Automation Engineer

description:
Do you want to influence the development of your own product and see the results of your work? What would it sound like to have a company where the team really enjoys themselves?

We are now looking for you, a Senior Software Developer, to develop Granlund Manager.

In your work, you participate in the agile product development of the Granlund Manager software. You develop the product's life cycle in a long-term way and taking the customers' needs into account. You work closely with the product management and quality assurance team as well as with other product development development teams.

Your future colleague, Software Developer Janne T√∂rnroos, tells you why product development should be done in Granlund's team:

"I've had a good time at Granlund, because here you can focus on what you do and know best. The most rewarding thing is solving difficult challenges and completing big projects."

Read more about Janne's interview

With us, you get to work in the rapidly digitizing real estate industry, which generates a huge amount of data on conditions and energy consumption, for example, every day. As a result of our work, property data flows smoothly between different systems. With us, you can see the traces of your work and the whole, the success of which you have been involved. With us, you can develop the leading software for real estate management with modern technologies in Microsoft's development environment.

We tend to work flexibly remotely and at the office. Your colleagues can be found at our head office in Helsinki, where we hope to meet you regularly. We offer an inspiring work environment with a large group of experts. With us, you can not only develop but also develop: we support you in increasing your skills and you can focus on exactly what interests you.

Read what kind of opportunities Granlund offers software development professionals

Could you be the expert we are looking for?

You will succeed in this task if you are a team player accustomed to agile development models. You have evidence of long-term and customer-oriented development of the software product. You work smoothly both in a team and independently.

We do development with several technology stacks in the Microsoft environment, so we value broad expertise from Web Forms to Core. You move smoothly as a full stack from the database to the front. We also value Azure and DevOps expertise.

Keywords: MS Visual Studio | MS SQL Server | C# | Azure DevOps | GIT | Entity Framework | ASP.NET WebApi 2 | ASP.NET Core | Kendo React | Kendo UI | Maui | ASP.NET Web Forms | React | SASS | jQuery | Typescript | Power BI

What is Granlund Manager?

Granlund Manager is Finland's most used real estate management SaaS software, which is used for real estate information management and reporting. With Granlund Manager, for example, you can monitor and optimize the energy consumption and carbon footprint of properties, maintain maintenance plans and receive and manage service requests. The data it collects can also be used, for example, in responsibility reporting. Granlund Manager also collects data from IoT devices, can be integrated into different systems and also works mobile. The software is trusted by numerous organizations, municipalities and companies in Finland and abroad: for example, Alko, the City of Espoo, OP Financial Group and S-Ryhm√§.

In our opinion, this is how we make your working life better

We are a connoisseur of building technology with over 60 years of experience and the market leader in building technology planning in Finland. We have a strong mentality of moving forward and the team really enjoys working with us year after year. There are already more than 1,400 of us from Granlund all over Finland.


 * With us, you help our society take significant individual steps in the green transition. We think the work of each of us is important.
 * With us, you can do your job as well as you can. Our reputation as the best in our field is not born out of the blue, but is based on our uncompromisingness and excellence.
 * It's nice to work with us. We think you'll have fun too. We care about each other, but above all we really have fun together.
 * We believe in pay equality and fair pay. We have also always had a habit of rewarding good work and successes. Our performance bonus model applies to all personnel.
 * Our reputation as a stable and reliable employer is based on a low hierarchy, valuing our experts, long-term customer relationships and active innovation.
   
   

In addition to this, we also have very competitive staff benefits to offer you. They support our everyday life and are desired by our employees themselves.

How did it seem? Would you become our colleague?

You can apply for this position and our colleague by sending your application and CV no later than 4 November 2024.

We go through the applications and meet interesting applicants already during the application period. So don't wait until the last minute. We are ready to make hiring decisions quickly - already during the application period.‚ÄØ

If you have any questions about the task, its goals or working for us, Mika will be happy to answer them. Head of Product Development Mika Ruottinen can be reached by email at mika.ruottinen@granlund.fi

For questions related to the recruitment process, you can contact Anna. Recruitment consultant Anna Palmgren can be reached either by phone on 040 523 1757 or by email anna.palmgren@granlund.fi
