description:
Type of employment contract: permanent / full-time

Location: It√§merenkatu 1, 00180 Helsinki / remote work

Application DL: 6.10..2024




Are you a mobile development professional who is enthusiastic about new developments? Would you like to be responsible for the mobile development of relevant healthcare solutions as part of a leading Finnish company in its field?




In the role, you are responsible for the architecture and technical decisions of mobile development as a trusted expert in the area together with the rest of the team.




Diktamen, which develops a comprehensive solution that enhances patient and customer registrations and has been awarded the Great Place to Work¬Æ certificate, is now looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Lead Mobile Developer for a key role. In this versatile task, you will participate in the rebuilding of the dictation management system and mobile application as part of Diktamen's team. In your work, you are responsible for the architecture and technical decisions of the application's mobile development as a trusted expert together with the rest of the team. In addition to this, you yourself participate in development work, maintenance and also further development. You also get to envision Diktamen's future and make technology choices and take responsibility for advancing and making development practices more agile. The current tech stack includes, for example, JavaScript, React Native and Electron.




You are the expert we are looking for, if you have solid experience in mobile development and you have the vision and courage to develop Diktamen's technologies and practices to the next level. From a working perspective, you are an active and enthusiastic factor in the development of new things, who, in addition to versatile technological know-how, has the attitude of a flexible team player. You are also able to work under pressure when necessary and work in rapidly changing situations.







Ditkamen offers you:

 * Diverse and meaningful work with healthcare solutions
 * Modern technologies and interesting projects where you can use and challenge your own skills
 * The opportunity to influence operating models and software development technology
 * A values-based working culture where cooperation, the spirit of doing things, responsibility, quality, flexibility and agility are emphasized
 * Opportunity for professional growth and development in Lead positions
 * Flexible working hours and flexible hybrid work practices
 * Competitive salary







We expect from you:

 * Solid experience in mobile development with Android / iOS
 * A positive and self-directed attitude and a desire to develop both yourself and the team
 * Excellent cooperation and interaction skills with different stakeholders
 * Finnish and English language skills







In addition, the following are considered advantageous:

 * Previous experience working with React Native or Flutter platforms
 * JavaScript knowledge
 * University degree suitable for the position







Practicalities:

In this full-time and permanent position, you will be employed directly by Diktamen. Diktamen works with the most flexible hybrid work practices. The office is located in Ruoholahti, Helsinki, but good remote work opportunities are also available.




Are you the creator we're looking for?

Send your CV or share your LinkedIn profile no later than October 6. by aTalent's application system: https://emp.jobylon.com/applications/jobs/253635/create/ . If you wish, you can also mention your salary expectations and the earliest possible start date in your application documents.




Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail, but only process applications received through the application system. You can learn more about Diktamen here. Questions about the application process and schedules are answered by Senior Recruitment Consultant Sofia Latva-Koivisto (0503214473, sofia.latva-koivisto(at)atalent.fi).
title: Lead Mobile Developer (Android/iOS)

description:
We are strengthening K group's software development teams by hiring internal software developers for several of Kesko's agile software development teams.

Our three main business areas are grocery, construction & building technology, and car dealership, each of which has its own software development teams building digital services and software products that are more functional and always aim for a better customer experience. With us, you can develop your skills in a variety of ways, working with different products and meeting the needs of customers.

At K, we believe in the power of diverse and motivated teams, with the help of which goals are achieved. It is important to us that we are able to offer our employees a stimulating and inclusive work environment. We work in a hybrid work model, where we combine office days and remote work in a way that best suits both the role and the team.

Come and develop your skills!

Senior developer - become part of the grocery development team!

Kesko's grocery digital development team is an agile software development team that meets business needs by developing service interfaces and microservice capabilities. The team is a DEVOPS team that runs its services in cloud environments. We are now looking for an experienced full-stack developer to join us.

The traditional grocery store is in transition both in terms of business and technological development. You get to influence the modernization of business processes, the creation of modern technological solutions and modern operating models. As a developer, you have a genuine opportunity to develop Kesko's operating methods and solutions to be like a software house. Renewal requires an understanding of the current state so that planning a new solution and change is possible. A holistic approach is welcome in order to understand how far different interactions extend in processes and information systems outside of one's immediate area of ‚Äã‚Äãresponsibility.

As a full-stack developer, you create new business capabilities together with business and designers to create the best possible customer experience. You solve challenges related to business logic, data flows and technical solutions by developing service API interfaces and background services. You feel proud of the high quality of the software, so you maintain comprehensive test automation and set up infrastructure if necessary.

We also expect that, as an internal developer, you are interested in creating Kesko's developer experience and bringing your own thoughts about the service's technical roadmap in the future to the discussion.

Our main technologies are: React, NodeJS and Typescript. We also process data with Snowflake, Azure Data Factory and Databricks.

Why us?

You get to work on an interesting business platform and processes - the results of your work make the everyday life of our employees easier and also affect the smoothness of the store's everyday life and the correctness of the data.

In addition

You will become part of the digital development team, where you will be part of significant product development of a new product. We offer a great opportunity to create and take ownership of the technical vision, and you also get to participate in the development of a fast-moving business area.

User interfaces aimed at different user groups and technical solutions that contain a lot of data processing offer learning opportunities even for experienced developers.

You will become part of a reform-minded culture that encourages experimenting, making mistakes and learning.

The K group offers the industry's most attractive way to develop the trade sector. You get a central place to be part of the industry's leading house and to innovate its core functions in the grocery trade.

An experienced, well-communicating, quality-oriented team and a multi-layered technical solution offer learning and interaction opportunities even for experienced developers. Digitally oriented and forward-looking creators have countless data and opportunities to harness their creativity to improve people's everyday lives. In addition, you are part of a reform-minded culture that encourages experimenting, making mistakes and learning.

What benefits we offer


 * You can spend your office day at our modern K-Kampus with good transport links in Helsinki's Kalastama. On campus you can find e.g. comfortable collaboration and break rooms, own gym and occupational health services, cafeteria and staff restaurant.
 * Modern tools and numerous opportunities for self-development as well as networking opportunities with industry professionals.
 * Other employee benefits offered by the K Group: mobile phone benefit, culture and sports benefit (EPassi), staff discounts in K Group stores (Citymarket, K Supermarket & K Market, K-Rauta, Intersport, Budgetsport), own occupational healthcare services and leisure accident insurance.
 * In the K group, we have an active work community that focuses on well-being at work. For example, we offer several self-development opportunities, such as internal trainings, online learning courses and other opportunities for professional development and career growth. We support work-life balance and encourage a positive work culture that promotes open communication, teamwork and cooperation.
   
   

We are looking for experienced experts who have


 * Versatile, definitely at least five years of professional development experience with Typescipt, NodeJS and React on the Azure platform
 * Experience and passion for back end development, enhanced with front end (React) OR exceptional knowledge of front end, in addition to solid knowledge of back end development.
 * Understanding what high quality in software development means and commitment to ensuring built-in quality in development
 * Ability to set up and configure infrastructure in Azure
 * Applicable degree ‚Äì e.g. university degree in information technology or software development
   
   

In the role of a full-stack dev, you can shine best, if


 * You have experience working in an agile, large development team working with a large set of microservices
 * You enjoy helping and guiding users and preparing proposals for their needs
 * Experience with agile software development methods such as Scrum and Kanban
 * Excellent teamwork skills
 * At the end of the day, technology is only a tool to achieve goals, the desire and enthusiasm to learn new things and solve problems with modern methods is what matters
 * Experience in the successful development of retail solutions
   
   

If you have a passion for continuous learning, you want to stay at the forefront of technological development and you have Diamond teamwork skills, you will certainly enjoy being a Full-Stack developer in our team!

Were you interested?

For more information about working in the team, please contact the development team's Development Lead Emilia Stor√•s, tel. +358 40 5531492. You can best reach Emilia from Tuesday to Thursday from 3 to 4 p.m. (or you can also send a message!)

If this sounds like the role you've been looking for, apply now! In addition to your CV, we would like a short description of you and reasons why you would like to join Kesko.

Please send your application no later than 23 November 2024 via the attached link.

We carry out drug testing for the selected person at the latest in connection with the employment inspection.
title: Senior Full-Stack Developer for the grocery development team in K-Group

description:
Come and build the future with Fikuro!




Visma Amplio Oy is a software company that offers tools from small invoicing needs to large ERP solutions. With our help, our customers can grow and develop, we want to offer customers the tools of the future for efficient business operations.




Fikuro is a modern cloud-based ERP system for small and medium-sized companies. Fikuro is growing and developing rapidly, and now we are looking for an experienced Frontend developer to join our agile product development team. In addition, other developers work in the team, and you work closely with the Product Owner, Architects and User Experience Designer.




Your tasks with us:




 * Develops, maintains and renews responsive user interfaces using the Angular library
 * Work in close cooperation with the product development team throughout the application development lifecycle
 * Ensures code quality, performance and maintainability




We expect from you:




 * Good knowledge of the following technologies: Angular (html, css, scss and javascript)
 * In addition, knowledge of Java, Spring Boot, and MariaDB is useful
 * Experience in planning and developing cloud-based solutions
 * Understanding of design thinking (Design Thinking)
 * Excellent problem solving skills and eagerness to learn new technologies
 * Experience with design systems or own component libraries
 * Enthusiasm to renew and develop the user interface of the software




We offer you:




 * Interesting and challenging work in a stable, growing and profitable company
 * The opportunity to grow and develop as a software development professional
 * A dynamic work environment and the support of a professional team
 * Versatile employment benefits (such as lunch, telephone, sports and cultural benefits and comprehensive disability insurance)
 * Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work




The position is permanent and your workstation is located in the office in Helsinki or Pori, where the team mainly works. You can also work remotely if you want, but we hope that you can visit the office from time to time to meet colleagues. When a suitable person is found, we are ready to be flexible about the location.




Were you interested?




If you want to join our team and take part in Fikuro's world conquest, send your application and CV with salary expectations by filling out the attached application form. Leave your information to us no later than 10/17/2024. We only process applications that come through the application form. We look forward to having you join Visma Amplio and Fikuro's success story! If you have any questions about the task or working at Visma, you can ask for more information:




Vesa Vesterinen

Director, Fikuro

vesa.vesterinen@visma.com

¬†

You can also get to know Fikuro: https://fikuro.visma.fi/

Apply for a position as soon as possible, because we start interviews already during the application process. The position will be filled as soon as a suitable person is found.




The application starts on October 2, 2024 and ends on October 17, 2024, at 23:59 (Europe/Helsinki)




Type of employment:¬†Permanent, full-time




Visma Amplio Oy




Visma Amplio Oy is a software company that offers tools from small invoicing needs to large ERP solutions. With our help, our customers can grow and develop, we want to offer customers the tools of the future for efficient business operations. We are part of the Visma Group, which is Europe's largest SaaS company. Read more at www.visma.fi/amplio.




Visma builds a more functional society by developing business-critical software and services. We improve people's everyday lives by streamlining and automating the daily tasks of companies and organizations. 15,300 employees, 1.7 million private and public sector customers in Europe and Latin America and a turnover of almost 2.24 billion euros (Q4/2023) commit us to developing functional solutions for tomorrow's makers.¬†www.visma.fi
